Name: Talent Acquisition Partner
Description: Talent Acquisition Consultant   BE PART OF OUR EVOLUTION Welcome to Ampion a Wipro company. Ampion is a technology services provider delivering a new level of specialisation at scale. As an independent subsidiary of Wipro, we deliver scalability and a breadth of capabilities, combined with the depth of global experience.   Ampion’s three areas of specialisation provide an engineering focus and strategic approach across software assurance (Assure), technology security (Secure), and digital transformation (Transform).   THE ROLE   We are searching for a passionate Talent Acquisition Consultant to join our high performing Talent team within Cybersecurity and Risk. An excellent opportunity to work in a high-profile team during an exciting transition period.   Talent Acquisition plays a pivotal role in our ongoing evolution and growth. You’ll have the ability to make a real contribution to the team, bring new ideas to the table and be involved in end-to-end recruitment. We are open to seeing individuals who have experience working within the Technology sector – ideally Cybersecurity (internal and/or agency experience).   The Talent team are all currently working remote, however the preferred candidate will be able to travel to either Sydney, Melbourne or Brisbane a couple of times per month for team meetings etc.    In this role you’ll have the opportunity to progress your amazing Talent Acquisition skills as well as adapt and learn new skills. In addition to sourcing great candidates, you will get the opportunity to work closely with our amazing administration and HR team, ensuring our candidates have a smooth and enjoyable onboarding experience and have a great start to life at Ampion.  We support all our employees learning and development. If this role sounds exciting to you; we want to hear from you!   KEY REQUIREMENTS  End-to-end technology Talent Acquisition experience (internal and/or agency) specialising in either Testing & Automation, Software Development, Digital Engineering or Project Services. Previous responsibility for the full recruitment cycle – working with hiring managers, taking job briefs, developing candidate search strategies, talent pooling, advertising / marketing jobs and other innovative sourcing methods Familiarity with job boards, databases and Applicant Tracking Systems (preferably JobAdder) Experience using professional social networks (LinkedIn is a must!) Be passionate about the candidate journey and ensure Ampion’s employer branding shines through! Ability to work with hiring managers and the wider business Excellent teamwork skills A professional and positive attitude Communication is key! Whether you are communicating with candidates, employees, hiring managers or your team – we expect someone to have excellent communication and interpersonal skills Outstanding organisation skills, this can be a fast-paced role! You’ll need to be able to manage multiple tasks at one time We do not micro-manage –you will need to be self-driven and able to set your own priorities    WHAT CAN AMPION OFFER YOU? We want to attract like-minded people to our team who are passionate about building successful teams and maintaining an employee first culture. Ampion offers rewarding careers and the opportunity to sink your teeth into whatever your passions might be.  We have a collaborative and supportive culture where everyone gets a voice. Flexible working arrangements Regular team building activities (Virtual Quiz nights, Amazing Race etc) Fortnightly awards to acknowledge the hard-working efforts of the team Opportunity to take IT certifications Plus much more  Ampion is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We believe in leveraging individual talents, to empower and support you to be the best version of you. We create teams that people want to be a part of and a culture that we are proud of.   WHAT’S NEXT? Ready to join our evolution? Submit your interest by applying now or contact our Head of Talent Acquisition - Tom Watt, tom.watt@ampion.com.au for more information on a career with Ampion. Please follow our new page on LinkedIn @Ampion to keep up to date!

Name: Strategic Account Manager
Description:
Targets-driven, high achieving, competitive…

Are these the characteristics you’d describe yourself as in those pesky self-assessment questionnaires?

Great, then you are probably the perfect match for this role.

We are partnered with one of the fastest growing Tech service providers in Australia on the precipice of a digital revolution. Our Client combines the engine of a 20 year old legacy with spirit,drive, appetite for growth of a start up. They are looking for an experienced Strategic Account Managers to join their growing Sydney & Melbourne teams.

If you want to come on board the future of tech, poised to move traditional infrastructure solutions into the next generation of digital, read on.

This is your opportunity to work for an innovative and successful business, who’s end-to-end, platform-enabled solutions, from cloud to cyber and data services, are removing the stress from tech for over 400 of Australia’s biggest brands.
 
Want to know more…
 
This role will suit someone who has worked in an IT or Telecom sales environment.

You’ll bring your innate passion for selling Cloud, Network, SDWAN/ NFV and cyber security solutions to Key National Enterprise customers.

You will focus on providing a confident and knowledgeable approach to advanced sales and solutions at a board room level, as well as driving new sales and retention opportunities to completion.
 
Must-haves…
 
Come ready to show how you’ve exceeded the odds when it comes to revenue, sales and NPS targets.
Plus, they want to see how well equipped you are to identify, engage, retain and grow a portfolio of existing customers.
 
Sweet perks…

Great opportunities for career development within a growing business
Hybrid flexible working
Paid parental and inclusive leave
Employee discounts and competitive remuneration package

 
To find out more, please contact Hannah on Hannah@theonset.com.au

Name: Business Development Manager - Technology
Description: Global tech organisation are looking to grow their Australian footprint with the help of an experienced Business development manager. If you consider yourself to be a "hunter" business development manager with a technical background and a passion to drive a company to success than this role might be just the right fit for you! About the role:In your role you’ll be responsible for partnering with and ensuring the long-term success of the company’s clients. You will oversee a variety of responsibilities, including product adoption and client retention. You will be responsible for developing and managing the relationships and trust with existing accounts as well as business development of new customers. In order to be successful in this role you must have the following:- Currently working as a business development manager in tech, cybersecurity or for an MSP (2 years minimum)- 1 year minimum experience in consultancy sales in tech or cybersecurity or MSP  - Willingness to adapt to new technology - Experience presenting in front of key decision makers   - A track record of being able to grow existing clients and build relationships - Strong knowledge and passion for Technology  - Impeccable stakeholder engagement What is in it for you? - Being a part of a supportive and fun team - Attractive salary and benefits  - Fantastic culture and rewards - Remote working  - Being a part of the growth of a global organisation If you interested in making a big impact on a global organisation and growing their Australian footprint the please apply ASAP.

Name: Project Manager Remediation
Description: eeking a Senior Project Manager to be part of a Large CyberSecurity and Infrastructure Uplift Program of work to perform application remediation Option to extend  Senior Project Manager is currently required for a contract role to March 2023 with option to extend to manage application remediation as part of an Infrastructure end of life /uplift program. This will include managing vendors and leading a project specialist team. To be successful in this position you will be highly experienced Project Manager who has demonstrated experience in managing application remediation or end of life projects.. You will also have solid experience in motivating teams and in managing vendors. Excellent stakeholder engagement skills are a must. Apply now using the link or email leonie.woodfine@randstad.com.auAt Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Name: Commercial Customer Success Manager
Description: Melbourne or Sydney based Mimecast is seeking a Customer Success Manager to join our team!  Customer Success Managers are responsible for representing the customer within the business, interfacing with all departments to ensure customer delight.  A Customer Success Manager has the responsibility for a portfolio of customers.  They are the custodians of the experience within that base from a proactive and reactive perspective.  The Customer Success Manager is a complex, demanding and highly visible role with many outcomes expected. It requires a highly-organized individual with good business acumen, strong planning skills, sound technical orientation, excellent relationship building skills and strategic execution ability to drive success.  Key Responsibilities: Customer DelightExecuting defined CS strategies within the designated customer base.Following up on surveys based on the guidelines provided.Identifying upsell opportunity within the assigned base and ensuring the Upsell Manager is aware and engaged.Customer RetentionBuild strong relationships to help proactively mitigate the risk of churn. Ensure Mimecast is part of the budget planning process and ensure there are no surprises from our largest customers.Increase the value of the Mimecast service within the customer base by ensuring feature utilization including end user applications. General Customer ManagementBe a known point of contact for relationship building for these customers, including escalations where requiredAbility to troubleshoot and solve customer problems where appropriate, alternatively to be able to escalate where required Drive customer education through training awareness and attendance, as well as ability to share knowledge and demonstrate or train when requiredMethodical and diligent record keeping and database management Relationship building at all levels of an organization through proactive contactEssential Skills and Experience:Degree preferred3-5 year’s work experience in a relevant role with at least 2 years managing commercial or mid-market level accounts, with prior technical experience or technical acumen.Excellent customer, partner and market orientation in software and subscription services.Demonstrated experience in ensuring customer successfully adopt and realize value from subscription software and services.SAAS company experience in cybersecurity space (preferred) Excellent people skills i.e. ability to build relationships, networking and understanding channel complexitiesExperience working with multiple levels of customer stakeholders – technical admins, team leaders, C level executives, legal, compliance, and procurement contactsGood administrative & communication skillsWe’re fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly – and outstandingly. We’re big on honesty because it makes us better. We’re empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That’s The Mimecast Way.Other perks of joining the team!Free leave days between Christmas and New YearsFlexible working arrangements supporting work-life balance  Paid Parental Leave Program Employee Assist Support Health Insurance reimbursement Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program that supports global and local initiatives via fundraising, volunteering and community engagement, with 5 paid volunteer days per year & donation matching DEI StatementCybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups.

Name: Programme Manager
Description: We’re inventing the future, right here, right now, at Thales. We design the critical security solutions of tomorrow by combining the curiosity to explore, the intelligence to question and the vision to create. Together we solve complicated problems by combining our experience in the market with our leading research and development capabilities.We are forming a select group of seasoned programme managers to lead and direct the most complex projects across Thales’s diverse defence, security and civil sectors in Australia and abroad.About Your RoleThis full time permanent Program Manager role is part of our corporate Project Management team servicing major projects and bids across Thales Australia. Partnering with different business units, you will be using your experience and expertise to lead a variety of complex projects through their most challenging phases. Anticipating project complexity and leading organisations and customers through challenging project phases.Systematically guiding teams through the project mobilisation phase with detailed planning to ensure the critical acceptance and delivery phases have the best chance of success.Directing project remediation activities and establishing well defined get-well plans with robust transition strategies.Leadership and management of large teams of internal employees, subcontractors and partners, aligning them around shared vision and objectives, anticipating workload and future skills requirements, building capability and ensuring optimal delivery and performancePromoting “One Thales” behavioural culture, fostering teamwork and collaboration with other parts of Thales that are related or involved in the portfolio.Strategic management of stakeholders and associated communications both external and internal in order to enhance business reputation.Building and maintaining an open, collaborative and trusting relationship at a level one above the respective project managers.Supporting capture and bid management activities to ensure portfolio tender submissions are compelling and competitive.How About You?Tertiary qualified in business, engineering, project management or related field, with formal IPMA certification preferred.Extensive experience of scoping, planning, managing and delivering highly complex, large-scale projects  from mobilisation to successful completion within a customer-driven environmentProven and effective leadership skills with a high level of interpersonal and verbal communication skills as well as the ability to lead multi-disciplinary teams.A champion of change, able to drive a culture of continuous improvement and embed the adoption of best practice within the organisationDemonstrated ability to lead large multi-skilled engineering teams in an international environment in diverse cultures and unstable arena concerning one or several stakeholders.Good to KnowYou’ll get an email acknowledgement after you’ve applied, Thales strives to provide a personalised experience for all suitable applicants. As a Defence security clearance is required for this role, applicants must be Australian citizens and eligible to obtain and maintain an appropriate clearance.  To learn more about clearances please visit – http://www.defence.gov.au/AGSVA/ [link removed]Prior to offer you’ll complete a pre-employment police and medical check.For more information on Thales visit us @ThalesCareers on InstagramThales is committed to promoting and maintaining a workplace culture of shared respect that enables all of us to feel valued, do our best, and remain truly passionate about the place that we work. We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and supportive workplace. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and individuals from diverse backgrounds.We are also proud to be a WORK180 Endorsed Employer for Women. If you would like to know more on how we are supporting our employees, you can view our policies and initiatives here: https://work180.com/en-AU/for-women/employer/thales [link removed].Wellbeing matters at Thales, and where possible we encourage flexible working.

Name: Graduate Cybersecurity Analyst
Description: IF YOU CARE, THERE’S A PLACE FOR YOU HEREFor a career path that is both challenging and rewarding, join Sedgwick’s talented team of 27,000 colleagues around the globe. Sedgwick is a leading provider of technology-enabled risk, benefits and integrated business solutions. Taking care of people is at the heart of everything we do. Millions of people and organizations count on Sedgwick each year to take care of their needs when they face a major life event or something unexpected happens. Whether they have a workplace injury, suffer property or financial loss or damage from a natural or manmade disaster, are involved in an auto or other type of accident, or need time away from work for the birth of a child or another medical situation, we are here to provide compassionate care and expert guidance. Our clients depend on our talented colleagues to take care of their most valuable assets—their employees, their customers and their property. At Sedgwick, caring counts®. Join our team of creative and caring people of all backgrounds, and help us make a difference in the lives of others. The role:As a Cybersecurity Analyst, you will troubleshoot various security incidents across the organisation and assist with providing feedback and resolution to mitigate future security shortfalls. Your main responsibilities will include:Assisting with detection, monitoring, and resolution of security incidentsAdministering various IT Security tools and applicationsAssisting IT groups and business units as necessary in troubleshooting compatibility issues between security tools and business or productivity programsAssisting management in investigating IT or cyber-security events and suggesting resolutionProviding feedback and suggestions to improve IT Security processes and proceduresWorking closely with project managers to meet and complete project milestones accurately and on timeSupporting the organisation's quality programmeTravelling as required. You will have/will be:As a global business, we are always interested in hearing from candidates with bi-lingual or multi-lingual skillsDegree in Information Systems or Computer Science is preferred, or equivalent commercial experienceBasic knowledge of the security confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) TriadBasic knowledge of security information and events management (SIEM) solutionsAbility to work with a broad range of security tools and new technologiesAbility to handle confidential sensitive information with integrityExcellent oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills What will you get for this role?Competitive salary depending on skills, experience and qualificationsMany of our vacancies offer the opportunity to work flexibly, whether from office and/or home Working at SedgwickOur company is a place where creative and caring people of all backgrounds can be challenged, grow as individuals, and feel a higher purpose in the unique value they bring and the difference they make in the lives of others. We celebrate our differences; cultivating uniqueness and belonging allows us to connect with our consumers on a personal level, understand our clients’ needs, support the communities in which we operate, and perform at our best.We’re passionate and understanding about our colleagues – so we have built flexibility into our colleague working model. If you wish to work from home, split your working time between the home and office or change your hours so you can collect your children or care for someone in your family, we’re supportive of that. As a flexible employer, we’re happy to discuss options that take into consideration your personal needs for this position during your interview. Applicants who are successful at interview will be, as part of pre-employment screening, subject to: ID document verification, credit check, address verification, employment verification, employment gap verification, anti-money laundering search, directorship search and global watch list check.Sedgwick is committed to Equal Opportunity and Diversity. We aim to ensure that no job applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the ground of race, colour, nationality, religion, ethnic or national origins, age, gender, marital status, sexual orientation or disability.  Sedgwick is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace.

Name: Graduate Cybersecurity Analyst
Description: IF YOU CARE, THERE’S A PLACE FOR YOU HEREFor a career path that is both challenging and rewarding, join Sedgwick’s talented team of 27,000 colleagues around the globe. Sedgwick is a leading provider of technology-enabled risk, benefits and integrated business solutions. Taking care of people is at the heart of everything we do. Millions of people and organizations count on Sedgwick each year to take care of their needs when they face a major life event or something unexpected happens. Whether they have a workplace injury, suffer property or financial loss or damage from a natural or manmade disaster, are involved in an auto or other type of accident, or need time away from work for the birth of a child or another medical situation, we are here to provide compassionate care and expert guidance. Our clients depend on our talented colleagues to take care of their most valuable assets—their employees, their customers and their property. At Sedgwick, caring counts®. Join our team of creative and caring people of all backgrounds, and help us make a difference in the lives of others. The role:As a Cybersecurity Analyst, you will troubleshoot various security incidents across the organisation and assist with providing feedback and resolution to mitigate future security shortfalls. Your main responsibilities will include:Assisting with detection, monitoring, and resolution of security incidentsAdministering various IT Security tools and applicationsAssisting IT groups and business units as necessary in troubleshooting compatibility issues between security tools and business or productivity programsAssisting management in investigating IT or cyber-security events and suggesting resolutionProviding feedback and suggestions to improve IT Security processes and proceduresWorking closely with project managers to meet and complete project milestones accurately and on timeSupporting the organisation's quality programmeTravelling as required. You will have/will be:As a global business, we are always interested in hearing from candidates with bi-lingual or multi-lingual skillsDegree in Information Systems or Computer Science is preferred, or equivalent commercial experienceBasic knowledge of the security confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) TriadBasic knowledge of security information and events management (SIEM) solutionsAbility to work with a broad range of security tools and new technologiesAbility to handle confidential sensitive information with integrityExcellent oral and written communication skills, including presentation skills What will you get for this role?Competitive salary depending on skills, experience and qualificationsMany of our vacancies offer the opportunity to work flexibly, whether from office and/or home Working at SedgwickOur company is a place where creative and caring people of all backgrounds can be challenged, grow as individuals, and feel a higher purpose in the unique value they bring and the difference they make in the lives of others. We celebrate our differences; cultivating uniqueness and belonging allows us to connect with our consumers on a personal level, understand our clients’ needs, support the communities in which we operate, and perform at our best.We’re passionate and understanding about our colleagues – so we have built flexibility into our colleague working model. If you wish to work from home, split your working time between the home and office or change your hours so you can collect your children or care for someone in your family, we’re supportive of that. As a flexible employer, we’re happy to discuss options that take into consideration your personal needs for this position during your interview. Applicants who are successful at interview will be, as part of pre-employment screening, subject to: ID document verification, credit check, address verification, employment verification, employment gap verification, anti-money laundering search, directorship search and global watch list check.Sedgwick is committed to Equal Opportunity and Diversity. We aim to ensure that no job applicant or employee receives less favourable treatment on the ground of race, colour, nationality, religion, ethnic or national origins, age, gender, marital status, sexual orientation or disability.  Sedgwick is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace.

Name: Cybersecurity Assessor
Description:
The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini, a global leader in consulting, digital transformation, technology and engineering services, is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today, it is a multicultural company with over 270,000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran, the Group reported 2020 combined revenues of EUR 15.8 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com [link removed].
 
Let's talk about the team:
Our Cloud Infrastructure Services (CIS) practice brings together the right technology, processes and culture to deliver business agility and cost reduction to our clients. We provide cloud focused client advisory and delivery services on areas such as hybrid cloud, workplace services, security, service desk and cloud service management/delivery. 
Let's talk about the role and responsibilities: 


Working with business and technical areas to support the development of security documentation in preparation for external IRAP assessment


Working closely with Customer's team to develop Governance, Risk Management and Compliance (GRC) deliverables (Security Strategy / Frameworks / Policies / Assessments / Solutions etc.) and lead their implementation either at customer location or remotely dependent upon the customers' requirements and preferred working practices


Developing and implementing Enterprise Security Strategy, Governance Frameworks, Standards, Policies (e.g., Conversant in IRAP, ISO27001, COBIT, PCI-DSS, etc.)


Professional experience in developing a variety of technical documentation


Maintaining quality and customer satisfaction


Let's talk about your qualifications and experience:  


Prior experience with ISM controls up to PROTECTED level


Security policy and procedure writing experience as they relate to core security artefacts defined in the ISM and PSPF


Knowledge of, or performance of IRAP and system certification and accreditation


Must have security clearance - baseline minimum


Must have experience in Security Risk and Compliance Audit and its implementation


Knowledge of risk management methodologies


Good governance exposure on ISO 27001, PCI DSS, SOX, GDPR standard and other regulatory requirements 


Knowledge in Unix, Windows, Active Directory


Knowledge of networking principles including TCP/IP


Good understanding or background in information security tools such as SIEM, endpoint software, IPS, IDS products, GRC products  


Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Services, or similar


Good to have trainings / certifications (IRAP, ISO 27001:2013 LA/LI, CISA, CISM, CISSP)


 
Let's talk about what's in it for you!
Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge, support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits.  We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. 
As "Architects of Positive Futures", Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:
Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation, which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religion, ability, intersex status or age.  To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion, we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali, Bastille Day, Pride, IDAHOBIT, IWD and International day of people with Disabilities.  Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini, OutFront, Indigeneous, Parents and Careers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.  
Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution.  We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.
Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models, Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030. 
Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row, ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business.  Embedded in our DNA, our seven values - Honesty, Boldness, Trust, Team Spirit, Freedom, Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life, visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ [link removed] and listen to some of our employee's stories.
Come join us, bring your whole self to work, create new possibilities for you, your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures. 

Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Name: Network and Cybersecurity, IT Professional
Description: Who We ArePSA Engineering are an established Industrial Automation and Electrical Engineers specialising in Oil and Gas, Utilities, Manufacturing and Amusement sectors.We are a flexible, results-oriented company, with a focus on bringing excellence to our customers. We take pride in the work we do and the results we deliver. We enable our staff through collaboration and teamwork to achieve superior individual and collective performance. We are proud to be part of an organisation that is supportive, inclusive, and transparent, and one that recognises our strength through diversity. The RolePSA Engineering are seeking an experienced IT professional (5+ years) to undertake network systems design and custom solutions development as part of our Digital Solutions team based in Brisbane. Preferred candidates for this role will have demonstratable skills and experience in four or more of the following technical areas: Excellent knowledge of Networking technologies (switching, routing, VLAN, WLAN, WAN, VPN, IP-SEC)IP LAN and WAN Network design and implementation, experience with Cicso, or Moxa networking equipment.Firewall implementation using Fortigate, Cisco, Moxa, Plao Alto or Juniper.  Practical experience with upgrading and augmenting networksExperience with Operational Technology and Process Control Networks highly regardedWindows and Windows Server administration, deployment, and maintenanceApplication Whitelisting, Carbon black and windows ATP highly desirable Advanced knowledge of Active Directory, Group Policies, DNS, DHCP and Windows Server 2012 through 2019Vcenter/VSphere integration Hardware obsolescence planning and implementationExperience with Physical Security design or implementation desirable  Additionally successful candidate must have:Strong written and verbal communication skills Well-presented and ability to communicate directly with customers and internal stakeholders  Effective time management and ability to work independentlyOpen Australian Driver’s License Must have the legal right to live and work in Australia. Day to day responsibilities and Opportunities:Design, Installation, administration and support of internal and customer Physical and Virtualised Network and Server Infrastructure.Active participation and/or leading technical project delivery for both internal and client projectsProviding onsite consulting and support services to our clients in the South East Queensland region as requiredAdministration, maintenance and support of internal IT systems, software environments and documentation.Work as part of a team of professionals from different backgrounds to deliver engineering projects.Opportunities to specialise in emerging technologies through formal training.Opportunities for overnight site travel. Benefits of working for PSA Engineering:Experience the impact of your work on customers and the organisationWork on diverse and challenging projects, with leading technologies, across several industrial sectorsFocus on new and emergent technologies and solutionsFlexible work policy tailored to individual circumstancesOptional Paid Overtime and flexible Leave arrangementsFocus on continuous training and developmentFlexible, competitive remuneration packagesLong-term career opportunities PSA Engineering is committed to the ongoing development of all team members. As our organisation evolves, opportunities continually arise for staff to pursue technical specialisation or management pathways.

Name: Enterprise Business Development Manager - Vic/Tas - Secure Power
Description:
Why us?
Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

€25.7bn global revenue

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. APPLY TODAY!

Name: Sales Manager (AUS)
Description: What We Do:Founded in 2015 by former NSA cyber operators, Huntress was built on a simple premise: to force hackers to earn every inch of their access.Today’s cyber-attacks aren’t limited to large organizations with the security tools that can ward off threats. Hackers don't discriminate and will find a way to penetrate any vulnerability in any size business.  Huntress enables IT providers and resellers to stop hidden threats that sneak past preventive security tools.Through a combination of expert human threat hunters, a comprehensive platform, and a desire to make the world a safer place, we’re working to deliver cybersecurity to the 99%—those small to midsize businesses that make up the backbone of our economy. Join the hunt and help us stop hackers in their tracks!What You’ll Do: Not only is Huntress growing, we’re growing internationally.  We are a US based managed security platform providing tools and services for small and mid-sized businesses.  As we prepare for our growth in Australia, we need to add a Sales Manager to help build and lead our first Australian Sales Development Representatives and Business Development Representatives team. You’ll be the primary leadership and mentorship for these teams, providing training, and ensuring the team is set up for success and maximum productivity.  You’ll be responsible for hiring, training, and mentoring your team while also being part of the greater sales leadership team, who will provide you the support needed to drive results and build a high performing team.  Huntress utilizes a consultative approach to sales and you’ll ensure our teams are providing education and value to our potential customers.  We don’t believe in sales gimmicks, we sell through education, transparency, and by partnering with our customers to solve their needs.  Responsibilities:  Provide initial and continuous training on cold calling best practices and pipeline managementEnsure SDR’s reach their KPI targets each month, through strong management processesMaintain quality assurance processes, providing input for improvement Work with operations to ensure tools and information databases are configured for maximum successMaintain an appointment no show rate at or below industry rateWork to remove SDR/BDR performance obstaclesHandle escalated calls Provide support for SDR/BDR questions in real timeMaintain and reinforce Huntress’ cultureWhat You Bring To The Team:  3+ years of demonstrated success in a sales leadership role, managing teams, quotas and training4+ years of demonstrated success in an SDR or similar role, with a proven track record of successPrevious experience working with MSP’s is requiredDemonstrate leadership and coaching skillsAttention to detail, and the ability to recognize patterns in a variety of performance statistics.Demonstrate empathy and thoughtfulness in your professional communicationCoachable and eager for continuous improvementWhat We Offer: Fully remote workNew starter home office set up allowance Generous personal leave entitlementsMobile phone reimbursement SuperannuationHuntress is committed to creating a culture of inclusivity where every single member of our team is valued, has a voice and is empowered to show up to work every day as their full self. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status. People from all culturally diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.We do discriminate against hackers who try to exploit small businesses.Accommodations:If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodations@huntresslabs.com.  Please note non-accommodation requests to this inbox will not receive a response.

Name: Risk and Assurance Manager
Description: I am working with a leading education institute in Melbourne CBD whom are currently going through a growth phase and are looking to expand their internal team.  The purpose of the role:  The overall purpose of the Security and Risk Assurance Manager is to leads the delivery of cybersecurity governance, assurance, risk (including third party risk management), and compliance programs and initiatives to help understand, measure, and manage my client's cyber-risk posture that underpins the their strategic goals. This highly visible role will be key to establish and enforce strong security practices across their businesses and strategic programs; including defining key security indicators, policies, standards and processes.  Organisational Unit  My client's information technology infrastructure provides capability to support teaching, learning, research and administration. The Information Technology Services (ITS) department provides services in relation to networks, communications, computing platforms, data stores, desk-top and mobile access, administrative enterprise systems, student learning environments, information security and IT risk management. The Director of their Cyber & Digital Networks provides strategic direction to the cyber - security practices for enterprise systems in alignment with corporate risk management and IT controls framework. The ITS Security and Risk Assurance oversees the development, implementation and enforcement of a range of underlying security controls, governance and risk assurance capabilities whilst ensuring enablement of strategic digital and transformational objectives.  Key Accountabilities:   ITS Portfolio Risk ManagementEnterprise Cyber and Technical Risk AdvisoryThreat Model and AssessmentISMS Development and MaintenanceCyber GovernanceThe main skills for this role:   Strong understating of security risks, governance and management reporting practices and standards including NIST, CSF, Cobit5, ISO2700xAbility to display training and certifications aligned to IT security including CISA, CISSP, CISM.Extensive experience in reviewing contracts to identify security risks of new solutions and cloud based services.10+ years of experience working in ISM and/or related functions such as Security Manager, IT Risk Management or IT Audit.Demonstrated experience in managing technical interactions as well as champion services in security advocate roles.If you are looking for a career where you can use our experience to deliver real results, this is the one for you.  If you are interested in this role or would like to have a confidential discussion about this, or any other role, apply now.  Due to the large amount of applications, only the successful candidates will be contacted.   Adrian OrleanskiRecruitment ConsultantManpowerGroup is committed to being a Diversity Confident Recruiter and encourages applications from people from a diverse range of backgrounds, including people with a disability. Please indicate your preferred method of communication in your resume and please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments should you be contacted for an interview.Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.By submitting your resume and other personal information with this application you are consenting to this information being collected in line with our privacy policy. Follow the link to learn more - www.manpowergroup.com.au/privacy-policy [link removed]Experis Pty Ltd is a wholly owned subsidiary of ManpowerGroupState: QLD, licensee/s Manpower Services (Australia) Pty Ltd, LHL-02026-D5L4Q. State: QLD, licensee/s Experis Pty Ltd, LHL-02014-Y5F6D. State: SA, licensee/s Manpower Services (Australia) Pty Ltd, LHS 288856

Name: Technical Delivery Manager
Description: Company description:Metro moves you around Melbourne.As the city's metropolitan rail service, Metro operates 226 six carriage trains across 998 kilometres of track, transporting 450,000 customers each day. We aim to encourage the Melbourne community's vibrant and ever evolving lifestyles, by providing a seamless transport solution to keep individuals connected.With 15 lines, 222 stations and services seven days a week, Metro can take you wherever you're headed across the city, whenever you want to go.Job description:   Why work for Metro?    Influence large rail infrastructure projects to integrate new technology into major infrastructure projects Have a significant impact on programs that will directly improve Melbourne's suburban rail network whilst ensuring these developments do not come at a cost to our safe and cost-effective delivery of services. All Metro Employees receive a free Myki pass for free Public Transport in Victoria.      Jargon Buster    OCMS - Operational Control Management Systems - Metro's Technology Team MTM - Metro Trains Melbourne MTP - Metro Tunnel Project MAR - Melbourne Airport Rail      About the Role   The Technical Delivery Manager is responsible for the design review, test verification and quality of technology solutions including High Capacity Signalling and Communications Based Train Control delivered to OCMS by contracted delivery partners as part of the Victorian State Government Big Build projects program.     Responsibilities    Reporting to the Head of Technology Integration - Metro Tunnel  and Melbourne Airport Rail , this role will: Build a solid and collaborative working relationship with technical subject matter experts from delivery partners and MTM functional team leads and architects responsible for the delivery of MTP and MAR technology solution components Ensure the right stakeholders are engaged and consulted to ensure successful technical review and delivery of technology solutions Lead a cross-functional technical team comprised of functions including control systems engineering, train control and signalling, enterprise architecture and cybersecurity      About You    Proven experience in successfully delivering multiple technology solutions  for large projects in a matrix model organisation Good understanding of testing regimes and experience in using them to deliver quality technology solution outcomes in large projects with critical interfacing and performance requirements Experience in ensuring technology solutions proposed and delivered meet industry/government-based security compliance standards (e.g. VPDSS, ISM, COBIT, ISO/IEC 27002, NIST) Rail experience or aligned industry such as road transport, aviation or telecommunications would be highly valued

Name: Senior Cybersecurity Engineer
Description:
About QIC
QIC is a leading long-term specialist manager in alternatives with a focus on infrastructure, real estate and private capital. We also specialise in liquid market solutions, providing multi-asset portfolios, liquid alternatives, active fixed interest and tailored overlays for our clients.
We’re high-performing and care about our clients, our colleagues and society at large. Headquartered in Brisbane, QIC is one of the largest institutional investment managers in Australia with over 800 employees across Brisbane, Sydney, Melbourne, New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, London and Copenhagen.
Life at QIC
QIC values and embraces differences and is committed to building an inclusive culture as we know our people do their best when they bring their whole self to work. Our commitment is represented through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan and employee-led diversity networks promoting LGBTI, young professionals and gender equality.
The wellbeing of our employees is at our core. We support your personal development, family and interests while empowering flexibility through initiatives such as; fitness reimbursements, recharge leave, study assistance and generous parental leave. At QIC, we know flexibility means something different to everyone; talk to us about what flexibility means to you. For more information on benefits to support your QIC career journey please visit our career page.

Join QIC's IT Risk and Security Team in Brisbane on a full-time basis as a Senior Cyber Security Engineer. You will be a technical advisor delivering expertise in the latest techniques and methods to identify, protect, detect, respond, and recover against evolving cyber security threats.  
As Senior Cyber Security Engineer you will be involved in executing reactive and proactive activities across technical and non-technical controls within the QIC environment to ensure that vulnerabilities are uncovered, and potential threats are exposed – whilst also ensuring equally appropriate contingency plans or responses exist.
Key role opportunities include:
SIEM Management – Optimise QIC’s early detection and response capabilities through the management of log ingestion, creation of automated reports and alerts. Work alongside QIC’s 24x7 (external) Security Operations Centre (SOC) to manage relationship and develop security use cases.
Incident Management - Execute incident management procedures including monitoring and manage all local security breaches and handling of security incidents, root cause analysis and impact, taking appropriate action to prevent recurrence wherever possible. Ensure all incidents are logged, reported, and appropriately documented as per a defined security incident procedure.
Emerging Threat Advice – Provide advice and insight to QIC management on significant emerging threats and recommend tactical or strategic change to counteract these threats. Prepare options and analysis on effective control changes across people, process, and technology to ensure QIC is protected.
Critical Peer Contact – Act as a liaison between industry peers, government agencies (including law enforcement) and other specialists, coordinating with QIC’s SOC, to identify and assess IT security incidents.
Cybersecurity Framework and Control Management– review and monitor QIC’s information technology security control environment. Assess the effectiveness of controls and ensure all technology assets (digital or otherwise) are adequately protected by effective and operating controls.
Vulnerability Management – Monitor QIC’s technology assets and ensure all vulnerabilities are identified, assessed, and remediated in accordance with QIC’s risk appetite. Provide advice on zero-day vulnerabilities to ensure QIC remains protected.  
Reporting and Communication – prepare regular business and executive reporting based on ongoing cybersecurity and information and metrics either internally or externally as appropriate.
Support, Assist and Advise – provide support to delivery teams to ensure optimal use and application of security controls and systems. Consultation with key stakeholders to ensure IT Risk and Security policies remains aligned with stakeholder requirements

You will be confident working autonomously as a senior contributor whilst building relationships across teams and mentoring others.  As a strong collaborator with a solutions mindset, you will bring solid expertise from prior IT or Cyber experience. You will be confident with report writing, presenting and communication skills. You will also bring;
Solid knowledge of security or information risk management 
Experience and expertise in areas of control management; assessment and monitoring
Sound knowledge of industry practise in cyber security frameworks (e.g. NIST/ CIS, etc)
Understanding of security review and response planning
Sound understanding of technology and contemporary use in corporate environments
Experience in using SPLUNK security information and events monitoring

Name: Senior Penetration Tester/Technical Specialist
Description: The global pandemic has resulted in a major slowdown for many organisations but Cybercrime by contrast has positively exploded. There are some really awesome opportunities out there for people with the right skills and mindset, the question is really about which path you wish to take…In 2021, SpiderLabs set out to build the most diverse, well supported and kickass team of offensive testers in the Pacific region, respected by our clients and our industry peers alike for our skills, innovation and professionalism.Our leaders are testers themselves, not middle management bureaucrats, so we understand what it takes to motivate and empower such a team, and accelerate your technical and career growth.Here are just a few things that we offer:$5k and 5 days training / continued education allowance per yearFlexible work arrangements within a world class team of high achieversA strong culture based on a flat hierarchy where you will be empowered and entrusted with autonomy, but strongly supported throughoutRegular team meetings to share our best memes and hacksSo who are we?The SpiderLabs Australian team is built on mutual trust from the top down. We are driven and passionate about breaking all the things, and getting down to amongst the weeds. We check our egos at the door and are firm believers in the power of collaboration.  We work hard and are passionate about the quality of our deliverables, but don’t take ourselves too seriously. Office pranks are not uncommon.Our team is a supercharged venomous amalgam of Hivint bees and SpiderLabs arachnids, both highly regarded in their own right, but by leveraging each others’ tools and skills, we are practically unstoppable.As is common in our industry, application and infrastructure testing is our bread and butter, but in recent times, we have also seen the exponential increase in bespoke and specialised jobs. Here’s a list of some particularly interesting jobs we delivered during COVID 2020, just to name a few:Numerous critical infrastructure testsHighly bespoke Red Team activities including physical, network, phishing, and vishing exercisesSystems that support COVID responseSmart hardware including building management, transport, manufacturing, critical infrastructure and kiosks, just to name a fewOur team collectively identified > 10 zero days and numerous CVEs both published and pending fixesThe SpiderLabs Australian team has hundreds of customers spanning a wide range of industries offering us exposure to a wide variety of the latest and greatest technologies.We are looking for passionate candidates with (ideally) around 3-4 years of relevant experience in application and network penetration testing (and ideally an OSCP - but lacking this, experience in the following are valuable: local CTFs, Hack The Box, TryHackMe, OverTheWire, Bugcrowd, DVWA, Pentester Lab, OWASP WebGoat), strong attention to detail, and solid communication (verbal and written) skills. Team management experience is also a plus (but not required). Valid work rights in Australia is also required.If you are considering being a part of this, do reach out to us, even if it's just for a chat with some of our SpiderLabs leaders to get to know our team and the role better.At Trustwave, everyone's experience is valued. We advocate Diversity of Thought, using diversity of experiences and perspectives to innovate and solve real world problems. Our people have studied at different universities, are self-taught, have worked in different companies in Australia, and around the world. Whoever you are, be comfortable, be different, be you, with us. Join Trustwave and together we’ll solve the cybersecurity challenges of today and into the future.Trustwave is an Equal Opportunity Employer.To All Agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Trustwave outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Trustwave policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via the Trustwave Agency Portal. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, by the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of Trustwave and in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Name: DevSecOps Engineer
Description: Servian is an award winning, regional and global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps, Digital app dev, Machine Learning and cloud. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has for us and our clients. All roles at Servian involve personal and technical development pathways which aim to facilitate your career growth. We aim to build an employee experience where you will grow more with us, not be drowned out by the loudest voice, and hence we strive to set you up for a career which will have a greater impact.Servian is looking for dynamic individuals to join our growing Cybersecurity practice. We are looking for people who want to use their strong engineering skills to solve security challenges.Governance, risk and complianceSecurity testingSecurity and Risk assessmentsImplementation of DevSecOps delivery modelsCompliance as code design and deliveryCISO-as-a-ServiceSecurity ArchitectureCloud security posture reviews The RoleWe are looking for DevSecOps engineers (or DevOps engineers who want to grow into a security focused role. Our consultants are natural problem solvers - they are curious, ambitious and experts in their fields. You will have the opportunity to collaborate and learn from them. We’re looking for people who understand the delivery patterns, have experience of multiple technologies and have a personal desire to learn and grow in the DevSecOps and cloud environments.  The position will require you to:Lead the implementation of cloud solutions for clients, including infrastructure, data platforms and migration strategy.Ensure a secure approach and architecture.Incorporate security automation tooling and related security standards and processes into the DevOps lifecycle.Work with clients to coach and share our solutions and approaches.Mentor and coach junior team members.Maintain accreditations with one or more of our key cloud and technology partners.Deliver training workshops and labs to our staff and clients.Provide Pre-Sales Support and solution architecture. Your experience - We’re looking for people who have the right approach and a breadth of knowledge across some of the following:Development, operations or system engineering experience.Experience with AWS, GCP or Azure Knowledge and experience with Infrastructure as Code and configuration management.Designed, implemented and operated secure code management and build pipelines.Implemented secure CI/CD pipelines with automated deployment and management.Experience with cloud services including IaaS, PasS and SaaS.A detailed understanding of the underlying technologies and platform building blocks of the cloud environment.Strong automation and scripting experience.A drive for self-improvement and a passion for learning.An holistic approach encompassing the business goals and solution architecture whilst maintaining a secure operating posture.A dynamic approach to your work enabling you to meet the needs of changing environments. Bonus points! If you have some experience in any of the following, it would be seen as advantageous:Experience in source code security tools, e.g. Snyk, SourceClear, Black Duck, SonarQube.Experience with SAST, DAST, RAST.Experience with compliance as code (E.g. OPA, Gatekeeper).Experience building/managing continuous compliance monitoring solutions.Experience designing/maintaining SIEM solutions (E.g. Splunk ES, Exabeam, Arcsight, Elasticsearch, Apache Metron, or something you built yourself!).Experience with secret management design and implementation.Applicable security certifications, such as CISSP, SABSA, CISM etc. Why join Servian?Work on a wide range of interesting projects, using a variety of emerging technologies.A chance to work alongside a collaborative and passionate like-minded team.Consultant-led events including Social clubs, Tech clubs (IoT, Chatbots, etc.), Gaming events, MeetUps, and Cloud vendor Hackathons.Proactive career development through structured learning and development, multiple avenues for growth and an innovative reward and recognition structure.Alongside the above, we also provide employees with life and salary insurance, progressive parental leave policy, and a sociable workplace that truly values its diversity. If you like what you see and are interested, please don’t hesitate…..APPLY NOW!

Name: Pentester/Technical Specialist
Description: The global pandemic has resulted in a major slowdown for many organisations but Cybercrime by contrast has positively exploded. There are some really awesome opportunities out there for people with the right skills and mindset, the question is really about which path you wish to take… In 2021, SpiderLabs set out to build the most diverse, well supported and kickass team of offensive testers in the Pacific region, respected by our clients and our industry peers alike for our skills, innovation and professionalism. Our leaders are testers themselves, not middle management bureaucrats, so we understand what it takes to motivate and empower such a team, and accelerate your technical and career growth. Here are just a few things that we offer:  $5k and 5 days training / continued education allowance per year Flexible work arrangements within a world class team of high achievers A strong culture based on a flat hierarchy where you will be empowered and entrusted with autonomy, but strongly supported throughout Regular team meetings to share our best memes and hacks So who are we?  The SpiderLabs Australian team is built on mutual trust from the top down. We are driven and passionate about breaking all the things, and getting down to amongst the weeds. We check our egos at the door and are firm believers in the power of collaboration.  We work hard and are passionate about the quality of our deliverables, but don’t take ourselves too seriously. Office pranks are not uncommon. Our team is a supercharged venomous amalgam of Hivint bees and SpiderLabs arachnids, both highly regarded in their own right, but by leveraging each others’ tools and skills, we are practically unstoppable. As is common in our industry, application and infrastructure testing is our bread and butter, but in recent times, we have also seen the exponential increase in bespoke and specialised jobs. Here’s a list of some particularly interesting jobs we delivered during COVID 2020, just to name a few:  Numerous critical infrastructure tests Highly bespoke Red Team activities including physical, network, phishing, and vishing exercises Systems that support COVID response Smart hardware including building management, transport, manufacturing, critical infrastructure and kiosks, just to name a few Our team collectively identified > 10 zero days and numerous CVEs both published and pending fixes The SpiderLabs Australian team has hundreds of customers spanning a wide range of industries offering us exposure to a wide variety of the latest and greatest technologies. We are looking for passionate candidates with up to 2 years of relevant experience in application and network penetration testing (ideally an OSCP - but lacking this, experience in the following are valuable: local CTFs, Hack The Box, TryHackMe, OverTheWire, Bugcrowd, DVWA, Pentester Lab, OWASP WebGoat), strong attention to detail, and solid communication (verbal and written) skills. Valid work rights here in Australia is also required. If you are considering being a part of this, do reach out to us, even if it's just for a chat with some of our SpiderLabs leaders to get to know our team and the role better. At Trustwave, everyone's experience is valued. We advocate Diversity of Thought, using diversity of experiences and perspectives to innovate and solve real world problems. Our people have studied at different universities, are self-taught, have worked in different companies in Australia, and around the world. Whoever you are, be comfortable, be different, be you, with us. Join Trustwave and together we’ll solve the cybersecurity challenges of today and into the future. Trustwave is an Equal Opportunity Employer. To All Agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Trustwave outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Trustwave policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via the Trustwave Agency Portal. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, by the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of Trustwave and in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Name: Business Development Manager
Description: Looking for BDM to join growing CyberSecurity company platform provider that combines next-gen security controls and streamline processes between Vendor and End user by offering best package. Company is offering great company culture, responsive management and realist targets, uncapped commission structure. Fully remote position with travel to Sydney to meet the team and attend industry events. Our Client is looking for: Strong New Business Development professional, taking initiative in identifying new opportunities. Ideal candidate would demonstrate proven history of success selling and winning new businesses across medium to enterprise level clients, taking proactive approach looking for new leads by attending industry events, networking and using tools provided by the company such as inbound requests, sales development rep, Webinars, conferences.A minimum of 3 years' experience in IT (with a strong preference for Cyber Security)Ability to work in a multi-facetted, fast-paced environmentExperience both in SaaS and services/consulting organisations, highly desiredMid-market or Enterprise level experience selling complex solutions, strongly desiredManage deal closures through use of strong negotiation skills at every point of the sales cycleEffective and organized management of multiple accounts and deals, on an on-going basisDrive sales through the use of strong qualification and sales methodology Maria ZemskovaSales Recruitment ConsultantLet's Connecthttps://www.linkedin.com/in/maria-zemskova-40a418115/+61 0431 624 400 ManpowerGroup is committed to being a Diversity Confident Recruiter and encourages applications from people from a diverse range of backgrounds, including people with a disability. Please indicate your preferred method of communication in your resume and please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments should you be contacted for an interview.Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.By submitting your resume and other personal information with this application you are consenting to this information being collected in line with our privacy policy. Follow the link to learn more - www.manpowergroup.com.au/privacy-policy [link removed]Experis Pty Ltd is a wholly owned subsidiary of ManpowerGroupState: QLD, licensee/s Manpower Services (Australia) Pty Ltd, LHL-02026-D5L4Q. Name: Software Programmer
Description:
Job No.: 631051
Location: Clayton campus
Employment Type: Full-time
Duration: 2-year fixed-term appointment
Remuneration: $92,589 - $101,552 pa HEW Level 07 (plus 17% employer superannuation)

Be inspired, every day
Take your career in exciting, rewarding directions
Be a part of an inclusive, collaborative community

There’s a certain feeling you get from working at Monash University. It’s the feeling that you’re a part of something special. Something significant. And that’s because you’re not just starting your career, or taking on a bigger challenge. You’re making a real contribution – surrounded by energetic, inspiring people who are driven to make a difference as well. Monash is a place where you’ll be able to develop your career in exciting, sometimes unexpected ways – putting you in the best possible position for a rewarding future.
The Opportunity
An opportunity has become available for a Software Programmer to join the Department of Software Systems and Cybersecurity within the Faculty of Information Technology at Monash University on a 2-year fixed-term basis. In this role you will be reporting directly to the Deputy Head of Department and will be asked to oversee and deliver high-quality technical services to support the operations of the Enhanced Telehealth Project team. There is also potential to work on other Faculty projects once the Enhanced Telehealth Project is finished. This role will play a critical role in supporting the delivery of user-centred and agile software engineering outcomes.
This can include:

Designing, developing, and delivering software solutions on the WebRTC framework to be integrated into our industrial partner Health Direct Australia’s telehealth platform
Contributing to project planning and operations to share knowledge and expertise in the area of technical specialisation
Providing specialist and technical advice and/or training to key stakeholders in the area of service or technical expertise
Developing and maintaining up-to-date specialist or technical knowledge of new and innovative methodology, equipment, technology, data management and analysis in the field of specialisation
Overseeing and undertaking all aspects of software engineering
Overseeing and co-ordinating the day-to-day technical operations including; software implementation, functional and user testing, data collection activities, ensuring OHS and a safe operations, maintaining equipment and materials, waste disposal and ordering of devices and supplies

This position is suited to a highly motivated individual who holds a degree qualification in a relevant field with extensive relevant experience; or extensive industrial software development experience and management expertise. The successful candidate will ideally have demonstrated experience in overseeing a successful technical service, program or facility, with a focus on operational excellence as well as demonstrated experience in working with modern web technologies. Additionally, the ideal candidate will have experience in supporting a safe operating environment and producing commercial grade software solutions in an agile framework.
This role is a full-time position; however, flexible working arrangements may be negotiated.
If you believe you can fulfil these requirements, you are strongly encouraged to apply.
At Monash University, we are committed to being a Child Safe organisation. This position at the University will require the incumbent to hold a valid Working with Children Check. 
Your application must address the selection criteria. Please refer to "How to apply for Monash Jobs".
Enquiries
Associate Professor Rashina Hoda, Deputy Head of Department, +61 3 9902 9970
Position Description
 Software Programmer
Closing Date
Sunday 17 July 2022, 11:55pm AEST
 
At Monash University, the health, safety and wellbeing of our staff, students and visitors remain our priority. In accordance with the Directions issued by Victoria’s Chief Health Officer, we require all staff, students and visitors to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption from receiving a COVID-19 vaccine in order to attend our campuses and locations. 
For the latest information on COVID-19 at Monash, please visit our website.
