Name: Vendor Business Manager
Description: The role of the Vendor Business Manager is to strategically align with a selection of Westcon vendors, build demand through a defined group of resellers and channel partners, coordinate and manage operations to deliver supply chain excellence, involving the development of a strategic business plan that meets the common needs of both Westcon Group and a selection of Weston vendors.The Vendor Business Manager must own the strategic development of the assigned vendors within Westcon Group and its customers, with the view to developing a strategic plan that assists to grow their revenues and market share in the chosen market, both geographically and segmented.  Other responsibilities include: To meet and exceed both Vendor and Westcon Group revenue targets. To manage pricing, supply chain management and other operational aspects to ensure the success of the assigned Vendor/s Business Unit. To seek initiatives that enhance Westcon Group’s profitability with the selected vendors.To work with the Westcon Group Marketing team to develop sales and marketing initiatives in order to grow incremental revenue streams for the selected vendors. This will incorporate vendor initiatives, marketing planning activities and pre-sales/training. Skills, knowledge & experience:Able to demonstrate a good general understanding of Enterprise technologies and how they relate to one anotherCybersecurity, SD-WAN or SASE exposure and knowledge a definite advantageProven ability to develop sales and marketing strategies that align vendor requirements with Westcon objectivesExperienced working in both the traditional “reseller” channel model, as well as within MSP and Cloud channel modelsDevelop and oversee business planning, identify dependencies and key stakeholders and  ensure business plan adoption and execution Strong interpersonal skills; ability to build strong relationships quickly and effectivelyAbout Westcon-ComstorWestcon-Comstor is the world's leading specialty distributor of advanced network technological solutions. Operating in more than 70 countries, we deliver business value and opportunity by connecting the world’s leading IT vendors with a channel of technology resellers, systems integrators and service providers.We combine our industry insight, technical know-how and decades of distribution experience to deliver value and accelerate our vendors’ and partners’ business success.Our success is founded on the energy and expertise of our people. Their ideas and enthusiasm for our company, our vendors and our partners fuels their daily mission to deliver outstanding channel performance. Come and join our innovative and commercially astute team who are focused on being the leaders in our industry and having a culture of partnership, integrity, empowerment, excellence and fun.

Name: Manager - IT Audit
Description:
Working at RSM 
Looking to work for a multinational and well-known organisation, but don’t want to get lost in the crowd? As a mid-tier firm, RSM has the perfect balance of providing exposure to a variety of clients and services, without overlooking an employee’s career objectives and individual areas of interest. RSM offers the combined benefits of a big firm including extensive networks, training and career opportunities – within a highly supportive, people-oriented workplace.  This combination provides a great environment to build skills and confidence. We help our people achieve to their best. RSM prides themselves on hiring and retaining employees by providing flexible work arrangements, regular and dedicated mentorship from senior management, and opportunities for future learning and training.
The technology team is a specialist team under the wider Risk Advisory Services cohort. You will be working closely with others within this specialist field, gaining exposure to numerous cyber security, information security and privacy related services. You will be provided with the opportunity to expand your knowledge and skillset with the dedicated support and guidance from both subject matter experts, as well as senior management.
Position Summary
Successful candidates will be responsible for effectively delivering engagements/projects and managing junior staff. You will be skilled and experienced at scoping, planning, delivery and reporting of IT general control (ITGC) reviews and keen to learn more about cyber security, information security and privacy related services.
Key Responsibilities:

Provide client management with guidance on IT risk management, particularly on application, database, operating system and network infrastructure controls. Help identify improvement opportunities for clients and write reports for clients with recommendations for identified findings.
Perform technology risk assessments, assess the effectiveness of processes/controls and make recommendations to improve the technology control environment.
Ensure completion of each assignment to a high-quality standard, within budget and on or before deadlines, while controlling the progress of other assignments.
Co-ordinate the engagement, liaise with client, mentor and coach the team, and ensure IT audit methodology compliance.
Work closely with other Risk Consulting and External Audit team members in delivery of reviews.
Assist partners and managers in business development activities.

Education Requirements:

Relevant tertiary degree and/or qualification is essential.
Certified Information Systems Auditor® (CISA®) qualified or nearly qualified (desired).

Demonstrated Experience & Attributes 

Minimum 4 years’ experience in IT audit, internal controls or risk management.
Experience performing IT general controls, technology risk assessments, testing or auditing against technology standards or governance frameworks.
Knowledge of IT processes, project management, applications, databases, operating systems and network infrastructure to apply better practice guidance and identify opportunities for improvement.
Outstanding interpersonal and communications skills, able to communicate effectively in verbal and written format with technical and non-technical audiences.
Experience managing a client portfolio, able to provide first class service in response to client demands.
Strong attention to detail and prioritising skills, able to produce high quality work autonomously and as part of a team.
Interested in developing skills further and working on engagements related to cybersecurity or information security standards or governance frameworks.

Life at RSM:
RSM provides a great environment to build skills and confidence and we help our people achieve their best. We are trusted advisors to our clients, so it is critical for us to find the right people for the job on offer. Our network of offices across Australia and around the world allow us to offer a personal service to all our clients regardless of where they are! Working for RSM entitles everyone to a wide range of leading health, wellness financial and lifestyle benefits.
How to apply:
Please click one the "apply now" button and complete our online application form. 
Agencies, thank you for thinking of us, but our recruitment is managed internally, and we will reach out to our preferred suppliers if we need assistance.

Name: Agile QA Manager
Description: Trend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fuelled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, Trend Micro's cybersecurity platform protects hundreds of thousands of organisations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints. As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, the platform delivers a powerful range of advanced threat defence techniques optimised for environments like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and central visibility for better, faster detection and response. With 7,000 employees across 65 countries, Trend Micro enables organisations to simplify and secure their connected world.By joining our team of passionate industry experts, you have the opportunity to become a trailblazer and shape the cybersecurity landscape. For additional information, visit www.trendmicro.com. Position Overview:The Agile QA Manager is responsible for…Manage multiple workstreams and coaching the Manual QA Team (managing test tickets, deployments, hotfixes, Amazon Elastic Search updates, API testing, and testing new features such as Cloud One integration, Template Security, Cloud One custom roles, etc)Manage the Automation QA Team (automating Public API, work on operations tickets, etc).Coordinate with developers and technical leads to enable technical knowledge transfer to the QA teamInvestigate customer raised issuesLead and support the teams as they transition from waterfall to agile QAAdvise and coach teams on how to build, deploy, and test infrastructure components on AWSLead the expansion of testing as a service for agileReduce the burden of manual testing and seek to improve QA KPIs as a combined manual and automated solutionImprove quality and velocity of engineering through integrated and efficient automated testingKnow how to solve common testing problems related to AWSContribution to improving CICD processesCommitment to quality, automation, securityWork with QA, developers and test engineers to improve test and release processesRemain current with market developments and recommend new test automation technologies Basic QualificationsSkills:Have a highly analytical mind that critically evaluates problems and solutions, as well as tools and technologies to assist in delivering engineering and operational goals expediently and cost effectively.Must be comfortable working independently, within a team, and seek to foster a culture of inclusion and constructive communication.Proactive and self-directed, identifying issues and opportunities ahead of time.Most of the automated tests run on serverless infrastructure and include end-to-end, unit tests, and smoke tests. So a knowledge of this would be importantExtensive experience working with AWS InfrastructurePreferred QualificationsUniversity degree is highly regardedAgile certificationAWS certification is a plusDevelopment experience, especially with JavaScriptBenefits of being a Trender!At Trend Micro, our people and culture are our power. There are no barriers – you are empowered to discover your passion and be the best part of yourself.We encourage you to challenge the status quo, break assumptions, and learn and grow every step of your career, fulfilling your potential.Helping customers succeed is our top priority. We believe in doing the right thing, solving the right problems, and maintaining business sustainability. And our efforts to make a difference go beyond the digital world.Trenders have the opportunity to be good global citizens by building houses in the Philippines, donating money to help underprivileged communities, educating kids and parents on online safety, advancing a diverse workforce (Close the Gap™ program), and more.We take employee wellbeing seriously. At Trend, you will have access to Medical Insurance, Mental Health Support through access to EAP, Yoga and Meditation sessions, Gym reimbursements, Paid Parental Leave etc. At Trend Micro, we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion. We believe that our people are our greatest asset and we understand the importance of bringing diverse perspectives, approaches, and experiences to our team. We are committed to building and supporting an inclusive workforce that truly reflects our global business and encourages people from all backgrounds to apply. We embrace change, empower people, and encourage innovation. Join Trend Micro and Thrive with us.We embrace change, empower people, and encourage innovation. Join Trend Micro and Thrive with us.

Name: Graduate Cyber Security Analyst
Description: Looking for a post pandemic change?Ready to put your cyber security training to workKeen to work for a company that offers maximum flexibility.Who we're looking for…Someone friendly, enthusiastic and helpful, with excellent technical and communication skills. In addition, we need someone who loves to be organised and enjoys giving attention to detail. You will be joining a Service Desk team that is striving to provide superior technical and customer focused support. In this role you will take lead on Level 1 cyber security tasks.Why work @ Matrix Solutions?We are a growing IT company that provides cloud solutions primarily to the legal industry. In addition, we offer managed support services for on-site networks. Most of our support is offered over the phone or online.Head office is in Sydney but we look after clients Australia-wide.  From the top down we really like our clients! We are a highly motivated group who enjoy working as a team to solve IT problems even when they are stressful.We also all enjoy our lives outside of work and strive to keep a healthy work/life balance!We have been doing what we do for over 27 years now so, in our opinion, we are getting better and better at it. Since our customer base is growing rapidly it seems our clients agree. However, we need to keep improving our systems as we grow. Our goal is to be Australia's number one supplier of IT services to small and medium-sized legal and professional firms.Your Background.....Information Technology degree with an emphasis on cyber security Excellent customer service skills, phone manners and passion in assisting employees with L1 IT issuesSkills in Active Directory, O365Excellent communication skills, approachable friendly personalityTertiary qualifications, ITIL or relevant certificationsEnthusiastic and contagious can-do attitudeFlexible attitude to all work dutiesThe Role:Respond to cyber security tickets assigned as first point of contact and, if necessary escalate issues to senior team membersUndertake continuous monitoring to detect anomalous or suspicious events in Microsoft 365 Security Portal, TrendMicro Portal and Netwrix Audit reports.Perform basic vulnerability management and monitoring on key client systemsDevelop and establish Standard Operating Procedures for Cyber Security related activitiesCollaboration with senior infrastructure engineers to implement security controlsMonitor system alerts and notifications, and respond accordingly through service tickets.Communication with customers as required: keeping them informed of incident progress.Working on a rotating roster to cover 8:00 am – 6:00 pm plus a 24 X 7 mobile phone rosterWhat we can offer youCareer path to grow within the team. A full-time position providing a negotiable salary, dependent on previous experience, plus superannuation.

Name: Project Manager
Description: About the RoleAs part of a growing projects team, you will be required to manage multiple projects at any one time. You will be able to work in a team with other project managers, engineers, and admin alike, but can also work autonomously to deliver required outcomes. Our clients are many and varied, which may mean travelling to client sites at times, so a valid driver's licence and personal car will be required. You will have a client focus, good commercial acumen, ensuring high quality service delivery backed by great customer service and excellent documentation skills. Time management and a willingness to interact with clients are critical to your success in the role.  ResponsibilitiesProviding effective day to day management of medium to large sized projects - budget, schedule, resource management, client engagement and satisfactionWorking with Pre-Sales teams to establish a strong project baseline through to kick off with the clientLeading project initiation activities including development of project schedules, procurement and engagement management for clients and sub-contractors.Maintaining risk, action, issue, and dependency registersCoordinating change management and project variationsDriving and monitoring project progress to the satisfaction of clients, while meeting company objectives Project administration as requiredRegular reporting on various metrics and progress measures Key Selection CriteriaStrong planning, coordinating and time management skillsWell-developed interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbalSolid understanding of the Project Management LifecycleDemonstrated skills in project management software toolsAbility to create and maintain high quality Name: IT Operations Manager
Description: Full-time permanent position with flexible work arrangements available Opportunity to apply your infrastructure expertise in partnership with global stakeholders Values-driven, global organisation operating in the international development sector The OpportunityDo you have a solid background in IT Infrastructure and are now on the lookout for your next career move? We are seeking an experienced IT Operations Manager to lead and manage the day-to-day operations for the Infrastructure Team and all aspects of delivering IT services for Abt Australia, Abt Britain and program offices in diverse geographic locations. This key role will also undertake infrastructure consulting, analysis and reporting in support of our strategic direction to drive technological innovation at Abt Associates. The post-holder will also act as the representative for infrastructure related activities as part of our global stakeholder group (One Global Abt) to support global strategic initiatives and projects.No day is ever the same and some of your key responsibilities in this role will include: IT InfrastructureManage and contribute to IT architecture design and reviews to ensure Abt IT Infrastructure (network, server, client computer, firewall, telephony, messaging, licensing, hardware, software, security, cloud and backup services) remain current, effective and supports critical business activitiesManage IT Infrastructure enterprise solution design, procurement and implementation to ensure solutions are delivered on time, with the required quality and within agreed budgetsCoordinate the design, development and implementation of infrastructure related IT policies, procedures and associated documentationManage the company-wide provision of computing, information processing and communications system infrastructure.Provide IT advice to the IT Lead, Abt executive and other management regarding future IT requirements and projects that are of strategic significance to Abt AssociatesManage relevant IT vendors to ensure IT services, infrastructure and procurement is delivered to budget and represent good value for moneyRepresent IT Infrastructure interests at Abt governance forums such as the IT Steering CommitteeIT Service DeskEnsure the provision of effective Service Desk services within agreed service levelsIdentify and implement process improvements and automation to continually improve the efficiency and effectiveness of Service Desk services to usersProvide technical and user advice and support for desktop, server and networking issues and queriesCybersecurity and Data SecurityWork with the Cyber Security Specialist to ensure:the security of Abt Associates data & networks is being continually monitored and improvedthe currency of the Cyber Essentials accreditation for Abt Britain to remain compliant with FCDO government obligationsEnsure IT Disaster Recovery plans are documented, implemented and regularly testedIT backup architecture and solutions are documented, implemented and regularly testedUndertaking other reasonable duties as required by management.You will be part of a close-knit IT team where you can add value, and where your ideas and expertise can bolster our efforts to strengthen IT Infrastructure for Abt Associates in Australia and Britain.  About You Our ideal candidate will have:Formal tertiary qualifications in an IT related field or 3+ years equivalent experience Minimum 2+ years’ experience leading an IT Infrastructure team or similarAbility to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across various teams and levels of management Demonstrated experience in cybersecurity risk, technical implementation and support of infrastructure technologies and processes in a distributed, international enterprise, and management of Service Desk services, processes and reporting across a distributed IT teamDemonstrated experience in relevant core technologies such as MS Windows/Office 365, Cloud Services, MS Windows Server, MS Active Directory, virtualisation, wide area and local area networking (WAN/LAN), Wi-Fi, firewall/security appliances, security software and telephonyHighly developed analytical and investigative skills with an ability to work under pressure Further Information & How to ApplyPlease submit your application online, attaching your CV and cover letter (as a single PDF document) addressing how you meet the requirements of this role. You must have full Australian working rights to be eligible for consideration for this role. This position has no closing date, candidates are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply. Abt Associates acknowledges the traditional custodians of the lands and waters on which we live and work. We pay respect to elders both past and present. About Us Abt Associates is a mission-driven, global leader with a proven track record in complex program implementation in the international development sector. We offer bold solutions and technical excellence in Health, Economic Growth, Governance, Research & Evaluation, Environment & Energy, Gender Equality & Social Inclusion. Working with our many partners, we have driven measurable social impact for more than 55 years, to achieve our mission of improving the quality of life and economic well-being of people worldwide. We operate in remote and challenging environments and employ more than 3,700 staff in over 50 countries. For more information about us and what we do, visit our website at www.abtassociates.comEquityAbt Associates values individuality and celebrates difference with a strong commitment to diversity, equality, racial equity, gender, and disability inclusion. We strongly encourage people from culturally and linguistically diverse communities and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people to apply for this position. We offer flexible work arrangements and a culturally safe environment for staff members from diverse racial and ethnic backgrounds.SafeguardingWe are deeply committed to safeguarding, to protect and prevent harm and abuse to individuals we work for and who work for us. Our recruitment and selection procedures reflect our commitment to protecting children and vulnerable adults from abuse and exploitation. We will not tolerate discrimination, harassment, child abuse, sexual abuse or exploitation in any form, and expect everyone to be treated with respect and dignity.

Name: Human Resources Manager
Description: About Atos Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with 107,000 employees and annual revenue of over € 11 billion. European number one in cybersecurity, cloud and high-performance computing, the Group provides tailored end-to-end solutions for all industries in 71 countries. A pioneer in decarbonization services and products, Atos is committed to a secure and decarbonized digital for its clients. Atos is a SE (Societal European), listed on Euronext Paris and included in the CAC 40 ESG and Next 20 Paris Stock indexes.The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education, and research in a multicultural approach and contribute to the development of scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the Group enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure information space. The RoleAn exciting opportunity exists for a HR Manager to join Atos to support our Australia and New Zealand business. Reporting to the HR Director APAC based in Hong Kong, this is a key role for our Australia business which will partner closely with our Managing Director and the senior leadership team to achieve business goals, through the effective delivery of strategic HR solutions which aim at creating, sustaining, and engaging a high performing team. Other Accountabilities include:To partner with the business to ensure human resources initiatives support business objectives and operating needs, whilst complying with local regulations and Atos’s policiesRoll out HR initiatives and programs aligned to global processes. Provide advice to local leadership team in areas of leadership development, talent management, succession planning, training and development and designing and implementing organizational effectiveness programsEstablish human resource objectives in line with organizational short and long-term objectivesChampion the development of a high-performance culture by working closely with local leaders, getting involved in workplace initiatives, identifying new ideas and building credibility with employees and managers as a trusted advisorCreate, implement, review and/or update local HR policies and proceduresCoach managers and employees on HR policies and processes, recommending solutions aligned to HR strategic directionOversee compliance and ensure all requirements are met from a HR perspective Take the lead in resolving employee relation issuesInvestigate and resolve HR related matters, performance issues and disciplinary actionPrepare and manage local human resource budgetInterpret and understand enterprise agreements, relevant modern awards, and employment conditions. Lead Enterprise Bargaining Agreement negotiations with the relevant key stakeholdersWork with overseas Payroll function to ensure timely and accurate processingParticipate in special projects led by regional or global teamMentor and manage a small team of HR professionals  The successful applicant must have:A bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business, Human Resources, or related areaPrevious experience operating in a similar role within a complex or matrix structure (preferred) with a minimum 2 to 3 years in a leadership positionMust have hands on experience working across the following areas: talent management, recruitment, selection and on-boarding, performance management, remuneration & benefits, expatriates, staff welfare, employee relations and work health safetySound knowledge of Fair Work Act, Modern Awards, EBAs and National Employment StandardsStrong sense in figures and excellent spreadsheet skills to run C&B process and reportingCourage to challenge status quo and create opportunities for new ways of working/thinkingPassion for human and organisational developmentStrong influencing & negotiation skills with an ability to work across a diverse group of   stakeholders and to get buy-inBe confident to navigate and operate in an environment which sometimes may be ambiguous Possess an ability to be both hands on and strategic in the way they approach their work Are good at conflict & stress management with experience managing complex people issues Experience working with SAP (HRIS system) is preferred but not mandatoryStrong working knowledge and experience across Microsoft suite packages such as Microsoft Excel, as required for reporting purposes  *To be considered for this role you must hold valid working rights to work in AustraliaHere at Atos, we want all our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. Our employee lifecycle processes are designed to prevent discrimination against our people regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. Across the globe, we have created a variety of programs to embed our Atos culture of inclusivity and work hard to ensure that all our employees have an equal opportunity to contribute and feel that they are exactly where they belong.

Name: Solution Architect

This role is responsible for partner enablement, technical solution design and maintaining vendor certifications.If you have 5+ years experience within the ITC Channel in a Reseller, Vendor or Distribution role within Cybersecurity, Networking, End Point Security or Storage we would love to hear from you. Role breakdown:30% Enablement of channel partners, and associated production of design and complex configs for Symantec/Tenable networks 20% Design and creation of programs to facilitate business across the Westcon Security business around endpoint security and vulnerability management 10% Contribution to execution of marketing campaigns 20% Development of Westcon capabilities (product or solutions) as directed by management 10% Self training Skills and KnowledgeStrong interpersonal skills; ability to build strong relationships quickly and effectively both over the phone and face to faceSound knowledge and understanding of End Point Security OR Cyber Security OR Networking OR Storage pre-sales function and proven success in a technical roleWorking knowledge of End point security OR Cyber security OR Networking OR storage and vulnerability management solutionExcellent customer relationship management skills with the ability to interact at all levels including sales, technical and CXOEffective communication skills both orally and writtenGood attention to detail and follow-upNegotiation and persuasion skillsExperience5+ years within the ITC Channel in a Reseller, Vendor or Distribution role.Industry certifications in Symantec / Palo Alto / Juniper / NetApp or equivalent will be highly regarded – Solutions architect / Professional levelProven experience as a Solutions Architect in a customer-facing role ideally in the channelHands-on experience in security, application, networking or storage technologies would be highly regarded.Experience in partner enablement activities

Name: Enterprise Business Development Manager - Vic/Tas - Secure Power
Description:
Why us?
Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.

€25.7bn global revenue
137 000+ employees in 100+ countries
45% of revenue from IoT
5% of revenue devoted for R&D



You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.


 Responsibilities
Business Development Manager – Secure Power 
Melbourne, VIC
Schneider Electric is listed as One of Fortune’s 2022 World's Most Admired Companies 
Schneider Electric Included in the 2022 Bloomberg LP Gender-Equality Index (GEI) 
Do you dream of working in a company that is driven by a meaningful purpose?
 
We have an exciting opportunity for a passionate individual to join the Secure Power team as a Business Development Manager in our Melbourne office.
 
The Business Development Manager will be responsible for retaining & hunting new business growth in VIC and TAS.
 
At Schneider Electric, we believe that great people and partners make Schneider a great company and that our commitment to Innovation, Diversity, and Sustainability ensures that Life Is On everywhere, for everyone, and at every moment.
 
What will you do?
Generate new business across several industries: 75% field based
Understand IT and Technology Ecosystems 
Develop new acquisition accounts whilst maintaining growth in retention accounts
Build relationships with external Channel Partners and Contractors
Develop and execute an edge-based solution strategy
Develop and implement annual and quarterly business plans by vertical and accounts
Participate in joint pipeline generation activities and track sales closures 

 Qualifications
Ideal Candidate 
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent desirable 
5+ years of sales experience in Data Centre, Cybersecurity, and/or Digital Transformation sectors
Experience in Edge/On-Premises, Cloud, Collocation and/or Telco
Confident in making cold calls
Experience pitching new business to Healthcare, Finance, and Retail
Understanding of critical power, critical cooling, and software 
Solid understanding of IT hardware vendors such as Cisco, DELL, HPE, and Microsoft
Commercial experience is a plus.
Highly developed presentation and communications skills
High EQ and Growth Mindset 
 
What’s in It for You?
Truly Flexible Work Environment
Competitive Salary Package
Inclusive Culture: We welcome people from all walks of life 
Access to our Employee Share Plan
Establish Mentorship to Grow Your Skills
Salary Continuance Insurance
Career Growth Opportunities
Opportunity to Work on Global Projects 
 
Let us learn about you! 
 
APPLY TODAY!
 
#LI-FG4

Name: Senior Director of Sales (AUS)
Description: What We Do:Founded in 2015 by former NSA cyber operators, Huntress was built on a simple premise: to force hackers to earn every inch of their access.Today’s cyber-attacks aren’t limited to large organizations with the security tools that can ward off threats. Hackers don't discriminate and will find a way to penetrate any vulnerability in any size business.  Huntress enables IT providers and resellers to stop hidden threats that sneak past preventive security tools.Through a combination of expert human threat hunters, a comprehensive platform, and a desire to make the world a safer place, we’re working to deliver cybersecurity to the 99%—those small to midsize businesses that make up the backbone of our economy. Join the hunt and help us stop hackers in their tracks!What You’ll Do: Not only is Huntress growing, we’re growing internationally.  We are a US based managed security platform providing tools and services for small and mid-sized businesses.  As we prepare for our growth in Australia, we need to first add our Senior Director of Sales to begin building and leading our growth strategy in Australia.  As our senior director, you’ll support our Manager and Sales Development team, provide leadership and strategic vision  for the team, provide training, quality analysis, and ensure the team is set up for success and maximum productivity.  We have are striving for bold targets and goals with our expansion by bringing our cybersecurity mission to the small and mid-sized businesses in Australia.  We need a proven leader that is enthusiastic to use their passion, skills and autonomy toward the task of building a team and bringing a new division to market. Responsibilities:  Build and execute a sales growth strategy including go-to-market plans, growth and expansion strategies, building your team, and optimizing our sales process for maximum success Hire, Train, and Develop Account Executives, Sales Development Representatives and Business Development Representatives to excel and grow within the companyEducate, build credibility, and trust to sell the Huntress security stack to new customers within the IT Managed Service Provider (MSP) communityMaintain a high level of pipeline organization & follow-up efficiency for your teamAbility to travel (up to 25% of the time) and confidently present in front of an audience during Trade Shows & WebinarsAchieve Sales Goals with your team ( by the Executive TeamDemonstrate adaptability and flexibility as part of an ever-growing sales organization What You Bring To The Team:  Experience in relevant channels: Cybersecurity, Manager Service Providers (MSP), Technology Providers, Technology Services providers, Solution Selling 8+ years of demonstrated success in a senior sales leadership position, with a proven track record of successPrevious experience working with MSP’s is requiredStrong time management & organizational skills as well as the ability to work across time zonesInternal drive of continuous improvement. Cybersecurity is a rapidly changing environment - the ideal candidate will possess a determination to continually learn and growWhat We Offer: Fully remote workNew starter home office set up allowance Generous personal leave entitlementsMobile phone reimbursement SuperannuationHuntress is committed to creating a culture of inclusivity where every single member of our team is valued, has a voice and is empowered to show up to work every day as their full self. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status. People from all culturally diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.We do discriminate against hackers who try to exploit small businesses.Accommodations:If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodations@huntresslabs.com.  Please note non-accommodation requests to this inbox will not receive a response.

Name: Solution Architect - ISM, IRAP, ASD Essential 8, PSPF
Description: $170 - $190 per hour Inc Super6 Month Contract + 6 Month ExtensionNV1 or NV2 Clearance Preferred Our Client, a large Federal Government Department located in Canberra, Melbourne and Adelaide is seeking an experience, pro-active and versatile Solution Architect to work with a project team. Deliverables comprise High Level Solution Approaches and Solution Detailed Designs that support completion of a significant and complex projects.
