Name: Cloud Security Architect - Manager/Senior Manager
Description: Company description:Deloitte Services Pty LtdJob description: What will your typical day look like?You will play a key role in cybersecurity implementation activities, provide expert technical knowledge on cybersecurity solution designs, development, and deployments, as well as provide input and oversight to cloud activities from a security perspective. You will also improve systems by studying current practices and designing modifications. You will liaise with other cybersecurity Deloitte architects and team members on design and build of services, and you will be responsible for continuous improvement of design, integration and operational capabilities.About The TeamPositioned first globally in Security Consulting Services for the 6th year in a row.  Yep, that's Deloitte.  The cyberspace is constantly evolving and so are the threats that it brings.  That's why our work is more meaningful (and exciting!) than ever.  Always one step ahead, we predict risks and safeguard our clients through end-to-end solutions.  More importantly, we help clients unlock new opportunities through safer and more secure systems and policies.Enough about us, let's talk about you:  You have the ability to execute design activities leveraging knowledge of cybersecurity design techniques, ensuring designs are consistent with approved solutions configuration. You adhere to design standards and performing technology proof-of-concept to support design approaches. You have solid knowledge in cybersecurity technologies, including requirements definition, system design and testing / QA and transition into production. You also have a strong understanding of security design patterns/methodology and configuration management practices and procedures. You can develop and maintain appropriate security controls and service management frameworks to protect all information as well as systems. You may possess significant breadth across other disciplines: enterprise security architecture identity and access management data loss prevention large-scale networking Deployment orchestration, automation, and security configuration management DevSecOps application security integration architecture (API) Cloud security and governance tools, CASBs and server and network virtualization technologies such as SDN Threat modelling and design reviews of new technologies You have excellent analytical/problem solving ability, strong written and verbal communication skills and excellent relationship management skills. You must be creative and independent thinker. You are a good team player. Skills essential: Expertise in one or more Cloud platform - AWS/Azure/GCP Security configuration of Cloud platform and AWS/Azure/GCP cloud services Terraform/CloudFormation/Ansible experience is essential Experience in CI/CD such as Jenkins, Bamboo, Azure DevOps, Codefresh Skills preferred Experience of Cloud Security Tools (e.g. AWS Security Hub, Azure Security Centre, GCP Security Command Centre) Experience in tools is preferred such as Prisma Cloud, SonarQube, Sonatype, Fortify, JFrog, Qualys Powershell/Python/Rego/Go language experience will be a bonus Cloud Certified (e.g. Azure, AWS or GCP)  Why Deloitte?At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia's borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.

Name: Security Manager
Description: Company description:Deloitte Services Pty LtdJob description:•    Work in a highly innovative and transformative business•    Work/life balance with access to flexible work arrangements•    Salary packaging - to suit your personal and financial circumstances What will your typical day look like?Working with project teams to plan, implement and deploy security assurance activities and maintain stakeholder expectations.Promptly raise any operational or project cyber risk where appropriate to management and stakeholders.Provide solution documentation to meet the firm's Technology Operating Model and System Secure Development Lifecycle.Advise other Business Units on cyber assurance matters. You will be responsible for: Implement and maintain robust Cyber Assurance and Secure System Development Lifecycle activities, framework and service to ensure the firm's security standards are met. Be an SME for Cybersecurity on critical initiatives to provide clear guidance on how to deploy solutions securely and that are also compliant against the firm's security standards and industry best practice. Understand solution architecture and design to provide security advice. Analyse and understand Application Security Testing and Vulnerability Assessment results and impact to help business meet their objective or advise mitigating controls. SME for Cloud Security to develop and maintain cloud security standards and requirements. Identify, manage and implement areas of improvement. Mentoring junior staff and perform quality assurance activities. Collaborate with Key Stakeholder and managed their expectation. Strategy documentation and reporting  About the team The ITS Cyber Assurance team assess the security posture of solutions in relation to ITS Deloitte policies and standard and provide the most appropriate recommendations to meet business needs within Deloitte's Risk appetite. We aim to empower the projects and business with security knowledge to make informed decisions to better secure Deloitte. Enough about us, let's talk about you. At Deloitte, we're all about disruption. Technology has radically transformed the way we live and the way we go about business. Amongst the disruption that emerging technologies bring, we take the reins and transform our business with innovative technology and tools. Our large (and ever growing) team of specialists are exposed to new challenges and opportunities day-by-day and are supported by the business from day one.You are someone with:  5+ years' experience in cybersecurity Experience in a Consultant position. Experience with Secure System Development Lifecycle Experience with ISO 27001 and Information Security Policies. Cloud security assurance Risk mindset Be an ambassador for cybersecurity  Why Deloitte? At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia's borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.  We're committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace, where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural, disability, LGBTI+, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality, we're leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.  We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress - check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space. Next Steps Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Name: Information Security Manager
Description: Garvan's 2030: Discoveries to Impact Strategy is designed to galvanise Garvan's researchers, professional staff, partners, donors and community around our vision of Global leadership in discoveries to impact, and to enable us as an Institute to deliver on that vision - such that Garvan becomes an institute where research discoveries are taken through to patient impact (new treatments, tests and prevention approaches), on a global scale.  The IT team exists to provide information technology solutions to enable research outcomes and administrative activities of Garvan, ultimately supporting Garvan's strategic aim to 'make it easy to do great science'. The Technology group is comprised of application, infrastructure and operations, and cybersecurity at the core of the team.  The Opportunity  This is an exciting newly created role to make your own! As the primary contact and subject-matter expert on cybersecurity, the Information Security Manager is responsible for developing and maintaining Garvan's Information Security strategy, policies and governance framework, and develop the cybersecurity program or activities.  Key Responsibilities  The key responsibilities include: Provide cybersecurity leadership to the organisationDevelop Garvan's three-year cybersecurity programDevelop and maintain Garvan's information security policies and governance frameworkDevelop and oversee information security audits and track remediation activitiesDevelop and implement Garvan's cybersecurity awareness programWork with the Risk & Compliance team to develop risk mitigation strategiesReview and report on emerging Cybersecurity risks in the sectorMonitor cybersecurity controls effectiveness and recommend improvement opportunities  Snapshot of benefits This is a permanent full time role paying $140,000 + 10% super + salary packaging. With salary packing the total salary is $156,450 + 10% superGenerous salary packaging ($15,900 for general household expenses and $2,650 for meal/entertainment allowance on top of base salary)Ongoing training and developmentFlexible work arrangements18 weeks paid parental leaveAdditional day's leave as Garvan DayEmployee Assistance ProgramDiscounted Health Insurance  About You  The key skills and experience include: Extensive experience in a similar role driving Cybersecurity in an organisation (5+ years)Certification such as CISM, CISSP, or equivalentPrevious experience developing an organisation's ISMS; ISO27001 framework preferableExperience developing and/or implementing a cybersecurity awareness programPresentation and training skills, (i.e., experience delivering cybersecurity training)Proven experience in information security culture influence and continual improvementExperience producing documentation to support compliance reportingStrong knowledge of technical security architectures supporting modern IT implementations (Okta, WAF, Azure AD, RedHat Linux, Networking architecture, Mac and Windows end-points)  How to Apply  To apply for this position, please submit your application with a CV and cover letter as one document, stating why you are interested in this role. Describe in the cover letter a project you implemented that fits the requirements of the role.

Name: Scrum Master
Description:
Crouch, hold, engage…

A global financial services leader is seeking a Scrum Master for an exciting greenfield opportunity within their Identity and Cyber Security technology team in Sydney.

This is a mature and well-established team with no prior use of Agile or scrum, so they will be looking to you to gently guide them as they upskill in this practice.
 
The role in question
The purpose of this team is to safeguard the company environment both internally and externally. The Scrum Master is responsible for the squad and how it’s functioning and performing. You are also charged with monitoring Agile processes and meetings as you employ methods to motivate and drive the squad’s efficiency, and advocate for changes that will ensure quality and timeliness.
You will be something of a mentor, bringing your passion for Agile practices and continuous improvement, always on the lookout for ways the squad can win and improve as you seek to instil a sense of pride in them.
 
You, yourself and why?

Current and substantial Scrum Master experience (3-5 years)
Strong team player and ability to build strong working relationships
Excellent stakeholder management and conflict resolution skills
Clear communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
A servant leader and a solid understanding of Agile methodologies & practices, including Scrum and Kanban.
Security experience preferable but not required
They are also interested in seeing people who might have led non-software development squads

 
What’s on offer…

State of the art CBD based office with a 50/50 WFH flexibility
A company with a great name in the market and culture of high performing and high achieving individuals 
They are looking to make big changes to the way they operate their business and you will be trusted to lead the changes
Ask to find out about other additional perks that come with working for the bank


If this position is of interest to you, please send through your CV or reach out to learn more: john@theonset.com.au

Name: Public Relations and Communications Specialist
Description: Melbourne or Sydney Based-Mimecast is looking for a public relations and communications specialist to harness our voice in the APAC cybersecurity market and to spread the word about Mimecast, help build our brand, power our narratives, and deepen our existing engagements across audiences. You will be responsible for executing the PR and communications plans for Mimecast in Australia, New Zealand and ASEAN markets. The person in this role will report to a Senior Manager out of the Johannesburg office who manages the PR programme in APAC and other regions. Being cross-functional must be in your DNA. Together with the APAC Senior Manager, and you will work closely with the global PR and social media team, global analyst relations director, local marketing and sales teams, and the entire corporate marketing team to help build our brand through PR in the region. Responsibilities: Position Mimecast as a high-impact leader and innovator in cybersecurityWork with the senior manager to develop the PR and Communications plan for the Australia and New Zealand business and target markets in ASEAN. Work in collaboration with global and local marketing team members for the execution of PR activities and campaigns.Development and execution of PR activities through the use of national, regional and global thought leaders through continued relationships with publicationsWrite and/or assist with local press releases and other PR contentWork closely with the PR Agencies in Australia and Singapore Supporting regional and global communications under the direction of the Senior PR ManagerHelp increase Mimecast’s share of voice, power of voice and brand presence in front of key audiences in APAC, through proactive media/ PR / social media / analyst outreach and elevation of executive leadershipCreate interesting and engaging content for social channels, provide local content for social calendar Develop and use the current measurement tools to measure share of voice / power of voice, sentiment, website traffic, etc. Provide required reporting inputs to monthly marketing and quarterly reviewSupport the global analyst relations program, under the guidance of the global Analyst Relations Director with day-to-day program execution specific to the APAC region, including regular analyst engagements via ongoing inquiries, briefings, advisory and relationship building with a set of target analysts.The ideal candidateMinimum of 5 years relevant experience in marketing/communications, PR, media relations, social media or another related fieldBachelor’s degree or diploma in a relevant field or equivalent work experienceProven expertise working on marketing and PR campaignsHave a fundamental understanding of the technology environment and software productsExceptional written and verbal communication skills and a proven marketer with creative skillsExperience working with various social media platforms and measurement platformsAbility to convey complex, technical content in clear, concise and compelling languageExperience working with analyst firms (preferable) Why join us? We’re fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly – and outstandingly. We’re big on honesty because it makes us better. We’re empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That’s The Mimecast Way.Other perks of joining the team!Free leave days between Christmas and New YearsFlexible working arrangements supporting work-life balance  Paid Parental Leave Program Employee Assist Support Health Insurance reimbursement Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program that supports global and local initiatives via fundraising, volunteering and community engagement, with 5 paid volunteer days per year & donation matching DEI StatementCybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups. We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality or any other protected characteristic won’t affect your application.

Name: CONSULTANT, NETWORKS AND SECURITY SERVICES
Description: Position Summary   The Network and Security Consultant shall Interface with our valued clients to develop secure network solutions. Will participate in Assessments, Audits, Design, and deployment projects in Network, Security and Virtualization. These Projects will be specific to enabling a connected enterprise / IT-OT convergence / Industry 4.0 by connecting the Industrial Internet of Things. Will need good understanding and experience of networking and security concepts for the OT side.   Potential candidates should have:   Minimum Qualifications / skill sets: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or Information Technology or related technology driven degree with minimum 5 years of work experience. If no degree, 15+ years of experience in Manufacturing Control Systems, Network Engineering, and Industrial Security Controls.  Hands-on experience configuring IT/OT equipment (Cisco ASA, Cisco Switches, Firewalls, Virtual Server Environments, Anti-Virus Software, Continuous Threat Detection). Previous experience working as part of a large, multi-disciplinary team completing full project life-cycle implementations.  Cisco / VMWare / Cybersecurity related certifications (CCNA, CCNP, VCP, GISSP, IEC 62443) Travel Requirements - Flexibility for travel 25% - 75% is required and can include both domestic and international trips.   Job RequirementsExperience in design and deploying security controls for an Industrial Network. These can include system management hardening, device hardening, end point security, perimeter security, disaster recovery, threat detection and monitoring as examples.  Understanding of NIST 800-82, NERC-CIP, IEC-62443 Standards Solid technical skills with EtherNet/IP or other Ethernet based networks, specifically around assessment, design and implementation of complex systems.  Strong commercial skills, ability to handle multiple projects, communication skills, ability to diagnose automation problems and interact with teams, clients and vendors. Familiarity with a variety of security and/or networking concepts, practices, and procedures, to include manufacturing and enterprise network convergence, network protocols, communication optimization, application effects on system performance and human exploitation techniques on the manufacturing network.  Experience in developing and deploying solutions in a virtual environment.   Desirable: Experience in Network Architecture, PLC, Networking and SCADA design/programming including data extraction and data analysis.  Exposure to PLC programming packages (Rockwell or comparable platforms) is desirable.  Design, implement and support customer’s converged business and manufacturing/industrial systems and user needs in parallel with their overall business strategies.  Write detailed documentation that could include user needs, system specifications, observed issues with remediation recommendations or implementation requirements in order to develop or modify manufacturing infrastructure.Design, recommend, and implement system security changes.  Design customer secure manufacturing architecture and provides vision, problem anticipation, and problem solving ability to customers.

Name: Cyber Security Manager
Description: Are you interested in joining the dream team at Wesfarmers OneDigital?Good call. We’re an exciting new digital enterprise with big ideas, supporting some of Australia’s most trusted and iconic brands focussed on making lives better for people all around Australia. We’re well on our way towards bringing the best of digital and data possibilities together to create more personalised shopping experiences for customers across our retail brands. We’re continuing to bring the best talent and skills under one roof, working together and across disciplines to build amazing experiences for our customers. We continuously feed off each other’s insights, talents, and capabilities, because we are a business that thrives on open collaboration and a shared vision of positive, fun and rewarding experiences. Our business is growing and so is the Technology Department. In this newly defined position, we're looking for a Cyber Security Manager with strong business instincts and management experience. Someone who is passionate about applying these skills to lead teams, drive smarter product decisions, and ultimately delight our customersIn this role, you'll get toProvide security leadership, strategy, stakeholder management and governance to OnePassOversee the OnePass cyber security functionEnsure appropriate security controls are in place and maintained within OnePass Validate the ongoing effectiveness of security controls and adapt/evolve as necessaryKeep the business safe while ensuring our teams are empowered and enabled to move at pace Collaborate with peers across the broader Wesfarmers group Provide oversight of cybersecurity threats, risks, and vulnerabilities Implement standards, procedures and policies supporting cybersecurity controls within the business • Support the Technology and Customer Chapters in building out the platform and enhancing the customer experienceLearning from your team while you share your knowledge adding your very own splash of colour to our palette and make it fun. At OneDigital It is part of everyone’s core role to ensure that no one is left behind and that everyone is enjoying their journey as they evolve!To shine on day one, what you need to have: Ability to stay close with daily activities in this small team Extensive (8-10+ yrs) experience in senior cyber security roles Experience in security architecture in large data analytics environments Breadth of experience across design, testing, architecture, operationsDemonstrated ability to synthesize complex, sometime contradictory information, priorities, and    stakeholder missions to effectively solve problems  Adaptive mindset to ensure business and customers contexts are constantly considered Experience in AWS Experience in identity management Exposure to devops environmentsIt's a bonus, but not required, if you have: •        Bachelor’s Degree in computer science or related field •        AWS Certification •        Azure experience Why OneDigital?Working in a community of industry-leading innovators with a diverse and deep set of skills and experience, you will learn, collaborate, and co-create to achieve great things. You’ll have ownership of your role, which will allow you to find the right balance between stretch and sustainability, work, and life. Culture of Comradery and collaboration - OneTeamPlus, all the tools and learning you need, the tone is set for you to shine and succeed.  We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection, so we strive to create a team where everyone feels like they belong. We support diversity, inclusion and we are a gender-neutral organisation. We celebrate individuals at their core, so they shine to their best.Team Benefits – just to name a few!To support you at work, what you value in life and in the community, our team member benefits include.Access to the latest technologies, an annual education budget, a % of your time will be allocated to upskilling in any area of YOUR choiceExtended parental leave, and paid volunteer days People-focussed culture that celebrates achievements big and small Oh, and did I mention paid subscriptions and discount cards.Next stepsIf this sounds like your next career move, then click on the ‘Apply’ button now. Please note that we may commence interviewing candidates prior to the application closing date. For brief enquiries please contact our Data & Digital Talent Acquisition Partner at PArora@wesfarmers.com.au.

Name: Scrum Master
Description:
Crouch, hold, engage…

A global financial services leader is seeking a Scrum Master for an exciting greenfield opportunity within their Identity and Cyber Security technology team in Sydney.

This is a mature and well-established team with no prior use of Agile or scrum, so they will be looking to you to gently guide them as they upskill in this practice.
 
The role in question
The purpose of this team is to safeguard the company environment both internally and externally. The Scrum Master is responsible for the squad and how it’s functioning and performing. You are also charged with monitoring Agile processes and meetings as you employ methods to motivate and drive the squad’s efficiency, and advocate for changes that will ensure quality and timeliness.
You will be something of a mentor, bringing your passion for Agile practices and continuous improvement, always on the lookout for ways the squad can win and improve as you seek to instil a sense of pride in them.
 
You, yourself and why?

Current and substantial Scrum Master experience (3-5 years)
Strong team player and ability to build strong working relationships
Excellent stakeholder management and conflict resolution skills
Clear communication, interpersonal and presentation skills
A servant leader and a solid understanding of Agile methodologies & practices, including Scrum and Kanban.
Security experience preferable but not required
They are also interested in seeing people who might have led non-software development squads

 
What’s on offer…

State of the art CBD based office with a 50/50 WFH flexibility
A company with a great name in the market and culture of high performing and high achieving individuals 
They are looking to make big changes to the way they operate their business and you will be trusted to lead the changes
Ask to find out about other additional perks that come with working for the bank


If this position is of interest to you, please send through your CV or reach out to learn more: john@theonset.com.au

Name: Snr Manager, Cyber Response & Monitoring
Description: Act as the intersection between the business, technology and industry for emerging technologies Permanent opportunity in Cyber Response and Monitoring as a Lead Cyber Specialist Macquarie Park location and hybrid ways of working - WFH   About us Transport for NSW keeps our State moving by providing safe, integrated and efficient transport systems. We put our customers at the centre of everything we do - and we do a lot. We connect people, communities and industry and manage how they use our road, rail and maritime networks and services, and even active modes like walking and cycling. The work we do connects the journeys you take every day. We are a state government organisation made up of more than 28,000 people and we're in the middle of delivering the largest transport infrastructure program in Australia's history. We work across planning, policy and procurement, harnessing data and technology to develop smarter and more adaptive transport solutions. That means job opportunities in metropolitan and regional areas right across NSW - you have the chance to be part of creating a lasting legacy that will benefit generations to come.   About IT at TfNSW TfNSW's IT group provides the tools, information and services that enable 30,000 employees to deliver a smart and efficient transport network. We bring the future to our people by delivering innovative solutions and minimising business disruptions, building an engaged and connected workforce through tech-enablement. This is an exciting time to join the team, with a committed annual investment of $700m for progressive technology projects including bots, apps, AI solutions, autonomous 3D mapping drones, cybersecurity and transforming cameras across our network.  The opportunity We are looking for a permanent Senior Manager, Cyber Response & Monitoring to join the team who are based in Sydney. The purpose of this role is to act as the intersection between the business, technology and industry for emerging technologies and innovation opportunities. Through these engagements, proof of concepts will be identified and delivered, ensuring alignment to the overall business strategy and roadmap. The role will also be responsible for the evangelisation of emerging technologies and embedding of new capabilities within Transport for NSW Information Technology. What you will be involved in:  Manage security incident activities across a number of internal and external teams for remediation or escalate events of serious concern to major incident management Strong experience in Cyber Security, IT Security, SOC Analyst or other Security Operations role Must have a strong technical background Solid experience using and fine tuning SIEM tools (E.g Splunk Cloud and Splunk ES) Solid experience using a range of security tools (e.g Qualys, Ansible, Symantec & Microsoft Security products) Experience working in large or complex security ecosystems  Strong analytical and investigative skills. Detailed analysis and investigation of security event data to determine if events may have potential security impacts Desirable - Experience with Cloud security monitoring and investigations Scripting experience desirable (e.g., Python, C, C++, Java, Ruby, or PowerShell)  Please click here to view a copy of the role description.  About you You are an engaging and consultative senior-level professional able to demonstrate knowledge of existing and emerging technologies and the ability to practically apply them to use cases to achieve targeted business outcomes. You are a strong communicator with the ability to present complex technical concepts into easily understandable business language. You are curious by nature and enjoy investigating problems and issues, results driven with a strong technical background. At your core you are a person with passion - for working with people, for innovating, for solving problems and for emerging technology!  Salary and Benefits This is a Transport Senior Service Manager role. An attractive remuneration package will be determined with the successful candidate. For more information on Employee Benefits at TFNSW please click here.  Interested? By joining Transport for NSW, you'll have access to a range of unique government benefits in a flexible work environment like no other. If you're ready to step into this meaningful and rewarding role, we want to hear from you!  How to apply To apply for this position, please answer all questions within the online application process and submit a resume. Applications Close: 11:59pm Monday 27th June 2022    We are the community we serveWe are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.We enable our people to work in ways that work for them. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options. ​For any enquiries, please email Paul Hollington at PAUL.HOLLINGTON@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU. We're certified as a Family Inclusive WorkplaceOur flexible work practices and policies for parental leave, employee and family wellbeing and family care enable us to provide genuine support for our people to thrive at work and at home.Working with Transport gives you access to a range of benefits that help you balance work with the things that matter to you. Look through our Employee Benefits Guide to learn more. Apply today to register your interest!Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.Take a look at our application tips video series for plenty of great information on navigating and acing the application and recruitment process here at Transport. Our COVIDSafe Measures PolicyAll Transport for NSW workers are required to have: appropriate evidence of being fully vaccinated with a TGA approved COVID-19 vaccine; or an approved medical contraindication. You will be required to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status or apply for a medical exemption prior to securing this role.

Name: Technical Product Manager
Description: Who are GWA?Since 1886, the experts at GWA have designed innovative, high-quality products for homes and offices. We have market leading, iconic brands including Caroma, Methven, Dorf and Clark.At GWA our purpose is to make everyday water experiences extraordinary. Water scarcity affects all communities and given that our consumers enjoy experiencing our products every day, we are proud to help save millions of litres of water each year.Your new roleWith your manager based in Sydney, Australia, for this role. We are interested in hearing from candidates across Australian and New Zealand locations!We are looking for an experienced Technical Product Manager / Product Owner to join our Technology & Transformation team. The purpose of this role is to help develop, maintain and support GWA's connected products, platform, and applications. A key focus will be to drive engagement with business stakeholders, customers, consumers, and technology vendors. You will play a critical role in the Caroma Smart Command cross functional team, leading the delivery of all technology projects & deliverables.You will have a wide remit where you will manage (and enhance):The entire technology stack of our connected products.Own technical specifications, requirements, and release plans. Project manage the development of hardware & software products.Be GWA's product evangelist. Understand customer needs and build product vision for the applications & data products. Work with offshore development teams to deliver software deliverables. Work with cross functional teams to launch new products and functionality to the market. Manage the workload of all external contractors, systems integrations & vendors.Enhance and execute the connected products roadmap.Manage stakeholder relationships to make sure that the customer needs are met, and that excellent technology support is provided to our customers.Hands-on involvement with implementing activities (agreed with the Cybersecurity team) which ensure the secure operation to protect GWA's reputation, information, and assets.About youAs an experienced Business Solutions or Technical Product Manager, you will have the following skills and experience:5+ Years of experience of working with products, applications &      platforms.Demonstrated experience with some or all the      following technologies: Digital products, gateways, edge devices & Cloud      platforms.Knowledge and experience of working with API's      & data.Knowledge and experience in networkingStrong communications skills Previous experience in Agile project      management.Experience in the management of software      solution delivery including packaged and bespoke solutionsExperience of cloud infrastructure and      high-level knowledge to provide leadership across a broad-spectrum of      modern software architecture and technologies.Coding knowledge is preferred, but not      essential.What's it like to work at GWA?Culture is key for us, and our people come from a variety of backgrounds and industries. We all share a common purpose of bringing to life all three of our cultural pillars: We are Customer Focused; We are One Team and We Care For Each Other. Our passion and dedication are evident in how we work together to ensure everyone achieves our goals and that we all play in a role in making GWA a great place to work.Our success is driven by a global team that share a passion to be the trusted and integrated solutions partner in the delivery of sustainable water solutions for bathrooms, kitchens, and laundries.GWA is on a journey from Good to Great, and we are looking for people who are excited by change and want to make a difference. We care for each other and encourage people to take the lead to deliver superior solutions for our customers and consumers.What else do we offer?Flexible and hybrid working optionsCompetitive remuneration and bonus structuresPaid parental leave programGreat Rewards program - exclusive access to discounts      and cashback rewards at your favourite storesBathrooms & More program - great discounts      on a wide range of our productsVolunteer and Community Service LeaveOption to purchase additional annual leaveAs well as other great benefits like discounted health insurance, financial advice, annual flu vaccinations, access to a range of online fitness programs via our Wellbeing Centre...and much more!Interested?Come join us and work with great people, great brands and a business with a history of strong growth. All you need to do is hit the apply button and be part of a company that is focused on delivering great customer experiences! For more information, please contact Emily Jaajaa, Talent Acquisition Specialist at ejaajaa@gwagroup.comGWA Group does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.You must be a citizen or permanent resident or hold all the relevant employment visas and other approvals for the location of this position to apply for this role. Please note that we are not accepting applications from agencies at this time.

Name: Business Development Manager
Description: Why work for Brennan?We are a national company with a reputation for delivering technical excellence, innovation and high quality service to the mid-market and have backed up that statement by winning the #1 Managed Service Provider in Australia for the past 10 years in a row. Brennan IT benefits include:  A strong culture underpinned by values that are truly lived every day An environment that embraces learning and development of all employees Flexibility to work in the way that brings out the best in you Uncapped commission program Monthly company wide rewards and recognition for high performers High performing but fun environment - birthday celebrations, monthly social club events like winery tour, arcade games, team dinners and much more!  The Role We are looking for a Business Development Manager to join our team based in Melbourne on a permanent basis. You will be selling a wide range of products and services from Managed IT, Networks, Cybersecurity, Cloud, Procurement and Software Development. Your primary responsibility will be to identify, develop and close new business opportunities in the region.To be successful in this role, you will need to be highly motivated with a consultative approach to solution sales and demonstrate a strong commitment to both prospects and customers.  Key Responsibilities:  Sell new business solutions that will support the customers business goals Sell solutions across all of our service offerings including Managed Services, Project and Professional Services, Security, Network, Communications and Cloud Build an accurate and viable pipeline Conduct all commercial activity within prospective accounts including responding to customer requests for information, developing and planning solution presentations and demonstrations, executive engagement etc. Prepare opportunity review plans and present to the bid committee when required Develop deep understanding of customer’s business including orchestration of strategic business planning, roadmaps,and workshops on how technology can help address their business requirements.  What experience you will bring to the team:  A minimum of 5 years sales ICT experience A successful track record of achieving sales revenue targets Proven ability to manage large, complex whole of business IT and Telecommunications solutions. Consultative sales experience and approach Demonstrated ability to position and present at a C-suite level Demonstrated ability to manage the sales process and pipeline Demonstrated skills in negotiation, organisation, and time management Strategic thinking with get-up-and-go attitude Ability to perform and work well under pressure  Desirable  A successful track record in complex ICT Solution sales ideally cloud services, managed services, and communications Tertiary qualification or relevant sales/sales management experience Technical industry certifications. A good knowledge of either;  IaaS, cloud and infrastructure market IT outsourcing and managed services market Data and Internet networking Unified communications, voice, and telephony    Note: As part of our hiring process, you will be required to undertake a National Criminal History Check.   Brennan IT is an equal opportunity employer.

Name: Senior Problem & Capacity Manager
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity. 
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us? 
 
What you’ll do
Your role will lead complex problem & capacity management and will resolve problem, and capacity issues and manage the process to restore normal service operation for highly available platforms, products and services that are accessible and performing effectively to Tabcorp’s Business.
You will obsess about customer happiness (Tabcorp Users) and provide a significant amount of user interaction and a highly effective resolution of service and end user issues to provide Tabcorp with a secure and robust service for all major services, 24/7/365 across all geographic locations.
You are accountable problem and capacity management within the Technology environment and focus on improving operational efficiency by building strong business relationships through delivery excellence, client focus and commercial insight.
What you’ll bring 

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or applied science or a related field of study, or equivalent experience.
ITIL Certified.
Experience in technology with experience in problem management working in a complex enterprise with 24/7/365 services, including servicing customer facing platforms.
Extensive operational support experience in supporting large and complex IT and business environments.
Advanced knowledge of IT Service Management concepts and processes.
Secure understanding of service levels from a commercial perspective.
Experience in delivery of technology uplift and remediation/simplification across infrastructure, cloud adoption, core software, digital engineering/DevOps.
Astute at developing business aligned IT strategies, frameworks, and roadmaps (and communicating these).
Experienced in agile, lean, DevOps, and other best (and next) practice.
Experience working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
ISO 27001 & 9001 knowledge.
Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.
An understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.

What you’ll get 
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is extensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp? 
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.?
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class?brands;?TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.?
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed].
COVID 
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

Name: Cyber Security Manager
Description:
Insurance for Individuals
Since Youi emerged in Australia in 2008 we have built a strong brand through awesome customer service, tailoring products to individuals and challenging our competitors to do better. We value both our people and technology, and our IT department of more than 150 passionate Youiers is testament to us taking our tech and business growth seriously. With over 1,700 employees, and gross written premium exceeding $1billion, we have ambitious goals to keep growing and continue delivering awesome insurance solutions across new products and distribution channels, backed by industry leading customer experience.
 
About the Role
The Cyber Security Manager is responsible for managing and developing the cyber security teams and other resources required to achieve the desired tactical and operational outcomes of the cyber security function – in line with the Cyber Security Strategy and Youi’s relevant frameworks and policies.
The Cyber Security Manager deploys the necessary resources to support system and/or data owners in ensuring that information systems are maintained in a secure manner and data is adequately protected.
It is an exciting time to be joining our growing IT function as well as play a pivotal part in supporting the strong growth at Youi.
 
Key Duties:

Collaborate with senior leadership on Youi’s tactical cyber security planning and execution Maintaining an understanding of Youi’s cyber security capability maturity at an appropriate frequency
Contributing to the formulation of Youi’s cyber security strategy, frameworks and resulting cyber security plan (also known as Cyber Roadmap)
Enabling cyber security teams to deliver the defined outcomes of their respective roles
Appropriately managing workload and skills uplift through appropriate prioritisation, delegation and escalation
Developing cyber security staff to provide subject-matter expertise for the delivery of security solutions
Hiring, training, development, performance management and annual performance reviews of direct reports
Cyber security compliance obligations – monitor and report against Youi’s cyber security regulatory obligations, standards, and policy compliance.
Responsible for the execution and delivery of Cyber Security Operations activities in line with organisational requirements
Cyber security incident detection, response, and recovery
Managed partner performance management, detection and response, and enhancement
Responsible for the execution and delivery of Application and Infrastructure (Systems) Security activities

 
About You

Degree in technology or a related field, or equivalent work- or education-related experience.
Professional security management certification is desirable, such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Cyber Security Manager (CISM) or other similar credentials.
Minimum of seven to ten years of experience in a combination of risk management, cyber security and IT jobs (at least five must be in a leadership role).
Should understand and articulate the impact of cybersecurity on business and be able to communicate this to senior stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, interpersonal and collaborative skills, and the ability to communicate cyber security and risk-related concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences at various hierarchical levels, ranging from board members to technical specialists.
Sound knowledge of business management and a working knowledge of cyber security risk management and cybersecurity technologies.
Up-to-date knowledge of methodologies and trends in cyber, business, DevOps, and IT.
Knowledge and understanding of relevant legal and regulatory requirements, such as: Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS), APRA Standards, Australian Privacy Principles.

 
Culture & Benefits
We are well known for our awesome culture and working environment and award-winning employee experience programs. Combine that with smart casual dress code, Sunshine Coast location, career progression opportunities and onsite cafes, it’s no wonder why our people love coming to work every day!
How to Apply
If you wish to be part of a highly motivated team focused on outcomes, please "APPLY NOW".

Name: Channel Development Manager - Fortinet VIC & Southern Region
Description: Secure Agility represents and partners with some of the leading organizations across the globe, as an extension of their business.    Who is our client?  They are a global trusted cybersecurity specialist for digital infrastructure helping to drive the transition to a trusted digital future for all people and organisations.     Why them?  Their unique approach to distribution gives partners more opportunity and more customer relevance, equipping them to capitalise on rapidly evolving technologies and transformative business models. Their story is a global one with a services-first ideology at its core, harnessing innovation and disruption to deliver partner value.  With offices in 43 countries and the ability to service customers in over 170 countries across five continents, they are a worldwide distribution powerhouse.    What is the role?  Our client is currently looking to employ a skilled Channel Development Manager to help and drive growth within the channel. This role is ideally suited to an account manager or inside salesperson that wants to take the next step in their career. Using your outgoing personality you will develop a good rapport with customers, both existing and new, that ultimately will see you achieve a significant level of success for both yourself and their organisation.     The responsibilities of this role include:  We are looking for a person that can perform and meet the below requirements:   Ensuring partners are engaged, familiar, and leveraging our initiatives that will assist with growth  Servicing existing accounts and developing additional opportunities within the channel  Target new resellers for new business and develop these accounts for continued sales revenue  Pipeline management, good administrative skills with strong attention to detail  Continually profile and analyse the partners, their technology investments, business verticals, and sales history to provide insights to inform growth opportunities.  Travelling interstate TAS, SA & WA to recruit and develop partners  Working with the Business Manager to develop and execute sales and marketing initiatives  Support the strategic development, operational management, and performance of an organization going through an exponential growth period  Candidate must have a minimum of 1-2 years experience in the IT Channel   What do you need to be considered?  The Ideal Candidate Will Have:   At least 1 - 2 years working in the IT Industry, or similar  Strong written and verbal communication, interpersonal, and organisational skills  Ability to collaborate and work with a dynamic, diverse, growing business.  Commercial acumen, record keeping skills, and attention to detail  Strong negotiation/persuasion skills  Ability to network in a mature and professional way  Positive, can-do attitude, and a creative approach to problem-solving   Additional Information:   This role is based in Melbourne  Ability to travel interstate as a regular course of executing the requirements of this role.  A car space can be provided if required.      An excellent remuneration package based on skills and experience as well as an excellent career path is on offer. Our client committed to personal development of all staff and strives to work with you to define and achieve your certification and training goals.  This opportunity is rare with a rapidly growing and exciting organisation     Important information: For this role, we can only accept applications from people with the right to work full-time in Australia.     If this sounds like you, or something you may be interested in, please apply now.
