Name: ICT Manager
Description: Qudos Bank Arena, Sydney Olympic ParkFull time, permanent position Sydney Olympic Park locationFree onsite parkingABOUT USQudos Bank Arena is Australia’s #1 entertainment venue.  We are looking for a professional, dedicated and driven individual to join our team as the ICT Manager. If you are passionate about technology, entertainment and live events, this is the role for you!ABOUT THE ROLEThis role will plan, coordinate, manage, control and deliver all ICT (Information and Communications Technologies) activities and requirements in line with the operating objectives of the Arena.This is a hands-on role. Reporting to the Director of Finance & Business Services, you will be expected to perform work for Business as Usual (“BAU”) and Events.  The purpose of this role is (but not limited) to:- Install and configure switches, routers, access points. Terminating, running and securing network cabling. Setup and pull-down of PC’s, Point of sale, Printers, etc.Assist in developing and implementing new innovations, improvements to processes, and improvements or upgrades to existing Arena ICT products and services.Prepare strategic analysis and planning for the Finance and Business Services DepartmentEstablish and implement policies, processes and procedures for the Arena’s ICT function, and verify their effectivenessIdentify client needs and expectations and manage the delivery of all ICT requirementsCoordinate and manage 3rd party support (In-House and / or external vendors) for efficient operationsEnsure the ICT Division’s Workplace Health and Safety obligations are metControl of assets, materials and labour costs for the ICT DivisionRespond to and resolve client helpdesk queriesMaintain ICT support documentation, including but not limited to:Create and maintain accurate “As-built” ICT system configuration information.Create and maintain accurate ICT installation procedures and configuration details.Create and maintain accurate ICT end-user “self-help” documentationManage user accounts - creation, deletion and modification; Policy and permission implementation and management; Email account management including exchange policy and data maintenanceDaily backup of production data and data storage managementProactive management and maintenance of  network equipment, including but not limited to routers, switches, firewall, VPN software and / or hardware, Wireless Devices, Voice Telephony, Digital SignageProvide planning and support services for Arena Hirers and partners with respective ICT needs including internet connectivity and other communications (pre, during and post event).ABOUT YOUEssential:Diploma of Information Technology or higherMinimum 5 years recent experience in a similar roleAbility to work unsupervisedCurrent knowledge of ICT trendsAbility to work with minimum external assistanceOutgoing and friendly personality, with a team focusWillingness to accept directionWell organisedStrong attention to detailAbility to work under pressure and meet deadlinesProven ability to use initiativeFlexibility with working hours (nights and weekends if applicable) Desirable:Above average documentation skillsExcellent communication skills at all levelsExcellent personal presentation and groomingStrong leadershipTechnology Platforms/ Applications:A strong understanding in the following is desirable Windows Server 2012 to 2019Microsoft 365 Administration Active Directory, AzureAD AdvantageousExchange 2016 + Exchange Online Cisco IOS network switching and routing incl VLAN/CoS/Aruba WiFiVMware VCentre + ESXIVoip and IP Telephony in particular 3CX Cybersecurity experience an advantageHow to apply: To apply for this role, visit: https://www.bfound.net/j156595

Name: Product Manager
Description: Join a reputable client Excellent permanent opportunity for both NSW and ACT candidates Competitive Package Are you a talented Product Manager looking for your next career move? We have an amazing opportunity for a Senior Product Manager to join one of our client's team for a permanent position.  This Role:This role will be responsible for defining, developing, and managing the clients security product offerings. Managed Security Services, via SIG (Secure Internet Gateway) are an important differentiator for the clients go to market. The Product Manager is responsible for the ensuring that this continues to deliver against the LAG (Lead Agency Gateway) deliverables, as well as the new product development roadmap. Ownership of the full security product roadmap including SIG services. Up-stream strategic thinking, customer insight, competitor analysis, vendor relationships, as well as LAG obligations and opportunities, which produce a product strategy and product roadmap. Then, product managing the design and deployment of the products to launch. Finally, being able to communicate product strategy and product positioning for the product family to internal and external audiences.  Key AccountabilityMarket AnalysisMarket StrategyGo-to-Market PlansProduct DevelopmentLifecycle ManagementPricingPackagingMarketing Collateral & Sales Readiness Experience and Skills for the ideal candidate: At least 5 years' experience in product managementExperience in Security related technologies5+ years' experience defining, designing, and bringing product to marketExperience in the following technologies:Hosting / Cloud ServicesCybersecurityCompute virtualisation (e.g. VMWare, blades, hypervisors, etc.)Storage (e.g. SAN, backup, etc.)Networking (internet, firewalls, load balancers, etc.)Disaster Recovery (HA, failover, replication, etc.)Security (infrastructure security such as HIDS, DDOS, etc., not desktop like antivirus/firewall) Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of this dynamic organisation. If you have what it takes to thrive in this role and want to know more, please reach out to Chelsea Batley on (02) 6103 1816 OR chelsea.batley@modis.com Joining Modis as a ConsultantNo payrolling processing feesUpskilling opportunities and training discountsConsultant gatherings eventsMODIS SME meet ups/information sessionsEAP Support ProgramDedicated Account Management Support Team About UsModis delivers cross-industry IT and digital engineering expertise to accelerate innovation and digital transformation. By combining a unique service offering of Tech Consulting, Tech Talent Services and Tech Academy solutions Modis enables businesses to progress, scale and perform. Modis has a global footprint with 30,000+ consultants in over 20 countries focused on Cognitive Technologies,Digital Transformation, Cloud & Infrastructure, Smart Ecosystem, and Industry 4.0 across the key sectors of Automotive & Transportation, Environmental & Energy, Software, Internet & Communication, Financial Services and Industrial Manufacturing. PrivacyDue to new privacy laws regarding the collection and handling of personal information, all applications must be submitted online. Once you click on the "apply for this job" button below you will be directed to our Online Centre where you will have the opportunity to read and agree to our Privacy and Consent statements and it will allow your details to be formally lodged and processed correctly. "Modis is an Equal Opportunity employer, committed to all forms of workforce inclusion. We actively invite and encourage applications by candidates from diverse backgrounds"

Name: IT Support Officer
Description: Learn from an amazing IT Manager Murarrie Location Up to $75K + Super depending on experience     We have an outstanding opportunity to join a fantastic client who are growing their internal IT team with a newly created IT Support Officer role!  This role will provide a mix of face to face, video and phone support to staff throughout the business.    This is an exciting opportunity for a tech savvy individual who is wanting to take their Help Desk experience to a new level where no two days will be the same.  Your ability to build rapport with internal staff will be a key to your success within this role as people come to you for help in a variety of IT issues across hardware, software, servers and networks!          Daily duties include but are not limited to:     Report directly to the IT Manager and work closely with him to provide support to approximately 200 staff throughout 4 businesses Provide first point of IT Support contact including technical support to resolution or escalate Troubleshoot assistance with PCs, laptops and mobile devices You will also provide support when required to suppliers, customers and contractors of visitors to the business Onboarding process - set up of new starters and sites for computer access, set up laptops, mobile phones, iPads, printers, etc Offboarding process Log incidents and service requests in the Helpdesk system Install and configure computer hardware operating systems and applications Ensure system and data security is maintained at a high standard Ad hoc duties and opportunity to get involved in projects        The ideal candidate will have the following skills or attributes:     IT qualifications highly regarded however relevant industry experience is the key Previous experience in HelpDesk, Desktop or IT support type role Understanding fundamental networking (TCP/IP v4, LAN, Network Adaptors, WIFI), Windows Server (2016), Active Directory, Windows 10, Microsoft Office Experience in Microsoft Exchange, Teams, Sharepoint, Cybersecurity practices, Group Policy, Veeam, VMWare, VPN, MFC Printers, Mobile Devices and management, VoIP, VLAN and HP or Dell Laptaps a bonus with willingness to learn essential Pro-active in the workplace and able to work in a fast-paced environment Confident communication skills and most importantly a team player attitude Happy to present professionally Proven experience in a fast-paced office environment     The benefits of this role include:     Fantastic opportunity to continue to develop your IT skills further Great offices located at Murarrie Strong team environment who have regular social get togethers – they work hard, but have a great time doing it The benefits working for this organisation are endless and include excellent working conditions, great people, a successful business who is continuing to grow and so much more!     Opportunities like this don’t come about everyday, don’t miss out, contact Jacquie Speirs by clicking on the APPLY NOW button as this role won’t last for long!    Please note:   only shortlisted candidates will be contacted on this occasion. We thank you in advance for your application and will contact you should any other suitable opportunities become available.

Name: Cyber Security Analyst
Description: Leading Utilities organisation is currently seeking a Security Analyst to join their growing team for a permanent role. This is a diverse role that will look at all aspects of security, including security monitoring / assessments and ensuring security compliance  You will also be required to perform the following:  This position will be responsible for the following key tasks* Performing a range of systems security related activities including proactive monitoring, reactive support, and documentation of security incidents to support the IT Team and ensure configuration management standards are applied* Monitoring the approach and compliance of security administration processes and security access through assessing metrics and data to identify unauthorised activity and prevent breaches occurring* Generating reports for IT administrators and business managers to evaluate the efficacy of the security policies in place and support continuous improvement security initiatives* Conducting security assessments through vulnerability testing and risk analysis to minimise the risk of security breaches* Analysing security breaches and other security related incidents to identify root causes and ensure systems changes are identified and assessed while escalating potential breaches to the IT Risk & Compliance Manager Maintaining and updating Internal Cybersecurity systems such as reporting platforms, firewalls and other associated systems - and documentation and polices required * Work with internal and external key stake holders to ensure compliance is maintained with cybersecurity policies* Create, distribute, and manage user awareness training programmes linked to cybersecurity.* Provide input into the risk management programme ensuring that Information technology systems Disaster Recovery plans include elements linked to cybersecurity.* Assume responsibility for the security of critical business systems, networks, and data, and ensures that all security policies and processes are complied with.* Develop and implement security standards, processes and procedures, and guidelines for the enterprise* Ensure and monitor security compliance with industry and government rules and regulations* Coordinate with technology and business groups to assess, implement, and monitor IT-related security risks/hazards* Ensures security compliance and meets all service level agreement requirements* Create an information security awareness program to ensure staff members across the organisation can identify and understand Cybersecurity risks To be successful in this position you will be an experienced Security Analyst who has solid experience in conducting security assessments, monitoring and troubleshooting security issues, and have an awareness of security governance and compliances. Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills are a must Apply Now by using the link or email leonie.woodfine@randstad.com.au At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Name: Information Security Consultant
Description: This role supports Vital Advisory in the delivery of consulting and advisory services to our clients. The role has scope for you to further develop your knowledge and experience to create practical solutions to meet our clients’ security, risk and governance needs. Your client-related work may include:Designing, developing, implementing, and operating Information Security Management Systems and/or Privacy Information Management SystemsAssessing and developing security capabilitiesPerforming business, threat and technical risk assessmentsDeveloping pragmatic documentation such as security and/or privacy policies, standards and other guidanceDelivering presentations, workshops, management meetings and other events Undertaking third party and other security assessments Performing controls assessment activities, such as controls self-assessments, assurance testing, and auditsIn addition to delivering services to our customers, other key requirements of this role are:Business acumen and understanding of business context and drivers for security and controlEnsuring timely and high-quality delivery of services to customersMaintaining a high level of professional ethical standardsA commitment to ongoing learning for personal and professional developmentA commitment to collaboration within the team and with our clientsAbility to coach and manage other staff, as requiredThe key knowledge areas for this role are:Knowledge of information security and related frameworks (such as ISO27001, ISO27701, NIST CSF, CPS234, PCI-DSS, SOC2/trust service criteria)Knowledge of risk and governance frameworks (such as COBIT5, ISO31000)Knowledge of Information Technology concepts, techniques, approaches, architectures, etc. Soft skills are also important in this role and include:Ability to work as part of a team as well as independently Initiative and commitment to continual improvementFlexibility with scheduling and work allocationAnalytical ability to break down problems into constituent parts to develop solutionsEffective communication skills and expertise, such as in translating technical jargon into business languageProven ability to analyse, assess and/or audit an IT environment to recommendations and improvementsQualifications and Certifications:We see qualifications and certifications as a demonstration of both your expertise and your commitment to the profession. For this role you may have:Certified Information Security Manager certification (CISM)ISO27001 Lead ImplementerISO27001 Lead AuditorCertified in Risks and Information Systems Control (CRISC)Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA)Certified Data Privacy Security Engineer (CDPSE)Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)A bachelor's degree in computer science, cyber-security or a related fieldRelevant experience should include:Over five years' experience in information security, IT, privacy, audit and/or risk preferredSolid understanding of information security Sound project management and communication skillsGood knowledge of data protection and privacy regulationsUse of technology such as Confluence, JIRA, Monday.com, ClickUp, and SharepointThis role is based in Sydney. It gives you the flexibility to work from home.To apply, please send your resume to Vaishali Shah on vaishali.shah@vitaladvisory.com

Name: Enterprise Applications Manager
Description:
Convenient Carlton based location & hybrid work option available
Attractive remuneration package
Opportunity to join a leading Business School

About Us
At Melbourne Business School (MBS) our purpose is to unleash ideas and leaders for a sustainable future. Our vision is to be among the top-ranked providers of business education within the Asia-Pacific Region, to be the first choice of students and clients seeking award and non-award educational experiences, and to be esteemed globally as a leading supplier of academic and business research.

The Opportunity 
An opportunity now exists to join the MBS information Services team where you will be responsible for ensuring that the portfolio of enterprise applications ensures MBS can achieve its strategic goals by providing support and development of applications including CRM, Financials and SharePoint.  The role also provides support in relation to the integration between core applications and associated applications such as the learning management system.
Some key accountabilities will also include:

Develop enterprise applications aligned to the solution architecture, enterprise data models and cybersecurity, IT controls frameworks and policies
Successful implementation of technology projects from conception to completion
Ensure that Disaster Recovery plans are developed and tested for applications that are identified in MBS Business Continuity Plans
Engage and influence stakeholders to identify solutions and make recommendations for projects that support MBS goals
Develop relationships with vendors with regards to provision of business solutions and applications
Accountable for the performance of the Enterprise Applications Team.
Develop and maintain appropriate documentation and knowledge base.

About you
You will bring to us significant leadership and project management experience gained within an Enterprise Applications environment, focused on a delivery of a “Cloud First” strategy, preferably with some expertise within an Academic context.  Experience with Microsoft Dynamics and Azure Platforms together with a strong understanding of application architecture and design principles will be strongly regarded.  A Bachelor degree in a related discipline area will complement your professional work experience.

What’s on offer
We value our people and ensure that we can reward you with more than just a salary and our benefits include:

Competitive remuneration, including not-for-profit salary packaging options and generous parental leave provisions
Flexible work options
Subsidised gym membership, health and wellbeing programs and regular social events
Access to world-class learning and development programs at a discounted rate
A workplace that promotes diversity, collaboration, and new ideas in the heart of Melbourne's innovation precinct
Working alongside talented and supportive colleagues who are passionate about innovation and creativity

To express your interest, please submit your application including a covering letter and a current resume by Tuesday 14th June 2022.

Name: Collaboration Solution Architect
Description: About the RoleAs a Collaboration Solution Architect you will work directly with clients and vendors to develop, scope and present detailed solutions that modernise and enhance their unified communications and collaboration capabilities. Your hands on experience and eye for detail will enable you to navigate recent technological shifts in collaboration to leverage integration opportunities and produce quality solutions for mission critical use cases. ResponsibilitiesWork directly with clients to design robust solutions that meet their business outcomesProvide pre-sales technical design, and subject matter expertiseCollaborate with the delivery team to ensure detailed handover of designs and solutionsAssist the sales team in the preparation of tender response creation and submission including design and costing of solutions with vendorsProduce quality design documentation that is concise, readable, and maintainable by the teamIdentify new business opportunities products, services, and markets for continued company growth Technical Skills and ExperienceCurrent CCNP Collaboration and/or CCIE CollaborationDemonstrated experience as a subject matter expert in Cisco collaboration technologiesMinimum 2+ years experience as a solution architectMinimum 3+ years in the collaboration industry (support, design, implementation)Proven collaboration skills and a familiarity with a majority of the following platforms:Cisco Unified Communications Manager, Cisco Unity, Cisco Webex, Webex Calling, Webex Contact Center, Cisco Expressway, Cisco Voice Gateways.Cisco Webex endpointsCisco IP phonesSpectralink Versity, Spectralink SAM, Spectralink AMIE (desirable but not essential)Microsoft Teams (desirable but not essential)Strong foundational networking skills (highly desirable) What will make you a good fit?Desire to learn and gain additional experience and certificationsCapable of creating and maintaining high-quality documentationStrong outcomes focus – client and companyStrong sense of accountability for your performance and actionsTeam player and ability to work autonomouslyAbility to adapt to changing situationsStrong troubleshooting skills with a passion for technology, unified communications and collaborationWell-developed interpersonal, communication and presentation skillsAbility to communicate effectively at all levels as a subject matter expert to stakeholders About ArchiTechArchiTech Network & Communications Solutions is a fast-growing Australian owned and operated ICT solutions integrator, specialising in enterprise networking, wireless, cybersecurity, collaboration, data centre and IoT technologies. With a focus on providing exceptional value and outcomes for our clients, we use our experience and industry expertise, to map leading world class technologies to organisational needs, and deliver custom solutions to suit. We have designed and delivered integrated solutions to some of the largest healthcare providers in Australia. Our approach to client engagement is what makes us stand out from the crowd - working closely with our clients to truly understand their business requirements, resulting in better delivery of outcomes and greater satisfaction to all. www.architech.net.au Why work at ArchiTech?We believe that when staff enjoy what they do, it drives them to work at their best. To us our people are not just workers, they are part of the fabric that makes ArchiTech a great place to work.An attractive remuneration package with flexible working optionsOpportunity to get involved in a variety of interesting, challenging and rewarding ICT projectsCareer development through training, mentoring, new product learnings and cross industry exposure Diverse and inclusive workplace with a supportive culture, where you can have fun and be yourself!How to applyTo start an application, click on ‘apply’ and submit the following:an up-to-date resume detailing your relevant experience for the rolea cover letter (max 1 page) specifically addressing the above criteria and your suitability to the role advertisedArchiTech reserve the right to close off this position early as applications will be considered upon receipt.  Please note:Only shortlisted candidates will be contactedYou must have the right to work permanently in AustraliaAn offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Clearance and Working with Children Check being provided to ArchiTechIn line with Government directions that apply to our client base, ArchiTech will require a copy of your Covid-19 Vaccination CertificateYou must have a valid Australian driver’s license and use of a personal vehicle to perform this roleFor any enquiries, please contact careers@architech.net.au

Name: Senior Information Technology Engineer - MSP
Description: GKM2 is a boutique next generation Microsoft Technology Partner and specialist Managed IT Services and Security provider based in Sydney. We were recently ranked in CRN's Fast50 Australia's biggest celebration of IT channel success; https://www.crn.com.au/fast50/presentation-2021/17-gkm2-solutions#viewThe role provides an exciting opportunity for an experienced Senior Systems Engineer to take his/her role to the next level and to lead our small team and be a key contact to our clients. This is primarily a work from home opportunity so a dedicated quiet space is essential, with all ongoing operating expenses such as Internet and Laptop paid for. You must be based in Greater Sydney to be close proximity to our clients.ResponsibilitiesProviding 3rd Level technical resolution to our clients via our ticketing system in relation to desktop, server, network and all related infrastructure issues such as software installations, configuration, maintenance and security either over the phone/remote or onsite.Assisting and taking escalations from our Level 2 Technical Staff.Managing and Training our Level 2 Technical Staff.Microsoft 365 management and support, including but not limited to; Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Endpoint Manager (Intune), Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps, Windows Defender for 365 and Endpoint, Enterprise and Mobility, Microsoft 365 E5.Leading technical projects such as new client onboarding, Server Migration Projects (on prem to on prem, on prem to cloud, cloud to cloud), Microsoft 365 and Azure Migrations.Working with Email Security and Backup and Archive Technologies such as AvePoint Cloud Backup and Proofpoint Essentials.Improving our Company's technical standards and processes, including client documentation, clients checklists, and introducing automation to improve efficiencies.You will be a primary contact to all our clients.Qualifications and Experience RequiredPrevious experience in an MSP environment is essential.Minimum 10 years of experience of configuring and supporting desktops, servers and networks (firewalls, switches, routers, wireless access points)Strong working networking knowledge (switching, routing, VLAN, WLAN, WAN, VPN)Strong working knowledge of all aspects of Microsoft 365 and associated services including, Microsoft Identity Management,  Enterprise Mobility and MDM.Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Azure including migrations and new builds.Excellent knowledge of common Antivirus (EDR) and Backup Applications and SolutionsStrong working knowledge of Windows Servers and have worked with and implemented all key server technologies such as Active Directory, DHCP, DNS, File & Print Services, Group Policy, Remote Desktop Services Farm etcStrong working knowledge and understanding of Virtualisation Technologies such as VMware, Hyper-V, Azure Virtual Desktop.Strong PowerShell/VB Scripting and/other scripting languagesStrong working knowledge of Linux OS, Build, Configuration and Administration.Cybersecurity SkillsStrong Analytical and Troubleshooting SkillsHighly Desirable Experience and technical working knowledge ofSophos XG/S Firewalls (firewall rules, NAT rules, SSL, IPSEC tunnels)Sophos Advanced Endpoint SecurityTechnical Certifications MS-100/101 and/or AZ-104Working with either N-Able N-Central/RMM, Datto RMM or similarWorking with ConnectWise Ticketing or similarWorking with Meraki Firewalls, Switching and Wireless Access PointsTelephony VoIP Skills and Microsoft Teams CallingITIL understandingPersonal Attributes RequiredExcellent verbal and written communication skillsWell Presented (Neat and Tidy)Self MotivatedExcellent Customer Service Skills - You will be customer facing!Ability to Work Under PressureEnjoys working with a team and helping othersGKM2 BenefitsWorking with a small organisation that really values their employeesAn easy-going environment and culture (we all enjoy what we do)Company LaptopOngoing TrainingWork from Home / Paid InternetWork with a wide variety of technologies - never gets boring hereLead the Team and work directly with the 2 Co-FoundersPaid Certification ExamsAre you ready to join a boutique well respected MSP? Do you have what it takes to take your career to the next level working on various technologies and platforms? To apply for this role, please include a separate cover letter together with your current resume, and in this letter please include: HashTag #ILoveTechnologyYour favourite DishOne hashtag that best describes youGenuine direct applications only.

Name: Senior Manager - Cloud Engineering & Operations
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity.
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us? 
 
What you’ll do
The Cloud Governance and Optimisation Manager is responsible for providing knowledge and guidance to application and data teams on their cloud consumption, on Tabcorp’s Public Cloud footprint.
In your new role you will facilitate and bridge a number of core teams, vendors, and internal support groups which look after critical systems and processes in order to meet the various SLA’s and Optimisation KPI’s that have been set for our Services and Engineering platforms. A high level of technical knowledge of cloud capabilities, as well as integration and API billing consumption data ingest, analytics & interpretation are essential skills for this role.
Furthermore, a high level of skill and capability is required in building interfaces and data ingest scripts for automation, database design and build to support central data capture and data analytics tasks. There are several application platforms managed by this role, alongside all the dashboards, while building, maintaining, and updating functionality to the Infrastructure & Cloud Operations KPI scorecard, AWS cost optimisation shutdown schedule tool, asset portal database and web presentation.
You will work hand in hand with your program counterparts to assist and aid in DevOps transformation and/or assist with best practise migrations of enterprise workloads to the AWS cloud platform. You will have firsthand experience at assessing Cloud and DevOps maturity, identify gaps and making improvements. You will create a unified strategy for cloud transformation governance, optimisation, automation, security, implementation and operations. Day-to-day you will be expected to lead your engineering peers through the technical and organisational challenges of Cloud and DevOps transformation and be responsible and accountable for ensuring a smooth and agile Cloud migration and DevOps transformation.
What you’ll bring

Significant experience in technology and experience leading cloud services across a complex enterprise with 24/7 services, and servicing multiple customer facing platforms.
Demonstrated capability managing and operating AWS deployments.
Demonstrated experience with DevOps practices and agile ways of working.
Experience with configuration management and tools such as Cloud Formation, Terraform, Chef, Puppet or Ansible.
Experience with IT infrastructure lifecycle planning and management across various technologies.
Experience working with Microsoft Azure/ AWS environment and private/public cloud adoption.
Experience in delivery of remediation across infrastructure services.
Collaborating with Solution and Enterprise Architects to aggregate input into future state roadmaps/operational plans.
Astute at developing business aligned IT strategies, frameworks, and roadmaps (and communicating these).
Experienced in agile, lean, DevOps, and other best (and next) practice.
Extensive vendor management experience, working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers
Proven track record in managing a highly effective team.
An extensive understanding of the Information and Technology industry, as well as technology trends and next practice.
Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.
An understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.
Working experience of market-based tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, Advanced Excel, SQL, Cloud Formation, CloudHealth, Cloud Bolt, Cloudability or Komulous etc. (Desirable).

What you’ll get
Not only will receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is expensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill. 
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible. 
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed].
COVID
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane.

Name: Platform Technical Delivery Manager - Salesforce
Description:
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity. 
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us?

Your role will deliver technical engineering capabilities for business demands across the Customer and Marketing Salesforce platforms including technical and design decisions, tooling, productivity, ways of working, direction, delivery scope and collaborative issue resolution.
You will understand how to engineer Salesforce platforms and add value to ensuring technology is continually improved and of the highest quality on a global scale.

Demonstrated experience in agile ways of working and the ability to drive adoption within a team. Experience in delivery upon Salesforce strategies.

Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.

Solid understanding of relevant legislation and associated regulations.

Solid understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk and compliance requirements in an ICT context (e.g. PCI-DSS, ISO 27001, ISO 9000).

Name: OCR Analyst & Cloud Data Engineer | Manager
Description: With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!) What will you create? You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems. Consulting bring this to life by helping clients improve the way they operate, reduce costs, manage risks, leverage talent, or fundamentally change the way they do business. Your work here will help organisations of all shapes and sizes work smarter and grow faster.  As a Manager in our Risk Analytics team you will work within small fast paced teams to design, develop and deliver innovative solutions, using data and technology within the Financial Services industry for the nations biggest Banking and Insurance clients.Your impact will be seen by:Designing and delivering solutions leveraging OCR technologies and building data pipelines using cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)Ensuring these solutions are robust and secureCreating repeatable delivery pipelines and processes that reinforce CD/CI principlesA passion to lead and mentor other team members while building out our OCR capabilityAbility to learn and use new technologies quickly and effectively, whilst keeping up to date with current trends in Big Data and Cloud data servicesDelivering complex data-driven projects using agile methodology. About youYou are an experienced OCR analyst and cloud data engineer with a proven background deploying data pipelines in the cloud. Working within a small team you will be familiar with agile software development practices. You will have practical experience in creating applications using some of the following key tools and techniques:Experience using ABBYY Flexicapture (or other OCR tools) to perform document intelligence and classification is keyExperience in data analytics languages (e.g. Python, SQL, ElasticSearch)Experience in deploying ETL data pipelines using cloud and serverless componentsExperience with Dev Ops and setting up CI/CD pipelines (e.g. using Jenkins, Bamboo, GitHub, Azure DevOps) is a bonusSetting up cloud infrastructure for developers across dev and prod environments in AWS/Azure with appropriate roles and ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threatsExperience with infrastructure-as-code and shell scriptingExperience in integrating with API endpoints Any prior consulting, Banking or Insurance experience is welcome alongside other risk specific business domains such as Fraud, Financial Crime or Regulatory Compliance.  You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to work with a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team drive a new capability focused on helping bring a technology and data driven solution to our clients business problems. Life at PwCOur culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also why we’re consistently named as one of Australia’s best workplaces. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together. We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us. We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.  PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

Name: Major Incident, Problem & Capacity Manager
Description:
Major Incident, Problem & Capacity Manager - Melbourne, or Sydney
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. It’s an exciting moment in our history - a new era of Tabcorp. We’re raising the game by creating the most engaging betting and entertainment experiences, and to lead in integrity.
We’re here to create excitement everywhere – through our incredible people, unrivalled experiences and strong relationships. We're bringing industry leading products and services to our customers and breaking into new horizons.
Game to join us?
What you’ll do 
You will lead the Major Incident, Problem & Capacity Management team and have ownership to drive the efficiency and effectiveness of the major incident, problem, and capacity management process to manage the process to restore normal service operation for highly available platforms, products and services that are accessible and performing effectively to Tabcorp’s Business.
Reporting to the Head of Support and Service Management, you will obsess about customer happiness (Tabcorp Users) and provide a significant amount of user interaction and a highly effective resolution of service and end user issues to provide Tabcorp with a secure and robust service for all major services, 24/7/365 across all geographic locations.
You are accountable for major incident, problem and capacity management within the Technology environment, and focus on improving operational efficiency by building strong business relationships through delivery excellence, client focus and commercial insight.
What you’ll bring

Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or applied science or a related field of study, or equivalent experience.
ITIL Certified.
Extensive experience in technology with 3 years’ experience in Service Delivery and Incident and Problem Management working in a complex enterprise with 24/7/365 services, including servicing customer facing platforms.
Extensive operational support experience in supporting large and complex IT and business environments.
Secure understanding of service levels from a commercial perspective.
Experience in delivery of technology uplift and remediation/simplification across infrastructure, cloud adoption, core software, digital engineering/DevOps.
Astute at developing business aligned IT strategies, frameworks, and roadmaps (and communicating these).
Experienced in agile, lean, DevOps, and other best (and next) practice.
Experience working with a variety of supplier / resource models, including matrix, managed services, and multiple suppliers.
ISO 27001 & 9001 audit knowledge.
Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.
An understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.

What you’ll get 
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the perks of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is extensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such as cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About Tabcorp
We’re Australia’s leading gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.
Our 3,000+ strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; TAB, Sky Racing and MAX. As an ASX listed company, we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.
Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact tabcorprecruitment@tabcorp.com.au [link removed]
COVID 
Tabcorp is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.
This role is based in Sydney.

Name: Product Specialist / Product Manager
Description: At Hitachi Energy our purpose is advancing a sustainable​ energy future for all. We bring power to our homes, schools, hospitals and factories. Join us and work with fantastic people, while learning and developing yourself on projects that have a real impact to our communities and society. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and be part of a global team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great InnovationWe are currently looking for a highly capable Product Specialist / Product Manager to join our High Voltage Products team in LilydaleAs Product Manager and Digital Platform Lead for Hitachi Energy’s Power Quality Products digital and controller product solutions, you are responsible for overseeing all aspects of the respective products/systems life cycle. This includes (but not limited to) identification of market needs and product development requirements, product launch activities, strategic planning and roadmap development, and managing direct or indirect resources to accomplish identified goals. You are comfortable working in a cross-functional role encompassing electronics hardware, software development, M2M and remote communications, as well as cloud computing and architecture fundamentals. You are instrumental in leading and coordinating the product lines’ digital transformation based on a clear vision for the future Come as you are and prepare to get better as you learn and grow. Bring your passion, bring your energy, and plug into a team that appreciates a simple truth: Diversity + Collaboration = Great Innovation Hitachi Energy is a pioneering technology leader. We are helping to increase access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all. We help to power your home, keep industry and factories running, and our hospitals and schools open. We offer power and automation products, systems, service and software solutions across the generation, transmission, and distribution value chain. That is what we do – Why we do it – sustainability. We are advancing the world’s energy system to be more sustainable, flexible and secure. We are playing a significant role in enabling a sustainable energy future – for today’s generations and those to come.Your responsibilitiesDevelop and drive the implementation of strategic product and solution roadmaps for the subject portfolio.Provide technical leadership and direction on the digital product portfolio and support customer implementation activities.Coordinate cross-functional resources (locally and globally as required) to achieve the subject portfolio objectives. This includes, but not limited to; marketing and sales teams, local operations (SCM, OHSQ&E, manufacturing), R&D resources, as well as specialist team functions (i.e., Cybersecurity, 3rd party developers, etc).In conjunction with Global Product Management and Global Technology Teams, identify and coordinate funding and resources required to achieve product development objectives. Support project execution accordingly.Provide technical, training, and production support as required.Perform market analysis related to the subject portfolios to identify new market opportunities. Translate the analysis into business plans and strategies in line with global product line priorities.Your backgroundBachelor’s Degree in Engineering (electrical, electronic, computer science, robotics/mechatronics preferred) with working electrical systems knowledge.Min 3 years relevant experience. Experience in leading product development projects highly valued.Familiarity and experience with embedded and PC based software languages / programming and communication protocols advantageous.Excellent written and verbal communication skills. High attention to detailHighly organized with a focus on timeliness and the ability to meet deadlines amidst changing priorities and activities.Ability to implement change and influence people throughout the organization.Experience in coordinating stakeholders in diverse functional areas; Relates well to people at all levels.Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team.Proactive, flexible, and with demonstrable problem-solving skills.Basic knowledge of business financial and commercial aspects. Comfortable tracking project planned costs vs. actualWhat we Offer (crowd sourced from our team members)A strong focus on learning – we offer multiple options to upskill in both your professional field and areas of interestIn addition to the standard EAP offering we fund access to specialist help lines for our people in the following fields of expertise – First Nations People, LGBTIQ+, Domestic and Family Violence, Eldercare and Disability and CarersWellbeing support – a range of initiatives to support wellbeing including webinars, RUOK?365, mindfulness programs, resilience programsCareer opportunities – we encourage people to build their career here and roles in Australia are advertised internally and communicated weeklyFlexible working for roles that can accommodate thatGenuinely multicultural workplaceThe opportunity to purchase additional leave to support you integrate home and workPaid parental leaveAdditional leave including charity, compassionate, serious illnessThe ability to swap public holidays for religious days that have meaning for youA global organization focused on sustainability and harnessing the power of renewable energyMore about usHitachi Energy is a global technology leader that is advancing a sustainable energy future for all. We serve customers in the utility, industry and infrastructure sectors with innovative solutions and services across the value chain. Together with customers and partners, we pioneer technologies and enable the digital transformation required to accelerate the energy transition towards a carbon-neutral future. We are advancing the world’s energy system to become more sustainable, flexible and secure whilst balancing social, environmental and economic value. Hitachi Energy has a proven track record and unparalleled installed base in more than 140 countries. Headquartered in Switzerland, we employ around 38,000 people in 90 countries and generate business volumes of approximately $10 billion USD. Hitachi Energy is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity and recognizes the importance of attracting the right people for the right job. We are actively seeking to increase the diversity of our team and encourage applications from people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, women, the LGBTQI+ community, people living with disability/ies and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Name: Senior Security Specialist -Digital
Description: About Us Woolworths IT is currently in an exciting period of transformation and growth. Among Australia's earliest adopters of the Google platform and agile methodologies, we are now investing in future-focused IT solutions for our stores and customers - and we need the best and brightest in technology to help us pave the way. The Cyber Security team provides security services and guidance to protect our team and customers from cyber threats, manage our risks and enable Woolworths to safely move at speed About the Role We are currently seeking  an experienced Senior Security Specialist- Digital, with a strong foundation in secure agile CI/CD development and secure cloud configuration practices, and demonstrated leadership, communication and problem solving skills, to join our  dynamic and exciting organisation!   This role is part of the Group Cyber Security Team, reporting to the Head of Digital - Security and Risk,  responsible for delivering fit for purpose Cyber outcomes to the group Digital brands. Working closely with the Digital Agile development squads and Cyber Security teams, this role will focus on leading Digital teams towards implementing repeatable processes and standards, building a Secure Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and Cloud infrastructure environment, and embedding a great security development and risk management culture into our Digital development teams.  This includes creating and maintaining the necessary cybersecurity standards end to end - from CI/CD tools, through to applications security testing practices, cloud configuration, cyber security controls compliance, and post-incident remediation - to improve cyber resilience.   Other key deliverables include:   Develop  a complete understanding of the Digital Technology system and application landscape, across all 4 Digital banners and assess from a cybersecurity perspective Provide cybersecurity leadership in Agile environments across the Digital squads  Design, create, embed and own pro-active cybersecurity best practice processes into the SDLC of all Digital development teams Plan, research and design robust security application architectures and patterns for all projects Research security standards, security systems and authentication protocols and educate the developers around their use Respond immediately to security-related incidents, manage any escalations and communications to the Senior Leadership team and provide a thorough post-event analysis  About You You will have  Cybersecurity experience in web, mobile, cloud controls along with strong applications development experience. You will also  have effective communication, negotiation and stakeholder management capabilities; able to influence and drive outcomes and build sustainable working relationships.  You will genuinely enjoy the  challenges that form part of this role and have the passion and drive to deliver. Other attributes and capabilities include:   Experience with recommending and setting the technical direction for managing Digital application security incidents Proven experience with initiating and interpreting technical vulnerability assessments  Understanding of common Agile development methodologies and relevant deployment and automation tools and their integration with best practice security guidelines Understanding of information security concepts and principles, system architectures and development Expert knowledge of software development and cloud security principles, concepts, and best practices Keen sense of humour and self aware about own skills, strengths and growth opportunities.   Grow with the Group Woolworths Group has announced it will be requiring Australian team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (subject to medical and religious exemptions). As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency. As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility, and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences - for our customers and for each other. We'd love to hear from You If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn [link removed] or via www.wowcareers.com.au [link removed]. #LI #work180. Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Senior Director of Sales (AUS)
Description: What We Do:Founded in 2015 by former NSA cyber operators, Huntress was built on a simple premise: to force hackers to earn every inch of their access.Today’s cyber-attacks aren’t limited to large organizations with the security tools that can ward off threats. Hackers don't discriminate and will find a way to penetrate any vulnerability in any size business.  Huntress enables IT providers and resellers to stop hidden threats that sneak past preventive security tools.Through a combination of expert human threat hunters, a comprehensive platform, and a desire to make the world a safer place, we’re working to deliver cybersecurity to the 99%—those small to midsize businesses that make up the backbone of our economy. Join the hunt and help us stop hackers in their tracks!What You’ll Do: Not only is Huntress growing, we’re growing internationally.  We are a US based managed security platform providing tools and services for small and mid-sized businesses.  As we prepare for our growth in Australia, we need to first add our Senior Director of Sales to begin building and leading our growth strategy in Australia.  As our senior director, you’ll support our Manager and Sales Development team, provide leadership and strategic vision  for the team, provide training, quality analysis, and ensure the team is set up for success and maximum productivity.  We have are striving for bold targets and goals with our expansion by bringing our cybersecurity mission to the small and mid-sized businesses in Australia.  We need a proven leader that is enthusiastic to use their passion, skills and autonomy toward the task of building a team and bringing a new division to market. Responsibilities:  Build and execute a sales growth strategy including go-to-market plans, growth and expansion strategies, building your team, and optimizing our sales process for maximum success Hire, Train, and Develop Account Executives, Sales Development Representatives and Business Development Representatives to excel and grow within the companyEducate, build credibility, and trust to sell the Huntress security stack to new customers within the IT Managed Service Provider (MSP) communityMaintain a high level of pipeline organization & follow-up efficiency for your teamAbility to travel (up to 25% of the time) and confidently present in front of an audience during Trade Shows & WebinarsAchieve Sales Goals with your team ( by the Executive TeamDemonstrate adaptability and flexibility as part of an ever-growing sales organization What You Bring To The Team:  Experience in relevant channels: Cybersecurity, Manager Service Providers (MSP), Technology Providers, Technology Services providers, Solution Selling 8+ years of demonstrated success in a senior sales leadership position, with a proven track record of successPrevious experience working with MSP’s is requiredStrong time management & organizational skills as well as the ability to work across time zonesInternal drive of continuous improvement. Cybersecurity is a rapidly changing environment - the ideal candidate will possess a determination to continually learn and growWhat We Offer: Fully remote workNew starter home office set up allowance Generous personal leave entitlementsMobile phone reimbursement SuperannuationHuntress is committed to creating a culture of inclusivity where every single member of our team is valued, has a voice and is empowered to show up to work every day as their full self. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any other legally protected status. People from all culturally diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.We do discriminate against hackers who try to exploit small businesses.Accommodations:If you require reasonable accommodation in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodations@huntresslabs.com.  Please note non-accommodation requests to this inbox will not receive a response.

Name: Senior Account Executive
Description: About the company Loop Secure is Australia's longest-standing cybersecurity firm with over 30 years history in the region,We are a leader in cybersecurity services, with 24x7 security operations, expert adversary simulation & penetration testing capabilities along with leading governance, risk and compliance consulting,As our clients' cybersecurity partner of choice, we forge long term valued relationships,Loop provides the opportunity for fast sales career advancement as part of a growing team with an emphasis on career development,You will receive comprehensive training on cybersecurity services sales and the support you need to succeed in this role,Loop offers a competitive salary package with flexible work/life balance within a fun working environment,Backed by the Australian ASX listed Tesserent, become part of Australia’s largest ASX listed ‘pure play’ cybersecurity consulting and solutions provider with over 350 security professionals, located across 8 offices across Australia and New Zealand.  About the roleThis role is an important position for Loop, with the expectation of professionally representing Loop in the a senior sales capacity.You are responsible for meeting sales targets through identifying new business opportunities within existing or new clients,You will be instrumental in establishing and maintaining effective business relationships with all clients,You are expected to gain a thorough understanding of the client's business, and identify the appropriate decision-maker(s) in the customer's organisation,You will also create and deliver proposals and maintains frequent communication with all customers,As part of the role, you will provide reports on individual activity to management and attend our national team and company meetings, as required. About the candidateFor this role we value candidates with the following behaviours:LeadershipThe ability to influenceSelf-motivatedExcellent relationship buildingPersistenceCommercial AcumenSelf-AwarenessThe role will suit a sales professional with at least 3-5 years prior experience in effective business development and prior experience with effective account management.  Our culture and valuesLoop focuses heavily on our culture and values to create an enjoyable working environment that recognises the best in our Loopies:We look for client success in everything we do,We strive for continual improvement, challenging the status quo and searching out opportunities to learn, grow and lead for ourselves and the business,Dependability is highly valued, when we say we are going to do something, we follow it through,Having fun is a big focus for us, calling out and recognising Loopies bringing enjoyment and laughter to our work day,Loopies focus on teamwork, working together to achieve our goals and helping out when someone is in need. We are always looking to share our ideas, thoughts and feelings,We take the initiative to get things done even when no one is watching. Being pro-active is an important part of being on the 'Loop Bus'. The qualifications we expect the candidate to have include business or commercial related education.

Name: Cyber Security Governance, Risk & Compliance Specialist
Description: CGI is a high performing global IT and Business Consulting firm. You will have the opportunity to expand your knowledge of security through working across multiple clients. CGI offer world class training and certification opportunities to support your career development, whilst giving you the ability to participate in supportive learning environments across a range of IT and OT technologies.Your future duties and responsibilities: Support the bid team in pursuit of new Cybersecurity business opportunitiesAssist in developing Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) servicesConduct IT risk assessments for clientsWork with clients on the development and updating of Risk Management Frameworks to ensure complianceSupport client policy, procedure and other compliance documentation developmentLead accreditation activities both internally and externallyAssist clients in the development, maintenance, and testing of business continuity plansProvide Board and C-Level advice and consulting.Skills and experience required to be successful in this role: 5+ years working in Governance, Risk, and ComplianceHold a current certification in ISO27001:2013 Lead AuditorExperience working within Cybersecurity environmentsA passion for cybersecurity – you love learning and are across the latest advancements in the sectorDemonstration of perform risk and compliance assessmentsExcellent communications skills (Verbal and written)Full work rights for Australia. One or more of the following are desirable:Experience in compliance frameworks such as NIST, AESCSF, VPDSF, PSPF, and/or PCI DSSKnowledge of the MITRE ATT&CK FrameworkExperience managing Defence accreditation of ICT systemsEligible for an NV1 Australian Government Security (AGSVA) Clearance.What's on offer?CGI’s total compensation package aims to offer something for everyone. Our member benefits are aligned with CGI’s philosophy of developing an ownership culture in which all members can feel empowered to contribute to CGI’s success. When you join CGI, permanent members have the opportunity to become owners, by participating in the Share Purchase Plan. Our aim is for every member to reap the benefits of ownership, have the tools and resources required to shape your career and have access to programs that contribute to a healthy work-life balance.CGI is proud to be a Work180 endorsed employer for all women.To find out more apply today!

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: CSIRT Technical Lead position  Job DescriptionSeeking a high level CSIRT Manager to join an agile yet fast paced team (Sydney CBD)This role will be reporting to me and working alongside the GRC team, SOC and Internal information Security Advisors. This role would be ideally suited to a technical Cyber professional from a SOC Management/Cyber Incident Response background. You will:·       Be the onsite CSIRT lead for all the security related incidents & topics in both the client and internal IT workstreams·       Be responsible for the overall security viability, manageability and operational stability of all Security services.·       Be leading the Security Operations Centre (SOC) service to ensure timely detection and alerting of security events. Essential Requirements·       Solid knowledge of Incident Response, with good awareness of Security concepts such as Traffic and Malware Analysis, Forensics, and analysis of security and infrastructure logs·       Understanding of SIEM, IDS/IPS, Web Gateway, DLP, Firewall, Vulnerability Management, Endpoint Security solutions, Cloud, Web/Email services, Sinkholes and Malware Sandbox Technologies·       Advanced knowledge of cybersecurity components, principles, practices, and procedures, and understanding of threat intelligence and threat modelling solutions.·       Understanding of computer network exploitation (CNE) and computer network defence (CND) concepts, and Understanding of vulnerability and exploit analysis
