Name: Cyber Security Analyst - OT
Description: This large Government Agency is currently embarking on a magor security up lift, and requires an experienced Analyst (Operational Technology) This will be an initial 6 month contract with hybrid working arrangementsKey accountabilitiesProvide cybersecurity IT and OT (Operational Technology) engineering subject matters analysis and adviceDesign, implement and coordinate appropriate security controls to ensure transparency and active management of cyber security riskEnsure assigned project delivery complies with applicable cybersecurity standards, processes, and regulationsDeliver cybersecurity artefacts at delivery assurance gates, and actively throughout delivery as directed across the portfolioMaintain effective records, and meet reporting requirements for IT and OT cybersecurity activity across the DivisionKey challengesEnsuring assigned IT and OT delivery and operational projects meet security requirements and milestones without compromising on safety, securityEngage successfully into project stakeholders with a broad range of cyber security literacyEssential requirementsTertiary qualifications in an Engineering discipline, or equivalent experienceProfessional Certification such as CISA, CISM, CISSP, ISO27001 LA or similar preferredGood working knowledge of IEC 62443 would be an advantagePlease reach out for a confidental chat today mjpollock@quayappointments.com.au

Name: Senior Software Engineer
Description: About the CompanyTech Mahindra offers innovative and customer-centric digital experiences, enabling enterprises, associates and the society to Rise. We are focused on leveraging next-generation technologies including 5G, Blockchain, Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence, and more, to enable end-to-end digital transformation for global customers. Tech Mahindra is one of the fastest growing brands and amongst the top 15 IT service providers globally. Job Overview:2-3 years of experience in Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN), Red hat PAM experience.Software Engineer with Red Hat Process Automation Manager work experience and good understanding of Business Process Model and Notation (BPMN) and Decision Model and Notation (DMN) standards is a must.Java in Redhat Linux environment experience is preferred Why Tech Mahindra?You will work within a successful, established and trusted organisation, where you the opportunities are only limited by your by aspirations; Do you want to travel the world? Do you want to be always learning new skills and developing professionally and personally? We offer everything you could desire with flexibility work, excellent salary, healthcare, dedicated training/certification platform and unrivalled recognition throughout the business. For further information please contact Mohan Narayan at email: mohan.narayan@techmahindra.com, Mobile: +61 480096159.

Name: Senior Engineer – Identity Access Management
Description:
Macquarie is looking for an experienced Senior Engineer to join our Identity Access Management teams that our part of Global Identity and Cyber Security division.
Our team focuses on Identity Access Management (IAM), one of the key pillars of cybersecurity and an important service that delivers value to our entire organisation on a global scale.
Bring your top engineering experience and discipline to this role, and in return we will help you grow into a domain specialist, working on exciting technologies and challenging engineering problems.  Already working in cybersecurity or IAM?  Even better, you will fit right in!  Become part of our growing team of passionate and collaborative professionals who are ready to make a difference.
As a Senior Engineer, you will be responsible for managing and coaching a team of engineers, ensuring the team follows best engineering practices and deliver quality and scalable software.  You will be a hands-on leader, working in the trenches with your team, modelling and encouraging a collaborative working style.  You will have a keen eye for balancing design decisions over immediate customer needs as well as capitalising on future market opportunities.  The role will challenge you to work on various key development projects involving the following:  cloud migration, REST API, Integration, site reliability engineering and lastly, data analytics.
To be successful in this role, you will have the following skills:

experience in leading a team of engineers, working in an Agile and DevOps environment
strong experience working in cloud computing environments (AWS preferred)
expert knowledge and experience with API design and development (Java SpringBoot)
experience with system monitoring and logging tools (e.g. AppDynamics, Splunk, CloudWatch) desirable
experience with continuous integration and relevant tools, in particular using Atlassian products Bitbucket/Bamboo/Jira etc.
strong programming and problem-solving skills with at least one general purpose programming language, Java preferred
experience on coding with either RDMBS or NoSQL database/cache
strong sense of ownership, self-motivated and able to self-manage work
strong troubleshooting skills and creative problem-solving ability
experience in SailPoint, or similar Access Management tool desirable
experience in Ping Federate or similar product desirable.

To join this dynamic and highly innovative team, apply now or contact Nathan.king@macquarie.com [link removed] for more information.
Find out more about Macquarie careers at http://www.macquarie.com/careers [link removed]
About the Corporate Operations Group
The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data, Technology, Market Operations, Human Resources, Business Services, Business Improvement & Strategy, and the Macquarie Group Foundation. The Corporate Operations Group’s purpose is to power the entrepreneurial enterprise. 
Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion 
The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths, and in combination with our inclusive environment, it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people, clients, shareholders and communities. From day one, you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us, please apply. With the right technology, support and resources, our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  
We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you, and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.

Name: MS Operations Team Lead
Description:
Data Centre & Cloud Solutions Architect - NTT
Is innovation part of your DNA? Do you want to enable a connected future for people, organizations, and society?
Join our growing global NTT team and you’ll be part of the world’s largest ICT company (by revenue). We’ve combined the capabilities of 28 remarkable companies to become one, leading technology services provider. Together, we help our people, clients, and communities do great things with technology to create a more secure and connected future. We employ 40,000 people across 57 countries. By bringing together the world’s best technology companies and emerging innovators, we work together to deliver sustainable outcomes to businesses and the world. Innovation is part of our DNA. We believe it’s key to what makes us different. So, we strive to move forward, challenge the status quo, and drive excellence through the technologies we integrate and the services we deliver around the world. The result is connected cities, connected factories, connected healthcare, connected agriculture, connected conservation, connected mobility, and connected sport. Together we enable the connected future.
Want to be part of the team?
NTT is a Global Technology and Business Solutions Provider. Services include digital business consulting, technology and managed services for cybersecurity, applications, workplace, cloud, data centre and networks.
Managed Services supports day-to-day operations, across multivendor hybrid IT environments. Engineers ensure client IT infrastructure, systems and solutions remain operational through proactively identifying, investigating, and resolving technical issues, restoring service, and facilitating the automated management and control of these systems.
The Managed Services Digital Workplace team within the Managed Services Delivery group provides services to clients across many industry sectors. They support and manage server platforms including Windows, Linux, Solaris and AIX, Messaging platforms, Citrix ADC and CVAD environments and related systems and applications.
Team Leads are primarily responsible for managing a team of engineers that ensure managed service is provided to all clients, to ensure that their IT infrastructure and systems remain operational and that contracted Managed Services outcomes are delivered to the client.
 
Responsibilities:

Monitors the work queues and provide support to client where the ticket is highly technical or sophisticated in nature
Works independently, with general direction from the client, stakeholders, team lead or senior manager, to perform operational tasks to resolve all escalated incidents / requests in a timely manner within agreed SLA
Provide support to escalated incidents
Use operational and diagnostic procedures to resolve escalated tickers in unique and complex client environments
Timely escalation of all tickets to management with ensuing updates, where applicable
Act as emergency support contact as needed, for critical client and business impacting issues
Provide operational support and continuous service improvement post client handover from TS (or other) teams
Constantly measure and analyse team’s delivery capabilities to Support, maintain and manage the technical aspects of a managed solution.
Implement training and development initiatives for direct reports
Lead talent acquisition / recruitment activities for vacant positions in direct team
Set goals and manage performance for direct reports

 
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, systems analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience
Experience spanning at least two IT disciplines, including technical architecture, network management, application development, middleware, database management or operations
High level of experience in management of people, process and technology
High level of experience in coaching and mentoring teams on a daily basis
Demonstrated experience in implementation of continual service improvement in previous roles (through automation, process enhancements, etc)
Demonstrated experience in organisational change management (transformational experience)
ITIL Foundation certification v3 / v4

 
Technical Stack

Server Infrastructure: DellEMC, HP, Cisco UCS
Hyperconverged Infrastructure: Cisco Hyperflex, VxRail
Storage: NetApp, DellEMC, vSANs, HDS, Pure, HP
Backup: Commvault, DellEMC, Veritas, Veeam, Rubrik
Hypervisor: Vmware, HyperV, OVM
Operating System: Windows Server, Linux, UNIX
Messaging Applications: Exchange, Skype, Teams, O365, Email Hygiene and Archiving
Citrix Virtual Apps and Desktops, Citrix Netscalers
Hyperscale Cloud Tenancies: Azure, AWS

 Join our growing global team and accelerate your career with us. Apply today.
For more information about this or other opportunities, please contact Raid Ahmad. Please quote our job reference number 568695.About usNTT Ltd. is a leading global technology services company. Working with organizations around the world, we achieve business outcomes through intelligent technology solutions. For us, intelligent means data driven, connected, digital and secure. As a global ICT provider, we employ more than 40,000 people in a diverse and dynamic workplace that spans 57 countries, trading in 73 countries and delivering services in over 200 countries and regionsNTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment. We do not discriminate based on age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, veteran status, or other protected category.

Name: Cyber Security Engineer – Multiple Opportunities
Description: Company DescriptionAt Leidos, we deliver practical solutions to the Federal Government’s most complex IT engineering problems. And, as a Prime Systems Integrator, these are often on a scale and variety rarely seen by other organisations. Whether developing and supporting technology transformation projects for the Bureau of Meteorology, providing software applications for critical Defence missions, or improving the way the ATO supports its service delivery, our work has a direct impact on the lives of Australians, and will certainly impact on your career.Job DescriptionYour New RoleLeidos has been engaged by Defence to provide a leading cyber security capability for the environments that our deployed military personnel rely on. The team develops and delivers key cyber security services to directly support the Department’s mission. We are seeking highly motivated and appropriately experienced staff to help us deliver outstanding results. This role is an exciting opportunity to perform crucial high value work to support and protect our personnel in the Australian Defence Forces.This is a rare opportunity for driven and focused people to “Get Cybersecurity Right”. This engagement is still maturing and there is real scope for the right individual to put their stamp on how Cybersecurity is done within the engagement, the end goal is a leading edge Cybersecurity capability that is the envy of others and we need the right people to get there.Our cyber engineering roles include support of the security function for our customer ensuring systems are available, appropriately maintained and secured. This role allows you to utilise your broad experience in a supportive team environment.You will have the following responsibilities:Management and configuration of the security tooling our Deployed ADF personnel rely on;Perform troubleshooting in support of the ADF or our Security Operations Centre, such as why logs aren’t shipping from point A to point B;Assist with vulnerability management including config reviews and software versions;Assist with incident investigation including obtaining logs, reviewing firewall rules, etc;Assist with monitoring the network for changes that may affect cyber security;Be cross trained into supporting cyber security tools such as proxies, sandboxes, mail gateways, and end point security;Integration and functional testing; andWork with other teams to troubleshoot complex issues across multiple networks.QualificationsAbout You and What You'll BringAs a Cyber Security Engineer, you will bring your knowledge and expertise to support the team. You will be customer-focused, and enjoy working as part of a team. We have a number of open roles from mid-level through to Senior. Our list of desired technologies is lengthy, however we don't expect you to bring all of the below to the table. We offer cross training across the entire tool suite for the right candidates.You will have the following skills/knowledge:3+ years in enterprise IT system administration;Knowledge of how a typical Enterprise IT system fits togetherIntermediate to advanced troubleshooting skills in complex networksWorking knowledge in cybersecurity principles such as hardening standards and techniquesWorking knowledge of Windows operating systemsIdeally you will have experience in some of the following:Worked with SOC operational teams to support evidence gatheringWorking knowledge of operating systems such as LinuxWorking knowledge of:SplunkMcAfee ePOTenable.SCCisco ASAsBluecoat ProxySG,ForescoutElastic SIEMFortinetCarbon Black Response or similar EDR toolsCarbon Black App Control or similar whitelisting toolsFortigate firewallsFortimailFortiauthenticatorFortiNACFortisandboxForticlientFortianalyserNutanix FlowIvanti Device ControlYou will have the following attributes:Comfortable working in cross team environments;Comfortable interacting with a mixture of highly technical peers and partners as well as military staff;Willing to learn new technologies in the cyber security space;Willing to mentor other team members; andWilling to go the extra mile to ensure customer mission needs are met.Additional InformationIf you want the following as part of your next role, please get in touch today.Important and engaging workLeading edge technologyExcellent training and career developmentHappy and focused high performing teamWork with experienced peersWell-resourced operationEnhance national securitySuccessful candidates will be required to be Australian Citizens and be able to obtain and maintain an Australian Government Security Clearance. NV-2 Clearance preferred, but an NV-1 cleared candidate with strong experience and team fit will be considered. This role requires tasks to be performed onsite due to the nature of the networks used.The successful candidate may need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements applicable to this role, and your nationality may be a factor in determining your suitability for this role.  At Leidos, you will be valued, included and supported. So if you are open-minded and keen to be the difference, we look forward to welcoming you.

Name: Senior Sales Engineer
Description: About Trend MicroTrend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fuelled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, Trend Micro's cybersecurity platform protects hundreds of thousands of organisations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints. As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, the platform delivers a powerful range of advanced threat defence techniques optimised for environments like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and central visibility for better, faster detection and response. With 7,000 employees across 65 countries, Trend Micro enables organisations to simplify and secure their connected world.By joining our team of passionate industry experts, you have the opportunity to become a trailblazer and shape the cybersecurity landscape.What are we looking for?Are you passionate about DevOps? APIs and SDKs? Automation of IT and Security workflows? Do you want to automate everything?The Trend Micro Australia Sales Engineering team is looking for someone different. Someone who can understand the mindset of those who are running toward the new IT world of DevOps and automating tasks and infrastructure through code. Someone who loves IaC. Someone who wants to integrate, orchestrate and automate.Do you have a background as a DevOps Engineer, DevOps architect, Cloud Architect, Support Engineer for a SaaS or DevOps, or Linux or Windows Administration? Sales Engineering experience is welcomed, but not necessary. If you're interested in a career in "next-gen" sales engineering, then we have an amazing opportunity for you.We want you to lead the charge on driving powerful demos showcasing our security automation capabilities using our API/SDK capabilities in our market-leading hybrid cloud security offer, Trend Micro Deep Security. This offer protects the "hybrid cloud" workloads across AWS, Azure, Google, and VMWare. Our customers need to automate their security operations, as code, across the hybrid cloud, at scale. A strong passion for customer success and curious nature is critical to the role.You will be working with our customers in our rapidly growing business and need to have the ability to lead and execute with our sales teams.Some of the Job ResponsibilitiesConsult with customers, understand their issues and demonstrate and architect possible solutions.Experience with APIs, SDKs, and technologies used in CI/CD pipelineAbility to listen to customer problems, work with the sales team, and demo a solution and provide useful code samplesEnable the technical sales field through the creation of collateral (demos, videos, training, etc)Having and displaying a passion for security and DevOpsRelevant Work ExperienceA good understanding of scripting and coding, tasks where things required automationComputer Science and/or Business Degree (related field) or equivalent work experienceExperience using a Source Code Repository (ex. github)Understanding of cloud-native technologies and containerization of services (AWS, Azure, EKS, ECS, K8S, Docker)Proven experience working as a Systems Engineer supporting automated builds and continuous integrationBenefits of being a Trender!At Trend Micro, our people and culture are our power. There are no barriers - you are empowered to discover your passion and be the best part of yourself.We encourage you to challenge the status quo, break assumptions, and learn and grow every step of your career, fulfilling your potential.Helping customers succeed is our top priority. We believe in doing the right thing, solving the right problems, and maintaining business sustainability. And our efforts to make a difference go beyond the digital world.Trenders have the opportunity to be good global citizens by building houses in the Philippines, donating money to help underprivileged communities, educating kids and parents on online safety, advancing a diverse workforce (Close the Gap™ program [link removed]), and more.We take employee wellbeing seriously. At Trend, you will have access to Medical Insurance, Mental Health Support through access to EAP, Yoga and Meditation sessions, Gym reimbursements, Paid Parental Leave etc.At Trend Micro, we embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe that our people are our greatest asset and we understand the importance of bringing diverse perspectives, approaches and experiences to our team. We are committed to building and supporting an inclusive workforce that truly reflects our global business and encourages people from all backgrounds to apply.

Name: Security Technician
Description: Due to growth nationally, we are seeking Security Technicians from all levels of experience.COVID has taught us to consider what is really important. Be valued, have purpose and make a difference to your countries security. With over twenty years of experience, Secom Technical Services, designs installs and maintains complete electronic and cybersecurity requirements for the Australian market.If you are alleged to our TECH Values we want to hear from you.Trustworthy: Delivering quality work reliably to completionEffective: Solid desire to consistently achieve the best possible outcomeCollaborative: True interest in working together to drive improved business outcomesHonesty: Always show ethical integrity through your work and behaviourEmployee BenefitsCompany Vehicle or Car allowance with Novated Lease OptionsTools of the trade providedPhone or sim, and LaptopPetrol CardCar ParkExternal training paid by the business; Project Management or Cyber Security DegreeSocial Team Building EventsFamily Fun DaysMentoring ProgramLeadership Program delivered by Sydney Swans Psychological CoachWhat’s it like working at Secom you ask??‘Our team is supported to do our best every day by our leader. He does this with his enthusiasm for his role, and his availability to talk about jobs, clients, or any questions/problems that we have. He ensures we have a great team culture!’ (Senior Security Technician, NSW)‘My supervisor instantly made me feel like I was working with a friend instead of just a boss. He goes above and beyond every day for his technicians and does anything he can to provide great support, ideas and comradery.’(Security Technician ACT)About you:High standard of ethics and you are aligned with our TECH ValuesQuality trade skills and you love tinkering with electronicsCurrent or ability to obtain a ACT/NSW Security LicenceCurrent or ability to obtain an Australian Government Security ClearanceCurrent drivers’ licenceCurrent or ability to obtain a cabling licenceCurrent Construction or ability to obtain a white cardCurrent or ability to obtain Asbestos Awareness cardStrong communication and stakeholder engagement skillsStrong attention to detail/situational awarenessObtains or ability to obtain an AGSVA ClearanceDesirable:Demonstrated Site Lead/ Electrical Forman experianceCert 3 or undergoing Cert 3 qualification in electrical, security or allied industries and/or trade based experienceAbility to program security systems such as GallagherAbility to perform basic ICT networking3 or more years experienceFault identification, isolation, repair, and reporting on systems installed and managedSound skills in electronic data and documentation managementVery effective report writing both technical and non-technicalStrong ability to perform cabling, fit off (including panels), and commissioning of electronic security systemsStrong ability to create engineering documentation including Cable Schedules and For Construction DrawingsIt's time for a change; join a global organisation that supports you like family.https://www.secomts.com  https://www.linkedin.com/company/secom-technical-services-pty-ltd/posts/?feedView=all&viewAsMember=true Please call our HR Manager, Lisa Sutton to have a confidential conversation ​02 5115 0635 or simply apply now.ACT Master Security Licence # 17501793

Name: Graduate Sales Support Role
Description: Our client has been making software buyers’ lives easier since 2000. Starting out as a pure play distributor, over the years they have evolved into a company with over 35 employees based in Sydney and Melbourne specialising in CyberSecurity and Systems Management solutions, and services to aid in the procurement of Enterprise Software.    Our client is now seeking a dynamic collaborative graduate to join their team, essential element is a genuine drive to learn quickly and the ability to be accurate and methodical.    About you:  Bachelor’s degree Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills Highly professional demeanour and attention to detail. Diligent and hungry to be successful  The Role:  Analyze and prepare renewal quotes Production of accurate renewals quotes including all relevant information required for the customer from the vendor Assisting others in the team as required to meet department deadlines High level of understanding of how the renewals process, including reinstatement, penalty and grace periods  Perks of the role:  Large company progression and growth opportunities Collaborative and supportive culture WFH Opportunities  If this sounds like you, apply now to join the team to advance your career and discover a future of opportunities.    For more information on ProForce and what we do, check out our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/proforceaustralia or visit our website: http://proforce.net.au/  *In order to be considered for this role you must have a completed university degree and full Australian working rights.

Name: Senior Lead Software Engineer
Description: Scala, JavaScript, HTMTL/CSS, SQL, Go, Python/Django, LinuxBankVault Cybersecurity is a technology innovator that is closing its Series A investment round to expand in the USA and Australia. We're looking for a senior lead software developer to become one of our anchors.The company has pioneered web security since 2015. We have more than twenty (20) innovations, six (6) Patents filed worldwide, five (5) products in market, and high-caliber shareholders including the Turing Laureate, Whitfield Diffie (Father of Internet Encryption).BankVault's product, MasterKey, is an intelligent new approach to Passwordless Authentication for Web Services. It is invisible and frictionless for users. The seamless experience achieves MFA in one step and is 10-100x faster to deploy than other solutions. The system, a new Decentralized Web Protocol, requires:   - No client software or user setup,    - No change management, and    - No backend system changes.If you'd like to join a Silicon Valley startup as it goes into orbit, please speak with us.Lightning Pitch/Demo (48-seconds)  https://lnkd.in/egPKjMpS

Name: Sales Account Executive
Description: Company DescriptionCyRise is Australia’s only venture accelerator that focuses on early stage cybersecurity startups. Based in Melbourne, CyRise offers cyber security founders a 3 month mentor driven program, $50,000 in investment and early access to foundational customers and investors. Our ability to help our founders go to market in Australia is without peer.CyRise is a partnership between Deakin University and NTT. We support the long-term growth of the Australian cybersecurity ecosystem by investing in and supporting cybersecurity founders.Since 2017 we have invested in 34 companies, with the teams in our portfolio now collectively worth close to $200 million. The CyRise brand is recognised throughout Australia for innovation, excellence, community focus and strong thought leadership around cyber security startups. We are a trusted partner to corporate Australia.About CyRise ElevateCyRise have launched a new product into the market called CyRise Elevate. CyRise Elevate is a peer to peer educational community for cyber security leaders in the Australian market. Starting with cloud first, high growth companies we have established our first set of customers and built the product around their needs.CyRise Elevate members meet each month in small groups to share knowledge, in order to get better, faster. On a regular basis throughout the year members come together as a bigger collective, including for events with some of the worlds best security leaders. We introduce them to the cyber security leaders from around the world to help them learn and expand their networks.Job Description:We are seeking a sales professional with experience selling B2B services to find, qualify, engage and sell potential customers who can benefit from CyRise Elevate. You will be selling the benefits of the community, and you should have a hunger for achieving goals that you set for yourself.As the first line of communication with prospects, you have a strong understanding of the sales process, excelling at researching leads, starting new relationships and closing the sale.. You should be a quick learner with strong communication skills, and have the ability to showcase our offerings in a compelling way.The job description is below but you shouldn’t take it too literally. If you think you can do 50% of what the role requires then you should apply. Don’t wait for perfection.You will:Utilise LinkedIn, PipeDrive, social media, events and our existing partnerships to identify and close new sales opportunities.Proactively seek new business opportunities in the marketGenerate leads and build relationships by nurturing warm prospects and finding new potential sales outletsManage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage with them for next stepsTake meetings or calls with prospective customers and close the sale if they are a good fit for the programReport to manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results - your success will be measured on finding and closing the right customers who sign onto CyRise ElevateIdentify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation playbookBe a trusted advisor to the security community through your ability to build strong relationshipsYou have:Experience in B2B salesAn interest in building relationships that generate value over timeA focus on being action oriented and a problem solverAn ability to work independently within a small team with a startup mindsetHigh standards of execution and a lifelong learnerExcellent written skillsA reputation as a digital nativeAn interest in startups and / or cybersecurity would be desirable.How we’d like to work with youWe are offering this as a full time role.We’d love you to be based in Melbourne so you could join us in our CBD co-working space but it’s not essential — we have learnt to work remotely during the pandemic, so remote is fine with us.You will be a key member of a small team, which is dedicated to delivering a high-quality experience for our startups and the wider cybersecurity startup community.We believe strongly in our cultural values, and call ourselves out if we fail to live up to them.Raise your standardsGive-before-you-getRadical transparencySeek truthTo applySend in a cover letter and a CV.

Name: Graduate Accountant
Description: About Trend MicroTrend Micro, a global cybersecurity leader, helps make the world safe for exchanging digital information. Fuelled by decades of security expertise, global threat research, and continuous innovation, Trend Micro's cybersecurity platform protects hundreds of thousands of organisations and millions of individuals across clouds, networks, devices, and endpoints. As a leader in cloud and enterprise cybersecurity, the platform delivers a powerful range of advanced threat defence techniques optimised for environments like AWS, Microsoft, and Google, and central visibility for better, faster detection and response. With 7,000 employees across 65 countries, Trend Micro enables organisations to simplify and secure their connected world.Position OverviewExcellent learning opportunity for Accounting Graduate to take their first step in the Commercial world. This Graduate Accountant position is accountable for prompt and accurate Accounts Payable and Accounts Receivable processing as well as supporting Accounting Manager with day to day operations of accounting and administration functions. As the role develops, the Graduate Accountant will be more involved in month-end reporting, preparing key stakeholders reports with the opportunity to participate in various projects as they arise.The successful candidate will join a friendly & experienced team and will be provided with a challenging and rewarding career path with support, mentoring, and training.Primary ResponsibilitiesProcessing employee reimbursements in accordance to Company policy and preparation of payment report for fortnightly payment cycleCorporate Credit Card reconciliation and settlement Processing of payables and vendor management AR collection Banking, filing, and daily bank reconciliation  AP & AR Aging Report preparation and analysis Daily sales invoice and credit memo delivery to customers Fixed Asset Maintenance and depreciation Preparation of regular expense trackersAssist with internal and external audit process as required Backup other Accounting tasks in absence of team membersSkills and ExperienceIdeally Accounting or Actuary degree qualified, you will be looking to expand your skills furtherWorking knowledge of Microsoft Business Central is an advantageCommitted, eager, and strong ability to learn Strong attention to detail with excellent time management skillsAbility to meet deadlines and use your initiative to perform delegated tasks Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word, email and internetBenefits of being a Trender!At Trend Micro, our people and culture are our power. There are no barriers – you are empowered to discover your passion and be the best part of yourself.We encourage you to challenge the status quo, break assumptions, and learn and grow every step of your career, fulfilling your potential.Helping customers succeed is our top priority. We believe in doing the right thing, solving the right problems, and maintaining business sustainability. And our efforts to make a difference go beyond the digital world.Trenders have the opportunity to be good global citizens by building houses in the Philippines, donating money to help underprivileged communities, educating kids and parents on online safety, advancing a diverse workforce (Close the Gap™ program), and more.We take employee wellbeing seriously. At Trend, you will have access to Medical Insurance, Mental Health Support through access to EAP, Yoga and Meditation sessions, Gym reimbursements, Paid Parental Leave etc.At Trend Micro, we embrace diversity, equity and inclusion. We believe that our people are our greatest asset and we understand the importance of bringing diverse perspectives, approaches and experiences to our team. We are committed to building and supporting an inclusive workforce that truly reflects our global business and encourages people from all backgrounds to apply.

Name: Service Solutions Specialist
Description: At Honeywell, we make a lot of incredible things. But most importantly, we make the future, and are looking for people to join our team global team of future shapers. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our performance culture comprised of diverse leaders, thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who are changing the future. Our people are committed to each other and to the realisation of our vision through their unique job functions. Our businesses embrace the challenges of innovation so that we define the future. And our global opportunities are endless for you to grow and get recognised for your passion to perform. About the Role​We have a fantastic opportunity for a Service Solutions Specialist for our Honeywell Building Technologies/Solutions team in Perth, WA. We are looking for candidates having experience in Building management systems and HVAC domain.As the Service Solutions Specialist, you will be responsible for the design, engineering, configuration, implementation, commissioning and ongoing support/maintenance and upgrades of all Operational Technology (OT), Enterprise Applications and Connected Services delivered into the service Line of Business (LOB). This will also include ensuring to adhere to the centralisation and standardisation of OT, ICT and Cybersecurity implementation and services to promote, deliver and maintain more connected, operational critical solutions to our customers, ensuring alignment and consistency with global standards and guidelines.The role will be required to drive alignment and standardisation of the installation, upgrades and support maintenance of the OT, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services that regularly form part of Honeywell’s solutions to ensure we can execute effectively for our customers, reduce our risk, cycle times, variation, and cost to deliver/service. This will also include working with peers to identify areas where we can streamline delivery by utilising digital deployment tools and centralised deployment standards.The Service Solutions Specialist team will also be responsible for working in collaboration with the Regional and Pole ICT Engineering teams to ensure correct implementation of ICT and Cybersecurity products and services in line with the HBS Buildings global ICT and cybersecurity offering portfolio.​Key Responsibilities:Contribute to the design, engineering, configuration, implementation, commissioning, support/maintenance and upgrades of Honeywell’s OT, Connected Services and Enterprise Software Applications (EBI, DVM, EM, OBS, Forge, Pulse, Vector etc.) in the service LOB.Possess a strong understanding of ICT and Cybersecurity principles and design and how these systems and services work in tandem with Honeywell’s OT, Connected Services and Enterprise Software Applications.Posses a strong understanding and knowledge of all industry standards and protocols (BACnet, Modbus, OPC, SNMP, APIs etc) and how these protocols are used to ingest and share data from Honeywell and 3rd party technologies/applications with Honeywell’s OT/ Enterprise Applications and Connected Services.Take ownership of site issues and work in collaboration with TAC to ensure any issues with OT, Enterprise Applications or Connected Services are identified and rectified promptly.Work with customers to understand their requirements to ensure proposed solution meets their needs and requirements, providing alternatives if needed/required.Sales Assistance/Design, involving innovative use of latest technology in establishing system design, and providing project estimatesPrepare submittals per engineering standards, ensuring commitment dates are met. Review submittals with sales and delivery teams and lead team to obtain submittal approvalDevelop detailed system designs/architectures, implementation procedures and documentation required for the successful delivery of the implementation/upgrades of all OT, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services.Provide technical direction, training and support to local field service specialists for operation, maintenance and troubleshooting of all OT, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services. Key Experience & Capabilities:Minimum 2 Years’ Experience in a design, implementation, maintenance, Enterprise Applications and Connected Services role.Bachelor’s degree in Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics Engineering (desired)Previous experience with Buildings Management systems is mandatory and if Honeywell will be an advantagePrevious experience in HVAC, energy management systems, energy efficiencies, Modbus & BACnetIntermediate skills in field troubleshootingAbility to work collaboratively both in person, and remotelyExperience with cloud platforms will be beneficialHaving software related works experience with SCADA (Supervisory control and data acquisition) will be an advantageThe role provides an excellent opportunity for you, as an engineer, to be at the forefront of transformation and enjoy working in a fast paced, changing and evolving environment while also contributing and helping to Honeywell growing OT, Enterprise Application and Connected Service product portfolio and capabilities. About UsThe world is changing. And it’s a familiar story at Honeywell. Our $36 billion business was founded on a legacy of firsts spanning 130 years. We’re building a safer, smarter, and more sustainable world through our technology and software across each of our 930 sites globally. Our impact is seen in every shape and size around the world. Our solutions are felt daily in aerospace, buildings and cities, retail, chemicals and materials, safety, industrial and manufacturing, safety, and supply chains.Discover MoreWe’ve been innovating for more than 100 years and now we’re creating what’s next. There’s a lot more available for you to discover. Our solutions, our case studies, our #futureshapers, and so much more. Learn more at careers.honeywell.com/us/en/If you believe what happens tomorrow is determined by what we do today, you’ll love working at Honeywell.The future is what we make it. So join us and let’s do this together.

Name: Senior Engineer - CCTV and Security
Description:
About the role 
Ensure that the design conforms to all safety, environmental, construction, commissioning, and operating requirements;
Implement cybersecurity technologies that meet the ICS cybersecurity standards/guidelines to address different risk scenarios.
Perform safety and/or hazard analyses, security analyses, and regulatory compliance assessments by identifying key issues and risks to comply with applicable standards, policies, and regulations.
Implement cybersecurity technologies that meet the ICS cybersecurity standards/guidelines to address different risk scenarios.
Work with ICS engineers to measure impact on performance to determine acceptable performance requirement and testing parameters which include network and operational performance impacts

About you 
Tertiary degree qualification to Bachelor status in Engineering (or equivalent industry experience in the absence of a degree);
Experience with analogue and IP type CCTV cameras, CCTV Digital Video Management Systems, video analytics and associated components10 years+ experience in the industry (in technology or related market verticals);
Must have an Australian Drivers Licence
Strong communication skills (oral & written) including strong negotiation and influencing skills and the ability to establish effective working relationships with a variety of people at different levels both internally and externally.
Demonstrated ability to work independently to organise and prioritise demands, handle multiple complex tasks simultaneously, set and meet deadlines and follow-through within a fast paced environment with multiple and competing demands;

What we offer
Diverse opportunities to grow, back yourself and achieve
Flexible working arrangements
Ongoing training for career progression 
A competitive remuneration package with salary continuance insurance, employee assistance program for employees and their families, AIA Vitality wellness program and Discounts on private health insurance, vehicles, travel and more

What makes you right for UGL  
Ability to provide a safe, supportive and positive workplace
Empower a united and collaborative culture
Deliver technical excellence and create efficient, innovative solutions
Build an enviable reputation and the trust of employees, clients and other stakeholders
Genuine concern for safety

About Us
UGL is a well-known and respected for providing end-to-end engineering, construction and maintenance services within; rail and transport, communications and technology systems, oil and gas, power, renewables and resources, water and defence markets. UGL partners with some of the world’s largest blue-chip companies and government agencies, private enterprises and public institutions. We are a member of the CIMIC Group of companies
At UGL, we value diversity – in the backgrounds, ideas, work styles and perspectives of our team. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strongly encourage people with disability, Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander people, mature aged workers and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply.
Please note that relevant screening checks will be conducted as part of the recruitment process. These may include a national criminal history check and for you to undergo pre-employment medical assessment including drug and alcohol screen.
Ref: 246544
#Work180

Name: Administration Assistant
Description: FraudWatch is a global leader in online brand protection and takes down thousands of Phishing & Malware sites, fake Domains, Social Media Profiles and fake Mobile Apps for clients across the world.About the role:We are seeking a dynamic and motivated Administration Assistant to join our friendly and supportive team. In this role you will provide administrative support and assistance, ensure the smooth running of the office and assist the Executive Assistant and Management Team where required. This includes:Handling incoming phone calls and directing queries to the appropriate internal team/member.Help to organise and prepare for meetings; compose and distribute meeting minutes.Act as the first point of contact for all building and office maintenance matters, which includes liaising with the building manager, contractors etc.Coordination of staff events and functions, including team building activities.Coordinate travel arrangements. Provide back-up support to the Executive Assistant and general administration assistance to the CEO.Support the People and Culture Manager to onboard new team members.General administrative tasks such as stationery ordering, mail, filing duties etc.This role is a permanent position, ideally 5 days per week and flexible hours may be negotiated with the successful candidate. The position involves working onsite and therefore requires adherence to current COVID-19 vaccination requirements. To be successful you will have:A willingness and capacity to embrace the Company Values – Integrity, Collaboration, Excellence and Transparency.Demonstrated administrative experience coupled with good computer skills and literacy – Microsoft Office 365 suit including Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint. Good organisational and time management skills.Demonstrated ability to provide professional customer service.Well-developed verbal, written and interpersonal skills.An ability to multi-task. What’s on offer:Commence with FraudWatch immediately! At FraudWatch we value employee wellbeing and offer a range of benefits including additional paid personal and holiday leave as well as a comprehensive Employee Assistance Program.We provide free onsite parking, and have a great coffee machine, pool table, table tennis and arcade games! If you’re looking for an opportunity with a growing industry leader in cybersecurity and feel you can contribute to the team based on experience and/or passion, submit your cover letter and resume now and a member of FraudWatch may be in touch to discuss this role with you further.For more information about FraudWatch International check us out at: https://www.fraudwatch.com ----------------------------A National Police Check will be performed prior to commencement of employment.Recruiters, thanks but we have this role covered!

Name: Senior Security & Network Engineer
Description: About the RoleAs Senior Security & Network Engineer you will be required to work in support and project delivery, but your primary role will be delivering security and networking projects to our clients. Naturally you will be able to work in a team with other engineers, but can also take the lead on projects, working autonomously to deliver required outcomes. Our clients are many and varied, which may mean travelling to client sites at times, so a valid driver's licence and personal car will be required. You will have sound technical knowledge and delivery experience, ensuring high quality service delivery backed by great customer service mannerisms and excellent documentation skills. Time management and a willingness to interact with the client are critical to your success in the role. ResponsibilitiesSecurity and networking design and implementationResponsible for running projects as an individual and as part of a teamWriting and peer reviewing ‘as built’ technical documentationEscalation point for security and networking customer issuesProviding leadership and guidance to junior engineersDevelopment of technical tasks and associated work estimates for input into customer proposals as required Technical Skills and ExperienceCurrent Cisco Security and/or Fortinet Certification (CCNP or CCIE, NSE 4, 5 or 7 level)Current Cisco Routing and Switching Certification (CCNP or CCIE desirable)Data Centre experience desirableNetwork/Systems integration experience Practical and autonomous project delivery skills7+ years hands on experience delivering projects5+ years design and implementation experience Relevant tertiary qualifications or equivalent experienceDemonstrated experience as a subject matter expert in security including network firewalls, Authentication, Authorisation, and Accounting (AAA) systems, IPS, web filtering and malware protectionExperience in consulting and as a project lead for your discipline (desirable)Well-developed routing/switching and security skills and a familiarity with a majority of the following platforms: Cisco ISECisco DNAC (Highly desirable but not essential)Cisco FirepowerFortinet Product Suite, including FortiManager and FortiAnalyser What will make you a good fit?Desire to learn and gain additional experience and certificationsCapable of creating and maintaining high-quality documentationStrong outcomes focus – client and companyStrong sense of accountability for your performance and actionsTeam player and ability to work autonomouslyAbility to adapt to changing situationsStrong troubleshooting skills with a passion for technology and cybersecurityWell-developed interpersonal, communication and presentation skillsAbility to communicate effectively at all levels as a subject matter expert to stakeholders About ArchiTechArchiTech Network & Communications Solutions is a fast-growing Australian owned and operated ICT solutions integrator, specialising in enterprise networking, wireless, cybersecurity, collaboration, data centre and IoT technologies. With a focus on providing exceptional value and outcomes for our clients, we use our experience and industry expertise, to map leading world class technologies to organisational needs, and deliver custom solutions to suit. We have designed and delivered integrated solutions to some of the largest healthcare providers in Australia. Our approach to client engagement is what makes us stand out from the crowd - working closely with our clients to truly understand their business requirements, resulting in better delivery of outcomes and greater satisfaction to all. www.architech.net.au Why work at ArchiTech?We believe that when staff enjoy what they do, it drives them to work at their best. To us our people are not just workers, they are part of the fabric that makes ArchiTech a great place to work.An attractive remuneration package with flexible working optionsOpportunity to get involved in a variety of interesting, challenging and rewarding ICT projectsCareer development through training, mentoring, new product learnings and cross industry exposure Diverse and inclusive workplace with a supportive culture, where you can have fun and be yourself!How to applyTo start an application, click on ‘apply’ and submit the following:an up-to-date resume detailing your relevant experience for the rolea cover letter (max 1 page) specifically addressing the above criteria and your suitability to the role advertisedArchiTech reserve the right to close off this position early as applications will be considered upon receipt.  Please note:Only shortlisted candidates will be contactedYou must have the right to work permanently in AustraliaAn offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Clearance and Working with Children Check being provided to ArchiTechIn line with Government directions that apply to our client base, ArchiTech will require a copy of your Covid-19 Vaccination CertificateYou must have a valid Australian driver’s license and use of a personal vehicle to perform this roleFor any enquiries, please contact careers@architech.net.au

Name: Industrial Control System Engineer
Description: Who we are….At SUEZ we are passionate about environmental services and our ability to impact the world we live in.For almost 160 years, SUEZ has supported local communities and industrial companies in the management of essential services such as water, waste, and air quality. As such, SUEZ produces drinking water for 66 million people worldwide, recovers 2 million tons of secondary raw materials per year, and generates 3.1 TWh of renewable energy from waste. In our ongoing management of the ecological transition and climate change challenges, SUEZ will rely on the expertise and commitment of its 35,000 employees (particularly in France, Italy, Central Europe, Africa, Asia, and Australia) to offer high value-added and customized environmental solutions to all its customers. SUEZ’s expertise allows, for instance, its customers to avoid the emission of 4.2 million tons of CO2, thus improving their carbon footprint and their impact on climate. What will you do?In this role you will ensure the efficient operation and security of the company’s industrial information systems used on the treatment plants, including SCADA, PLC, and Plant Data historians. The position will focus on developing and embedding an Industrial Control Systems governance framework.In close coordination with our corporate IT team, as an ICS cyber-security operations counterpart, you will assist with the development of cyber-security best practices, and ongoing support.The position will also be responsible for preparing annual budget estimates and monitoring expenses against budgets on a monthly basis. You will liaise with client auditors and supervise all contractors working on Industrial IT systems of our treatment plants. The position will require you to develop and train plant staff as required. Your primary duties will includeIndustrial Control SystemsPlan the development, improvement, maintenance and operating priorities of ICS systems, in collaboration with each sites;Cultivate standards and provide technical assistance and information to users;Develop standards and documentation, ensuring all IT systems are running properly;Install software and hardware, provide a regular review of agreements in place with industrial IT suppliers and contractorsCybersecurityDevelop and lead the implementation of ICS Cybersecurity Governance frameworks.Operate, maintain, and identify enhancements to the adaptive ICS security environment and associated controls.Report on performance and audit security sites practices, and identify opportunities for improvement Client Relations Ensure good Client relationships are maintained when interacting with Client representatives and the Client’s Operations and Maintenance representatives. What you can bring to the teamFirstly you will share a strong passion for the environment and be excited by the opportunity to make an impact on the world we live in. You will have a solid background in automation and/or industrial processes and Corporate IT Management.You will have experience in SCADA and PLC systems.You will possess commitment to innovation and drive for excellence.Want to know more?You can learn more about what it's like to work at SUEZ by visiting our website and YouTube channel.If you are passionate about our values and excited by what you have read, then we want to hear from you. Apply now!

Name: Senior Systems Engineer
Description: The Role:  Our client is a large Education organisation on the lookout for a Senior Systems/Cloud Engineer working with Azure. $130k - $145k + Super NFP Salary Packaging of up to $15,900 a year Sydney Based - Hybrid Working  You will be responsible for maintaining both on-premise computer server hardware/software and cloud-based workloads and providing operational management.This role is responsible for providing effective and efficient technical support to the enterprise, maintaining ICT systems, applications and systems.Your Responsibilities:  Administer and support IT systems solutions (on-premises or cloud-based) to meet service delivery requirements. Professionally and efficiently respond to ICT incidents and service requests via the ICT service management tool. Develop and maintain the ICT on-premises and cloud services operational support policies, processes and procedures. Project managing ICT systems, infrastructures and business solutions, ensuring they are supported and delivered within the agreed time, scope and budget. Actively pursue possibilities to enhance cybersecurity processes and procedures and develop business cases to present new solutions to management. Regularly audit, review and update all systems design and operation documentation.  About You:  Proven extensive hands-on experience in building and supporting enterprise on-premises or cloud-based ICT systems. Proven extensive hands-on experience in development and the operational management of the following programming languages: Powershell (Essential) Python (Desirable) JSON (Desirable) Proven extensive experience in performing server administration and operations. Practical knowledge and experience in automating solutions and migrations using code scripting. Windows Server 2012/2016

Name: Practice Lead Security - SaaS Product
Description: Full time, permanent and contract opportunities availableGreat company culture where customers come firstFlexible, hybrid working arrangementsAbout us:Genie Solutions is a high-growth technology company and a trusted name in Practice Management Software for Medical Specialists around Australia. At Genie Solutions we embrace diversity and equal opportunity in a serious way. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.We pride ourselves on making Genie Solutions a great place to work and offer flexible hybrid working hours, an in house wellbeing coach, reward and recognition programs…and much more!About this Opportunity:This is a fantastic opportunity to be the subject matter expert in security related design and operations of our products and services. Using your skills and experience in secure software development and general Cybersecurity, you will lead and champion security and maintain a proactive, security first culture. Key ResponsibilitiesMentor, advise, and train Product Delivery Group teams on security best practices in a cloud-based SaaS environment.Create and rollout an application threat modelling approach usable by agile delivery teams as part of product design through to delivery.Working with DSO, IT, and the group CISO, provide guidance and training on secure data management and security best practices in a Genie Solutions context.Drive the deep embedment of automated security testing into all aspects of the SDLC including CI/CD pipelines for our products to maintain a secure supply chain.Support our ISO27001 compliance and ISMS operations. Skills & ExperienceThe ideal candidate will have skills in and knowledge of security control frameworks, various toolings for security and dependency scanning in CI/CD pipelines and knowledge of AWS Security and Governance services.You will be very familiar with the industry standards and guidelines regarding secure web application development such as OWASP, AWS Well Architected Security Pillar as well as the ability to communicate security related priorities with product development activities.If you're keen to develop your expertise within the health tech industry, send through your resume!

Name: Solution Technologist Architect
Description: The Company: My client is a world-leading investment bank specializing in wealth management, global fixed income, and commodities trading, located in Sydney, New York, London, and Hong Kong    Role My client is looking for a Solution Architect that has a strong technology background and is able to influence stakeholders on technical decisions. You will be responsible for working on a large transformation program including risk and data platform migration into AWS, strong stakeholder and vendor management skills are essential    Responsibilities:   You will be responsible for coming up with and driving strategy within the architecture team for Capital Markets Provide technical input and ensure adherence to company security and best practices Engage with various stakeholders within the business to ensure they line up their architecture direction with our strategy  Working closely with the business and the engineering team  Experience in the following:  Strong data platforms and tools experience Concepts of cybersecurity or architecture Knowledge of network topology and associated technologies Experience working on end-to-end solution applications Engineering background Background working with AWS, API Gateway Platforms, Data Hub, and Database Platforms Able to work in a fast-paced and agile environment Excellent communication skills are essential     What’s in it for you: Work for a highly reputed, successful, global bank located in one of the most prestigious buildings in Sydney CBD. Extremely good opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment where you will be facing off the business   If this role has caught your attention and sounds like something you would like to explore further, please reach out to me: Becca on 0404 144 565 or email me at becca@clarrow.com.au.

Name: Pre-Sales Engineer
Description: The Business    Our client is a well-established Technology Solutions Provider that have an enviable track record of support and delivery for over 30 years. With excellent vendor relationships across infrastructure and cloud technologies, they combine their strong technical skills and customer focussed solutions to provide a successful outcome to their clients.  Key Responsibilities    Working closely with the Business Development Managers, you will play a vital role in the sales team to scope, design and present technical solutions to new and existing corporate clients.    Duties and responsibilities will include.  Architecting and designing business technology solutions across corporate technologies including cybersecurity, wireless and related stacks Defining customer requirements to facilitate the design of appropriate solutions Building relationships with customers, defining their existing technology environments, and providing reviews and recommendations Work with BDM and delivery teams in the implementation of solutions Assist in the development and design of new tech offerings  About You    In order to be successful in this role, you will need:  A strong generalist technology focus with cybersecurity and design within your skill set, ideally having exposure to Palo Alto, HPE Aruba, Fortinet or Sentinel One amongst others The aptitude to develop the security and generalist technology solutions Work with the Sales and Marketing Director in assessing new vendor solutions Travel interstate to attend conferences and assist customers as required Proven technology professional with a strong bent for engineering and design Excellent presentation and communication skills Experience responding to tenders Ability to collaborate with internal technical teams Experience managing relationships  What’s on Offer    Being part of a well-established business, your contribution will be highly visible and measurable from day one. This company is looking for highly motivated, highly technical professionals to grow with them.      Curtis Partnership specialises in Sales, Marketing & Operations, Finance & Accounting, Technology and Property recruitment.

Name: Network Engineer
Description: Rapiscan Systems is an industry leader in detection technology, providing cargo and vehicle inspection systems and services for ports, borders, military, high-threat facilities, and checkpoints to help customers combat terrorism, drug smuggling, illegal immigration, and trade fraud.  We offer a broad array of scanning system configurations that leverage low-, medium-, and high-energy X-ray technology – or multiple X-ray technologies – to address each customer’s unique security application requirements.  Our commitment to excellence in imaging performance, innovative design, and uncompromising quality ensures our solutions consistently deliver best-in-class imaging, high reliability, and operator satisfaction, to help customers find threats and contraband with ease and confidence.ResponsibilitiesDesign, prototype and verify thru testing solutions used to interface Rapiscan’s X-Ray machines to other equipment, belonging to Rapiscan, customer or third party. These interfaces are generally Ethernet network based (1 and / or 10Gbe) and include servers (hardware and operating systems), computers, network switches / routers and possibly third party fault-tolerant software platforms. Provide solutions to specific customer’s requirements based on their available infrastructure.Release design after preparing design and build documentation (BOMs, network diagrams etc.).Support service to diagnose problems at customer site. Travel to site if required (Up to 20%, domestic and international).Support End of Life qualification activities for hardware, operating systems and network components.Uphold the Company’s core values of Integrity, Innovation, Accountability, and Teamwork.Demonstrate behavior consistent with the Company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct. It is the responsibility of every Rapiscan Systems employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem.Duties may be modified or assigned at any time to meet the needs of the business.RequirementsApproximately 5+ years post graduate diploma experience within a relevant engineering field Configuring Industrial network devices (media converters, Ethernet switches, routers, firewalls, wireless subscriber stations and customer premises equipment) ensuring network integration in multi-vendor environments Hands on experience delivering network integration projects including liaising with subsystem design teams and contributing disciplines to ensure seamless integration Design Verification and Validation activities High standard of oral and written communications CCNP qualifications or equivalent Cybersecurity knowledge / experience will be highly regarded Proactive and energetic problem solver Willingness to travel on adhoc basis  OSI Systems, Inc. has three operating divisions: (a) Security, providing security and inspection systems, turnkey security screening solutions and related services; (b) Healthcare, providing patient monitoring, diagnostic cardiology and anesthesia systems; and (c) Optoelectronics and Manufacturing, providing specialized electronic components and electronic manufacturing services for original equipment manufacturers with applications in the defense, aerospace, medical and industrial markets, among others.

Name: Senior Security Architect - Digital
Description: About Us Woolworths IT is currently in an exciting period of transformation and growth. Among Australia's earliest adopters of the Google platform and agile methodologies, we are now investing in future-focused IT solutions for our stores and customers - and we need the best and brightest in technology to help us pave the way. The Cyber Security team provides security services and guidance to protect our team and customers from cyber threats, manage our risks and enable Woolworths to safely move at speed. About the RoleWe are seeking an experienced Senior Security Architect - Digital, to champion the early engagement of security in new, or significantly changing solutions, and work with Digital teams to identify and address security controls gaps in existing solutions. This role is part of the Group Cyber Security Team, and reports to the Head of Digital - Security, and Risk, delivering fit for purpose Cyber outcomes to the group Digital brands, including WooliesX. In this role, you will provide subject matter expertise and leadership with in-depth cybersecurity experience, across a range of technology platforms and Woolworths systems, to maximise security outcomes. You will be working closely with the Digital Agile development squads and Cyber Security teams, and lead the deployment of security services and security controls across all functional areas. You will deliver security outcomes in line with security standards and industry best practices and will empower Digital agile squads to uplift control maturity and reduce cyber security risk. This role is aligned with the Security Architecture and Strategy team and works closely with the Digital Product Owners across WooliesX, BigWx, CountdownX, and WPay, playing a pivotal role in defining and executing Woolworths' strategy for Digital security maturity over the coming years.Key responsibilities include   Develop a complete understanding of the Woolworths Digital Technology systems and application landscape and assess from a cybersecurity perspective Work with the Head of Digital - Security and Risk to develop strategies and plans to enforce security requirements, address identified risks and develop security awareness programs Provide technical security expertise and advice to the Woolworths Digital teams Align Cyber service capabilities to the Digital environment, and provide oversight of technical solutions based on Cyber Security requirements and adherence to the Cyber Security policy, standards and controls Assist with the selection and adoption of appropriate security controls to manage Digital cyber risk exposure  Provide input to cyber security architectural reviews for new and inflight Digital solutions, to ensure best practice DevOps and Cloud configuration cyber outcomes  About You To be considered for the role, you will have 8+ years of security experience with key responsibilities in architecture and design and 10+ years of varied overall IT security experience. You will have gained your experience within a large multinational and/or a consulting organisation known for its knowledge and experience in the world-class business. You will have strong communication and influencing skills, able to " read the room" and tailor your messages, with the ability to translate complex technical information into easily understood pieces for non-technical audiences. You will also have: Experience in processes improvement including automation, agile methodologies, and CI/CD Security related platform and application experience  Ability to do basic scripting, O/S, and database management Experience developing and producing metrics reports for various audiences. Experiences working with large vendors and external support partners Experience with common information security management frameworks Capability to manage deliverables within a matrixed organisational structure  Grow with the Group Woolworths Group has announced it will be requiring Australian team members to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (subject to medical and religious exemptions). As an inclusive, team-first company, our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued, respected, and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, disability, sexual orientation, or life stage. We are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTQ+ inclusion and as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency. As our Group continues to evolve, innovate and support our communities, we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers, by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all, and most importantly, we're all about creating better experiences - for our customers and for each other. We'd love to hear from You If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn [link removed] or via www.wowcareers.com.au [link removed]. #LI #work180. Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Woolworths Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Project Coordinator - ICT
Description: About us Transport for NSW keeps our State moving by providing safe, integrated and efficient transport systems. We put our customers at the centre of everything we do - and we do a lot. We connect people, communities and industry and manage how they use our road, rail and maritime networks and services, and even active modes like walking and cycling. The work we do connects the journeys you take every day. We are a state government organisation made up of more than 28,000 people and we're in the middle of delivering the largest transport infrastructure program in Australia's history. We work across planning, policy and procurement, harnessing data and technology to develop smarter and more adaptive transport solutions. That means job opportunities in metropolitan and regional areas right across NSW - you have the chance to be part of creating a lasting legacy that will benefit generations to come. About IT at TfNSW TfNSW's IT group provides the tools, information and services that enable 30,000 employees to deliver a smart and efficient transport network. We bring the future to our people by delivering innovative solutions and minimising business disruptions, building an engaged and connected workforce through tech-enablement. This is an exciting time to join the team, with a committed annual investment of $700m for progressive technology projects including bots, apps, AI solutions, autonomous 3D mapping drones, cybersecurity and transforming cameras across our network. The opportunity We are currently looking for an experienced Project Coordinator to join our IT Division. This is a fixed term contract position up to September 2023. Our home hub is based in Parramatta, but we come together into the office when it makes sense to.  Flexible working arrangements are encouraged. What you will be involved in:    Delivering small to medium sized projects or assisting the project manager of larger projects including with administrative tasks and being involved in the full project lifecycle. Various project management activities ranging from organising meetings, taking minutes, project reporting and following up on various project related tasks. You will coordinate projects in the IT portfolio to ensure they are implemented according to required project management processes. You will help to build strong relationships with the business driving advocacy into IT and back into the business.  Growth opportunities exist to deliver projects autonomously and take on Project Management responsibilities. For more information please click here to view a copy of the role description. About you Essential requirements to be considered for this role are:  Demonstrated experience in project managing and providing project support services Strong understanding and exposure to project coordination within a complex IT organisation Exposure to complex IT such as Security Systems, Data Analytics, Portfolio and Asset Management or similarly complex industries, with an appetite to learn new concept concepts Strong communication skills & proven ability to work on multiple tasks concurrently in a fast-paced environment. Ability to build relationships quickly with excellent stakeholder engagement & management. Self motivation, high energy and a passion to deliver customer focused outcomes. High integrity and willingness to champion the Business.  Salary and Benefits The salary for this position is Grade 7 ($106,086 to $118,816) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading. For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here. How to apply To apply for this position, please answer all questions within the online application process and submit your updated resume.  Applications Close: 11.59 PM Tuesday 28 June 2022 We are the community we serveWe are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.For any enquiries, please email Karen Rayner at KAREN.RAYNER@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU. Apply today to register your interest!Take a look at our application tips video series for lots of great information on navigating and acing the application and recruitment process here at Transport.Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.
