Name: Cyber Security
Description: Permanent / Full-Time roleImmediate startSouth Yarra location Company Profile:Our client is a leading managed services cyber security business, focused on delivering advanced proactive cyber security services. Part of the key deliverables from the SOC are to manage, detect & respond to cyber risks and threats and proactive ongoing management and support. Our client works with the most advanced cyber security solutions available on the market. The Role:Our client is looking for a Cyber Security Analyst to work with their team in Melbourne. The ideal candidate will have worked in a security role for at least one year, investigating anomalies and managing security events and incidents. Key Responsibilities:Carry out hunting activities, investigate anomalies, security events and incident investigationsPrevious experience with 2FA / MFA  Proactively identify, prevent and respond to security events and incidentsOn boarding and deploying of cyber security solutions to new and existing clients Professional communication and documentation of processes and procedures.Ongoing investment and training will be paid as part of this role       Prior experience in a similar role is highly advantages Desired Skills and Experience:12 months experience as a security analyst or working in a cyber security operations centreExperience in conducting cybersecurity monitoring, analysis and investigation on enterprise IT infrastructure,Experience with deploying and maintaining Cisco DUO Experience with endpoint security products Understanding service metrics and SLAsStrong work ethic and attention to detail Driven and passionate about IT Security Highly desirable having a bachelor’s degree in cyber security or related fields Highly desirable having industry certifications

Name: Collaboration Solution Architect
Description: About the RoleAs a Collaboration Solution Architect you will work directly with clients and vendors to develop, scope and present detailed solutions that modernise and enhance their unified communications and collaboration capabilities. Your hands on experience and eye for detail will enable you to navigate recent technological shifts in collaboration to leverage integration opportunities and produce quality solutions for mission critical use cases. ResponsibilitiesWork directly with clients to design robust solutions that meet their business outcomesProvide pre-sales technical design, and subject matter expertiseCollaborate with the delivery team to ensure detailed handover of designs and solutionsAssist the sales team in the preparation of tender response creation and submission including design and costing of solutions with vendorsProduce quality design documentation that is concise, readable, and maintainable by the teamIdentify new business opportunities products, services, and markets for continued company growth Technical Skills and ExperienceCurrent CCNP Collaboration and/or CCIE CollaborationDemonstrated experience as a subject matter expert in Cisco collaboration technologiesMinimum 2+ years experience as a solution architectMinimum 3+ years in the collaboration industry (support, design, implementation)Proven collaboration skills and a familiarity with a majority of the following platforms:Cisco Unified Communications Manager, Cisco Unity, Cisco Webex, Webex Calling, Webex Contact Center, Cisco Expressway, Cisco Voice Gateways.Cisco Webex endpointsCisco IP phonesSpectralink Versity, Spectralink SAM, Spectralink AMIE (desirable but not essential)Microsoft Teams (desirable but not essential)Strong foundational networking skills (highly desirable) What will make you a good fit?Desire to learn and gain additional experience and certificationsCapable of creating and maintaining high-quality documentationStrong outcomes focus – client and companyStrong sense of accountability for your performance and actionsTeam player and ability to work autonomouslyAbility to adapt to changing situationsStrong troubleshooting skills with a passion for technology, unified communications and collaborationWell-developed interpersonal, communication and presentation skillsAbility to communicate effectively at all levels as a subject matter expert to stakeholders About ArchiTechArchiTech Network & Communications Solutions is a fast-growing Australian owned and operated ICT solutions integrator, specialising in enterprise networking, wireless, cybersecurity, collaboration, data centre and IoT technologies. With a focus on providing exceptional value and outcomes for our clients, we use our experience and industry expertise, to map leading world class technologies to organisational needs, and deliver custom solutions to suit. We have designed and delivered integrated solutions to some of the largest healthcare providers in Australia. Our approach to client engagement is what makes us stand out from the crowd - working closely with our clients to truly understand their business requirements, resulting in better delivery of outcomes and greater satisfaction to all. www.architech.net.au Why work at ArchiTech?We believe that when staff enjoy what they do, it drives them to work at their best. To us our people are not just workers, they are part of the fabric that makes ArchiTech a great place to work.An attractive remuneration package with flexible working optionsOpportunity to get involved in a variety of interesting, challenging and rewarding ICT projectsCareer development through training, mentoring, new product learnings and cross industry exposure Diverse and inclusive workplace with a supportive culture, where you can have fun and be yourself!How to applyTo start an application, click on ‘apply’ and submit the following:an up-to-date resume detailing your relevant experience for the rolea cover letter (max 1 page) specifically addressing the above criteria and your suitability to the role advertisedArchiTech reserve the right to close off this position early as applications will be considered upon receipt.  Please note:Only shortlisted candidates will be contactedYou must have the right to work permanently in AustraliaAn offer of employment will be subject to a satisfactory National Police Clearance and Working with Children Check being provided to ArchiTechIn line with Government directions that apply to our client base, ArchiTech will require a copy of your Covid-19 Vaccination CertificateYou must have a valid Australian driver’s license and use of a personal vehicle to perform this roleFor any enquiries, please contact careers@architech.net.au

Name: DevOps Engineer
Description: About Us Phriendly Phishing trains, nurtures and helps organisations create long lasting employee behavioural change. We’re an Australian-based company which provides security awareness and phishing simulation training solutions as we teach employees how to identify and respond to common, costly and difficult to detect security threats. Our training programs are measurable, scalable and can be used by anyone in your organisation regardless of technical expertise. We’ve joined forces with CyberCX, a leading independent cyber security services organisation in Australia and New Zealand. CyberCX has united the country’s most trusted cyber security companies (like Phriendly Phishing) to deliver the most comprehensive end to end cyber security services offering to Australian enterprises and governments. We’re a unified team of highly qualified, certified and skilled professionals working together on the same mission: to protect and defend Australian organisations from cyber threats. The Team The product team is a deeply ambitious and highly motivated cross functional team that works in a fast-paced agile environment to deliver exceptional outcomes for our customers. Our team partners closely with the business to help design and develop technologies that dramatically improve people’s cyber awareness. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analysing, positioning, packaging, promoting, and tailoring our solutions to our users. The Role Our ideal candidate is an individual who is looking to create and own this function. You will be coming into a new team and you’ll take accountability for deploying product updates, identifying production issues, and implementing integrations that meet our customers' needs and deliver exceptional outcomes that drive the success of the Phriendly Phishing product in market. You’ll take ownership of developing software to integrate with internal back-end systems and designing procedures for system troubleshooting and maintenance. You will build and set up new tools and infrastructure as well test and examine code written by others and analyse results coupled with ensuring that systems are safe and secure against cybersecurity threats. Additionally, you’ll also work across the following:  Provide level 2 technical support, investigate, and resolve technical issues, and perform root cause analysis for production errors Understand the needs of stakeholders and work collaboratively with the development team to resolved issues Work on way to automate and improve development and release processes Identify technical problems and develop software updates and ‘fixes’ Work with software engineers to ensure that development follows established processes and works as intended Plan out projects and being involved in project management decisions  About you  You have a degree in computer science/ engineering, IT, or relevant field and a few years’ experience in a DevOps Engineer role. You also possess the following:  AWS Certified DevOps Engineer Azure DevOps Engineering Expert Certification Strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills Strong attention to detail and high quality of work Experience working with outsourced development teams Skilled in responding to setbacks in an agile and resilient manner Able to simplify complex ideas and communicate them with clear, logical thinking Strong attention to detail and high quality of work Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and the ability to build sustainable, scalable solutions and processes to meet complex operational problems  What's in it for you?   Attractive salary and employee benefits package (plus perks) with a once-in-a-career growth opportunities – a unique chance to be part of a high-growth business and take full ownership of your role. Work with cyber security thought leaders to deliver world-class services in a dynamic, independent environment where you’re given flexibility to do your best work.

Name: Junior/Graduate System Administrator
Description: Are you a recent IT graduate, still studying or just tech savvy ready to start your career in IT? Then this could be the role for you!Connect ‘n’ Grow is a Registered Training Organisation delivering high-quality health and human services training services to adults and within schools across Queensland, South Australia and Northern Territory.Our MissionWe are building a job ready health and human services workforce that provides care to all.The RoleConnect 'n' Grow is seeking a Junior System Administrator/IT Support role to join our team to provide general IT support and training to our team of 40 based in various locations. You will provide support with the use of our Student & Learning Management Systems (Canvas & JobReady+), Google workspace, Microsoft & Zoom. You will work independently, learning and growing with the business becoming familiar with our people, processes and systems. Duties may include; General remote IT Support (setting up hardware, creating new accounts, password resets)Working with system vendors and becoming a subject matter expert in our system to help train othersProblem solving issues Maintain asset/software registers Assisting with some general administration/date entry duties Reporting/Data managementCyber SecurityWebsite updatesOther technology projects as required About YouPassionate about technology and how it can support our business and create efficienciesPatient with less ‘tech savvy’ people Self-starter willing to learn and problem solve things on your ownLooking for a role where you can develop and growDesirable or willing to self-learn:  Experience using Learning Management Systems Experience with Google Workspace & Microsoft Experience with Apple MacbooksUnderstanding of CyberSecurity needs within a businessIf this role sounds like you and you are looking to work for an exciting and rewarding organisation click APPLY and include a one-page cover letter & resume.Application Close: 25th June 2022

Name: Senior Consultant - Digital Forensics & Incident Response
Description: Job DescriptionWith PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture, innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits, such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums, dads and foster carers (no minimum service!) What will you create? You’ll help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare, to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry, together we build trust in society and solve important problems. Cybersecurity & Digital Trust builds trust in Australian organisations by securing their digital future and developing the nation's leading cybersecurity workforce. As a Senior Consultant in our Defensive Security team your impact will be seen by:Conducting cyber detection and response including incident response, threat intelligence, hunting and security monitoringDeveloping cyber intelligence assessments and briefs for both technical and business stakeholdersDeveloping internal tools and procedures to contribute to the team’s knowledge base;Reporting and presenting to both technical and business stakeholders About you You have a background in cyber security with experience in incident response, threat intelligence, threat hunting, or security operations and are able to independently manage engagement delivery. You have a strong grasp of technical/business writing and have the ability to train and mentor junior members. As a bonus, you may hold security related certifications such as CISSP, CISM, ITIL or GIAC. You may also hold relevant vendor certifications.   Passionate about being at the forefront of change, you’re ready to help our Consulting team deliver practical advice that speaks straight to the heart of client business issues and deliver innovative results. You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with. Life at PwC  Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.  We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us. We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.  Paul Bui is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experience high volumes of applications, we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.  Location: Flexible (any major city) We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $77,000.00 including 10% Superannuation,  however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings.#LI-PWCLMT PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

Name: Senior Data Engineer
Description: About us  Transport for NSW is the lead agency of the NSW Transport cluster. Our role is to lead the development of a safe, efficient, integrated transport system that keeps people and goods moving, connects communities and shapes the future of our cities, centres and regions. We work with several government agencies to coordinate road, rail, bus and maritime services, always keeping the safety and comfort of our customers at the heart of what we do. About AAI at TfNSW TfNSW's Advanced Analytics and Insights group design sustainable solutions that will effectively address the uncovered opportunities through business analytics and we deliver a solution that is governed by enterprise standards, with the potential to evolve in line with your business needs. AAI leads data, analytics and insights across Transport to deliver impactful solutions through analytics, data and insights. Our branch supports strategic business decision making for a better customer future. Along with the business engagement team, backed by a team of highly specialised architects, analysts, developers and co-ordinators can help you find the right data solution to meet your business requirements. The opportunity  We have a new opportunity for a Senior Data Engineer, temporary full time role upto 31st March 2024 within Advanced Analystics and Insights division. This role has the responsibility for the provision of all maintenance tasks, modifications, improvements, cleansing, and manipulation of data from across the entire Transport Cluster. Your role will include: Provide technical leadership and implement of a variety of data ingestion processes, technologies and systems which underpin our branch and various data teams across the cluster with the primary focus of driving data democratisation for the delivery of insights. Ensure that data governance processes are implemented at each point of the data management lifecycle and are a key consideration of any implementation that is auditable to a shared reference specification. Design and lead the automation of existing business logic and business processes surrounding data services with a focus on optimising delivery and reliability and extracting business value from data using the latest in cloud technologies with a special focus on near-real-time pipelines Maintain strong stakeholder relationships at various levels, both internally and externally by tailoring consultative services and recommendations to drive alignment and capability uplift of data teams across the Transport Cluster. Monitor compliance with cybersecurity recommendations and advisories while taking the lead in implementing and demonstrating best practices in terms of protecting our data as key assets of the organisation. Lead the identification, design, and implementation of internal process improvements: automating manual processes, streamlining data delivery and re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability and elegance. Identify, analyse and communicate potential opportunities for Business Intelligence, Analytics and Data Science teams to extract new business value to drive business decisions. Design and develop data tools and scripts for Analytics, Business Intelligence and Data Science teams to assist in building highly optimised products ready for a scalable production environments. Lead consultation at an enterprise level to determine the most appropriate and engaging solutions to deliver shared outcomes for federated analytics teams across the Transport Cluster.  For more information please view a copy of the role description. About you We are looking for a hands-on Senior Data Engineer with extensive experience in AWS ‘Big Data' suite, data modelling, data mining, segmentation techniques, a guru in SQL database design and has worked with large, complex data sets. You are a creative and adventurous thinker who enjoys experimenting with new techniques and is looking for a career-building opportunity to showcase your engineering skills. You are also a collaborative team member who enjoys brainstorming, has strong communication skills and is disciplined and organised. Scripting knowledge in Python or similar, backend application development, DBA administration including configuration and knowledge or experience in data governance will be highly regarded. Salary and Benefits The salary for this position is TfNSW Grade 9 ($138,670.00 - $155,309.00) per annum plus superannuation and leave loading.   For more information on Employee Benefits at TfNSW please click here.  How to apply To apply for this position, please answer all questions within the online application process and submit a resume.   Applications Close: 11.59 PM Sunday, 3rd July 2022  We are the community we serveWe are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options. For any enquiries, please email Srivatsa Lakshmi Narayana at Srivatsa.Lakshminarayana@transport.nsw.gov.au Apply today to register your interest! Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us

Name: Graduate Sales Support Role
Description: Our client has been making software buyers’ lives easier since 2000. Starting out as a pure play distributor, over the years they have evolved into a company with over 35 employees based in Sydney and Melbourne specialising in CyberSecurity and Systems Management solutions, and services to aid in the procurement of Enterprise Software.    Our client is now seeking a dynamic collaborative graduate to join their team, essential element is a genuine drive to learn quickly and the ability to be accurate and methodical.    About you:  Bachelor’s degree Excellent interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills Highly professional demeanour and attention to detail. Diligent and hungry to be successful  The Role:  Analyze and prepare renewal quotes Production of accurate renewals quotes including all relevant information required for the customer from the vendor Assisting others in the team as required to meet department deadlines High level of understanding of how the renewals process, including reinstatement, penalty and grace periods  Perks of the role:  Large company progression and growth opportunities Collaborative and supportive culture WFH Opportunities  If this sounds like you, apply now to join the team to advance your career and discover a future of opportunities.    For more information on ProForce and what we do, check out our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/proforceaustralia or visit our website: http://proforce.net.au/  *In order to be considered for this role you must have a completed university degree and full Australian working rights.

Name: Web Developer (Full-time, permanent)
Advertiser: The Translational Research Institute Pty Ltd
Description: The Translational Research Institute (TRI) is a leading Australian innovative medical research, development and translation facility.  It is home to a range of cutting edge technologies including interventions to prevent and treat human diseases, and provide diagnosis of early disease. TRI is charged with partnering scientific development with the commercial sector to ensure innovations move rapidly to improve patient outcomes and commercial return. To this end, TRI is at the interface of science, medicine and industry.The Web Developer is a newly created position at TRI and is responsible for developing web based strategic and operational solutions for TRI. The role will engage staff, researchers and the wider TRI community to design, create, test, deploy and document solutions that will improve the customer experience and operational efficiencies. As part of a digital transformation agenda, the Web Developer will play a key role in actively engaging with the TRI community through detailed consultation, in order to recommend and/or develop suitable web based solutions. The role will also project manage a new content management system, website and enhanced digital experiences as part of this project.Key AccountabilitiesDesign, development and maintenance of TRI’s web based and online touchpointsManagement and implementation of web development projects within appropriate constraintsTechnical ownership of TRI’s content management system, institutional repository, in house directory and other online systems as requiredDevelopment of online solutions that cater for enhanced experiencesProvide advice and recommendations on TRI’s technology suite for both client side and server side web applications and systemsEnsure high levels of security and appropriate security framework is in place for all relevant solutions within TRISelection Criteria - Experience, Skills, abilities & Knowledge, Qualifications ExperienceAt least three to five years’ experience working in a similar role with experience in the following areas:Implementing a new Content Management System in an enterprise contextManaging projects for the design, development and implementation of websites, intranets, etc.Developing client-focused solutions that deliver a premium user experienceDeveloping integration solutions between varied web based systems and/or productsDevelopment of custom modules within popular Content Management Systems (such as Drupal, Wordpress, etc.)A range of development languages, including PHPA range of server side technologies such as LAMP, WAMP, Active Directory, PostgreSQL etc.Skills, abilities and KnowledgeOutstanding customer service skillsAbility to identify opportunities for improvement and act as a champion of changeAbility to collaborate with all levels within and around an organisationUnderstanding of change management practices in relation to solutions implementationUnderstanding of technologies across a range of arenas, server side, client side, cloud based, development languages, content management systems, development practices, etc.Understanding of cybersecurity risks in relation to solutions development, web applications and cloud based systemsAbility to operate independently yet understand the importance of delivering on the technology strategy and ultimately, the wider organisational strategyQualificationsBachelor Degree or an Associate Diploma or an equivalent combination of experience, education and training.To apply for this position, candidates must submit a cover letter addressing the selection criteria with a current resume quoting job reference 1434.  Applications close Monday 4 July 2022 TRI is covered by the Workers in healthcare setting (COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements) Direction No.2, and as a result, you have to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to work at TRI.

Name: Identity Engineer
Description: The Opportunity As a member of the Identity & Access Management Team, you will be a critical part of the Endeavour cybersecurity team and a key driver of the Cyber Security strategy via engagement with the IT transformation and underlying projects. The complexity of the environment creates the opportunity for the successful candidate to establish a solid foundation for the organisation to traverse the required transformation over the coming years. The candidate will work closely with stakeholders in the business and the Cyber Security team. They will be involved with an assortment of projects that support the business. A day in the life of an Identity & Access Management Architect / Engineer...  Reviewing current Identity & Access Management frameworks and recommending and implementing enhancements Work closely with the Security architecture team to ensure security requirements are accounted for at design time in all IDAM solutions. Produce required IDAM documentation Assess the status of existing IDAM infrastructure Provide active support in remediation activities pertaining to the IDAM infrastructure Ensure relationships with all project stakeholders are developed and maintained. Actively act as an Engineer with a hands-on approach as required to ensure desired outcomes. Work Closely with other Identity Team members to ensure the future state identity landscape is built appropriately for the current and future needs of the organisation.  What You'll Need to Succeed Extensive experience in Identity & Access Management with a focus on Azure Active Directory, Sailpoint Identity Now Hands-on experience Innovative Mindset. Be comfortable with configuring and integrating systems A firm grasp on security and IDAM best practices and the ability to guide development teams and external vendors Solid understanding of security protocols, authentication, authorisation Ability to interact with a broad cross-section of personnel to explain and enforce IDAM measures Expert level knowledge in MS Azure and Identity services Intermediate knowledge of Google Cloud (GCP) Self-motivated and able to manage multiple priorities and tasks concurrently.  What's in it for you?   Excellent remuneration package and flexible working in every sense. We value our people   Everyday Rewards plus card - access exclusive employee discounts across Woolworths, BigW and Endeavour Group brands (BWS, Dan Murphy's etc) and 50% off food at ALH venues.   Our innovative ways of working include headspace mornings once a month (no meetings company-wide), opportunity to partner alongside bright minds and genuine investment in leading technologies    Paid learning & development opportunities   Career progression to help you realise your potential. As our business grows so do the opportunities for our people   Access to our Endeavour Group Employee Share Scheme!   Wine education: Bronze, Silver & Gold certifications   Work with an industry-leading team and be a part of one of the most exciting retail transformations in Australia      Grow with Endeavour Group Bring your spark. Tap into our spirit. That's the power of Endeavour.  If you want to experience the diverse spirit of drinks and hospitality businesses, here you can tap into Australia's leading brands including Dan Murphy's, BWS, ALH, Pinnacle Drinks, Endeavour X and more.If you have a passion for connecting people with products they love, here you can join an industry that's deeply embedded in the way Australians socialise, unwind and celebrate.If you want access to a breadth of career opportunities, here you can enjoy a path that travels between diverse roles and businesses within the Group.If you're already asking ‘what's next for me' and our industry, here you'll thrive.If you want to bring your full self to doing fulfilling work, here you'll find a culture that's welcoming, inclusive and responsible. If you are looking for flexibility, here we encourage our team members to work in ways that meets their work / life commitments and supports their wellbeing.Come grow with Endeavour where we are passionate about our purpose of creating a more sociable future together, and leaving a positive imprint on our team members and the communities we serve.If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.  You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au #EDG #EGL  Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Endeavour Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Customer Technology Support
Description: Join us during an exciting time of expansion! Are you an energetic, motivated, technically minded individual with Security experience? This is a fantastic opportunity to join Carrier Fire & Security in our growing Notting Hill Technical Support team. Not only do we have a fantastic team culture, but you will benefit from employment stability, progression opportunities as well a range of additional benefits that come with working with a market leader.The roleReporting to the Customer Delivery Manager, this permanent full-time position is for a Customer Technical Support Officer. The focus of the role is to provide the first response of manufacturer level technical support to our partners in the field, who are our Distributors, Value Added Resellers (VARs), and high-profile large-scale end users of our security technology.  We are looking for a quick-thinking individual capable of dealing with at times complex cases, with a customer first mentality.Key responsibilities:Coordinate with Services & Technology Functions to address Customer & Sales team needs.Answering helpline calls from our partner distributors, VARS and end users, ensuring customer support tickets are logged and followed up, ultimately resolved within agreed timeframes.Continually update customer with progress of ticket.Identifying and troubleshooting technical issues using our in-house guides and database.Talk clients through series of actions to resolve technical issues.Compiling knowledge that will help solve future customer issues.Regular cross function meetings with Product Managers, Engineering and Sales to discuss and resolve Commercial issues / ticket.You will need the followingA strong track record in a fast paced, call center type environment – ideally as a Technical Support Engineer, Desktop support technician or similar.Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills.Excellent interpersonal skills with a customer focused mentality.Knowledge of help desk ticketing applications such as Zendesk.An understanding of phone systems and call metrics.Additionally, the following would be highly regardedExperience with Security Software/Hardware and bus protocols.Familiar with other Database and/or related applications.Knowledge on Microsoft SQL, Query, troubleshooting etc.Certification in Microsoft, Linux, Cisco or similar technologies.Hands-on experience with Windows / Microsoft / Virtual environments.Working with Cloud solution like Azure, AWS (Optional).Understanding of Cybersecurity knowledge (Optional).BenefitsYou will be provided with a competitive base salary and strong career progression opportunities within our global organization. Apply now to find out how you can grow your career with Carrier!Carrier is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: Leading Government Client is looking for Cyber Security Specialist (Essential 8 experience) at Sydney for a 6 months contract + possible extension. APPLY NOW!  The Role The Cyber Security Specialist Practitioner is responsible for the coordination and delivery of a range of specialised cyber security services resulting in Safe and Secure implementation of ICT projects.  Key ResponsibilitiesProvide Information Security Services (ISS) within in the Service Delivery directorate specialised cyber security subject matter expertise to NSW Government Department and Health organisations.Ensure that ICT products and their product teams meet cyber security maturity levels of organisation.Undertake and communicate the outcome of risk assessments, ensuring that cyber security risks are identified, owned and are being met with appropriate risk treatment plans.Support the development and implementation of Information Security Management Systems (ISMS) that ensure compliance with cyber security strategies, frameworks, policies, guidelines and directives.Maintain expertise in emerging cybersecurity risks, trends and technologies as well as provide a broad and thorough understanding of all business risks and threats to inform high quality, expert advice to key stakeholders.Follow Departments standard project management and administrative procedures that support efficient, customer centric delivery for cyber security services.Ensure meetings and contracts are scheduled in a timely manner to facilitate ongoing compliance of cyber security reporting, policy, audits, certifications and related legislation.Negotiate, influence and collaborate with other teams, NSW clients and vendors to create positive engagement and ensure appropriate expectations and deadlines are met.Support the Cyber Security Management team and the Chief Information Security Officer in exercising their duties. Key Specialisations  A Senior Cyber Security Specialist Practitioner will be accountable for one or more of the key focus areas in ISS. These currently include the following areas of Cyber Security specialisation: 1) Incident Handling and Digital Forensics 2) Vulnerable Management 3) Governance, Risks, Compliance (GRC) and Policy 4) Advisory and Privacy, Security Assurance 5) Education and Awareness 6) Cloud Services 7) ACSC's Essential Eight Mitigation Controls  Key challengesFacilitate engagement on providing cyber security specialist services across the organisations system, balance competing demands to achieve business objectives, establish effective stakeholder relationships and arrangements that ensure customer input to all decisions, and balance state-wide needs with local innovation and national directions.Work within an environment where technologies are subject to rapid evolution and change and identify technology solutions and platforms that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the overall service offering for customers and drive improved value and stay at the leading edge of knowledge in the trends in cybersecurity risks and threats to ensure delivery of unbiased, risk-based analysis to ensure pragmatic solutions.Establish collaborative and influential relationships with stakeholders, customers and colleagues, to ensure easy and effective achievement of team / project / business goals.Create and maintain a constructive workplace culture in a rapidly changing and demanding service provision.If this sounds like you, APPLY NOW!Umema NetterwalaRecruitment SpecialistLet's ConnectManpowerGroup is committed to being a Diversity Confident Recruiter and encourages applications from people from a diverse range of backgrounds, including people with a disability. Please indicate your preferred method of communication in your resume and please let us know if you require any reasonable adjustments should you be contacted for an interview.Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.By submitting your resume and other personal information with this application you are consenting to this information being collected in line with our privacy policy. Follow the link to learn more - www.manpowergroup.com.au/privacy-policy [link removed]Experis Pty Ltd is a wholly owned subsidiary of ManpowerGroupState: QLD, licensee/s Manpower Services (Australia) Pty Ltd, LHL-02026-D5L4Q. State: QLD, licensee/s Experis Pty Ltd, LHL-02014-Y5F6D. State: SA, licensee/s Manpower Services (Australia) Pty Ltd, LHS 288856

Name: Senior Cyber Security Lead
Description: ABX has Modernised, Globalised & Integrated the precious metal markets by redefining the way physical bullion is traded. ABX connects all major global liquidity centres and break down the barriers to entry to the global wholesale market. Allocated Bullion Exchange founded and partnered with Kinesis who are a leading global fintech that is delivering a new global monetary system that leverages emerging cryptocurrency technologies backed 1:1 by the allocation of physical gold and silver. Robert Walters have partnered with Allocated Bullion Exchange. We are looking for a passionate Cyber Security Leader to establish and further the ABX Cyber Security Practices.  In this role, you will be responsible for leading our cyber defense and IT risk portfolio across our exchanges and crypto trading applications. This role will work closely with our clients operations and development teams to ensure their software is fully tested and is highly secure. You will be responsible for driving a small globally distributed team working alongside our Architects, Project Managers and delivery partners to deliver highly secure solutions and infrastructure. You will also be responsible for maintaining our PCI-DSS standards, completing the SAQ's, training internal teams, securing our infrastructure and improving our security posture.  ResponsibilitiesProtects our systems by defining access privileges, control structures, and resources.Recognises problems by identifying abnormalities, reporting violations.Implements security improvements by assessing current situation; evaluating trends; anticipating requirements.Determines security violations and inefficiencies by conducting periodic audits.Upgrades system by implementing and maintaining appropriate security controls.Keeps the business informed by preparing performance reports, communicating system status.Maintains quality service by following and improving our organisational standards.Maintains technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications.Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.To be recognised as our expert in cloud-based computing and operation of multiple web-based applications and services.Matches the technical security requirements with the need to be compliant and meet our privacy obligations.Researching, designing, and implementing IT security solutions for company systems that comply with applicable security policies and standards.Monitor all security operations and infrastructure.Work across all functions to reduce our technical risk.Implement new ideas and technology.Audit policies and controls on an ongoing basis.Champion cybersecurity for and to ABX / Kinesis. Skills5+ years of experience in security engineering and design.Experience in fintech and / or crypto-currencies.Expertise in complex web environment.Experience in securing API transactions including authentication.Practical experience with database security, content filtering, vulnerability management, and anti-malware, Data Loss Prevention, Identity Management, encryption, mobile device security, penetration testing, incident response, Security Event Management.Assessing and managing security tools in the market and making recommendations.Knowledge of regulatory compliance and information security management frameworks.Knowledge of common vulnerabilities and exploitation techniques.Analysing potential impact of new threats and communicating risks to the business.Experience working in a fast-paced environment.Ability to work collaborate within teams and across functions.Excellent attention to detail.Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.Adept at communicating the technical to non-technical stakeholders.Committed to ongoing learning and development.Strong organisational / time management / multi-tasking skills and the ability to manage changing deadlines and work autonomously.Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply. To apply please click apply or call Chris Butcher on 08 9266 0946 for a confidential discussion.

Name: Senior Network Engineer
Description: Company description:At Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career. We recognise the importance of flexibility and work life-quality and over 80% of our employees have informal or formal flexible work arrangements. Additionally, Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds and we want our teams to reflect this.Job description:  Senior Network Engineer     Design, build and operate high performance network connectivity to the Cloud Utilise your problem-solving skills Join an Organisation with Community at heart    An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Senior Network Engineer with Cisco Meraki & AWS experience to join our Innovations, Marketing & Technology team in Sydney.       The Role  To be successful in this role you will be an experienced a network engineer supporting technologies/products in large-scale enterprise environments, with a deep understanding of data networks and solid foundation in Enterprise Networking, Security and Unified Communications.  Large scale enterprise design and deployment experience is also required.  Design, build and operate high performance network connectivity to the Cloud and SAAS service providers. Keep abreast of and gain expertise in the evolving technologies relevant to Stockland's aims. Understanding how new technologies could be applied.  Lead technical design discussions that facilitate decision making within business operations. Collaborate and drive key network vendors to maximise IT capability and realize business value. Independently solves problems in complex, and unique networks with mixed environments Ensure compliance to agreed ITIL principles of change, incident and problem management that drive reduced down time and improved customer experience.  Document, share knowledge and mentor network engineers, IT Helpdesk and IT partners to more effectively support their environment. Assist to provide process, configuration & automation tools that drive productivity to reduced operational overheads and improve user experience. Maintain agreed disaster documentation and capability as per agreed plan and requirements. Support and deliver network patch management process Implement & configure monitoring tools that improved visibility, improve performance and up-time of the environment Maintain and operate Stockland network security infrastructure, and always maintain strong cybersecurity controls Support the application, integration, and connectivity requirements of Stockland's core system application and customers' requirements    About You  To be successful in this role you will be a team player that is technically strong with the following experience:            Tertiary qualification in a technical field, such as Computer Science, Computer Networking, Information Technology, Electrical/Computer Engineering or a similar field Experience in Cisco Meraki platform (mandatory) Experience in delivering Internet-based and zero trust network architectures Experience with Zscaler secure web gateway technology Experience managing and deploying Security infrastructure including firewalls. Experience in Cisco Network infrastructure and administration Experience in remote edge networks that support innovation and mobility including WI-FI, Cellular, IoT Experience in cloud networks, carrier services, technical design and implementations including IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS delivery model (AWS experience is mandatory) Demonstrated ability to work and communicate effectively with business stakeholders, internal teams and strategic vendors.    The Stockland Proposition   At Stockland we are a community delivering outcomes that benefit the community at large. We work collaboratively and inclusively, building strong working relationships. Our portfolio is diverse and so are the opportunities for professional and career development. We are committed to providing our people with broad experiences to build a successful career. We recognise the importance of flexibility and work life-quality and over 80% of our employees have informal or formal flexible work arrangements. Additionally, Stockland has a strong commitment to achieving the best outcomes through an inclusive and collaborative culture. Our customers come from diverse backgrounds and we want our teams to reflect this. We offer competitive remuneration and benefits. As a Stockland employee, you and your immediate family can access a range of financial and non-financial benefits.   Due to the permanent nature of this role, we can only accept applications from Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or Open Work Visa holders with more than 12 months validity from their role start date.   Apply today - Stockland - it's your place.   Agencies should note that unsolicited resumes will not be accepted for this position and Stockland will not pay any fees related to resumes that are submitted directly to hiring managers and not through our approved process. Where appropriate, the Careers @ Stockland Team will work with our preferred panel of agencies to source candidates for roles. Please submit any queries relating to the approved process of submitting candidate resumes or Stockland's preferred agency panel to careers@stockland.com.au [link removed]

Name: Systems Administrator
Description: Systems Administrator   About VICSEG New Futures VICSEG New Futures is a not for profit community organisation offering various services to recently settled migrant and refugee families for almost 40 years. VICSEG New Futures' registered training organisation, New Futures Training, was established in 2002 and provides vocational training and pathways to employment in the human services and care sectors.    About the role We are looking to employ a full time Systems Administrator.  You will be responsible for analysing, installing, troubleshooting, and maintaining all areas of the VICSEG network, including client/server systems, client/server applications, systems communications, user account management, software deployment, and endpoint protection.  You will also be responsible for proactive maintenance tasks such as checking backup systems and ensuring they are running, as well carrying out various preventative and reactive maintenance measures. This position would suit a person with 3-5 years’ experience in a similar role along with direct experience working within a Non for Profit organisation.     You will be responsible for  Configure, implement and administer servers and related applications to provide a responsive and consistent computing environment with optimum securityIdentifies computing requirements and confers on system needsInstall, configures and maintains multiplatform systems hardware, software and componentsResponsible for all network, hardware and systems infrastructure; managing and maintaining routers, switches, firewalls, and wireless networks; maintaining and testing backupsBuild new systems and deploy application softwareInstall new software releases and system upgradesCreate, update, audit, and modify Data Centre documentation as requiredTroubleshoots components of systems relying on proven techniques for IT data centre analysis and evaluation.Partners with Engineers to ensure successful implementation of new technologies and assures SOP’s are accurate.  Skills and experience Essential  Must hold a current Degree Qualification in Computer Science or Information Technology or Information      Systems  A minimum 3 years’ experience working as a Systems AdministratorKnowledge of Windows Server technologies, Active Directory, storage, and backup devices, VMWare and other solutions as necessary to fulfil job responsibilities.Analytical/problem-solving skillsProficiency in server, storage, and virtualization standards, techniques, and toolsStrong understanding of networks and network equipment, antivirus software and cybersecurity platforms and excellent Scripting skillsClear and concise verbal and written communication to all levels of the organizationWorking with Children Check and National Police Check High level of organizational, administrative, and planning skills Demonstrated ability to work efficiently, and respond to management request with urgency                             Desirable   Experience of working in a multicultural environment with understanding and empathy regarding issues faced by migrants, refugees and others from non-English speaking backgrounds. Direct experience working within the NFP space   Benefits and perks You will be joining a culturally diverse, community based organisation with a supportive culture and management    team. This position offers a great work/life balance with, with family-friendly hours. As a Not-For-Profit organisation, we also provide the opportunity for Salary Packaging. $73,000 - $83,000 per annum + 10.5% superannuation     How to Apply Please follow the prompts and 'apply' now by submitting a Resume and Cover Letter outlining your suitability for the role. Please outline your experience with the essential experience listed above.   Closing date for applications is 17/7/2022 We wish you all the best, and look forward to meeting you.

Name: Non-executive Director
Description: Non-Executive DirectorCommunity Options AustraliaSydney NSW 2000CEO & General Management - Board AppointmentsPart-timeExpressions of interest are invited for up to 3 Non-Executive Director vacancies with Community Options AustraliaAbout Community Options AustraliaEstablished as a not-for-profit representative organisation in 1996, Community Options Australia became recognised as a leader in the development and delivery of packaged care solutions to a wide range of people.  Community Options Australia has continued to evolve and champion programs that address support for people who have complex needs (https://communityoptions.net.au/).Through our provider network, we continue to work proactively to deliver increasingly individualised responsive person-centred care.  Our provider network is committed and connected to their local communities across Australia. It is through working collaboratively with our providers, consumers and carers we can deliver on our promise of connecting with care.About the roleCommunity Options Australia is seeking expressions of interest for up to 3 Non-Executive Directors to complement the skills and experience of the current six Directors. The successful candidate will address and evidence in their 1- 1.5 page application letter and 2 page resume the following skills:Clinical governance leadershipAPHRA registered professional (one Director position)Public policy in health and human servicesNational and/ or state Health networksHealth innovation/technologyAged care servicesCommunity sector servicesAdvocacy/ Stakeholder engagementInfluencing and lobbyingService Reform and transformationStrategic marketing and communications Health DataCybersecurityHave significant community sector management experience in a service delivery organisation – preferably in the health, disability, aged or the community care sectorSkills in human resources, or marketingHave built or grown a successful, fast-growing health care organisation – preferably with demonstrated experience in building organisational cultures that enable people to excelBe able to evidence ‘expansive thinking’ compared to their peersBe aligned to the core values of Community Options Australia and to creating a lasting social impact via connected care solutions for AustraliansApplicants with a cultural diverse background, lived experience of disability, chronic disease and/or mental health or who identify as a First Nations person are encouraged to apply.Applications are open to Australian based candidates with a preference to those who have significant connections in NSW, and Victoria. Board meetings are held in Sydney and by Zoom six times a year. You should be able to attend board meetings in person and will be required to serve on one subcommittee. GAICD or equivalent is highly desired. This is a paid opportunity commencing at the November 2022 AGM with the Board’s annual two day strategic planning retreat being held near Sydney in early 2023.TO APPLYFor the board pack and further information please contact andrew@communityoptions.net.auExpressions of interest close 12 midday ACST 15/7/22

Name: Level 3 Tech Support - Managed IT Services
Description: About UsWe are leading MSP with national presence going though a massive growth.We are utilising acquisitions as our growth strategy to become a leader in the Technology Services space for Australia, which includes 24/7 NOC, SOC, Support, Cloud, Telecomm services - to name a few. Our current primary offices are in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and the Gold Coast.We are looking for an experienced Level 3 Support Technician with excellent customer service skills to join our exciting tech team in Castle Hill, NSW.You will be focusing on Infrastructure Projects pre-sales, planning and deployment, NOC escalations, Support escalations for our Sydney and National clients. This role is a mix of work from home, office and client sites - where onsite is required, especially around infrastructure projects deployments. Main Duties and ResponsibilitiesInfrastructure Projects pre-sales assistance to Account ManagersInfrastructure Projects planning and deploymentFinal (L3) support escalation point for user requestsFinal (L3) escalation point for NOC / SOC (machine generated tickets)Providing all levels of support services via ConnectWise Manage PSA and RMM SystemsClients' network infrastructure (site) documentation in ITGlueTrain and mentor IT&C Group Helpdesk Staff (training through ticket escalation)Ongoing vendor, industry training and certifications (e.g. Microsoft, Sophos, Datto) Required SkillsPrevious experience in an MSP role is essential (min. 5 years)Strong Windows Server 2012 to 2019 experienceStrong Active Directory, DNS, DHCP and group policy experienceStrong Microsoft 365/Azure/Intune experienceStrong Exchange 2013 - 2019 and Exchange Online experienceStrong Hyper-V experienceStrong Backup, BCDR and AntiVirus/EDR System experienceStrong Cybersecurity, Firewall experienceGood experience with various network technologies (switching, routing, VLAN, WLAN, WAN, VPN)Proven experience in project planning, and deliveryExperience with ConnectWise PSA/RMM a preferenceExperience with Datto BCDR products a preferenceExperience with Sophos, CISCO products a preference BenefitsWork, Life Balance Flexibility (WFH, office, clients sites / Office BBQ's / Family Oriented)Company Laptop and Peripherals Supplied for your WFH and OfficeExposure to multitude of sites, network environments, technologies within SME, Large Enterprise and Local GovernmentA culture that encourages personal and professional growthA culture that encourages and rewards professionalism and productivity

Name: ICT Managed & Project Services  - Level 3
Description: This is a pivotal role working closely with our clients and our internal teams so your communication skills will be paramount to your success.  This is not an entry level position.  You must demonstrate that you have vast experience & and work autonomously on a wide variety of technologies. This is a hands-on role with a mix of work from office, home and client sites - where onsite is required. The job will involve:Pre-sales assistance to Account ManagersProjects planning and deployment with a range of customers and technical environmentsRollout of new Microsoft implementations & ICT AuditsConfiguration, testing and administration of Cisco Meraki networking products –Eg. Switches, routers, firewalls, wireless LAN etcFinal (L3) support escalation point for user requestProviding all levels of support services via ConnectWise ManageClients' network infrastructure (site) documentation in ITGlueMicrosoft Active Directory administrationMicrosoft Office 365 and Azure project design, implementation and maintenanceTrain and mentor other ICT Helpdesk staffOngoing vendor, industry training and certifications (e.g. Microsoft, Cisco, Datto)Manage, monitor, implement and troubleshoot server and network infrastructure as well as business applications for managed clientsThe successful person has:Minimum of 5 years experience in IT (MSP preferred)Microsoft Global Admin experience deploying and managing Microsoft 365/Microsoft Azure/IntuneStrong Active Directory, DNS, DHCP and group policy experienceStrong Backup, BCDR and AntiVirus/EDR System experienceStrong Cybersecurity, Firewall experienceStrong Networking skills, including firewalls, VPN, switches, DNS, DHCPExcellent communication skills - both verbal & written.Ability to prioritise and work in high volume environmentsITIL, Cisco, or Microsoft certifications are highly regardedAmbitious, quick and self-motivated learnerAre motivated, high energy and have a passion for contributing to a great team environmentRemuneration is circa $100-$130k; commensurate with experience & knowledge Apply now if you are an energetic & self-motivated individual who likes to be busy and can work under pressure & in a fast paced environment.  Shortlisting & interviews will begin immediately.Only successful applicants will be contacted.  You must:Have current Australian Drivers LicenseHave unrestricted working rights in Australia

Name: System Verification and Validation Lead
Advertiser: Hitachi Rail STS Australia Pty Ltd
Description: Hitachi Rail is a fully integrated, global provider of turnkey rail solutions across rolling stock, signalling, operation, service and maintenance, digital technology and turnkey with a presence in 38 countries, across 11 manufacturing sites on three continents and over 12,000 employees. Hitachi Rail is headquartered in London, UK and is ultimately wholly owned by Hitachi Ltd.  Our engineering heritage and culture is rooted in Japan, where our first steam and electric locomotives were built in the early 1920s. We continue to deliver the most current Shinkansen for Japan’s railways, and have successfully exported our technology and expertise to multiple rolling stock projects across the globe - from high speed, tram and metro, to driverless technologies for passengers and freight. In recent times, our global footprint outside of Japan has been established primarily on organic expansion in the UK. Recent acquisitions in Italy and beyond have cemented our digital growth, which has diversified revenue and added capability in signalling and turnkey in particular. We are ambitious and continue to seek to expand into new key geographies and to deliver new solutions. Drawing on the wider Hitachi Group’s market-leading technology capabilities and R&D, we strive for industry leading innovations able to deliver value for customers and help build sustainable railway systems which benefit wider society. About the role:Hitachi Rail is seeking an experienced System Verification and Validation Lead to join the team based in Brisbane. Reporting to the System Assurance Manager, you will be accountable for the planning and reporting on System Validation from the development lifecycle through to the target operational configuration state. Additionally, you will be responsible for the Verification and Validation planning, coordination and completion of reporting for the system and subsystems. The V&V Lead will have a team of subsystem verification and validation leads, as well as the independent validator for the safety functions in compliance with EN50126 and EN50128. This will support successful execution of the system V&V management.Work within a passionate, supportive and inclusive team environment. Play an integral role within the Cross River Rail Project. If you looking for a role that truly makes a positive impact, now is your chance to join the Hitachi Rail team on this exciting journey.  Responsibilities of the Role:Maintain sub-system, Speciality Engineering, test facilities verification and validation planning and reporting requirements to enable the integration schedule to progress.Successfully verify and validate ETCS System requirements.Review methods for the verification and validation of each system and interface requirement through the lifecycle.Define verification requirements and ensure compliance with the allocated method, for tracing to the verification specifications.Define validation requirements and ensure compliance with the allocated method, for the ETCS System for tracing to the validation specifications.Verify and validate ETCS System interface requirements.Maintain comprehensive allocation of the verification and validation requirements to work packages.Manage the independent validation test activities.Identification of all verification and validation deliverables to enable the integration schedule.Monitor and report verification and validation activities.Maintain continuous improvement of verification and validation activities. Desired Knowledge/ Experience:Previous experience in a similar role and industry.Knowledge of system engineering, specialising in system verification and validation. Awareness of IEC 15288 Systems and software engineering — System life cycle processes and IEC 29148 Systems and software engineering — Life cycle processes — Requirements engineering. Understanding of development and implementation of Railway Signalling Command and Control Systems, ideally European Train Control Systems.Understanding of system interface and integration constraints derived from speciality engineering areas including - Safety, Reliability, Availability, Maintainability (RAM), Cybersecurity and Human Factors.Outstanding communication skills - written and verbal. Capability to liaise with all levels of management. Excellent negotiation, conflict resolution and planning skills.Experience working on projects that are regulated by the Office or National Rail Safety Regulator (ONRSR) or similar regulatory environment. Education and Training:Australian Honours Degree in engineering or equivalent at Washington accord level.Registered Professional Engineer Queensland (RPEQ) or able to achieve within 3 months of appointment.

Name: Research Postdoctoral Fellow Cyber Security (CRC)
Description: Establish research in cyber security in AustraliaWork with leading companies and government agencies within CSCRCEnjoy the benefits of working in a large organisation in a regional locationThe RoleFixed Term (up to 12 months), Full Time$100,476 to $119,121 pa (plus 17% superannuation)Bathurst or Wagga WaggaFunded by the Cyber Security Cooperative Research Centre (CSCRC) you will work closely with the CSCRC to develop and engage in high-quality, impactful research projects that contribute to cyber security in Australia and are supported by the CSCRC.  The focus will be to apply software engineering, machine learning and/or cyber security expertise in real-life scenarios including cyber security for agriculture through various relevant tasks such as agriculture asset management, data collection and visualisation, virtual CISO development, malware detection, ransomware detection, vulnerability detection, intrusion detection, threat hunting, authentication, cryptography, cyber security disaster recovery, data trustworthiness, privacy-preserving data sharing/flow, and privacy-preserving federated learning.  To be successful you will have:A PhD relevant to the computing discipline, computer science, information technology or related areas in cybersecurity, machine learning or software engineering with strong programming expertise.Excellent research track record in cyber security, machine learning and/or software development as demonstrated by publications in top-tier journals and conferences.Demonstrated capabilities to conduct research in the area of cyber security, machine learning, software engineering or related technical areas and implementation of such research and/or a record of research capacity to make an autonomous contribution.A demonstrated ability to effectively liaise with academic colleagues and administrative staff, and work as a member of a team.Application Requirements  Applicants are expected to apply online and address the selection criteria in the position description. If you experience difficulties applying online or for further information on completing the application process please visit our how to apply page or contact us.  Evidence of having received a full course of a COVID-19 vaccination approved by the Therapeutic Goods Administration is required as a condition of entry onto Charles Sturt University campuses. Accordingly, evidence of vaccination or a valid exemption is a condition of employment at Charles Sturt University.  About Us  Charles Sturt University is a young and growing university committed to developing far-sighted people who help their communities grow and flourish. We make a significant contribution to the prosperity and vibrancy of our rural and regional communities, with a reach and impact across Australia and internationally. We work together with industry, communities and students to create new thinking, inspire each other and make a positive and progressive contribution to the world.  The Faculty of Business, Justice and Behavioural Sciences covers a diverse range of disciplines and is comprised of 6 Schools, 2 Centres and CSU Engineering - the School of Management and Marketing, School of Accounting and Finance, School of Computing and Mathematics, School of Policing Studies, Australian Graduate School of Policing and Security, School of Psychology, Centre for Law and Justice, Centre for Customs and Excise Studies and CSU Engineering.  Our Faculty are leaders in their fields of teaching and research and combine significant professional experience with academic expertise. Our schools continue to grow through close collaboration and consultation with private industry, regulators, professional bodies, community engagement, partnerships and global networks.  Charles Sturt University (Charles Sturt) is member of the consortium which has been successful in establishing $140M Cyber Security Cooperative Research Centre (CSCRC). The Cyber Security CRC consists of 23 participants including leading companies such as Optus, CISCO, TSS Cyber and Tata Consulting and crucial government agencies such as the Australian Signals Directorate and the Australian Federal Police. State governments including from NSW to WA are also members of this industry led consortia.  Charles Sturt University offers a great work-life balance, professional development opportunities and generous financial benefits.  Charles Sturt University is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. This is demonstrated through our Workplace Gender Equality Agency Employer of Choice Citation and our Athena SWAN Bronze Institutional Award. Charles Sturt is also a participating member in the Australian Workplace Equality Index. Applications are encouraged from Indigenous Australians; people with a disability; women (particularly for senior and non-traditional roles); people who identify as LGBTIQA+; and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.  Further Information  Additional information is available in the Position Description or by contacting:  Zahid Islam | Professor of Computer Science | zislam@csu.edu.au | Ph: 02 6338 4214  Closing Date: 11 pm, 21 July 2022
