Name: Information Security Specialist ( Brisbane )
Description: As a recognized global cyber defender that stops cyber threats all day, every day – we enable our clients to conduct their business, securely.Trustwave detects threats that others can’t see, enabling us to respond quickly and protect our clients from the devastating impact of cyberattacks. We leverage our world-class team of security consultants, threat hunters and researchers, and our market-leading security operations platform, to relentlessly identify and isolate threats with the right telemetry at the right time for the right response.Trustwave is a leader in managed detection and response (MDR), managed security services (MSS), consulting and professional services, database security, and email security. Our elite Trustwave SpiderLabs team provides award-winning threat research and intelligence, which is infused into Trustwave services and products to fortify cyber resilience in the age of advanced threats.Flexible work arrangementsCareer growth - receive mentoring, coaching, and support to progress your careerContinued education/learning & development programsAbout the teamWe’re Thinkers, Innovators and Team Players and we’re defending our customers one professional at a time with an award-winning Cyber Security solution portfolio.About the roleThe key purpose for the ISS is to support the World Leading Trustwave solutions and services to meet the client’s specific requirements; or to support an ISA or number of ISAs in delivering outcomes to customers.  The ISS supporting the premium level ISA service requires some customization and specific functions such as Custom Reporting, some Custom Processes (that do not interfere with TW SOC standard processes), emerging threats, Darkweb monitoring, solution, infrastructure, design and documentation reviews to name a few.  Each client's requirements differ slightly/significantly from client to client as there are variable client and contractual requirements. The Information Specialist is a hands-on technical or analyst role providing configuration changes, technical analysis on data or products.  This role does not provide direct consultancy to customers but may deliver reports to the customer directly or to internal Trustwave teams or working in collaboration with one or many ISAs. The ISS information and context to the ISA and provide observations and recommendations for key decisions in the area of security, which may include operational technical support, and other duties in support of the client and / or the primary ISA on the account.The Information Security Advisor function possesses a strong technical background in one or more security domains and skills that may include industry recognized certification (such as CISSP) and may have experience in some aspects of project delivery.   The ISS is a pooled resource with other ISS and ISA resources with the power of the global Trustwave ISA’s, the ISS is not a head for hire, allocation for the ISA service is based on hours sold to a client as part of an MSS/MTDR service.This is a great career opportunity for a talented professional interested in working at one of the cyber security industry’s global top 10, award-winning and fastest growing companies.Key Responsibilities:Common activities include; Obtaining information and data from technologies such as Rapid7, Log Rhythm, Carbon Black, NetskopeReview of data and analysis, develop and deliver customised reporting. Correlating data from various sources to provide observations to internal Trustwave Stakeholders.  Review and monitor the Log Rhythm SIEM dashboard report for log source going silent or unexpected spikes in log volumesReview or monitoring of technical configuration or equipment. Filling out change management documents, and coordination of activities between customer and TrustwaveCreation of Configuration for and delivery of configuration to equipment/technologies. Create or involvement in technical documentation to support solutions or process development/tuning including documentation to be supplied to the customer for customer change management process. Problem management, seeing issues through to resolution.  Incident management – providing support for ISAs or internal Trustwave teams.  Provide analysis of customer telemetry collected in the MTDR service to identify threats and tuning opportunities; as well as engaging additional Trustwave expertise when appropriate in coordination with the ISA. Work with the ISA to maintenance and optimise the customer specific runbooks and in-scope customised Threat Detection content. Create MSS Service reports and metrics relating to customer on a weekly basis with the ISA. Attend meetings with customer as local contact point, to acquire a higher understanding of customer intent. liaise and work with the ISA to deliver outcomes. Configure customer systems as required to enable MTDR services.  Respond timely to Trustwave initiated Security Incidents.Participate in tuning and service optimisation activities as required.   Resolve deviations from the project plan or scope of work in a timely manner. Take responsibility for customer satisfaction and overall success of managed services.Provide a single point of contact to the account management and delivery teams for all operational security related reporting for the customer account.On a regular weekly basis, meet with the account team to review security reports, status, review any risks, issues, incidents, and outstanding activities.Ensure that opportunities to improve security are identified.Offer executive-level presentations for the account or client management and proactively keep Trustwave senior leadership abreast of all account concerns. Skills and Knowledge Requirements: Must have skills/knowledge in several of the following areas: Hands on Experience with tools such as Rapid7, Log Rhythm, Carbon Black, Netskope or similar common technology tool experience is required.Information Security Operations Project Engagements Technical knowledge of some common technologies (SIEM, Endpoint, Vulnerability Management) Information Security Standards and RegulationsData Analytics – able to review data and provide insights.   Desired experience: Analytical skills Self-motivated team player who can work to contribute to the Trustwave team success Deadline and detail oriented Fluent in English.Certification(s) in Security Sector (CISSP or similar)  Required: Three to five years of technical experience Experience in aspects of delivering projects.Ability to interpret and communicate complicated data sets and scenarios At Trustwave, everyone's experience is valued. We advocate Diversity of Thought, using diversity of experiences and perspectives to innovate and solve real world problems. Our people have studied at different universities, are self-taught, have worked in different companies in Australia, and around the world. Whoever you are, be comfortable, be different, be you, with us. Join Trustwave and together we’ll solve the cybersecurity challenges of today and into the future.Trustwave is an Equal Opportunity Employer.To All Agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Trustwave outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Trustwave policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via the Trustwave Agency Portal. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, by the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of Trustwave and in the event a candidate is submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Name: Network Operations Team Lead
Description: Great opportunity to join a ASX Listed company on the rise and at the for front of new network technologies.   At Field Solutions Group we are looking for an experienced Network Operations Team Lead who is a critical thinker with a passion for mentoring people.Exciting opportunity for a motivated team leader to make an impact in a growing team.  We're after a Network Operations Team Lead with carrier experience to support our team and manage the “business as usual” operations of our diverse FSG network.   This role is available in either Hobart or Brisbane.  Field Solutions Group are an ASX listed company supplying IT and Mobile telecommunication solutions to rural, regional, and metro Australia. Central to our solutions is our ability to combine and connect technologies across our network to ensure the business solution we deliver is robust, reliable and delivers true broadband.  FSG operate a Juniper and Arista environment with a mix of MPLS, eVPN and VXLAN to provide client overlays.  Recent acquisitions have introduced Cisco and Mikrotik into the mix.  Access technologies include the usual range of NBN products along with dark fibre, radio and LTE networks operated by FSG. FSG has recently acquired a telecommunications and managed services organisation (TasmaNet) and their managed services product suite is being integrated into FSG’s existing national presence.  Your responsibilities will include:Management of incidents escalated from the first and second line support teams.Leadership of major incidents in conjunction with the General Manager of Network Operations.Engaging with third line support teams in client organisations and the resolution of any associated incident.Organise the team to ensure continuous management of incidents around the clock using a mix of in-office and on-call resources.Working with vendor support teams to manage any hardware and software issues that may arise.Network capacity management.Release management regarding the software version deployed across the technology suite.Assisting with network automation initiatives.Assisting with network engineering projects as the operational workload permits. To be successful in this position you will need to demonstrate:Contribute to the organisation’s change management processes,Ensure that documentation is current and available to other staff,Ensure that the network monitoring and alerting functions are always fit for purpose,Contribute positively to the organisation’s cybersecurity posture in all activities,Participate in an on-call roster,Perform work after hours as required,Knowledge of Cisco or Juniper MPLS core, layer 2 and layer 3 technologies, Desirable knowledge of Arista, f5, Mikrotik, Cambium, Ceragon, Fortinet, VMware & HP hardware, Travel to other offices and client locations as required,Hold a valid Australian driver’s license. This role will offer a constant stream of diverse challenges that will require you to be innovative & adaptable. Strong communication skills are required as you will deal with complex scenarios to management, clients, and your team.If you are interested in a career that will challenge and motivate you, then please get in touch.

Name: Senior Systems/Cloud Engineer - Azure
Description: The Role:  Our client is a large Education organisation on the lookout for a Senior Systems/Cloud Engineer working with Azure. $130k - $145k + Super  NFP Salary Packaging of up to $15,900 a year Sydney Based - Hybrid Working  You will be responsible for maintaining both on-premise computer server hardware/software and cloud-based workloads and providing operational management. This role is responsible for providing effective and efficient technical support to the enterprise, maintaining ICT systems, applications and systems.Your Responsibilities:  Administer and support IT systems solutions (on-premises or cloud-based) to meet service delivery requirements. Professionally and efficiently respond to ICT incidents and service requests via the ICT service management tool. Develop and maintain the ICT on-premises and cloud services operational support policies, processes and procedures. Project managing ICT systems, infrastructures and business solutions, ensuring they are supported and delivered within the agreed time, scope and budget. Actively pursue possibilities to enhance cybersecurity processes and procedures and develop business cases to present new solutions to management. Regularly audit, review and update all systems design and operation documentation.  About You:  Proven extensive hands-on experience in building and supporting enterprise on-premises or cloud-based ICT systems. Proven extensive hands-on experience in development and the operational management of the following programming languages: Powershell (Essential) Python (Desirable) JSON (Desirable) Proven extensive experience in performing server administration and operations. Practical knowledge and experience in automating solutions and migrations using code scripting. Windows Server 2012/2016

Name: Graduate Front End Software Engineer - IoT, HTML Programmer
Description: SummaryGrowth business in the Smart Building and IoT spaceRapidly evolving industryFun flexible work environment Permanent position About UsAt Edge Semantics we create software that assembles unconnected building data to unlock operational efficiency and provide insightful analytics for our clients. Edge Semantics was born to fill a gap within the Smart Building industry where traditional software solutions required substantial human resourcing to deploy and maintain. Our integrated data platform, Annexx, was developed with Semantic Web Technology and is a solution that normalises disparate data and automatically builds dynamic visual displays on request.    **www.edgesemantics.com** Why Edge Semantics?We work in an environment where initiative is encouraged and excellence is rewarded. We believe that an innovative and inquiring approach is the best way to address our clients' challenges. Our team is the core of our business and it’s our objective to create one of the best places to work in Melbourne. We accomplish this by giving our team ownership and autonomy. Empowering our team to achieve their individual and collective potential is our highest priority. Our company is in a period of extreme growth, with many opportunities for career progression as our solutions continue to impress our clients and win over the market.Other perks we provide are aimed to facilitate a positive work environment, lifestyle balance and help combat burnout during these difficult times:Flexible working hoursWorking from home/office support including home office equipmentTeam events; Grand Prix, Lawn Bowls, Golf, lunches/dinners etcWe prioritise our team’s growth and learning by establishing individual personal development programs.About the RoleWe are seeking a graduate front-end software developer to work within our Melbourne-based team developing, testing, and maintaining our innovative Building Technology software products. What you will need:Strong problem-solving skillsA qualification in Software engineering, programming, computer science or equivalentProficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Nodejs, HTML5 & CSSOther desirable skills include experience with:SQLJavaJDBCGitjQueryMongoDbGraphDb / SPARQL / RDFCloud solutionsCybersecurityWhat you will bring:A positive can-do attitudeAn inquiring mind that drives you to learn and challenge yourselfPride in your workSound time and task management skillsHigh level of attention to detailAbility to collaborate effectively within a teamStrong written and verbal communication skillsIf you would like to contribute to a team delivering truly innovative solutions, work on a diverse range of projects and technologies under a positive and inclusive work environment, you should apply.

Name: Senior ICT Engineer – Smart Buildings
Description: Communities are fundamental. Whether around the corner or across the globe, they provide a foundation, a sense of place and of belonging. That's why at Stantec, we always design with community in mind.We care about the communities we serve—because they're our communities too. We're designers, engineers, scientists, and project managers, innovating together at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships. Balancing these priorities results in projects that advance the quality of life in communities across the globe.Stantec are proud to be recognised as an employer of choice by WORK180Significant forward workload on challenging and exciting projectsOpportunities that come with working for a Global Consulting firmAbout the role:Our Smart Buildings section is seeking a Senior Information and Communications Technologies (ICT) Engineer to contribute to the growth and success of the Smart Buildings team. Modern and advanced, Smart building technologies are creating a safer, more sustainable, cost efficient and resilient built environment and driving enhanced user experience.Smart Buildings put people and experiences first; transforming property into a flexible live-work-play space, adaptable to the needs of its users through data-driven insights. Defined as the interface between the infrastructure, building systems and technologies deployed, a well-executed smart buildings strategy tailors the outcomes to the people, spaces and activities within a building. Our approach focuses on delivering value-based, advanced technology design. We take a pragmatic approach to ensure buildability and performance, including measuring your sustainability and wellness goals. Smart technologies in buildings can serve as the frontline of defence in cybersecurity, protecting your assets. We see Smart Buildings as the catalyst to visualise, analyse and progressively enhance the effectiveness of your business investment.Building automation, access control, video surveillance, audiovisual and many other systems must be interconnected over a robust and reliable infrastructure to enable communication and interoperability between systems. Join us in designing innovative solutions that will shape the way buildings are maintained and operated.In this role, you will be part of a dynamic multi-disciplinary team responsible for the advisory and design of advanced technologies in modern, smart and iconic projects throughout Australia. The successful candidate will be responsible for ensuring coordination with other disciplines and meeting client needs.Day to day tasks would involve:Provide design support in ICT for our various offices and projects across Australia for the design of local area networks (LAN), including racks, network devices, containment, cabling and physical spaces.Contribute to the design of various ICT systems, including access control, security, video surveillance, wireless coverage, audio-visual, building automation, guard calls and public calls systems.Prepare technical documents for planning, preparation of specifications and drawings, calling of tenders and providing construction service support including testing and commissioning.Maintain strong customer relationships for the execution of projects and participate in business development.Support other Project Engineer’s in completing projects in terms of program, profitability, technical risk management and overall Client satisfaction.Provide support and mentoring to Junior staff membersSupport clients and internal customers on technical queriesTo be successful for this role you'll need:Bachelor's degree in Engineering or equivalent training in networking and computer science.RCDD, CCNA or CISSP certifications are considered an asset. Experience in the design of physical infrastructure and network cabling (telecommunications rooms, server rooms, cable tray, interconnection, etc.)Experience in designing or implementing service of one of the following systems: DAS, wireless coverage, real-time location, VoIP, public call, intercom and building automation.General understanding of network protocols and concepts (IP addressing, subnet masks, VLAN, link aggregation, DHCP protocol, etc.).Strong knowledge of industry codes and standards (AS/NZ, IEC, ANSI / TIA, BICSI, IEEE, CSA, OBC, NBC).Excellent written and verbal communication skillsAble to innovate based on customer and industry requirements Positive, can-do attitudeAbility to prioritise workloads to meet deadlinesWhat we offerAlong with a competitive salary we offer many other benefits to ensure your professional development & wellbeing is ongoing.Genuine Flexible Working Arrangements - Including work from home opportunities, provision for school term contracts, job sharing and part time employment.Option to purchase up to 4 weeks additional leave.Learning and Talent Development Programs - Including Global programmes, online learning and on-the-job learningMentoring for your own development and the opportunity to mentor othersA friendly team environment, with dedicated and enthusiastic staff committed to producing high quality service and deliverablesProfessional MembershipsSalary Continuance Insurance (SCI) Mental Health and Wellbeing Programs Service Recognition AwardsEmployee Assistance ProgramAbout StantecThe Stantec community unites approximately 25,000 employees working in over 400 locations across six continents. We collaborate across disciplines and industries to bring buildings, energy, resources, water, environmental, transport and infrastructure projects to life.Our work from initial project concept and planning through design, construction, and commissioning begins at the intersection of community, creativity, and client relationships.How to applyIf this position is of interest, please apply via the link below. Please note that no agency applications will be accepted at this time.

Name: Financial Accountant
Description: We are seeking a Financial Accountant to join our APAC regional accounting team. The Financial Accountant role is responsible for a broad range of duties, primarily statutory compliance and reporting, management reporting, maintenance of a strong internal control environment and business support. This role forms an integral part of our APAC Finance team and reports to the Finance Manager.As the Financial Accountant you'll be responsible for: Maintaining, interpreting, and reporting of timely and accurate financial dataPreparation of monthly and quarterly management accounts including meaningful variance analysisPreparation of Balance Sheet reconciliations and resolution of action itemsSupporting the annual statutory audit and financial statement preparation process under IFRSSupporting the risk management process through compliance with corporate governance and the maintenance of a strong internal control environmentAssisting with the review of cross-border transactions, ensuring compliance with Transfer Pricing proceduresPreparation of GST / PAYG/ FBT and Payroll Tax returnsMaintaining the Fixed Asset Register, including review of system depreciation calculations, impairment testing, disposals, and reportingImplementation of best practices and process improvements within the departmentOther duties as requested by the Finance Manager including cover during periods of high-workloads and absencesThe ideal candidate: Degree in accounting, business, or commerceProfessional accounting qualification such as CA or CPAMethodical, diligent, accurate and accountableAudit background and experience is preferredAbility to challenge the status quo and drive improvement through changeStrong organisational skills and ability to multi-task and deliver high-quality work to deadlinesExcellent problem-solving and analytical thinking skillsAbility to interface and communicate cross functionally and with stakeholders at all levelsExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExperience with multi-currency reporting is desirableWhy join us?We’re fast thinking. We go big to reach our cyberattack-disrupting goals. And we do what we need to protect the world of business from getting important (and potentially compromising) data stolen. We never leave anyone behind. We deliver quickly – and outstandingly. We’re big on honesty because it makes us better. We’re empowered by our mission. And if cybercriminals have a good day, we work twice as hard to make the rest of their days a nightmare. That’s The Mimecast Way.Other perks of joining the team!Free leave days between Christmas and New YearsFlexible working arrangements supporting work-life balance  Paid Parental Leave Program Employee Assist Support Health Insurance reimbursement Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program that supports global and local initiatives via fundraising, volunteering and community engagement, with 5 paid volunteer days per year & donation matching DEI StatementCybersecurity is a community effort. That’s why we’re committed to building an inclusive, diverse community that celebrates and welcomes everyone – unless they’re a cybercriminal, of course.We’re proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer, and we’d encourage you to join us whatever your background. We particularly welcome applicants from traditionally underrepresented groups.We consider everyone equally: your race, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, ability, marital status, nationality or any other protected characteristic won’t affect your application.

Name: Senior Cyber Specialist: Assurance Services
Description:
About the Role We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Cyber Specialist to join our sophisticated, multi-disciplinary, cyber security team and contribute to keeping the University’s digital assets safe from unauthorised access. The Senior Cyber Specialist: Assurance Services will be part of a larger group that is responsible for the comprehensive cyber defence of UniSA’s digital assets. The role has overall technical leadership and responsibility for developing and implementing a proactive and comprehensive program of cyber assurance services activities across the University’s entire IT environment. You will use your considerable expertise to gather, identify and manage cyber risk, governance, and compliance. Your technical expertise and up to date knowledge of cyber security trends will see you identify risks and work with other key specialists to ensure compliance with cyber security best practice. You will also contribute to the leadership of the team and have operational and project responsibilities to ensure effective cyber security operation and service delivery for the University. About UniSA Information Strategy and Technology Services (ISTS)The University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. We are South Australia’s largest university and one of the very best young universities in the world. At UniSA, we are authentic, resilient, and influential - and we deliver results. We pride ourselves on our dynamic and agile culture, which embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Plus, we are committed to the principles of excellence and equity.The Information Strategy and Technology Services (ISTS) team provides primary strategic and operational responsibility for UniSA’s considerable IT infrastructure and services. The Cyber Security team works with a wide range of stakeholders across the University to ensure all staff are aware of cyber security issues and good cybersecurity practice and are storing and managing data in accordance with the University’s data classification policy.We have a commitment to staff development and provide a professional environment in which to work.Core Responsibilities

Lead the design and implementation of a proactive and comprehensive governance, risk, and assurance program of cyber related activities across the University’s entire IT environment
Ensure compliance, review and enforcement of the UniSA security framework mapping with NIST and ISM for defence-based process
Preparation of IT cyber compliance reports, key risk indicators and key performance indicator dashboards for management review
Conduct cyber related audit and compliance activities in order to safeguard the University’s digital environment
Work with key stakeholders to ensure IT Cyber governance

Essential Skills and Experience

Relevant qualifications or demonstrated equivalent knowledge, experience and skills and a commitment to ongoing professional development
Comprehensive experience in cyber security in a complex organisation comparable with the University
Extensive experience in cyber security governance, risk and compliance and assurance 
Experience in developing policy and provision of advice in relation to cyber security best practice, standards, process, and guidelines in a complex IT environment 
Comprehensive understanding and application of security principles and risk management frameworks

Benefits Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as: 

Generous superannuation contributions of 17% 
Flexible working conditions 
Employee assistance and development programs 
Corporate health insurance 
A variety of leave arrangements

CultureAs a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results. How to Apply For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.  Please address your cover letter to Jessica Frisari, Recruitment Consultant. For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 1700 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4208. Applications close: 11.30pm Monday 27 June 2022 Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment. #LI-DNI

Name: Modern Workplace Support Consultant
Description: Service Desk /IT Support Analyst (L1/L2). Join a modern workplace solutions provider to provide proactive IT services to small and medium sized business clients. Up to $70kAre you a highly motivated go-getter with an entrepreneurial spirit?Do you enjoy a mixture of working remotely and on site with flexible hours? We are building a modern experience team, delivering game changing digital solutions to our customers. MODEX is a digital-first, modern workplace solutions provider focused on helping customers make the most of leading edge technologies to improve the way they work, turning IT into business value. Our approach is to develop a strategic partnership with our customers, understanding their business to become their IT team, helping them achieve their goals. About YouTo be successful in this position, you have proven customer service experience and knowledge of the Microsoft 365 suite. You are driven, passionate in developing customer relationships and have a genuine desire to help people with technology. You have outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, and are committed to providing proactive outcomes through ownership and team collaboration. You are a forward thinker and a positive individual with the ability to think outside-the-box and see the big picture. You pride yourself in delivering exceptional customer-first results. Key ResponsibilitiesBe the problem solving champion for our customers’ IT needsHelp our customers make the most of their modern workplace technologies to improve the way their business worksBe a subject matter expert aligning to modern workplace, cloud technologiesDesign solutions leveraging Microsoft 365 and AzureHelp our customers migrate applications and data to the cloudTake ownership of incidents, problems and changes and follow through to resolutionProactively seek continuous improvement across our customers’ IT services and our ownHelp our customers get up and running themselves by contributing to our end user self-help portalOptimise resolution of common tasks through documentation and automationManage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure and proactively ensure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availabilityCommunicate proactively and effectively with customers, partners and internal staffContribute to our technical blogging and other marketing initiativesProactively assist and mentor other team members in meeting deadlines, setting client expectations and jointly developing technical skills Skills and ExperienceHighly motivated, result-driven entrepreneurial attitudeCalm and reliableExcellent problem solving skillsHave a challenger mindset – always identify new and better ways of doing things, challenge the status-quoGreat ability to build relationships with internal and external stakeholdersAble to work autonomously and as part of a team to achieve desired outcomesExcellent collaboration skills, well-organised, flexible, proactive with a high attention to detailArticulate and can communicate effectively in written and verbal form to both colleagues and customersExperience in a customer service roleCertification in MS-900 Microsoft 365 Fundamentals (favourable)At least 1 year experience in a technical support or service provider environment using the following modern workplace technologies: Microsoft 365 – Specifically Exchange Online, Endpoint Manager, Teams and Azure ADWindows 10 SupportWindows Server managementUnderstanding of the following core networking concepts and technologies:Firewall managementNetworking and TCP/IP management, DNS and Domain managementBasic knowledge of cybersecurity principlesSolid documentation skillsStrong time management skills – ability to multitask, set priorities and meet deadlines Join the MODEX team!!Great opportunity to get into an exciting startup and be part of our exponential growthWork remotely and flexiblyYour role is what you make of it, going above and beyond will always be rewarded

Name: Senior Lecturer, Lecturer, Casual Lecturer
Description: The CompanyThe Australian Institute of Higher Education (AIH) is now actively seeking experienced and enthusiastic Senior Lecturer (Contract) and Lecturers (Contract and Casual) for our to collaboratively work within, support, and contribute to the Masters and Undergraduate Programs of Business Information Systems at our Sydney campus. The Australian Institute of Higher Education has been operating for more than 9 years and is located in the Sydney CBD.  Since its establishment, AIH has grown to 1,500 students from 30+ nationalities and is committed to teaching with innovative models and excellence, providing a comprehensive set of courses offering Undergraduate Certificates, HE Diplomas, Associate Degrees, Bachelors and Masters Degrees.The RoleAIH invites applications for the positions of Senior Lecturer, Lecturer and Casual Lecturer.  Appointments are expected to commence in July 2022, or as negotiated with the successful candidates.  The appointed candidates will support, with scholarly experience and knowledge, our accredited Bachelor of Business Information Systems and Master of Business Information Systems (MBIS General, MBIS Cybersecurity and MBIS Data Analytics). For more information about the courses, please visit the AIH website.As teaching-focused members of staff, the holders of the positions will be responsible for the academic oversight of all allocated unit aspects either in the Bachelor and/or Master programs. This includes the academic quality both in discipline-specific knowledge and skills and the pedagogy, development, alignment of learning outcomes, learning activities, delivery and assessment of the units.We are ideally seeking a Senior Lecturer with a strong background in Data Science or Cyber Security, and Lecturers and Casual Lecturers in all areas of Business Information Systems including the above mentioned areas.Key responsibilities of the Lecturer position include:Prepare, coordinate and deliver workshops and practical classes as required and engage the interest and enthusiasm of students, encouraging them to learn.Ensure that content, methods, and delivery of learning materials meet the defined learning objectives for a unit of study.Select appropriate assessment instruments and criteria, assess the work and progress of students by reference to the criteria, with guidance, providing constructive feedback to students.Provide unit or course coordination and advising.Appreciate the needs of individual students and their circumstances, through use of listening, interpersonal and pastoral care skills to deal with sensitive issues, referring students to appropriate services for further help as necessary.Monitoring and acting on student feedback, participation, academic progress and attendance.Participate in academic course meetings.Provide collation, moderation and submission of results and finalisation of grades, extensions, reviews and instances of academic misconduct.Provide assessments results and reports for Board of Examiners Committee.Demonstrate maintenance of disciplinary knowledge through relevant scholarly activity.Support strategies and follow a culture of compliance to the Institute’s policies and procedures in the discipline area.Ensure academic Integrity in delivery of unit content and student interactions.Contribute to a safe and supportive environment at the Institute.Demonstrated commitment to cultural diversity and ethical practice principles and demonstrated knowledge of equal employment opportunity and workplace health and safety, appropriate to the level of the appointment.Key responsibilities of the Senior Lecturer position include:All key responsibilities of the Lecturer Position.Provide leadership in discipline area of the course.Assist Program Manager with the quality of teaching and learning. Reflect on our current practices and implemented innovative strategies to improve quality.Maintain engagement with external stakeholders relevant to the work integrated learning program.Conduct general administration, as and when required.Required Lecturer Essential Criteria:Hold a PhD in business information systems (or related discipline) from an accredited institution.  Knowledge and expertise in Data Science or Cyber security is advantageous.Demonstrated evidence of, or capacity to, undertake high quality teaching in tertiary environment in a broad area of subjects, including involvement in unit coordination and curriculum design.Demonstrated exemplary record of teaching, especially in a blended and online environment.Demonstrated excellent communication and interpersonal skills with an ability to foster a scholarly and cooperative teaching and learning environment.Demonstrated high-level computer skills including the use of learning management systems, spreadsheets and word-processing.Demonstrated ability to deal effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds.Demonstrated ability to review and amend course content to be aligned with the AQF requirements.Australian FULL work rights are essential. Professional or hands on industry experience is advantageous.Demonstrated excellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skills, including the demonstrated ability to establish effective relationships with staff, students, and industry.Supporting students with academic and/or other challenges impeding their academic progress and demonstrated ability to deal effectively with individuals from diverse backgrounds.Ability to work effectively in a business and academic environment and ability to lead and motivate others.Excellent organisational skills and demonstrated high-level computer skills including the use of learning management systems, spreadsheets and word-processing.Possess strong ethics regarding the delivery of quality education.Desirable Criteria:Membership and ongoing engagement with the Australian Computer Society (ACS) or an equivalent professional association.Formal qualifications in teaching or management at a tertiary level (e.g. Graduate Certificate in Tertiary Teaching)Relevant industry experience.Required Senior Lecturer Qualifications:All Lecturer requirements stated above.PhD is preferred in Data Science or Cyber security.Experience at teaching at tertiary institutions for least five years.Demonstrated experience in general knowledge of the units in the area of Business Information Systems.Ability to lead and motivate others.Applications should include a cover letter specifying what position you are applying for, brief response to required criteria, and curriculum vitae (current). Applications must be submitted in the form of one PDF/MS Word file. Please forward applications electronically to:A/Prof. Dr. Cesar Sanin, Program Manager Business Information Systems, AIH.c.sanin@aih.nsw.edu.auApplications are received until positions are filled.

Name: Software Engineer
Description:
Software EngineerCloud Services CompanyFlexible Working environmentMelbourne Location - Remote Working Opportunity
SXiQ is a fast paced, high energy, Cloud Services business that works across a range of industries with leading Australian organisations. Operating across a variety of technical environments, we partner with both AWS and Microsoft to provide both cloud-in-a-box and hybrid cloud solutions through intelligent cloud orchestration and interconnectivity.
We specialise and support our clients across three pillars:Multi-Cloud ServicesDigital transformationCybersecurity
Our Mission is to help our customers unleash the immense technical and business benefits of the cloud, so they can drive faster innovation, smarter insights and disrupt their industries in ways they never imagined possible.
Our mission is ultimately about helping our customers enhance their own competitive advantages and take their digital transformation further and deeper.
Our business is growing rapidly, which has created an opportunity for experienced Software Engineer to join our team in Melbourne on a permanent full-time role. The successful candidate will be responsible for presales support to our Sales team for engaging customers around the development of solutions to address business problems
Key responsibilities:Effectively gather customer requirements in a professional and consultative manner for the purpose of proposing solutions Develop high quality customer proposals for the SXiQ sales team Follow internal governance processes to ensure proposals are aligned to the customers’ requirements, capable of being efficiently delivered and are accurately costed Ensure solutions are aligned to SXiQ vendor partners and architectural patterns Prepare and present solutions to key decision makers Work with other presales staff across different technology domains to develop broader customer solutions Ability to compare different solution options for customers, against their business requirements, and provide recommendations Perform Design and Implementation activities for our CMO on specific projects as required for ongoing technical training and continuity of customer relationship management Proactively contribute to the development and maturing of SXiQ service and product offerings Engage with key SXiQ vendors as part of ongoing relationship building, training certification and specific presales activities? Complete, in a timely manner, all assigned certifications necessary for SxiQ to retain relevant partner statuses with strategic vendors Completion of reports for customers in a high quality and timely manner Proactively update internal systems to effectively track and inform status of assigned tasks 
Required Skills:
Tertiary qualifications in IT or equivalent industry experience Demonstrable background working of at least 2 years in a presales and technical architecture environment Previous experience in a team lead or leadership capacity Broad exposure to multiple vendor technologies around storage/compute virtualisation hosting platforms Strong (5+ years) knowledge of common virtualised hosting solutions for on premise and cloud ? Strong analytical and Design skills Excellent written and customer presentation skills 
Desirable:
Proven cert in areas of key technical capability is highly desirable.? (Cisco, HP, Lenovo, VMware, Microsoft) Good knowledge of any of the following: 
	
Pre-sales and Design experience in Backup solutions, such as Commvault and Veeam ?Experience with pre-sales and design of converged infrastructure virtualisation solution 

 
Benefits of working at SXiQWe live our core values: Insightful, Inquisitive and IntuitiveOpportunity for career growthFlexible working arrangementsWork with industry experienced professionalsPerformance BonusProfessional DevelopmentCompany social eventsFocus on employee health and wellbeing
Interested?
Please apply using the link below or email sxiqrecruitment@sxiq.com.au

Name: Storage Engineer
Description: About the BusinessAustralia’s largest ASX listed (ASX:TNT) cybersecurity provider, Tesserent’s Secure Cloud division is an agile, and dynamic organisation delivering private, public cloud solutions along with managed services. Over the last 10 years the group has evolved into a market leader with the help of passionate, hardworking, and determined individuals. Every employee is handpicked to fit our culture, ideals, and common goal of becoming the leading secure hybrid cloud partner in Australia.About the RoleTesserent is seeking a Storage Engineer to deliver projects and operational services to key enterprise clients in the Sydney area. Reporting to the IT Infrastructure Manager, you will be responsible for designing, delivering, and management of compute infrastructure including troubleshooting and capacity planning for our growing internal enterprise and government client base. Deep technical skills in EMC are highly desirable.The successful candidate will be responsible for:Performing daily Storage SAN/NAS operational tasks, provisioning, monitoring, troubleshooting issues and initiating corrective action.Creating and updating documentation including standard operating procedures, solutions, knowledge base articles and applicable project documentation.Performing problem management and incident correlation on re-occurring issues; suggest and document workarounds and solutions.Acting as an escalation point on all storage issues.Supporting, planning, designing and delivering storage projects from detailed technical designs through implementation and handover to client technical teams. Willingness to participate in an afterhours rotating shift. The Ideal Candidate Must have current eligibility to work in AustraliaExcellent communication skills with an ability to interface with multiple layers of client organisations.Extensive experience and certification in Dell-EMC storage platforms.Strong and proven troubleshooting ability on a large scale, fast-paced operations environment.Strong Knowledge of Network attached storage and access protocols, such as SMB and NFS.Understanding of VMware and Hyper-V and their implications for storage infrastructure.Willingness to get "hands-on" with storage implementations from design and delivery through to operational handover.Willingness to undertake training and achieve vendor certifications.Reliability and commitment to getting the job done (including after hours as required).Desirable SkillsSkills in other storage and cloud technologies will be highly regardedSkills in backup and recovery solutions Strong skills in MS Excel, MS Word, MS Project, and MS PowerPointExperience with NetApp and Nutanix platforms Experience in both operations and in the delivery of infrastructure projects for mission critical environments.Benefits and perksSalary in line with industry standardsOpportunities to undertake technical training, secure industry recognised certifications, attend industry eventsRole provides an excellent opportunity to work in a fun team that continues to have exceptional success

Name: Senior Security Architect (Cyber)
Description: About usTransport for NSW keeps our State moving by providing safe, integrated and efficient transport systems. We put our customers at the centre of everything we do - and we do a lot. We connect people, communities and industry and manage how they use our road, rail and maritime networks and services, and even active modes like walking and cycling. The work we do connects the journeys you take every day.We are a state government organisation made up of more than 28,000 people and we're in the middle of delivering the largest transport infrastructure program in Australia's history. We work across planning, policy and procurement, harnessing data and technology to develop smarter and more adaptive transport solutions.That means job opportunities in metropolitan and regional areas right across NSW - you have the chance to be part of creating a lasting legacy that will benefit generations to come.  Work with one of the largest technology teams in the government sector    Be part of a $700m annual investment for progressive technology projects   Join our team and be part of our exciting business transformation    About IT at TfNSW TfNSW's IT group provides the tools, information and services that enable 30,000 employees to deliver a smart and efficient transport network. We bring the future to our people by delivering innovative solutions and minimising business disruptions, building an engaged and connected workforce through tech-enablement. This is an exciting time to join the team, with a committed annual investment of $700m for progressive technology projects including bots, apps, AI solutions, autonomous 3D mapping drones, cybersecurity and transforming cameras across our network. The opportunity Right now we have 2 new permanent, full time opportunities for Senior Security Architects (Cyber) to join our Transport Cyber Defence Team. In this highly collaborative role you will primarily develop security solutions for designated business units within the context of the overall architecture frameworks.The role partners with Project Managers, the Cyber Advisory team and key peers and stakeholder across the business to ensure effective delivery of security and technology solutions.The role acts as an important link between the business units and IT in ensuring that security solutions are designed to meet business/user requirements while also aligning to the overall IT architecture and security frameworks. Please click here to view a copy of the role description. You will:  Identify, develop and design security solutions and options for internal customers in both a project and BAU context.   Contribute to the development of security architecture patterns and ensuring alignment with the Enterprise Architecture framework and other groups across the cluster.   Provide comprehensive technical reports defining and describing the business security architecture, and the relevant methodologies and activities required for maintenance and support.   Manage complex and sensitive consultations with diverse stakeholders, within agreed timelines, varying expectations, viewpoints and interests.   About youYou are a highly collaborative professional with expertise in delivering Security Architecture solutions, business and systems requirements, and technical design and analysis in a complex and maturing technical environment.You understand business needs through your excellent stakeholder engagement, relationship building and influencing capabilities.  Analytical, pragmatic and innovative, you able to navigate and prioritise a multitude of stakeholder expectations and perspectives and are at home working in a complex and demanding matrix, organisation.You put people at the centre of every decision you make, and draw satisfaction from the knowledge that you're making a real difference working on services that connect people and communities in NSW.You can manage multiple requests and engagements concurrently, and are adept at context switching, prioritisation and working with customers to meet their needs and expectations in terms of timing and quality. Salary and BenefitsThis is a Transport Senior Service TSSM level role.For more information on employee benefits click here. How to applyTo apply for this position, please answer all questions within the online application process and submit a resume.   Applications Close: 11.59PM Wednesday 29th June 2022 We are the community we serveWe are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.We enable our people to work in ways that work for them. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations, staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options. ​For any enquiries, please email Christine Stenzel at CHRISTINE.STENZEL@TRANSPORT.NSW.GOV.AU. We're certified as a Family Inclusive WorkplaceOur flexible work practices and policies for parental leave, employee and family wellbeing and family care enable us to provide genuine support for our people to thrive at work and at home.Working with Transport gives you access to a range of benefits that help you balance work with the things that matter to you. Look through our Employee Benefits Guide to learn more. Apply today to register your interest!Find out more about Transport for NSW at https://www.transport.nsw.gov.au/about-us.Take a look at our application tips video series for plenty of great information on navigating and acing the application and recruitment process here at Transport. Our COVIDSafe Measures PolicyAll Transport for NSW workers are required to have: appropriate evidence of being fully vaccinated with a TGA approved COVID-19 vaccine; or an approved medical contraindication. You will be required to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status or apply for a medical exemption prior to securing this role.
