Name: DevSecOps Engineer
Description: Servian is an award-winning global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps, Digital, Machine Learning and Cloud. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has for us and our clients. All roles at Servian involve personal and technical development pathways which aim to facilitate your career growth.Servian is looking for dynamic individuals to join our growing Cybersecurity practice. We are looking for people who want to use their strong engineering skills to solve security challenges.Governance, risk and complianceSecurity testingSecurity and Risk assessmentsImplementation of DevSecOps delivery modelsCompliance as code design and deliveryCISO-as-a-ServiceSecurity ArchitectureCloud security posture reviewsPurpose of the role:Servian is currently recruiting for DevSecOps Engineers to be a part of the growing team in Melbourne. As part of the role you will be working on-site leading the design and implementing strategies and solutions that are required by our client with a focus on Security with DevOps. You will assist teams with incorporating security automation tooling and related security standards & processes into their DevOps practices. You’ll have a passion for learning new technologies and be an advocate for our principles of 'automate everything, infrastructure as code and collaboration between teams'. The Position:Lead the implementation of cloud solutions for clients, including infrastructure, data platforms and migration strategy.Work with clients to coach and share our solutions and approaches.Provide security automation guidance and implementation to client teams.Coach junior team members.Maintain accreditations with one or more of our key partners, AWS, Microsoft, GCP, Hashicorp and SumoLogic.Deliver training workshops and labs to our clients.Pre-sales support and solution architecture. Your experience - We’re looking for people who have the right approach and a breadth of knowledge across some of the following:Development, operations or system engineering experience.Knowledge and experience with Infrastructure as Code and configuration management.Designed, implemented and operated secure code management and build pipelines.Implemented secure CI/CD pipelines with automated deployment and management.Experience with cloud services including IaaS, PasS and SaaS.A detailed understanding of the underlying technologies and platform building blocks of the cloud environment.Strong automation and scripting experience.A drive for self-improvement and a passion for learning.An holistic approach encompassing the business goals and solution architecture whilst maintaining a secure operating posture.A dynamic approach to your work enabling you to meet the needs of changing environments.Bonus points!  If you have some experience in any of the following, it would be seen as advantageous: Experience in source code security tools, e.g. Snyk, SourceClear, Black Duck, SonarQube.Experience with SAST, DAST, RAST.Experience with compliance as code (E.g. OPA, Gatekeeper).Experience building/managing continuous compliance monitoring solutions.Experience designing/maintaining SIEM solutions (E.g. Splunk ES, Exabeam, Arcsight, Elasticsearch, Apache Metron, or something you built yourself!).Experience with secret management design and implementation.Applicable security certifications, such as CISSP, SABSA, CISM etc.We hire for mindset! If you don’t possess all of the above skills we can teach you what’s missing. So if this role resonates with you then hit that apply button!Why join Servian?Our career pathways are not a one-size fits all, we help you identify your personal and professional goals through our mentorship program. Helping you put together an action plan and keep you accountable.Growth through unlimited L&D and goal-based learning - free access to Udemy, you pass we pay model for courses and certifications, internal run boot camps and communities of practice (Machine Learning, DevOps, WebDev, Agile/Scrum Guilds)Flat Structure - No silos or departments; have the opportunity to work across various tech stacks, industries and projects. We value trust and transparency, that’s why we have an open-door policy across the business.Create your own destiny -  We support our consultant’s creativity. If you have an idea, turn it into an initiative!Flexible WFH policy - We value work-life balance, accountability and autonomy.Wellbeing & Benefits:We provide employees with Life Insurance, Income Protection Insurance and access to an Employee Assistance Program.Generous Parental leave.Substantial Referral fee. We value your opinion and want our employees to contribute to the success of Servian!Wellbeing and mental health initiatives - Yoga, Meditation, Steptember, Around the Bay.We are proud to have a sociable workplace that values diversity and celebrates achievements with quarterly company-wide events, social events and more. Think VR laser tag, wine tours and cooking classes.Monthly in-person team lunches/dinners so you can connect with your colleagues outside of work!Consultant-led initiatives to get everyone excited, which include social and tech clubs (gaming, IoT, badminton, wellbeing, whisky and wine, etc.), meetups, and cloud vendor hackathons.Come to the tech side… we have cookies! APPLY NOW!

Name: ITC Assets and Procurement Coordinator | KU Children's Services
Description:
Who we are:
KU Children's Services (KU) is a leading not for profit provider of nearly 130 early childhood education and care services in NSW, VIC, the ACT and QLD. Established in 1895, KU is one of Australia’s most experienced and respected providers of long day care, preschool, outside school hours care, family programs and early intervention services. KU also operates brokered programs on behalf of the Commonwealth Government and provides professional services to the early childhood sector and the wider community.
The Role:
We are seeking an appropriately qualified and experienced ITC Asset and Procurement Coordinator within KU Children’s Services ITC Support team on a permanent full-time basis accruing a monthly RDO. This position is based out of our newly renovated, sun lit central office - opposite the QVB on York Street, Sydney. The office is only a very short walk from Town Hall train station.
The ITC Assets and Procurement Coordinator is the primary point of contact for KU staff who require ITC hardware to be quoted, procured, asset tagged, entered, and allocated into the asset register, and ultimately despatched to the user. You will work collaboratively with the ITC Support team, and a range of internal and external stakeholders, to deliver ITC assets and services to our customer base.
The main responsibilities of this role are:
Support the strategic direction of the organisation and KU business goals by meeting all service delivery standards developed by the Manager ITC and ITC Team Leader & Cybersecurity Analyst
Reviews financial reports to find ways to reduce costs of goods and services consumed by KU
Provide timely and customer focused support for all ITC procurement requests within agreed timescales and in line with KU IT&T policies and procedures
With approval, compiles and presents asset management reports as requested to customers, managers and senior executives
Coordinate the work of external service providers in responding to user requests, tracking and escalating where necessary to ensure that orders are completed within agreed timelines
Demonstrate respect for KU staff and external service providers by communicating clearly in writing, electronically and verbally to ensure high standards of customer service are maintained
Participate fully as a member of ITC Support team and other relevant KU teams
Ensure that the principles of anti-discrimination, WHS, anti-modern slavery and ethical practices are applied in all aspects of the position

What we're looking for
Someone who has a strong understanding of MICROSOFT 365 products eg, InTune and Azure AD
Has at least 2+ years’ experience working in ITC whilst employed in the areas of asset management and procurement with exposure to SharePoint, OneDrive, Power Bi and Power Apps
Demonstrable ability to prioritise user requests and tasks
Ability to deal with users at any level of KU who have varied experience levels
Understanding of the need to follow organisation standards, policies and procedures
Willingness and aptitude to learn new technology skills
Good level of problem-solving ability
Good verbal, electronic and written communication skills
Current Australian driver’s license
The preferred candidate will be required to undertake a Working with Children check
Demonstrated ability to follow policies in respect of anti-discrimination, WHS and ethical practices issues in the workplace

The KU Difference:
We Reward - We offer sector leading pay and benefits including salary packaging and discounted private health insurance
We Build Careers - We enable and encourage our people to grow and evolve with us
We Grow Our People - We provide opportunities to learn, grow and enhance your professional practice through KU’s high quality professional learning program
We Offer an Inclusive Culture - We have created a diverse and inclusive working culture with a shared vision and common values

COVID19 Vaccination
At KU, the safety and wellbeing of our employees, the children in our care and their families remains our highest priority. This is at the forefront of all that we do, and we welcome applications from candidates who share this spirit. It is a condition of employment that KU staff members are required to hold, at a minimum, their initial two COVID-19 vaccinations
Unlocking Endless Possibilities
KU has been awarded Employer of Choice each year since 2016, and is committed to continuing the development of a workplace culture of inclusion and diversity. We actively promote the employment of people from across the spectrum of society
We encourage all applicants with skills and/or experience relevant to the position to apply, regardless of individual differences such as age, colour, religion, gender, sexual identification or orientation, or ethnic origin – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, members of culturally and linguistically diverse communities and people with disabilities
We invite you to communicate to us your individual needs in relation to the application process. This allows KU to adapt its recruitment processes to address your specific physical or cultural requirements
How do you apply?
If the above resonates with you and you feel you can positively contribute and lead this close-knit team, please click the 'apply now' button to be taken to the application form!
For inquiries, contact Anthony, HR Generalist via careers@ku.com.au or on 0418 299 494 (please note: applications are not accepted via this email)
KU Children’s Services is committed to being a child safe organisation. We put children’s safety and wellbeing at the centre of our practices. Child safety is a shared responsibility across the organisation. All KU staff contribute to maintaining our child safe culture and ensuring the safety and wellbeing of the children in our services and programs. KU has a zero tolerance of harm or abuse of children.
APPLICATIONS CLOSE: Sunday 26th June 2022 and must include a cover letter addressing key selection criteria - All applications will be reviewed at this time.

Name: Security Technician
Description: Due to growth nationally, we are seeking Security Technicians from all levels of experience.COVID has taught us to consider what is really important. Be valued, have purpose and make a difference.With over twenty years of experience, Secom Technical Services, designs installs and maintains complete electronic and cybersecurity requirements for the Australian market.If you are alleged to our TECH Values we want to hear from you.Trustworthy: Delivering quality work reliably to completionEffective: Solid desire to consistently achieve the best possible outcomeCollaborative: True interest in working together to drive improved business outcomesHonesty: Always show ethical integrity through your work and behaviourEmployee BenefitsCompany Vehicle or Car allowance with Novated Lease OptionsPower Tools providedPhone or sim, and LaptopPetrol CardEtagExternal training paid by the business; Project Management or Cyber Security DegreeSocial Team Building EventsFamily Fun DaysMentoring ProgramLeadership Program delivered by Sydney Swans Psychological CoachWhat’s it like working at Secom you ask??‘Our team is supported to do our best every day by our leader. He does this with his enthusiasm for his role, and his availability to talk about jobs, clients, or any questions/problems that we have. He ensures we have a great team culture!’ (Senior Security Technician, NSW)‘My supervisor instantly made me feel like I was working with a friend instead of just a boss. He goes above and beyond every day for his technicians and does anything he can to provide great support, ideas and comradery.’(Security Technician ACT)About you:High standard of ethics and you are aligned with our TECH ValuesQuality trade skills and you love tinkering with electronicsCurrent or ability to obtain a ACT/NSW Security LicenceCurrent or ability to obtain an Australian Government Security ClearanceCurrent drivers’ licenceCurrent or ability to obtain a cabling licenceCurrent Construction or ability to obtain a white cardCurrent or ability to obtain Asbestos Awareness cardStrong communication and stakeholder engagement skillsStrong attention to detail/situational awarenessObtains or ability to obtain an AGSVA ClearanceDesirable:Cert 3 or undergoing Cert 3 qualification in electrical, security or allied industries and/or trade based experienceAbility to program/commission security systems such as GallagherAbility to perform basic ICT networking3 or more years experienceFault identification, isolation, repair and reporting on systems installed and managed by Secom and other Security companies in the industrySound skills in electronic data and documentation managementVery effective report writing both technical and non-technicalStrong ability to perform cabling, fit off (including panels) and commissioning of electronic security systemsStrong ability to create engineering documentation including Cable Schedules and For Construction DrawingsIt's time for a change; join a global organisation that supports you like family.https://www.secomts.com  https://www.linkedin.com/company/secom-technical-services-pty-ltd/posts/?feedView=all&viewAsMember=true Please call our HR Manager, Lisa Sutton to have a confidential conversation ​02 5115 0635 or simply apply now.Master Security Licence NSW:  409829990

Name: Major Incident Specialist
Description: Green Light Worldwide’s Delivery Team are looking for a Major Incident Specialist. Major Incident Specialist who is comfortable communicating with a wide range of internal and external customers, Problem Management, Service Delivery Management and many more. The role will involve shift work and will involve working in a fast paced environment. This role will drive restoration, recovery and review of major incidents based on an ITIL based incident management process, resulting in better service-related outcomes and optimized availability for customers. ResponsibilitiesOverseeing the major incident management process and matrix-management of team members involved in the prompt resolution of major incidents.Producing documents that outline Major incident procedures, such as how & when to escalate, communication plans, handling of cybersecurity threats or how to correct server failures.Collaborating with the incident and problem management teams to ensure that all processes are diligently followed.Ensuring all administration and reports are maintained and up-to-date, including contact information, technical diagrams, Post Incident Reviews (PIRs), and raising incident, problem and change records for Major Incident resolution.Being accountable for resolving major incidents via a workaround or permanent fix, as well as following-up on any resulting permanent resolution of Problems or documented Known Errors.Guiding and adjusting the incident management process as required to ensure its effectiveness and efficiency in the swift resolution of major incidents and problems.Manage an ongoing program with the client and delivery teams to identify and implement service improvement initiatives.Staying on top of resolution processes and initiative  Core SkillsDemonstrated experience in IT Support Service ManagementProblem-solving approachGood reporting skills (written and statistical)Excellent verbal/written communication skills/ customer service skillsExperience working within an ITIL frameworkSecurity Clearance NV1 is mandatory – as the role is with the federal government.Green Light is one of Australia's most successful and fastest growing IT services businesses. We offer a wide range of IT services in Security, infrastructure and Systems Integration to a diverse customer base throughout Australia, New Zealand, SE Asia and Europe.

Name: Instructional Recruiter
Description: What We’re Looking For:2U is a global, US based company with a local office situated in Byron Bay. We provide 6 month bootcamp courses spanning Data Analytics, Web Development, UX/UI, FinTech and Cybersecurity. These courses are delivered through our university partners in Sydney, Melbourne, Perth and Adelaide. 2U is one of the fastest growing tech education providers globally, offering an alternative way to study outside of a traditional learning landscape for working professionals looking to expand their skill set.What you’ll doThe internal Full Cycle Recruiter owns the talent acquisition process of strategic sourcing for tech professionals with a natural aptitude for sharing knowledge and converting them into teachers. You’ll build strong relationships with candidates in our talent pool and take a consultative approach in finding the right fit for each cohort. You’ll be liaising with internal stakeholders to deliver a high caliber of candidates to meet both the university partner and 2U’s’s standards. You’ll drive engagement of passive candidates, facilitate pipeline progression, and successfully manage the final steps to land the preferred candidate, including offer extension and negotiation.In addition, you'll participate in product launch initiatives or special projects that focus on delivering improvements in the department’s processes, tools, and technology to support the work.Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited To:Conducting initial phone interviews, facilitating the talent evaluation process, and managing the candidate relationship and offer process.Strategically sourcing for talent in the market and reaching out to passive candidates.Continuous improvement against core recruiting and hiring metrics such as candidate response rates, sourcing efficiency, hiring lead time, time to fill, candidate conversion rates, etcParticipate in workforce planning for current and future talent needs.Develop and implement local market talent engagement strategies.Develop and implement referral generation strategies, leveraging existing instructional team members, university resources, corporate partnerships, industry relationships, etc.Maintain industry and market awareness in terms of hiring/salary trends, competitive insight and challenges.Things That Should Be In Your Background:1-2 years recruitment experience preferred, however transferrable skills will be considered.Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment managing a high number of requisitions.Self-starter, fast learner, who has the ability to speak the language of the tech industry.Adaptable, flexible, and able to pivot when the business priorities shift.Nice to have: proficiency with Google Suites tools, Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) and CRM platforms such as Salesforce and Greenhouse.Nice to have: proficiency with recruiting platforms such as LinkedIn Recruiter and SeekAbout 2U Inc. (NASDAQ: TWOU)2U is comprised of 3 lines of business: Graduate Degree Programs, Short Course, and Boot Camps. Going beyond traditional learning management systems, we use tech, people, and data to help top universities and enterprise organizations transform in the digital era—and eliminate the back row in higher ed. We support lifelong learning which means thinking beyond a single degree. It means finding ways for students to gain the skills they need to change careers, evolve their expertise, and meet the challenges of the changing world head-on. We help our partners fill those needs—developing new digital education technologies and offerings capable of supporting students at different points in their lives. Whether they need a simple refresher, to learn something new, or to change their career trajectories completely, our partners are there to help them succeed. Together with our partners, 2U has positively transformed the lives of more than 275,000 students and lifelong learners. 2U Diversity and Inclusion StatementAt 2U, we are committed to creating and sustaining a culture that embodies diverse walks of life, ideas, genders, ages, races, cultures, sexual orientations, abilities and other unique qualities of our employees. We strive to offer a workplace where every employee feels empowered by the ways in which we are different, as well as the ways in which we are the same. Benefits & CultureYou’ll hear all about the tangible impact of bootcamp programs and success stories of students reaching their goals. Whether that is shifting out of their current career into their first role in the tech industry, or gaining more tools under their belt to grow in their current job, you’ll see firsthand how this role will change lives and create opportunities. On top of this, you’ll be working in a tight knit, supportive team across Australia and the US, who value the connections they build with colleagues and our students alike. Your role will be remote or split between WFH and the Byron office, which has cafes, boutique stores, table tennis and a pool.To learn more, visit 2U.com. #NoBackRowNote: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by individuals assigned to this position, and are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required. All employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.2U is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against applicants or employees and ensures equal employment opportunity for all persons regardless of their race, creed, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, age, marital status, disability, citizenship, military or veterans’ status, or any other classifications protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. 2U’s equal opportunity policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, job benefits and pay.

Name: Cyber Security Lead
Description: Steadfast was founded on the belief that a network of brokers would be stronger together, and this idea has been the backbone of our culture ever since. We believe that none of us is as good as all of us. At Steadfast we are proud of our diverse mix of people and skills, coming together across multiple business and business units to not only support our broker network, but to create the next generation thinking, systems and technologies that will drive the insurance sector forward. We are leaders of the general insurance broking and underwriting industry, and we lead from the front.  A bit about our opportunitySteadfast is a progressive organisation that offers diverse roles and learning opportunities. Don’t be fooled by our size – Steadfast is an exciting business that operates in an agile and collaborative way. Our continued success reflects our ability to work towards the big picture to evolve our industry as well as our ability to deliver in the today’s highly competitive environment.   The Head of Cybersecurity is accountable for defining the Cyber security strategy and managing its implementation to protect Steadfast from security threats and bad actors. You will ensure Information Security practices and controls are aligned to business criticality and information sensitivity of IT systems.This remote working role is open to candidates across Australia.  In this role, you will:Provide expert guidance and counsel on cyber security, operational and strategic risk management to key business stakeholders including the Executive Leadership team and board.Work closely with the Chief Risk Officer and M&A team in assessing cyber risk.Develop the cyber security strategy that is aligned to priorities and strategic objectives.Design, implement and maintain cyber platforms and processesDevelop, implement, and maintain a governance program across cyber, data and technology risks. Facilitate information security risk assessment and risk management processes across Steadfast entities.Conduct investigations after breaches or incidents, including impact analysis and recommendations for avoiding similar vulnerabilities.Create and oversee information security awareness training programs with defined metrics to track competency and effectiveness across different audiences.Develop timely and actionable cyber security reporting and controls. A bit about youTo be successful in this role, you will possess:Strong experience with the following: Proven track record in developing information security policies and procedures. Strong understanding of the different occurrences of incidents, scenarios and situations, including an understanding of evolving threat tactics, techniques and procedures, the MITRE ATT&CK framework and threat modellingTechnical knowledge of cyber security domains including Azure, Microsoft 365, Compliance Manager, MCASWorking with audit teams demonstrating control evidenceOversight of day-to-day operations including anti-virus, security incident management, security information and event management (SIEM), data loss prevention (DLP), vulnerability management Demonstrated experience in endpoint analysis Knowledge and experience in performing malware analysis The successful candidate will also possess the following skills:Minimum 5 years of cyber security operations experienceDemonstrated experience in implementing, maintaining and improving information security risk management systems in alignment with ISO 27001Excellent analytical skills and the ability to manage multiple projects under strict timelines Knowledge and awareness of trends, developments and innovations in information and cyber data securityHold or be working towards pursuing certification such as CISSP, CISMA degree in Computer Science, Business and/or a post graduate degree would be advantageous but not essential. BenefitsWe offer an extensive range of benefits to reflect the value we place on our team whilst supporting them in their professional and personal lives. As a Steadfast employee you will benefit from and have access to:Flexible working to help you balance work and personal responsibilitiesCareer enhancement and development opportunities through our technical and well-defined Leadership Pathway which utilises best in class programs through Xplore and Korn Ferry. Free company provided Life, Temporary Permanent Disablement, Salary Continuance and Travel insurances, plus access to other discounted insurances.An expansive Health and Wellbeing program, which includes annual free health checks, annual free skin checks, Flu shots, holistic support and advice, discounted gym membership, exercise events & challenges and confidential counselling.Discounts on travel, hotels, hire cars, electronic and vehicle packages through our various partners.Working in a vibrant and collegiate culture where you as a person, and your contribution is valued.A bit about us At Steadfast, we provide valuable opportunities to build meaningful career opportunities alongside some of the brightest and most influential people in the insurance industry. We are proud of our diverse mix of people and skills, coming together across multiple businesses and business units to foster next generation thinking, systems and technologies that will drive the insurance sector forward. Diversity and our Social Responsibility is at the heart of our business and we reflect this in our actions. We have strong commitments to equality; an active D&I committee and our Reconciliation Action Plan provides opportunities for First Nation peoples to work and grow. We are major sponsors of the Dive In festival, sponsor female entrepreneurs and are active members of the Champions of Change.  In addition, our charity, The Steadfast Foundation, sponsors many charities and local community initiatives. Our environmental commitment includes the sponsorship of our Sustainability Ambassador to undertake climate research and our initiatives reflect our commitment to the achievement of green and carbon offset goals.       Interested to apply or find out moreIf Steadfast and its people sounds like the type of company you are looking for and the opportunity is of interest to you, please click on the link to apply today!We are always on the lookout for great talent, if you are interested in a confidential conversation regarding career opportunities please email Careers@steadfast.com.auVaccination Status - To ensure the health, safety and wellbeing of our people and visitors, Steadfast requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Confirmation of your vaccination status will be required during the recruitment process.

Name: Security Architect
Description: Servian is an award-winning global tech consultancy with a rich heritage in Data, DevOps, Digital, Machine Learning and Cloud. We embrace innovation, change, and the positive impact it has for us and our clients. All roles at Servian involve personal and technical development pathways which aim to facilitate your career growth.Servian is looking for dynamic individuals to join our growing Cybersecurity practice. We are looking for people who want to use their strong engineering skills to solve security challenges.Security testingSecurity and Risk assessmentsImplementation of DevSecOps delivery modelsCompliance as code design and deliveryCISO-as-a-ServiceSecurity ArchitectureCloud security posture reviewsThe RoleA dynamic opportunity to identify, develop and deliver Security Architecture practices across our client base. We’re looking for people who can design and implement secure solutions, have experience across multiple technologies and have a desire to learn and mentor. This position will require you to:Lead assessment activities across a range of organisations and verticals to provide insight on current status and pathways to improvements.Lead security assessments of environment and application architecture to identify and articulate the security risk profile.Lead workshops and discussions to determine a secure solution that delivers the client’s expected outcomes.Work across on-prem and cloud environments.Deliver cloud assessment reviews to enable clients to understand their alignment to best practice, with recommendations on improvements.Maintain accreditations with one or more of our key cloud and technology partners.Deliver training workshops and labs to our staff and clients.Provide Pre-Sales Support and solution architecture to tendered offerings.Your Experience: Delivering a strong security architecture requires a breadth of experience, not all of it in the security space. We’re looking for both existing security architects, as well as those looking to move into an architecture role. We are looking for a breadth of knowledge across some of the areas outlined below:Practical experience in development, operations and/or systems engineering delivery.Experience in delivering solution, enterprise or security architectures.Strong communications and an ability to communicate issues and concerns with a range of audiences.Experience with Infrastructure as Code, configuration management and automated deployments.Business and commercial acumen, enabling a pragmatic, holistic, view of the security approach.A detailed understanding of the underlying technologies and platform building blocks of the environment.A drive for self-improvement and a passion for learning.A holistic approach encompassing the business goals and solution architecture whilst maintaining a secure operating posture.A dynamic approach to your work enabling you to meet the needs of changing environments.Whilst we are looking for a Security Architect, we value a breadth of skills and capabilities. If you have some experience in any of the following, it would be seen as advantageous:Experience with application development.Experience with cloud operations.Experience in source code security tools, e.g. Snyk, SourceClear, Black Duck, SonarQubeExperience with security build chain tooling, including SAST, DAST, RAST.Experience with compliance as code approaches.Experience building/managing continuous compliance monitoring solutions.Experience designing/maintaining SIEM solutions (ie. Splunk ES, Exabeam, Arcsight) .Experience with secret management design and implementation.Applicable security certifications, such as CISSP, SABSA, CISM etc.Why join Servian?Our career pathways are not a one-size fits all, we help you identify your personal and professional goals through our mentorship program. Helping you put together an action plan and keep you accountable.Growth through unlimited L&D and goal-based learning - free access to Udemy, you pass we pay model for courses and certifications, internal run boot camps and communities of practice (Machine Learning, DevOps, WebDev, Agile/Scrum Guilds)Flat Structure - No silos or departments; have the opportunity to work across various tech stacks, industries and projects. We value trust and transparency, that’s why we have an open-door policy across the business.Create your own destiny -  We support our consultant’s creativity. If you have an idea, turn it into an initiative!Flexible WFH policy - We value work-life balance, accountability and autonomy.Wellbeing & Benefits:We provide employees with Life Insurance, Income Protection Insurance and access to an Employee Assistance Program.Generous Parental leave.Substantial Referral fee. We value your opinion and want our employees to contribute to the success of Servian!Wellbeing and mental health initiatives - Yoga, Meditation, Steptember, Around the Bay.We are proud to have a sociable workplace that values diversity and celebrates achievements with quarterly company-wide events, social events and more. Think VR laser tag, wine tours and cooking classes.Monthly in-person team lunches/dinners so you can connect with your colleagues outside of work!Consultant-led initiatives to get everyone excited, which include social and tech clubs (gaming, IoT, badminton, wellbeing, whisky and wine, etc.), meetups, and cloud vendor hackathons.We hire for mindset! If you don’t possess all of the above skills we can teach you what’s missing. So if this role resonates with you then hit that apply button!

Name: Cloud Developers (React.JS / Node.JS / C# / AWS)
Description:
Immersive is looking for talented cloud developers to join our growing full-stack cloud section. As part of the team, you will help us develop existing and new cloud products that augment the advanced training simulators we manufacture. We are the global mining industry leader in optimising human performance through simulation, and take pride in the quality and innovation our people imbue in our products.
Our current customer-facing cloud products include:
A data aggregation platform that ingests, transforms, organises and securely hosts data and diagnostics from our simulation productsA learning management system that integrates our various training offerings (e-learning, VR, interactive missions) together into common curriculums, using industry standard protocolsAn analytical system that looks at trends in customer production, training and maintenance data to draw insights about training and coaching opportunities for customer personnelA product update distribution system
Our team also builds and supports a variety of internal-facing analytical & support applications.
What we offer
Exciting opportunities for technical mastery in many different areas related to Cloud and Data technologiesCompetitive salaries and strong opportunities for career progression in a successful, industry-leading companyEmpowerment to plan and estimate your own work, and have your ideas genuinely listened toAgile methodologies, continuous integration and no 'crunch time'Opportunity to pursue personal passion projects that contribute to the company's success with a portion of your timeA chance to have a real positive impact on the safety and efficiency of mining equipment operatorsAn excellent work-life balance and flexible work hours (including allowance to work from home)A friendly, welcoming work environment with a great culture and many social events
What you’ll be doing
In this role you will be working with our experienced, full-stack team to enhance and expand our suite of internal and customer facing cloud products. We deploy on the AWS platform and use modern web technologies including React.JS, TypeScript, Node.js, C# .NET. Our team is responsible for the whole lifecycle, from the AWS infrastructure to the API design to the front-end and Ux, and so we have plenty of opportunities to give our developers variety but also foster mastery and passion in specific areas.
Some of the exciting things our teams are doing are:
Developing ongoing improvements to the User Experience of our various web applications, including pushing adoption of React.JS across our product rangeExpanding the data we collect from our and our customer's products, then bringing it together to produce unique and valuable insightsDeveloping a consolidated identity management service across our products, supporting social login, MFA and enterprise user directory integrationAdopting infrastructure-as-code (Hashicorp Terraform) to manage our AWS cloud infrastructure, following best-practice architecture and cybersecurity standards
About you
We’re looking for developers with commercial experience who can demonstrate the skills we need in one or more of the following areas. You will start in your area of expertise and then be supported to grow your full-stack skills.
Frontend Developers (React.JS)
Good working knowledge of modern JavaScript (ES6+) / TypeScript for front-end web developmentWe use React.JS extensively, so experience with this is preferred but not essential
Backend/API Developers (C# or Node.JS)
Solid development fundamentals including OO, algorithms, data structures and API principlesGood working knowledge of one of:Modern C# web development in ASP.NETModern JavaScript (ES6+) / TypeScript development in Node.JSModern C# application development in WPF or WinForms
Cloud DevOps or DevSecOps
Good working knowledge of core AWS infrastructureWorking knowledge of scripting in modern JavaScript (ES6+) / TypeScriptWorking knowledge of cloud deployment and security principles

If your skills or experience are a bit different from the above but you think you'd be great at the role, we're keen to hear from you to learn more.
Why Immersive?
Immersive Technologies is one of the world’s most successful companies in driving continuous improvement of human performance within the mining industry. We’re part of the global Komatsu Group of companies, and are the world’s largest supplier of mining equipment simulators and simulator training services, with our solutions deployed in over 50 different counties. We have a large, Perth-based engineering group with plenty of experience and a great development culture.
We have some of the most exciting and interesting development projects in Perth, and our products make a genuine difference in the safety and performance of operators.
Immersive is committed to recruiting and maintaining a diverse and inclusive team because we strongly believe we’re more effective with people from a wide range of backgrounds and identities. We offer both full-time and part-time positions with flexible working hours because we value the importance of work-life balance. We work both from home and in our central well-equipped office with its lake views and great coffee.
We have a great group of people who work together in a casual and friendly atmosphere where we can all learn from each other. We work in teams and embrace lightweight, industry best-practice processes with a focus to continually improve.
Let’s talk!
If you think we're a match then please apply via our website (https://www.immersivetechnologies.com/careers/index.htm)
We’ll need your resume, detailing your experience with the technologies we use.
Immersive Technologies provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants.

Name: IT Support Officer and Systems Administrator
Description: Luv Bridal is a popular and reputable international bridal and formal retailer/wholesaler with our Head Office located on the Gold Coast.The origins of the company have come from Australian retail, however in recent years we have expanded our brands into the UK and European markets, focusing on our wholesale customers. An exciting opportunity has recently become available for a Full Time IT Support Officer/Systems Administrator to join our Head Office team. This position is responsible for the IT & Systems functions of our Australian and UK/European Companies.  About the position:Working in our Head Office;Variety of tasks in supporting company networks, systems, and data;Technical support across all areas of our business applications from the ground up;Technical support of Microsoft Products including Office 365, Microsoft 365, Windows as well as management and migrations;Setup and maintain user access for all IT systems such as Microsoft Office 365 / Dynamics GP and other corporate systems, Monitoring and maintenance of company's critical assets through backup, disaster recovery, and cybersecurity best practices.Maintain Software License registerUpgrade systems and processes as required for enhanced functionality and security issue resolutionEngage with third party vendors to resolve issues that require vendor escalationParticipate in the delivery of IT projects such us systems integration through APIs  What we are looking for:Motivated to be hands on with all major projects and have a pro-active attitude towards everyday tasks with suggestions as to how to improve workflows and processes.Confidence in your IT knowledge allowing you to resolve complex and basic IT related issues in a timely manner. Maintain a disciplined, dynamic and professional attitude as you work with colleagues located in different geographical locations such as our showrooms and employees located both Australia-wide and internationally.Our requirements regarding professional knowledge and exposure:Experience and knowledge of Windows server operating systems including deployment, configuration, and management (all versions) as well as server roles such as TS, File, DNS etc.Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft Exchange / Office365 including hybrid, migration, implementation, and management.Intermediate knowledge of active directory/security structure (files and folders).Experience in networking, firewalls, and switching particularly in design, configuration, implementation, and management.Ability to support end-user devices including desktops laptops, mobile devices, smart devices, etc.Desire to work with a range of line of business applications such as Microsoft 365, Business Central, Microsoft Dynamics, specialised commercial software, etc.Experience with integrating with enterprise ERP systems such as Microsoft Dynamics and with integration platforms such as Jitterbit, Mulesoft, etc, are an advantage  What we desire (but do not require) regarding your professional knowledge:Relevant tertiary IT qualification.Experience working for a fast-paced Retail/Wholesale environment, as you will be required to multi-task. Exposure to VoIP solutions and telephony technology.

Name: Level 3 Tech Support - Managed IT Services
Description: About UsWe are leading MSP with national presence going though a massive growth.We are utilising acquisitions as our growth strategy to become a leader in the Technology Services space for Australia, which includes 24/7 NOC, SOC, Support, Cloud, Telecomm services - to name a few. Our current primary offices are in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and the Gold Coast.We are looking for an experienced Level 3 Support Technician with excellent customer service skills to join our exciting tech team in Castle Hill, NSW.You will be focusing on Infrastructure Projects pre-sales, planning and deployment, NOC escalations, Support escalations for our Sydney and National clients. This role is a mix of work from home, office and client sites - where onsite is required, especially around infrastructure projects deployments. Main Duties and ResponsibilitiesInfrastructure Projects pre-sales assistance to Account ManagersInfrastructure Projects planning and deploymentFinal (L3) support escalation point for user requestsFinal (L3) escalation point for NOC / SOC (machine generated tickets)Providing all levels of support services via ConnectWise Manage PSA and RMM SystemsClients' network infrastructure (site) documentation in ITGlueTrain and mentor IT&C Group Helpdesk Staff (training through ticket escalation)Ongoing vendor, industry training and certifications (e.g. Microsoft, Sophos, Datto) Required SkillsPrevious experience in an MSP role is essential (min. 5 years)Strong Windows Server 2012 to 2019 experienceStrong Active Directory, DNS, DHCP and group policy experienceStrong Microsoft 365/Azure/Intune experienceStrong Exchange 2013 - 2019 and Exchange Online experienceStrong Hyper-V experienceStrong Backup, BCDR and AntiVirus/EDR System experienceStrong Cybersecurity, Firewall experienceGood experience with various network technologies (switching, routing, VLAN, WLAN, WAN, VPN)Proven experience in project planning, and deliveryExperience with ConnectWise PSA/RMM a preferenceExperience with Datto BCDR products a preferenceExperience with Sophos, CISCO products a preference BenefitsWork, Life Balance Flexibility (WFH, office, clients sites / Office BBQ's / Family Oriented)Company Laptop and Peripherals Supplied for your WFH and OfficeExposure to multitude of sites, network environments, technologies within SME, Large Enterprise and Local GovernmentA culture that encourages personal and professional growthA culture that encourages and rewards professionalism and productivity

Name: EOI: Council Member
Description: EXPRESSIONS OF INTERESTThe QIMR Berghofer Medical Research Institute (or QIMR Berghofer) is seeking new Council members to join its diverse and dynamic Council.    The Council of the Queensland Institute of Medical Research is the governing body of the QIMR Berghofer Medical Research Institute (QIMR Berghofer) and is a statutory authority governed by the Queensland Institute of Medical Research Act 1945 (the Act). Appointments to the Council are made by the Governor-in-Council on the recommendation of the Minister for Health.   QIMR Berghofer is a world-leading medical research institute.  The Institute’s purpose is "Better health through impactful medical research" and our vision is to lead the way to significant innovation in health - nationally and globally. Our research focuses on cancer, infectious diseases, inflammation, genetics of diseases, mental health and neuroscience, population health and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Health. We work in close collaboration with clinicians and other research institutes, nationally and internationally, to support ground-breaking research discoveries and achieve impactful medical research.    The Council’s role is to control and manage the Institute as described in the Act.  The Council is responsible for setting the strategic direction, and ensuring appropriate planning and financial stewardship for the Institute. Council members contribute to enhancing the Institute's public standing and inspiring supporters and partners across community, corporates and philanthropy to invest in ground-breaking research and create impact together.   We are seeking members with skills, experience and expertise in one or more of the following areas: corporate governance, public or academic administration, health or clinical research, health ethics, financial management, fundraising, human resources, cybersecurity, environmental sustainability.  Previous board experience is essential for a number of these Council positions, and completion of the Australian Institute of Company Directors course (or equivalent) would be highly desirable. Experience with health or medical research or academic environments would be an advantage. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply.Remuneration is paid in accordance with the Queensland Government "Remuneration Procedures for Part-Time Chairs and Members of Queensland Government Bodies." Please note that the Queensland Cabinet Handbook requires that information on a person’s suitability for appointment to the QIMR Berghofer Medical Research Institute Council must be obtained for all appointments. A range of probity checks are undertaken on identified nominees (not applicants). Details are shown in Part B of the Application Form.Applications close Sunday 12 June 2022 and must include the Application Form (includes proof of identity); covering letter (maximum two pages); Curriculum Vitae (maximum 2 pages). Candidates may also provide a full resume if relevant.Access to the Application Form can be found here: https://qimrberghofer.turborecruit.com.au/custom/802/files/ApplicationForm.docxFor further information about the role or for a confidential discussion, please contact Rosemary Swanborough at Rosemary.Swanborough@qimrberghofer.edu.au.

Name: Cyber Security Specialist
Description: The Opportunity:We are seeking an experienced Cyber Security Specialist to join an exciting new project for one of our Federal Government clients You will be responsible for:Conducting capability and concept development in context with technical security.Conducting security requirements analysis and development.Conducting security design and implementation.Conducting V&V.Supporting the security certification and accreditation process.Planning and delivering engineering services, regulatory compliance.Resource management and project outcomes.Conducting reviews of contract deliverables.Supporting and/or undertaking internal cyber security assessments of the Enterprise and associated environment.Implementing technical requirements for the certification and accreditation of systems within the Enterprise.Contributing to the development and maintenance of documentation to support cyber security.Developing and supporting the cyberspace worthiness of the Enterprise and associated systems.Reviewing, evaluating, and/or providing input into the various plans, procedures, technical documentation and system review materials identified above.Attending identified meetings and provide reporting and review input What will make you a good fit for the role:Minimum NV2 clearance requiredBe a qualified cybersecurity specialist with ability to support engineering and ICT staff in developing new and novel communications technologies. Be able to support cyber security governance activities within a blended workforce team of the Department, APS and contracted technical staffUnderstand Agile project management methodology as well as the Departments technical regulatory and cyber security requirements.  Join our global team and accelerate your career with us. Contact Alex Clark via email at for a confidential discussion today.  About us NTT Ltd. is a global ICT provider, employing more than 40,000 people in a diverse and dynamic workplace, and delivering services in over 200 countries and regions. NTT is proud to be an equal opportunity employer with a global culture that embraces diversity. We are committed to providing an environment free of unfair discrimination and harassment.  E: au.act.digital.ocrcareers@global.ntt

Name: Network Engineer - Cyber Security
Description: 6 Month contract with view to extendLarge Energy Client in Sydney/MelbourneRate on offer up to $970/day incl superOpportunity for Career growth & work life balanceJob Description:  Position responsibilities:Lead and manage the identification of security engineering approaches to address organisational security objectives, in line with the Cyber Security Strategy and supporting security standardsChampion and lead the communication of the value of cyber security throughout all levels of the organization and stakeholdersCollaborate with architects and engineering teams to ensure appropriate security controls are applied to non-production and production systems, in accordance with security architecture reference models, designs and security baselinesPartner with operational personnel to deploy vulnerability mitigations on IT systemsEngagement with Program and Project stakeholders to ensure security requirements are met and all cyber security products meet security baselines and standards and operational assurance standards before delivery into productionWork with architecture and engineering teams to determine the security requirements for ICT projectsPlan and manage the conduct of security testing for ICT products and solutionsConduct Risk Assessments of current and future ICT inhouse or third party externally developed projects including threat modellingSupport the cyber risk governance processes to provide ICT security risks, mitigations, and input on other technical risks, including managing the monitoring of compliance against the security standardsProvide insights and interpretation of patterns and indicators of noncompliance to the Cyber SecurityManager in order determine their impact on levels of risk and/or overall effectiveness of client's cybersecurity postureAll employees within client are required to have an awareness of, and a commitment to the Principles, Values and Standards as set out in the Code of Conduct and applicable Company policies, procedures and management systems (e.g. for Safety, Environment and Asset Management).QUALIFICATIONS, CERTIFICATIONS, LICENCES AND AUTHORISATIONS  RequiredBachelor of Electrical/Mechanical/Computer Engineering or similar or demonstrated capability through past employment experience and/or relevant qualifications.Demonstrated capability through past employment experience and/or relevant qualifications.DesirablePost Graduate Qualifications in Information/Cyber Security highly regardedRelevant industry Cyber Security Certifications.EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:A minimum of 3 years relevant work experience in Cyber SecurityUnderstanding of security engineering principles, cyber threats, risksKnowledge of relevant information security frameworks and standards to the Critical Infrastructure SectorDemonstrated experience and knowledge of current and emerging technologies and assessment of their relevance and potential value and risk to the organisationExperience in Windows and Linux environments is an advantageExcellent presentation, analytical, and interpersonal skills with attention to detailthe ability to view current processes and procedures as opportunities for enhancement, tuning and improvement.Strong problem solving and conceptual thinking capabilitiesAbility to create and work in virtual teams to solve business issuesAs a Network EngineerUnderstanding and application of security architecture, network security (secure LAN, WAN, VLAN, MPLS, and secure network zoning and restricted network design) and database, operating system and application security.Understanding of Network and communication protocols common in corporate environmentsstrong understanding of Firewalls (Check Point, Palo Alto, Cisco ASA)Good understanding of IP networking and Internet technologies, in either Cisco or other switch & routing platforms. CCNP or CCIE would be an advantageExperience of designing networks for deployment in Cloud environments such as Azure or Oracle Cloud InfrastructureStrong understanding of Network Based IDS and Host Based IDS and WAF deploymentUnderstanding of network security monitoring and traffic analysis for suspicious behaviourHow to apply:Please apply using the link below or call Nick on 0480 081 934 for further details. Applications closes based on the volume of applications received. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.Adaps is an equal opportunity employer that actively embraces diversity in its workforce through accurate community representation of gender, culture; thought and work arrangements.

Name: Infrastructure Support Engineer
Description: EARN $65 - $80 ph ex GST | Negotiable Based on Experience Join an Innovative Organisation Servicing a Wide Range of Clients Rolling Contract 6 Months | Dynamic & Varied Role in Sydney    About The Company    Our client is a specialist in providing cloud and infrastructure design, deployment, and managed services. They have extensive experience in delivering complex projects and supporting many different organisations across a wide range of industries.  About The Opportunity  Reporting directly to the Executive Director some of your responsibilities will include:   Accept, manage and resolve support incidents to the conclusion Lead or assist with the design, implementation, and support of Infrastructure and Cloud solutions for clients Proactive monitoring and response to automated infrastructure monitoring and vendor incident alerts Participate in rotating after-hours/weekend support, maintenance, and monthly patching exercises as required Attend training, networking, or business development events as nominated by the company   About You   The successful candidate will have:   3+ years experience in a similar role Financial Services Industry experience Strong public cloud knowledge and skills including AWS/Azure compute, network connectivity, and security Active Directory / Group Policies Wintel/Linux server and administration experience Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (AWS Workspaces, Azure WVD, Citrix) Office 365 including MS Teams (support and migration) Infrastructure Monitoring   The following are also highly regarded:   Cybersecurity operations experience Disaster recovery design and testing DevOps/Infrastructure as code experience (Cloud Formation / Terraform) Identity Access Management and Governance experience SIEM / monitoring experience (Splunk, DataDog, New Relic)   What's in it for You?   Join an Innovative Organisation Servicing a Wide Range of Clients Enjoy Working From Home on Occasions | Dynamic & Varied Role Join a Friendly Hardworking & High Performing Team  Immediate Start Available for the Right Candidate   Apply today and don't miss out on starting this opportunity as soon as possible!     The Next Step of your Application (Please Read)  You will need to submit your resume, cover letter and answer some role-specific screening questions to be considered for this role. This is an opportunity to impress the employer and set your application apart from the rest! Please do not copy and paste your resume. Your application will be reviewed and we will contact you via email if you progress to the next stage.  Please take a look at our other vacancies here: https://recruitshop.applynow.net.au/

Name: Technical Trainer
Description: TECHNICAL TRAINER - APAC Who are we?Devo is a cloud-native logging and security analytics platform. A company powered by innovative minds. Our team is reinventing how organizations use the full potential of all their data and security analytics for business success. And we have fun doing it!We enable you and your enterprise to build and transform your SOC - Security Operations Centers, empower your security analytics with next-gen SIEM, bring intelligence to your IT Operations (AIOps) and provide centralized log management.We are a software Unicorn, that’s been evaluated recently at USD 2.0B - backed by Insight Partners, Georgian, TCV, General Atlantic, Bessemer Venture Partners, Kibo Ventures and Eurazeo. We are also very proud to be recognized as a Great Place to Work®!Check us out! www.devo.com Why are we hiring a Technical Trainer?In the last year, our training team has grown from three to seven members! And due to the explosive growth of Devo’s customers and their training needs, we are keen to hire another Technical Trainer based in APAC to join the Global Training Team! What kind of people are we looking for?Lean-ed in and Extroverted individuals that love to be a part of the team.Passionate about providing tangible solutions.Operators that value the commodity of people’s time.Someone that likes to help people learn and grow.Want a genuine career in the Software/Security/Cloud industry. What will you be doing on a day-to-day basis?Train customers and partners with the collaboration of the Devo Departments.Help in Creation/Updating content that fits the training needs, either face to face training or inside the e-learning platform.Help develop and deliver training initiatives that match the needs of all employees across the company.Drive continuous improvement and growth in line with the company strategy in APAC (availability to travel).  What would be the ideal background and experience of this team member? (don’t worry if you don’t hit most of the requirements. We will grow and nurture the right individual!)2+ yrs experience in the delivery of training courses related to IT environments is preferred.Have provided training related to programming languages, databases, Big Data, Networking, or Security environments (desirable).Cybersecurity experience: Experience in the use of threat detection tools, incident response and SOAR (desirable).Possessing knowledge in any SIEMs will be valued positively: SolarWinds SIEM, Datalog, QRadar, Splunk Enterprise SIEM, etc.2+ yrs experience using a learning management system (desirable).In-depth knowledge of some of the following programming languages Python, JavaScript, Nodejs or SQL will be valued although not essential.Extensive experience with MS Office tools.Knowledge and expertise demonstrated with learning techniques, strategies, and development in terms of training.Ability to quickly learn services, products, and technologies of the company.Ability to organize, prioritize, and multi-task in a fast-paced, changing environment to meet deadlines.Demonstrated ability to present and speak in public.Effective written & verbal communication.Proficiency in written and spoken English. Master of other languages, especially Bahasa Malay, Mandarin/Cantonese or “Singlish” will be highly regarded.Any background in Translating other languages to English would also be highly regarded. What is on offer when you join us?Work for a company that prides themselves on having a real cloud-native logging / security analytics platform that crushes the competition.100% work/life balance - Work from home, work in the office or in one of our partnered shared offices.One of the most impressive salary packages and bonus structures in the industry.Company based/Individually performance based annual bonuses - Depending on role.All the tools, bells and whistles for you to execute your position with flying colors.Work with an Unicorn Company that provides immense growth opportunities internally and globally! What are the next steps?Ultimately, we want to hire awesome people into our amazing teams. If you are serious about change in scenery or want a real career that's rewarding and provides plenty of opportunities for you to upgrade your skills and attributes, please don’t hesitate! Fill out your details below or click to apply!Disclaimers:All Respective Applicants-Due to the high influx of applicants, Devo will only be able to reach out to only shortlisted applicants.Devo does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act) with respect to employment opportunities.-Devo HRAll Recruitment and Resource Agencies/Consultancies/Third party resource/Contract providers- Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of Devo outside of the Talent Acquisition team. Devo's policy is to only accept resumes from agencies via the Devo Agency Portal. Agencies must have a valid fee agreement in place and they must have been assigned the specific requisition to which they submit resumes, by the Talent Acquisition team. Any resume submitted outside of this process will be deemed the sole property of Devo and in the event a candidate submitted outside of this policy is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.-Devo LEGAL

Name: Multiple Traineeships in Admin, IT, Finance, People & Culture and Social Media
Description: PEOPLE WITH TERTIARY QUALIFICATIONS NEED NOT APPLY.  Current university applicants may have to defer their studies to be eligible for this traineeship. To be considered for these opportunities, all applications MUST be submitted through the AFL SportsReady jobs board via the links at the bottom of this page. ABOUT THE ROLESAFL SportsReady currently has exciting entry level opportunities in fields such as Administration, Information Technology, Finance, People & Culture and Social Media. As a successful trainee you will:Be employed by AFL SportsReady LtdWork in a hybrid environmentGet real workplace experienceStudy for an accredited Certificate III qualificationBuild a network of key industry contacts Why should you work with us?Our Traineeships are the best way to fast-track your career.  We will provide you with the real skills and experience needed to succeed when first starting your career.If you are an Aboriginal and / or Torres Strait Islander, you will also receive one-on-one mentoring support and networking. Available Traineeships:Administration Trainee x 2Administration Officer and Education Administration - both based in MelbourneResponding to queries from trainees and external stakeholders.Supporting induction of trainees including completion of enrolments of trainees and students.Supporting Field officers and Educators.IT Trainee - based in MelbourneHelp desk, software and hardware support and maintenance.Supporting the roll out of some IT projects.Learning about higher level IT areas like project management, cybersecurity and development / coding.Finance Trainee - based in MelbourneInterest and passion to pursue a career in the finance industryHighly organised and good attention to detailStrong numerical abilityPeople and Culture Trainee - based in Melbourne or NewcastleSupporting P&C functions like recruitment, learning and development coordination, staff engagement activities.Helping to organise staff conferences.Assisting with implementation of new P&C technology.Social Media Trainee (First Nations Identified role) - location negotiableAssisting in the management of social media accounts.Helping to create creative content on Facebook and Instagram.Helping to improve our connection with community through meaningful content and story telling.Assisting in the reporting of social media advertising campaigns. As a successful candidate, you will receive:a National Training Wage Awarda fully funded Qualificationcompany benefits including tickets to Melbourne based AFL games, an AFL SportsReady hoodie, and access to our Mental Health and Support program (EAP). Applicants must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, including the booster shot, or an appointment to have this done. To apply for any of our traineeships, please copy and paste the relevant link/s below into your browser;Administration Officer - https://aflsportsready.com.au/jobs-board/administration-officer-traineeship-3/Education Administration - https://aflsportsready.com.au/jobs-board/education-administration-trainee/IT - https://aflsportsready.com.au/jobs-board/it-support-trainee-10/Finance - https://aflsportsready.com.au/jobs-board/finance-support-trainee/People & Culture - https://aflsportsready.com.au/jobs-board/people-and-culture-trainee-2/Social Media - https://aflsportsready.com.au/jobs-board/social-media-trainee-first-nations-identified-role/ All positions close Friday, 10th June, 2022 at 5.00pm

Name: Senior Technical Officer: Electronic (HEO 5)
Description:
About the Role This position provides electronic expertise and undertakes a broad range of technical duties to support STEM’s teaching, research and commercial activities and provides need based support and services to the Future Industries Institute.About UniSAThe University of South Australia is Australia’s University of Enterprise. Our culture of innovation is anchored around global and national links to academic, research and industry partners. Our graduates are the new urban professionals, global citizens at ease with the world and ready to create and respond to change. Our research is inventive and adventurous and we create new knowledge that is central to global economic and social prosperity.UniSA STEM links engineering, mathematics, science, defence and cybersecurity, environmental science, aviation, information technology, construction and project management, harnessing the connections across disciplines to bring big ideas to fruition. Our researchers are solution focused and collaborative to deliver technical expertise and advice to industry, government and community groups to make commercially viable and sustainable impacts. We integrate research into our teaching, with students working alongside researchers in first-class facilities, what’s discovered one day is taught the next. Our graduates are entrepreneurs and trailblazers, who design and build the world they want to live in.  UniSA STEM also incorporates leading edge research organisations; the Future Industries Institute, the Australian Research Centre for Interactive and Virtual Environments and the Centre for Industrial Artificial Intelligence (AI).The Unit recognises the importance of personal commitments and are sensitive to employees cultural and religious beliefs and obligations. We’re committed to equity, respect, and having a balanced and representative work force. The successful applicant is welcome to negotiate and participate in University's Flexible Work Arrangement options suited to their circumstances.Core Responsibilities 

Plan, coordinate, and take part in the design, adaptation and/or fabrication of specialised electronic and mechatronic equipment and components for use in laboratories, student projects, and research activities
Partnering closely with students, academics, and researchers to understand their needs, provide innovative solutions, and work collaboratively to deliver outcomes in a timely manner 
Provide technical support, services and advice as required to support STEM’s commercial/consulting activities or projects involving internal and/or external stakeholders 
Induct and demonstrate the safe use of identified plant and equipment for the purpose of undertaking a particular task or process 

Essential Skills and Experience 

A Bachelor degree in Electronic/Electrical Engineering or a Trade Certificate in relevant discipline and extensive relevant work experience in an engineering environment
Expert knowledge in at least one of the following areas: industrial electronics, embedded systems, mechatronics, industrial control systems, or power systems
Demonstrated work experience in designing, fabricating, operating and maintaining specialist electrical/electronic equipment, including experience in embedded programming
Demonstrated analytical skills appropriate to effective problem solving and support for a diverse group of users
Highly developed diagnostic skills with demonstrated experience in applying theoretical knowledge to conceptual design and ability to communicate complex technical matters 

Benefits Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as: 

Flexible working conditions
Access to great personal development opportunities 
Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
Employee assistance and development programs 
Staff study support 

Culture As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results. How to Apply For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.  Please address your cover letter to Emma Kelvin, Recruitment Consultant. For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 0482 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4206. Applications close: 11.30pm Monday 27 June 2022Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment. #LI-DNI
