The successful applicant is welcome to negotiate and participate in University's Flexible Work Arrangement options suited to their circumstances.Core Responsibilities 

Plan, coordinate, and take part in the design, adaptation and/or fabrication of specialised electronic and mechatronic equipment and components for use in laboratories, student projects, and research activities
Partnering closely with students, academics, and researchers to understand their needs, provide innovative solutions, and work collaboratively to deliver outcomes in a timely manner 
Provide technical support, services and advice as required to support STEM’s commercial/consulting activities or projects involving internal and/or external stakeholders 
Induct and demonstrate the safe use of identified plant and equipment for the purpose of undertaking a particular task or process 

Essential Skills and Experience 

A Bachelor degree in Electronic/Electrical Engineering or a Trade Certificate in relevant discipline and extensive relevant work experience in an engineering environment
Expert knowledge in at least one of the following areas: industrial electronics, embedded systems, mechatronics, industrial control systems, or power systems
Demonstrated work experience in designing, fabricating, operating and maintaining specialist electrical/electronic equipment, including experience in embedded programming
Demonstrated analytical skills appropriate to effective problem solving and support for a diverse group of users
Highly developed diagnostic skills with demonstrated experience in applying theoretical knowledge to conceptual design and ability to communicate complex technical matters 

Benefits Getting a great job working with the best is just the start. UniSA rewards its staff with a wide variety of benefits such as: 

Flexible working conditions
Access to great personal development opportunities 
Generous superannuation contributions of 17%
Employee assistance and development programs 
Staff study support 

Culture As a University of Enterprise, we offer a dynamic and agile workplace culture, one that embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Our staff are creative and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm. We embrace diversity and inclusion in a vibrant, engaging environment. Our people are authentic, resilient, and influential, and we deliver results. How to Apply For a copy of the position description and to apply, please visit Working at UniSA. The online application form will list the specific selection criteria that you need to address.  Please address your cover letter to Emma Kelvin, Recruitment Consultant. For further information about the position or the recruitment process, please contact UniSA Recruitment Central on +61 8 8302 0482 or via email at recruitment@unisa.edu.au using job reference number 4206. Applications close: 11.30pm Monday 27 June 2022Applications welcomed from Australian or NZ citizens, Australian permanent residents and those who have the legal right to work in Australia for the term of appointment. #LI-DNI

Name: Security Technician
Description: Due to growth nationally, we are seeking Security Technicians from all levels of experience.COVID has taught us to consider what is really important. Be valued, have purpose and make a difference.With over twenty years of experience, Secom Technical Services, designs installs and maintains complete electronic and cybersecurity requirements for the Australian market.If you are alleged to our TECH Values we want to hear from you.Trustworthy: Delivering quality work reliably to completionEffective: Solid desire to consistently achieve the best possible outcomeCollaborative: True interest in working together to drive improved business outcomesHonesty: Always show ethical integrity through your work and behaviourEmployee BenefitsCompany Vehicle or Car allowance with Novated Lease OptionsPower Tools providedPhone or sim, and LaptopPetrol CardEtagExternal training paid by the business; Project Management or Cyber Security DegreeSocial Team Building EventsFamily Fun DaysMentoring ProgramLeadership Program delivered by Sydney Swans Psychological CoachWhat’s it like working at Secom you ask??‘Our team is supported to do our best every day by our leader. He does this with his enthusiasm for his role, and his availability to talk about jobs, clients, or any questions/problems that we have. He ensures we have a great team culture!’ (Senior Security Technician, NSW)‘My supervisor instantly made me feel like I was working with a friend instead of just a boss. He goes above and beyond every day for his technicians and does anything he can to provide great support, ideas and comradery.’(Security Technician ACT)About you:High standard of ethics and you are aligned with our TECH ValuesQuality trade skills and you love tinkering with electronicsCurrent or ability to obtain a SA Security LicenceCurrent or ability to obtain an Australian Government Security ClearanceCurrent drivers’ licenceCurrent or ability to obtain a cabling licenceCurrent Construction or ability to obtain a white cardCurrent or ability to obtain an Asbestos Awareness cardStrong communication and stakeholder engagement skillsStrong attention to detail/situational awarenessObtains or ability to obtain an AGSVA ClearanceDesirable:Cert 3 or undergoing Cert 3 qualification in electrical, security or allied industries and/or trade based experienceAbility to program/commission security systems such as GallagherAbility to perform basic ICT networking3 or more years of experienceFault identification, isolation, repair and reporting on systems installed and managed by Secom and other Security companies in the industrySound skills in electronic data and documentation managementVery effective report writing both technical and non-technicalStrong ability to perform cabling, fit off (including panels) and commissioning of electronic security systemsStrong ability to create engineering documentation including Cable Schedules and For Construction DrawingsIt's time for a change; join a global organisation that supports you like family.https://www.secomts.com  https://www.linkedin.com/company/secom-technical-services-pty-ltd/posts/?feedView=all&viewAsMember=true SA AGENT: ISL 268504

Name: Senior Systems Engineer
Description: The Role This is an excellent opportunity for a competent and highly motivated person to work alongside IT professionals in an interesting and growing industry. In this position you will be provided with in-house training for many vendors and technologies. To be considered for this role we are seeking a professional individual with proven technical ability willing to take their skills to the next level. ABOUT THE POSITION. You will be reporting to the Chief Technology Officer where you will be responsible to for the overall health of organisational systems and infrastructures. You will report on and show leadership of change management cycles for technology implementations and server deployments with an active effort to provide a seamless transition for your team members in IT and the wider business.  DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES.  Provide 3rd level technical support to the business. Deployment of technology and upgrades. Proactively create strong relationships with both technical and non-technical personnel. Actively maintain both software and hardware technology. SKILLS & EXPERIENCE.  Strong, proven experience in a previous Senior Network Engineer role. Expert understanding in Microsoft Server, Office 365, Azure AWS and Security. Cisco and Microsoft based certifications are preferred.  e.g. CCNA, CCNP, MCSE, SCCM, AWS, etc.     Previous experience in similar roles with the following knowledge and skills are required: Skills & Experience:  Extensive knowledge of Windows PC/Mac & ideally Windows/Linux Server operating systems. Working with Active Directory & Office365 Administration. Familiar with Citrix suites. Familiar with NETAPP HCI and Storage Networking experience around products from Cisco, Meraki, Ubiquiti, VMware, etc. Basic understanding of Cybersecurity concepts would be highly regarded. Capability to provide support for general desktop, laptop and mobile hardware & software  Experience troubleshooting & configuring printers, data projectors, switches, routers, WAPs & IP Phones from various environments. Defence Industry Knowledge would be highly regarded This role will offer:  Dynamic work environment. All tools provided - Laptop and Mobile. Great exposure to Windows Server / Virtualization and converged technologies. The opportunity to become a vital part of a fast growing national company. Experience remotely supporting users in many locations across Australia. If this role sounds like you, please click "Apply for this job".

Name: ICT Managed & Project Services  - Level 3
Description: This is a pivotal role working closely with our clients and our internal teams so your communication skills will be paramount to your success.  This is not an entry level position.  You must demonstrate that you have vast experience & and work autonomously on a wide variety of technologies. This is a hands-on role with a mix of work from office, home and client sites - where onsite is required. The job will involve:Pre-sales assistance to Account ManagersProjects planning and deployment with a range of customers and technical environmentsRollout of new Microsoft implementations & ICT AuditsConfiguration, testing and administration of Cisco Meraki networking products –Eg. Switches, routers, firewalls, wireless LAN etcFinal (L3) support escalation point for user requestProviding all levels of support services via ConnectWise ManageClients' network infrastructure (site) documentation in ITGlueMicrosoft Active Directory administrationMicrosoft Office 365 and Azure project design, implementation and maintenanceTrain and mentor other ICT Helpdesk staffOngoing vendor, industry training and certifications (e.g. Microsoft, Cisco, Datto)Manage, monitor, implement and troubleshoot server and network infrastructure as well as business applications for managed clientsThe successful person has:Minimum of 5 years experience in IT (MSP preferred)Microsoft Global Admin experience deploying and managing Microsoft 365/Microsoft Azure/IntuneStrong Active Directory, DNS, DHCP and group policy experienceStrong Backup, BCDR and AntiVirus/EDR System experienceStrong Cybersecurity, Firewall experienceStrong Networking skills, including firewalls, VPN, switches, DNS, DHCPExcellent communication skills - both verbal & written.Ability to prioritise and work in high volume environmentsITIL, Cisco, or Microsoft certifications are highly regardedAmbitious, quick and self-motivated learnerAre motivated, high energy and have a passion for contributing to a great team environmentRemuneration is circa $100-$130k; commensurate with experience & knowledge Apply now if you are an energetic & self-motivated individual who likes to be busy and can work under pressure & in a fast paced environment.  Shortlisting & interviews will begin immediately.Only successful applicants will be contacted.  You must:Have current Australian Drivers LicenseHave unrestricted working rights in Australia

Name: Senior Salesforce Developer
Description:
We’re not your average water business. We’re pretty innovative and like to challenge ourselves and push boundaries. We’re extremely passionate about building a culture where our people feel empowered to make a difference and are curious and excited about what they do!
The role requires an experienced developer who adopts best practice software development practices and collaborates with business and ICT representatives, including User Experience, Product Management and Digital Marketing staff, to deliver visual design intent and maintainable solutions.
We are expanding our Salesforce capability throughout the business and we are looking for someone to be part of this journey, developing for larger projects and initiatives, as well as BAU continuous improvement.
Our Customer Experience Product Team is passionate about our internal and external customers. We are all about being “Easy to Deal with” and delivering sustainable and stable solutions to our stakeholders. We are a tight knit team looking for someone that wants to join us on this exciting journey!
About the role

Take responsibility for Salesforce development work undertaken and ensuring highly maintainable solutions to complex problems.
Participate in meetings with customers, third party vendors, internal stakeholders and the Digital Enablement team to define requirements and progress initiatives.
Translate business requirements into functional software.
Collaborate with others on technical design and architecture for products and services as required.
Adopt best practice software development practices ensuring that software documentation is created and maintained, including architectural and cybersecurity components, and quality assurance consistently applied.
Contribute to product backlogs ensuring alignment with the Queensland Urban Utilities Digital Strategy and the priorities identified.
Capture and report product analytics to enable performance monitoring and identify future innovation opportunities.
Keep on top of enhancements and new features introduced to the Salesforce platform, as well as Sales Cloud and Service Cloud products.
Champion the use of digital tools and agile solution delivery, encouraging the adoption of underpinning principles and practices.

Experience:

Extensive experience in Salesforce programming, including:



Apex classes and triggers
Experience in Aura Components / Visualforce
Lightning Web Components (desirable but not required)



Strong knowledge/understanding of Salesforce Service Cloud and Sales Cloud products
Experience supporting integrations via APIs, ETL tools
Provide technical support for Salesforce mobile app
Create and customise standard and custom objects including fields, page layouts, Lightning Pages, security rules, validation rules
Knowledge of declarative Salesforce development tools including Process Builder, workflow, approval processes, outbound messages
Identify, diagnose, and resolve Salesforce technical problems, escalate and track problems appropriately
Best practice understanding on coding standards, governance, deployment, security implementations

Skills and attributes:

Excellent communication and analytical skills
Ability to self-manage and deliver to agreed timelines, meet expectations and produce quality outcomes that provide value to Queensland Urban Utilities and its customers.
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail
Innovative and creative mind-set
Knowledge of and proven experience in Agile solution delivery
Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (Octopus, TeamCity, GitHub or similar tools)
Ability to provide detailed development documentations

Why join us?
We CARE. We're a team that show up for the moments that matter and have a strong influence in shaping the moments to come. It's an exciting time to join the Experience team and make a lasting impact across customer, community and people. We're passionate about building a culture where our people feel empowered to make a difference and are curious and excited about the work we do and where we are heading.
We offer genuine flexibility and remote working arrangements, generous leave provisions, a holistic well-being program and the opportunity to be part of a community, not just a company.
If you are genuinely passionate about delivering an outstanding people experience and ready to make a real change – then what are you waiting for? Apply now!
For more information on the role: 
 DI-CRM Product Engineer Specialist - E2536.1-20220217.pdf
For more information, please get in touch with the Talent Team at careers@urbanutilities.com.au

Name: Security Architect
Description: Company DescriptionAbout UsThe first thing you learn at Leidos Australia is to leave current thinking at the door. Our aim is to make the world a safer, healthier and more efficient place, but we won’t get far using existing ideas. We need incisive minds like yours to weave together information technology, engineering and science skills into practical solutions for the most complex and high risk challenges.Job DescriptionAbout your new role Are you an experienced security architect? Or, looking to transition from an engineering role? Do you believe that systems should be designed securely from the outset and not just validated at conclusion?Working with a team of solution architects and engineers, you will be become a trusted security advisor to a Federal Government customer. You will collaboratively design secure systems that meet our customer’s needs. You will present new security and technology solutions to meet requirements whilst being part of a supportive and integrated team with peers in Pre-Sales, Project Management, Architecture, Engineering, and Security Architecture. You will be capable of building strong relationships working closely with customer stakeholders, Architecture and Security teams.In a typical day, you will: Support security architecture services across project life cycles from concept, requirements, design, build, test verification and ongoing maintenance and support;Documenting how the design follows the Australian Information Security Manual (ISM) for accreditation;Providing design input into security functions in the design;Preforming security risk assessments on the design;Derive, review, interpret and respond to customer security requirements to ensure alignment between customer expectations and current and future road map technologies;Work on security focused project activities to ensure requirements are captured and solutions align with the customer and Leidos strategic directionAuthor and contribute to the design and definition of the security solution components contributing to High Level Designs (HLDs) and Detailed Level Designs (DLDs)Engage with the Engineering team and CTO on solutions and alignment to existing and pipeline security solutions;Work collaboratively with Engineering, Architecture and Security team to support security design compliance and governance activities with projects.QualificationsAbout you and what you'll bring:You have demonstrated experience in:Knowledge of applying defence frameworks such as ISM, DSPF and PSPF;Experience in preparing security accreditation documentation;Experience with working in a Defence in Depth environment;Knowledge of OWASP and Essential Eight Maturity Model;(Desirable) A Cybersecurity qualification, such as CISSP, CISM, CISA, CRISC, SSCP, CompTIA Security+, GIAC or equivalent background knowledge;(Desirable) Worked with System Hardening (CIS benchmarks and ASD guidelines) and Vulnerability Assessments; andExperience across the breadth of on-premise and cloud (Azure and M365) Microsoft technologies are also highly desirable.This role does require the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen, undergo an Australian Police Check and hold an active Baseline,  NV1 or NV2 clearance.Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveThis is a fast growing business currently implementing a range of business improvement initiatives, so you’ll have the chance to see some market leading technologies implemented across the function along with contributing to building further on the progressive work currently being developed. We offer a flexible working environment where it’s possible to design your ideal work week.You’ll be joining a fun and friendly team who support each other closely and love to celebrate together.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

Name: Partner Customer Engineer, Security Specialist, Google Cloud
Description: At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Sydney NSW, Australia; Melbourne VIC, Australia.Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.10 years of experience in security solutions for enterprise B2B software.Experience as a pre-sales solutions architect or specialist sales engineer in a security technology company.Preferred qualifications:Experience in technical selling with the personas of a Security Partner’s Customer (e.g., Security Analyst, SOC Analyst, Incident Management Specialist, Network Security Specialist etc.).Experience in creating solutions for advanced cloud native secure software supply chain, specifically container scanning, signing, static, and dynamic code analysis.Experience in creating solutions for Advanced Cybersecurity solutions such as XDR/EDR, SIEM, and/or SOAR.Experience in creating solutions for Advanced Network Security specifically ZTNA, SASE, and CASB products.About the jobWhen leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring customers benefit from partner solutions complementing Google Cloud's capabilities. In this role, you will work with Solution Architects and Sales teams as a security subject matter expert for a partner solution to make Google Cloud useful to our customers. You will help prospective customers understand the power of the partner solution in conjunction with Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and problem-solving any potential roadblocks.Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.ResponsibilitiesHelp the Google Field Sales and Cloud Architects team understand the “Core Value Proposition” for the security partner or solution.Help the Field Sales and Solution Architects identify the right personas and segments of customers for the security partner or solution.Help our security partners create solution plays, guides for the Field Sales team and the Solution Architects to help them pitch and architect the solution. Create artifacts that tell how to handle the technical sales life cycle for solutions offered by the partner.Operate systematically and at scale, working with a program management team to identify prospective existing and new accounts in the territory, organizing them by industry segment and creating applicability criteria of a given partner solution and an execution plan.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Partner Customer Engineer, Security Specialist, Google Cloud
Description: At Google, we have a vision of empowerment and equitable opportunity for all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples and commit to building reconciliation through Google’s technology, platforms and people and we welcome Indigenous applicants. Please see our Reconciliation Action Plan for more information.Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Sydney NSW, Australia; Melbourne VIC, Australia.Minimum qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.10 years of experience in security solutions for enterprise B2B software.Experience as a pre-sales solutions architect or specialist sales engineer in a security technology company.Preferred qualifications:Experience in technical selling with the personas of a Security Partner’s Customer (e.g., Security Analyst, SOC Analyst, Incident Management Specialist, Network Security Specialist etc.).Experience in creating solutions for advanced cloud native secure software supply chain, specifically container scanning, signing, static, and dynamic code analysis.Experience in creating solutions for Advanced Cybersecurity solutions such as XDR/EDR, SIEM, and/or SOAR.Experience in creating solutions for Advanced Network Security specifically ZTNA, SASE, and CASB products.About the jobWhen leading companies choose Google Cloud it's a huge win for spreading the power of cloud computing globally. Once educational institutions, government agencies, and other businesses sign on to use Google Cloud products, you come in to facilitate making their work more productive, mobile, and collaborative. You listen and deliver what is most helpful for the customer. You assist fellow sales Googlers by problem-solving key technical issues for our customers. You liaise with the product marketing management and engineering teams to stay on top of industry trends and devise enhancements to Google Cloud products.In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring customers benefit from partner solutions complementing Google Cloud's capabilities. In this role, you will work with Solution Architects and Sales teams as a security subject matter expert for a partner solution to make Google Cloud useful to our customers. You will help prospective customers understand the power of the partner solution in conjunction with Google Cloud, explaining technical features, helping customers design architectures, and problem-solving any potential roadblocks.Google Cloud accelerates organizations’ ability to digitally transform their business with the best infrastructure, platform, industry solutions and expertise. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology – all on the cleanest cloud in the industry. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.ResponsibilitiesHelp the Google Field Sales and Cloud Architects team understand the “Core Value Proposition” for the security partner or solution.Help the Field Sales and Solution Architects identify the right personas and segments of customers for the security partner or solution.Help our security partners create solution plays, guides for the Field Sales team and the Solution Architects to help them pitch and architect the solution. Create artifacts that tell how to handle the technical sales life cycle for solutions offered by the partner.Operate systematically and at scale, working with a program management team to identify prospective existing and new accounts in the territory, organizing them by industry segment and creating applicability criteria of a given partner solution and an execution plan.Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.To all recruitment agencies: Google does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, Google employees or any other organization location. Google is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Name: Systems Engineer
Description: If you're a highly-skilled Systems Engineer looking to join a flexible, friendly, forward-thinking team – you're in the right place. Let's get to know each other.  Let's start with the perks:  We help people, not just computers. That starts at our core, with our people. As a family-oriented company, we're big on work-life balance. We want you to learn, grow, and enjoy your job - with the flexibility to balance other important things around it.  Here's what we bring to the table: A competitive salary package.  Work from home arrangements. Flexible start and finish times. Hands-on experience with the latest Microsoft technologies.  Paid study leave so you can grow your skills.  Modern office located centrally close to public transport.A huge breakout room designed to help you unwind and have a good time. Tasty food in the fridge and barista-quality coffee every day. Regular team social events.  PT-led workouts every Monday after work, open to everyone (partners too). A relaxed, inclusive culture fostering support and growth.   Life at Trimble:  A day in the life at Trimble's usually starts with a fresh barista-grade brew. You'll kick off your workday with a helpful, dynamic team at your side and, of course, cutting edge tech. Then, make yourself at home in our kitchen, stocked with fresh food for lunch. Need some quiet time? Head to our huge balcony overlooking the river. Keen to socialise? Come to the breakout area to eat with friends or play some pool.  Now, a bit about you: You have a genuine desire to deliver outstanding service and know that managing client expectations is vital. You're a problem solver who knows how to troubleshoot and believes in continual education. Plus, your organised and systematic approach means you can successfully juggle multiple priorities.  Your career: Where do you want to go? Your passion and input are valued. We'll do everything we can to make things happen for you.  We know our people are brimming with brilliant ideas and recognise the importance of creating opportunities for you. With an open-door policy to senior management, training, and support like paid study leave – we help you succeed in ways that matter to you.  What you'll be working on: Using the latest Microsoft technologies, you'll take care of day-to-day support for multiple clients. Plus, you'll get hands-on with security best practices, projects, and solutions design.  Solve complex problems, high-impact challenges Day-to-day remote and onsite technical support Proactive maintenance and project-related client site workEscalation and technical mentoring for peersOn-call support (roughly six weeks rotation)Maintain expert skills in alignment with industry standards What you'll bring: Ideally, you'll have at least five years of experience with:  Windows Server 2012 to 2019 Active Directory, Group Policy Microsoft 365/Azure/Intune Exchange 2013 – 2019 and Exchange Online Microsoft Hyper-V Backup, Antivirus & Endpoint protection Various network technologies DNS, DHCP, VPN, WLAN/WANCybersecurity/Firewall management ITIL understanding experience is highly advantageous You'll also have an Australian Drivers License and be willing to travel interstate on occasion.  Time for a bit about us:  Trimble Networks is an industry leader in managed IT services, prioritising security and driving digital transformation. For almost 20 years, we've been building a spectacular experience for our clients and a friendly, inclusive, and supportive workplace for our people.   Our goals: We measure our success on how well we: Take care of our staff's physical, mental, and social well-being. Keep our team's skills up to date.  Maintain high client satisfaction and procedural efficiency. Continue to develop and improve our company culture.  Grow and expand Trimble Networks across new industries.   What comes next? Our hiring process goes a little like this:   Find this ad. Get excited.  Hit the apply button or flick your CV Wait for us to review your application. We'll do this as quickly as possible. Get on the phone with us so we can discover what you're looking for. Join us for an in-person interview so we can get to know each other better. Time to meet the team for coffee – and find out what life at Trimble is really like. You join the Trimble family, and we all do a happy dance. Thanks for sticking with us until the end. Hopefully, we'll be seeing you soon.

Name: Security Architect
Description: Company DescriptionAbout UsThe first thing you learn at Leidos Australia is to leave current thinking at the door. Our aim is to make the world a safer, healthier and more efficient place, but we won’t get far using existing ideas. We need incisive minds like yours to weave together information technology, engineering and science skills into practical solutions for the most complex and high risk challenges.Job DescriptionAbout your new role Are you an experienced security architect? Or, looking to transition from an engineering role? Do you believe that systems should be designed securely from the outset and not just validated at conclusion?Working with a team of solution architects and engineers, you will be become a trusted security advisor to a Federal Government customer. You will collaboratively design secure systems that meet our customer’s needs. You will present new security and technology solutions to meet requirements whilst being part of a supportive and integrated team with peers in Pre-Sales, Project Management, Architecture, Engineering, and Security Architecture. You will be capable of building strong relationships working closely with customer stakeholders, Architecture and Security teams.In a typical day, you will: Support security architecture services across project life cycles from concept, requirements, design, build, test verification and ongoing maintenance and support;Documenting how the design follows the Australian Information Security Manual (ISM) for accreditation;Providing design input into security functions in the design;Preforming security risk assessments on the design;Derive, review, interpret and respond to customer security requirements to ensure alignment between customer expectations and current and future road map technologies;Work on security focused project activities to ensure requirements are captured and solutions align with the customer and Leidos strategic directionAuthor and contribute to the design and definition of the security solution components contributing to High Level Designs (HLDs) and Detailed Level Designs (DLDs)Engage with the Engineering team and CTO on solutions and alignment to existing and pipeline security solutions;Work collaboratively with Engineering, Architecture and Security team to support security design compliance and governance activities with projects.QualificationsAbout you and what you'll bring:You have demonstrated experience in:Knowledge of applying defence frameworks such as ISM, DSPF and PSPF;Experience in preparing security accreditation documentation;Experience with working in a Defence in Depth environment;Knowledge of OWASP and Essential Eight Maturity Model;(Desirable) A Cybersecurity qualification, such as CISSP, CISM, CISA, CRISC, SSCP, CompTIA Security+, GIAC or equivalent background knowledge;(Desirable) Worked with System Hardening (CIS benchmarks and ASD guidelines) and Vulnerability Assessments; andExperience across the breadth of on-premise and cloud (Azure and M365) Microsoft technologies are also highly desirable.This role does require the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen, undergo an Australian Police Check and hold an active Baseline,  NV1 or NV2 clearance.Additional InformationWhat You'll LoveThis is a fast growing business currently implementing a range of business improvement initiatives, so you’ll have the chance to see some market leading technologies implemented across the function along with contributing to building further on the progressive work currently being developed. We offer a flexible working environment where it’s possible to design your ideal work week.You’ll be joining a fun and friendly team who support each other closely and love to celebrate together.Applicants may also need to meet International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) requirements. In certain circumstances this can place limitations on persons who hold dual nationality, permanent residency or are former nationals of certain countries as per ITAR 126.1.

Name: PhD or Masters by Research Scholarship
Description: The University of South Australia (UniSA) is Australia’s University of Enterprise. We are South Australia’s largest university and one of the very best young universities in the world. At UniSA, we are authentic, resilient, and influential - and we deliver results. We pride ourselves on our dynamic and agile culture, which embraces challenges and thrives on breaking new ground. Plus, we are committed to the principles of excellence and equity.Our people are critical to our success. They are creative, enterprising and innovative thinkers, communicating with clarity, conviction and enthusiasm.We educate global professionals ready to create and inspire change, through more than 200 world-class degrees. We deliver outcomes-focused research that is inspired by global challenges and opportunities, to deliver economic and social prosperity.Our strategic plan, Enterprise25, focusses on our people, programs and precincts, and sets out our path to ensure that we continue to deliver quality teaching, research and student outcomes.100% of our assessed research rated at or above world-class - 2018 Excellence in Research for Australia (ERA), 4-digit Fields of Research.No. 1 in Australia for industry research income - 2019 THE World University Rankings.No. 1 in Australia for research impact & engagement - 2018 ARC Engagement and Impact Assessment (EI), Combined Impact – Approach to Impact and Engagement on Assessed Fields.Athena Swan Bronze Award.About the research degree project:Advance knowledge about invasive species, tropicalization and ecosystem functioning in a large inverse estuary, South AustraliaIf you are seeking to advance your career in marine biology and interested in biosecurity and the impacts of invasive species, the University of South Australia – Australia’s University of Enterprise – is offering a practical project-based PhD with real-world impact in partnership with Biosecurity SA, Department of Primary Industries and Regions South Australia.Human activities like shipping are helping spread marine species across the world, threatening biodiversity and homogenising the ecological nature of coastal areas. However, not all introduced species establish widely or necessarily do much harm in their new location but changing climates can also mean even initially benign species start to spread further and/or have greater impacts.One recently introduced species in South Australia is the pearl oyster (Pinctada albina sugillata), a tropical species that appears to have invaded large areas of subtidal and intertidal habitats of the Upper Spencer Gulf, South Australia. Spencer Gulf is one of the world’s largest inverse estuaries and supports important fisheries, aquaculture, tourism and a range of other coastal industries.Ten years ago, locals around the northern parts of the Spencer Gulf started reporting the oyster becoming abundant and attaching to (and potentially smothering) native bivalve shellfish such as razorfish, but the impact of the introduced oysters is not clear, nor is whether they are continuing to spread (or how far they might go). This project will assess the ecology of pearl oysters as they establish in the gulfs in South Australia and the impact this is having on this unique marine ecosystem.You will join a strong and dynamic research group focussed on human impacts in the marine environment.  We have established connections with government and industry in the Upper Spencer Gulf and work on environmental issues in collaboration with the Environment Protection Agency, Department of Environment and Water, SA Water, regional councils, Northern and Yorke Landscape Management Board, as well as port authorities and resources companies.You will have access to the Future Industries Institute which brings together UniSA’s world-class strengths in advanced manufacturing, nanomedicine, minerals and resource engineering, and environmental science, and hosts a substantial number of postgraduate students, as well as a range of advanced analytical equipment that might be used in this research.What you’ll doIn this project-based research degree, you will be involved in intertidal and boating field work in the Upper Spencer Gulf, including overnight trips. Some periods of field work are likely to run out of UniSA’s Whyalla campus in the Upper Spencer Gulf. The project will help you develop skills in designing and running environmental surveys and manipulative field experiments, analysing ecological data, and conducting risk assessments for biosecurity.  You will have unparalleled access to vehicles, vessels, remotely operated vehicles (ROV) and other field equipment necessary for this project. Collaborating with Biosecurity SA and research scientists from Aquatic Sciences at the South Australian Research and Development Institute on this project you will gain understanding/experience in translating research outcomes into policy decisions and start building your industry and professional networks.Where you’ll be basedYou will be based in UniSA STEM. We link engineering, mathematics, science, defence, cybersecurity, construction management, environmental science, aviation, information management, information technology, and project management, harnessing the connections across disciplines to bring big ideas to fruition.Our researchers deliver technical expertise and advice to industry, government and community groups to make commercially viable and sustainable impacts. The Future Industries Institute, Innovation and Collaboration Centre, and Australian Research Centre for Interactive and Virtual Environments all provide consultancy and access to advanced technology.In an information-rich world, our people think big, combatting problems, testing solutions and making data-driven decisions. Our graduates are entrepreneurs and trailblazers, who design and build the world they want to live in.Supervisory TeamAssociate Professor Craig Styan - Principal SupervisorDr Zoe Doubleday - Co-SupervisorAssociate Professor Gunnar Keppel – Co-SupervisorDr Marty Deveney (South Australian Research and Development Institute)In addition, the student will collaborate with Biosecurity SA and there may be opportunities to do an internship with them later during the candidature, helping to translate research findings into policy.Financial SupportThis project is funded for reasonable research expenses.  Additionally, a living allowance scholarship of $28,854 per annum is available to eligible applicants. A fee-offset or waiver for the standard term of the program is also included. For full terms and benefits of the scholarship please refer to our scholarship information for domestic students or international students.Eligibility and SelectionThis project is open to application from both domestic and international applicants.Applicants must meet the eligibility criteria for entrance into a Masters by Research or a PhD. Additionally applicants must meet the projects selection criteria:Background in marine ecology and invertebrate biologyFamiliarity with ecological samplingWillingness to do remote (intertidal and boating) fieldworkApplicant who can also demonstrate the following will be highly regarded:Familiarity with ecological statistics and the use of statistical packages such as R and PERMANOVAAll applications that meet the eligibility and selection criteria will be considered for this project. A merit selection process will be used to determine the successful candidate.The successful applicant is expected to study full-time or part-time and to be based at our Mawson Lakes Campus in the north of Adelaide. Note that international students on a student visa will need to study full-time.Essential DatesApplicants are expected to start in a timely fashion upon receipt of an offer.  Extended deferral periods are not available.  Applications close on Tuesday, 28th June

Name: Solution Architect - Integration The Lottery Corporation
Description:
Solution Architect - Integration (The Lottery Corporation)
Could this be one of those rare moments to do the best work of your career? At Tabcorp, our story continues to evolve every day. Now we’re doubling our impact. We’re demerging, with a sharp focus on two new ASX-listed companies: The Lottery Corporation, Australia’s leading lottery company, and new Tabcorp, a leading diversified wagering operator and gaming services provider. For the next 12 months and beyond, we’re bringing the brightest minds together to go bigger and braver than ever. Game to join us?
The Strategy & Enterprise Architecture (S&EA) function is responsible for the overall direction and policy-setting for the use of Technology within Tabcorp, defining the enterprise architecture principles and blueprint, and for planning the roadmap of major Technology initiatives to support Tabcorp's business strategies.
You will architect Application integration solutions for security, reliability and scalability, designing integration solutions for the full stack from infrastructure to applications realising you will be helping Tabcorp across the enterprise see the benefits of technology come to life, always with a focus on delighting our customers.
Reporting to the Head of Enterprise Architecture you will guide strategic technical decision-making and investment priorities across integration solutions (e.g. iPaaS, API Management Platforms, ETL, ESB, etc) and the evolution of the agreed future-state architecture.
Technical Knowledge:• Strategic planning• Architectural Frameworks & artifacts• Solution architecture Information Technology • Infrastructure Library (ITIL)• Knowledge and understanding of different modelling languages (such as UML and ArchiMate)• Understanding and knowledge of IT standards and controls• Excellent understanding of application development methodologies and infrastructure and network architecture Qualifications• Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, system analysis or a related field of study, or equivalent experience
Experience:• 7+ years of experience with at least 3 years’ as a Solution Architect leading integration solution design, at scale.• Hands on technical experience in designing integration solutions (iPaaS, API Management platforms, etc) for digital assets and experience in application development.• Working with Engineers to review and validate understanding of requirements and translate initial scope into technical deliverables.• Creating architectural documentation and artifacts to support a cloud journey.• Astute at developing business aligned IT strategies, frameworks, and roadmaps (and communicating these).• Familiar / experienced in agile, lean, DevOps, and other best (and next) practice. • An extensive understanding of the Information and Technology industry, as well as technology trends and next practice. • Proven experience in developing and maintaining strong relationships across business and technology teams.• An understanding of IT governance, cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements in an ICT context.
What you’ll get 
Not only will you receive an awesome candidate experience from our caring Talent team, the benefites of working with us are pretty good too!
The list is extensive but here are a few:

A “say yes” approach to flexible working to meet your individual needs
A multitude of leave types such cultural leave, volunteer leave and 18 weeks’ parental leave for all new parents, regardless of gender
We’re committed to Inclusion & Diversity with a range of initiatives such as our annual Inclusion Month celebrations and our Gender Affirmation Statement of Support
We’re proud to have been named an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the federal government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) for the seventh consecutive year
We offer a comprehensive (and free) health and wellbeing app called The Arena to support you and your family’s mental and physical health
We’re committed to your learning and development with a dedicated platform with helpful resources from leadership to technology to upskill and cross train

About The Lottery Corporation
The Lottery Corporation Limited (ASX: TLC) is Australia’s leading lottery company with licences and approvals to operate in each Australian state and territory, except Western Australia.  
Best known for The Lott and Keno, we’re proudly one of the highest-performing lottery businesses in the world.  
For more than a century, we’ve been supporting Australian communities through lottery taxes, donations, and partnerships. We play our role in making a better future by delivering winning moments every day to our people, our customers, retailers, partners, and our community.  
COVID 
The Lottery Corporation is closely monitoring Department of Health guidelines to ensure we continue to provide a safe working environment. You may be required to present evidence of Covid vaccination in order to comply with Public Health directions and fulfil the requirements of this role.

Name: Cyber Security Engineer
Description: Who are GWA?Since 1886, the experts at GWA have designed innovative, high-quality products for homes and offices. We have market leading, iconic brands including Caroma, Methven, Dorf and Clark.At GWA our purpose is to make everyday water experiences extraordinary. Water scarcity affects all communities and given that our consumers enjoy experiencing our products every day, we are proud to help save millions of litres of water each year.Your new roleWe take cyber security seriously at GWA and it is pivotal to supporting our digital transformation and managing the direction of the infrastructure underpinning our digital growth.  To bring all of this to life, we are looking for a Cyber Security Engineer who is experienced in all facets of modern enterprise technologies to help us bring this transformation to life. You will proactively partner with your stakeholders and the Technology team to drive best practice cyber security leadership across our transformation projects, all whilst supporting ongoing operational security activities.At GWA we recognise that hybrid work is the new way of working, and to support this we have our Moments that Matter hybrid working framework.  To ensure you can deliver and partner with the people needed, you will have the flexibility of working at both our North Sydney and Prestons sites in Sydney. Our Prestons site has onsite parking, and our North Sydney office is a quick 5 minute walk from the train station.As our new Cyber Security Engineer, your key responsibilities will include but will not be limited to: Providing hands on engineering capability for securing cloud servicesProviding system support and supporting the team for any high priority issues. Providing technical security leadership and mentoring across the Transformation and Technology team to ensure a "secure -by-design" approach is embedded to transformational activitiesProviding thought leadership and remaining up to date with new security technologies whilst identifying any areas of improvement.About youAlong with your previous experience (2+ years) in security engineering and operations, you'll have knowledge and experience in:Public Cloud Infrastructure and of the Azure Cloud platform and supporting Microsoft TechnologiesIdentifying and responding to cyber security incidentsSecurity services such as Sentinel, Defender, Secure Hub/VWAN, Cloud App Security, AzureAD and Application Gateway.Microsoft security stack and auxiliary technologies (i.e. PIM, AzureAD, Sentinel, Defender, Cloud App Security, VWAN)Vulnerability and patch management tools (e.g. Rapid7)Secure code practices and secure code automation pipelinesThe design and delivery of cloud security architectures and patternsLogging and monitoring using cloud native SIEM architecture, development, and analysisIdentity and access management including OIDC, Conditional Access, Privileged Access Management and integrations using principles of least privilege and segregation of duties. Data protection strategies and integrations including Data Loss Prevention and Information Rights ManagementAdditional qualifications you will hold to ensure you are the best person for the role include: Cloud / or Microsoft Certifications (including AZ-500)Cybersecurity industry certifications such as CISSP, OSCP, GIAC Incident Handler are highly desirable but not essentialWhat's it like to work at GWA?Culture is key for us, and our people come from a variety of backgrounds and industries. We all share a common purpose of bringing to life all three of our cultural pillars: We are Customer Focused; We are One Team and We Care For Each Other. Our passion and dedication are evident in how we work together to ensure everyone achieves our goals and that we all play in a role in making GWA a great place to work.Our success is driven by a global team that share a passion to be the trusted and integrated solutions partner in the delivery of sustainable water solutions for bathrooms, kitchens, and laundries.GWA is on a journey from Good to Great, and we are looking for people who are excited by change and want to make a difference. We care for each other and encourage people to take the lead to deliver superior solutions for our customers and consumers.What else do we offer?Flexible and hybrid working options Competitive remuneration Great Rewards program - exclusive access to discounts and cashback rewards at your favourite stores Bathrooms & More program - great discounts on a wide range of our productsCommunity Service Leave As well as other great benefits like discounted health insurance, financial advice, annual flu vaccinations, access to a range of online fitness programs via our Wellbeing Centre...and much more! Interested?Come join us and work with great people, great brands and a business with a history of strong growth. All you need to do is hit the apply button and be part of a company that is focused on delivering great customer experiences!  For more information please contact Emily Jaajaa, Talent Acquisition Specialist at ejaajaa@gwagroup.comGWA Group does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, colour, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.You must be a citizen or permanent resident, or hold all the relevant employment visas and other approvals for the location of this position to apply for this role.Please note that we are not accepting applications from agencies at this time.

Name: Senior Engineer
Description: About the OpportunityYou’ll have access to professional development and technical upskilling that is all about helping you thrive. You’ll work with inspiring people, join a culture driven to make a difference and develop your skills as you help us to solve important problems. With paid study leave, flexible working and other benefits, you’ll have the freedom to create a career that grows as you do.   What will you create? Using your skills in problem-solving, critical thinking and tech, you’ll help our clients define their strategy for managing and protecting data, and assess and implement information security management solutions. Our Cybersecurity & Digital Trust team works alongside government and business to solve the most complex cyber & digital risk problems facing Australia.  As a Senior Engineer in our Skilled Service Hub, your impact will be seen by:Testing and automation of technology controls, liaising with stakeholders, reviewing and completing assessment deliverablesAssisting organisations in the assessment of their supplier network, identifyin areas of concern and providing stakeholders with appropriate levels of assuranceIdentifying and managing privacy risks and compliance requirements, working across client organisations to exceed stakeholder expectationsSupervising and coaching junior team members, to foster an environment of continued growth and development within the team About youYou have a solid background or experience in any of the following:Data advisory and are skilled in leveraging principles, framework (EU GDPR, Australian Privacy Act, Californian CCPA) and tools to improve data governance and data management practices, and hold an understanding of how to assess and improve business processes.Information Security and are skilled in the review, development and/or implementation of security standards and frameworks (PSPF, ISM, DSPF, ISO 27001/2, PCI DSS, COBIT, ISO 31000, NIST) including the development of supporting artefacts (TRA, SRMP and SSP) that support ongoing systems accreditation activitiesAssisting organisations in the assessment of their supplier network, identifying areas of concern and providing stakeholders with appropriate levels of assuranceYou have a strong grasp of technical/business style writing and have the ability to train and mentor junior members.  As a bonus, you may hold Information Security qualifications and professional certifications such as CISSP, CISM, ISO27001 Lead Auditor, CIPM, DCAM, CIPP/E. You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients andstakeholders. Most importantly, you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with. Life at PwC Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of, and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC, you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together. We empower you with the technology, coaching, flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference, while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people, clients and society around us.We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural, disability, LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business, which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.  Next StepsWe’ll be assessing applications immediately and progressing candidates who meet the program eligibility criteria to digital interviews.The timing of this will depend on when you apply and complete this part of the recruitment process.Please note, all applications will be reviewed. PwC is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our people, as well as visitors to our offices and events.PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff, contractors, clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices, attend client sites, undertake work-related travel, or attend work-related events, subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html

Name: Specialist Cybersecurity Program Administrator
Description:
The Specialist Cybersecurity Project Administrator will be responsible for performing the Project administration of all the Cybersecurity Project Initiatives from the global Cyber Security team, including subject matter experts and vendors. We are eager to engage with people who have a genuine interest in progressing a career within Cybersecurity and program delivery. Below are the key aspects of the role:

Oversee the delivery of project documentation including investment approval, project delivery, design and handover deliverables
Construct easy-to-digest snapshots, project schedules, dashboards, metrics and milestone status in various forms. Create and track complex statuses, updates, interactions and inter-dependence across multiple projects and teams
Provide information and technical support for the preparation, coordination, undertaking, and post evaluation of Program/Project management reviews, conferences and technical reviews. Perform work in accordance with the PDG procedures
Record incoming program office tasking and tracks responses. Update tracking documentation for tasking, correspondence, brief preparation, and monitor schedule of tasking, correspondence, and program briefs, to improve coordination and reduce response times
Maintain project schedules and coordinates calendars to accommodate program/project review meetings and will also act as the main SME/user for project related systems including SAP, Planview etc.

Name: Principal Cybersecurity Projects
Description:
The Principal Cybersecurity Projects will be a hands-on Cybersecurity Project Manager accountable for project coordination & execution, leading the approved program of work to ensure delivery of large, complex global cybersecurity project outcomes within committed time, scope and budget. Supporting flexible work arrangements, this role can be based in Brisbane, Perth or Adelaide.
This role will be responsible for: 

Managing scope, schedule, cost, quality & risk across the program, from project initiation to completion, operationalisation & final handover

Name: Cloud Security Architect - Manager/Senior Manager
Description:
Description: 
 
 

Job Requisition ID: 28269 

Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best.
Rewards platform - your hard work won't go unnoticed at Deloitte.
Training and development - at Deloitte we believe in investing in our best assets, the people! You will have access to world class training and funding towards industry and other professional certifications.

What will your typical day look like?
You will play a key role in cybersecurity implementation activities, provide expert technical knowledge on cybersecurity solution designs, development, and deployments, as well as provide input and oversight to cloud activities from a security perspective. You will also improve systems by studying current practices and designing modifications. You will liaise with other cybersecurity Deloitte architects and team members on design and build of services, and you will be responsible for continuous improvement of design, integration and operational capabilities.
About The Team
Positioned first globally in Security Consulting Services for the 6th year in a row.  Yep, that's Deloitte.  The cyberspace is constantly evolving and so are the threats that it brings.  That's why our work is more meaningful (and exciting!) than ever.  Always one step ahead, we predict risks and safeguard our clients through end-to-end solutions.  More importantly, we help clients unlock new opportunities through safer and more secure systems and policies.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you:


 

You have the ability to execute design activities leveraging knowledge of cybersecurity design techniques, ensuring designs are consistent with approved solutions configuration. You adhere to design standards and performing technology proof-of-concept to support design approaches.
You have solid knowledge in cybersecurity technologies, including requirements definition, system design and testing / QA and transition into production. You also have a strong understanding of security design patterns/methodology and configuration management practices and procedures.
You can develop and maintain appropriate security controls and service management frameworks to protect all information as well as systems.
You may possess significant breadth across other disciplines:
enterprise security architecture
identity and access management
data loss prevention
large-scale networking
Deployment orchestration, automation, and security configuration management
DevSecOps
application security
integration architecture (API)
Cloud security and governance tools, CASBs and server and network virtualization technologies such as SDN
Threat modelling and design reviews of new technologies
You have excellent analytical/problem solving ability, strong written and verbal communication skills and excellent relationship management skills.
You must be creative and independent thinker.
You are a good team player.
Skills essential:
Expertise in one or more Cloud platform – AWS/Azure/GCP
Security configuration of Cloud platform and AWS/Azure/GCP cloud services
Terraform/CloudFormation/Ansible experience is essential
Experience in CI/CD such as Jenkins, Bamboo, Azure DevOps, Codefresh
Skills preferred
Experience of Cloud Security Tools (e.g. AWS Security Hub, Azure Security Centre, GCP Security Command Centre)
Experience in tools is preferred such as Prisma Cloud, SonarQube, Sonatype, Fortify, JFrog, Qualys
Powershell/Python/Rego/Go language experience will be a bonus
Cloud Certified (e.g. Azure, AWS or GCP)

Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference, and embrace people with diverse backgrounds, experiences, gender identities, abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.
By applying to this job, you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.
At Deloitte, we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another; prioritise respect, fairness, development and wellbeing; foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background, experience, identity, ability or thinking style, and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request. 
The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

Reporting to the APJ MSSP Manager within the APJ Alliances organisation, as CrowdStrike’s APJ MSSP Internal Channel Account Manager, you will work to accelerate CrowdStrike’s go-to-market motions for partners who embed CrowdStrike into their ecosystem of service offerings, uncover new pathways to revenue, and optimize the end-to-end relationship to ensure mutual success. In this role you will be tasked with transforming and evolving the partner experience for CrowdStrike’s strategic managed security service providers by leading a diverse portfolio of projects in partnership with Executive Leadership, Alliances, Program Management, Engineering/Products, IT, Solution Architecture, Services and Sales, Finance and Legal teams across both CrowdStrike and our Partner community.

Demand Generation & Marketing

Gather feedback from alliances, sales and partners regarding areas for improvment in our processes and products and convey that feedback to the appropriate cross functional teams at CrowdStrike.

5+ years of experience in building and ideally leading enterprise projects and programs with high attention to detail and accuracy, meeting deadlines despite competing priorities
5+ years’ experience in the Partner/B2B ecosystem including Channel, Global System Integrators (GSI), Telecommunications (Telco), and Managed Service Providers (MSP/MSSP)

Excellent communication and presentation skills

Name: Information Security Principal Consultant
Description:
How will I help? We are looking for an Information Security Principal Consultant to join the Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) team. This person will be a technical lead for Westpac's critical security monitoring services. Developing and continuously improving logic to detect threats and expanding SIEM coverage over critical feeds. Key responsibilities:

Maintain an up-to-date knowledge of Information Security trends and threats.
Define and develop Security Use Cases to threat models using SIEM technologies. Including, but not limited, to complex correlation rules and various forms of visualisations.
Provide input into defining and continually improving architecture and design of Westpac’s detection and response capabilities such as but not limited to SIEM, log management, and SOC operations.
Integrate dynamic and static data feeds such as network device, operating system, middleware, database and application logs, and contextual data such as STIX/TAXI compliant intelligence sources, enterprise network and asset information.
Support Westpac’s SIEM toolset including but not limited to Splunk and Azure Sentinel.
The role involves 24x7 on call or incident response work, if required.

What’s in it for me? You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to become one of the world’s great service companies. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.
What do I need?

Minimum of 5 years’ experience in information security, SIEM engineering, cybersecurity incident response or equivalent.
Experience with SIEM and other types of data analytics solutions, on-boarding processes, and use case development. Strong Splunk skills including Enterprise Security with certifications to Power User, Advance Power User, and Developer preferred.
In depth knowledge and experience in using and developing regular expressions, SQL, Python, JavaScript, and custom parsing.
Experience in UEBA, SOAR and CI/CD stack.
Experience in information technology infrastructure, application administration and support, and/or information technology service management.
Demonstrable understanding and experience of information security incident analysis, triage, and response techniques.
Experience with security controls typically used as part of Defence in Depth.
Solid knowledge and an understanding of international security and risk-related standards or frameworks, including SABSA, ISO-27000 series, ISO 31000, SOX.
Formal education or certification in information security, information technology, risk management, service management, audit or equivalent discipline is essential.
Industry certifications (CISSP, CISM, SABSA, ITIL) desirable.

What’s it like to work there? As well as competitive remuneration and a great culture, joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking, wealth, and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications, using online learning, training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer, we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.
How do I Apply? Start here. Just click on the APPLY button. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further, the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces. Name: Corporate Account Executive - Identity Protection
Description:
​​#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role 
The company is seeking a Corporate Account Executive who will be focused on the acquisition of new business. You will be responsible for driving sales across CrowdStrike’s Identity Protection across your region. You will need to prospect and target strategic accounts as well as develop relationships with our partners and resellers to extend your prospecting and pipeline. You should be results driven, comfortable presenting to customers, have the ability to talk through security solutions and discuss use cases to help customers solve their challenges.
Responsibilities

Actively engage our prospective customers for new opportunities across CrowdStrike’s Identity Protection in ANZ.
Run a sophisticated sales process from Prospecting to Closure.
Work closely with Marketing to strategise activities for customers and partners in your region.
Work closely with internal teams to build a successful pipeline to meet and exceed your individual sales quota.
Forecast and report updates to management team.
Provide exceptional customer service, including escalation and coordination of support issues as needed for set accounts.
Act as CrowdStrike ambassador within specific client accounts.

What You’ll Need

Proven successful track record in a similar role selling high technology products to ANZ customers.
Ability to understand and position an Identity Protection solution to clients.
Must have experience in solution-selling security software.
Understanding of broad range of security technologies – experience working in Cyber Security preferred.
Ability to provide accurate forecasting – Salesforce.com experience desired.
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills.
Ability to create and deliver value propositions.
Ability to identify and influence key decision makers.
Ability to succeed in a quota driven sales environment..
Strong business acumen and professionalism.
Leadership, accountability qualities required.
