Name: Big Data DevOps Engineer – Kafka & Cassandra/Elasticsearch (Remote, AUS)
Description:
​​#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We’re looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.
About the Role:
CrowdStrike is looking to hire a Big Data DevOps Engineer to the Data Services team to help us take our database systems to the next level. We’re looking for a highly-technical, hands-on DevOps Engineer, who wants to work with data plane services like Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Kafka, MongoDB and Hadoop, and is comfortable building automation around large-scale cloud-based critical systems. We’ll be looking at your resume with an eye on achievement - what you’ve accomplished in the past tells us the most about what you can do for us in the future.
If you are a hands-on Big Data DevOps Engineer who wants to operate at scale, please apply and we can review your application! 
Responsibilities:

Maintain a deep understanding of the data components - including Cassandra, Elasticsearch, Kafka, MongoDB, Zookeeper, Hadoop, and Spark, and use that understanding to operate and automate properly configured clusters
Work with Engineering to roll out new products and features
Develop infrastructure services to support the CrowdStrike Engineering Team’s pursuit of a full DevOps model
Work closely with Engineering and Customer Support to troubleshoot time-sensitive production issues, regardless of when they happen
Keep petabytes of critical business data safe, secure, and available

Technology Stack:

Cassandra
Elasticsearch
Kafka
MongoDB
Zookeeper
Hadoop (EMR)
Spark
MySQL, PostgreSQL
Redis
Memcached
Python
Chef
Terraform
Jenkins
AWS

Desired Skills & Experience:

4+ years of experience with large scale data stores using technologies like Kafka, Cassandra and/or Elasticsearch, MongoDB, Zookeeper, Hadoop, Spark
Experience with large-scale, business-critical Linux environments
Configuration management automation using Chef and/ or Puppet, Ansible
Coding or scripting experience – Python or Bash, Perl
Experience operating within the cloud, preferably Amazon Web Services
Proven ability to work effectively with both local and remote teams
Track record of making great decisions, particularly when it matters most
Fluency in English, both written and verbal, with excellent communication skills required
A combination of confidence and independence with the prudence to know when to ask for help from the rest of the team
Experience in the information security industry preferred, but not required
Bachelor’s degree in an applicable field, such as Computer Science, CIS or Engineering

Name: Senior Security Architect
Description:
Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best.


Rewards platform - your hard work won't go unnoticed at Deloitte.


Training and development - at Deloitte we believe in investing in our best assets, the people! You will have access to world class training and funding towards industry and other professional certifications.


Deloitte is currently seeking Security Architects or Security Consultants to join our Risk Advisory business in Melbourne, Sydney or Queensland. You will be across the delivery of security architecture and strategy, shaping the outcome of business & technology driven initiatives as well as providing thought leadership to our clients   
About the role
With your deep understanding of a number of current security frameworks such as NIST, CSF, AESCSF, SOCI and technical security domains such as cloud, applications, networking, data security, identity, cryptography, threat & vulnerability 
management; you will be a key contributor to the delivery of security outcomes to our 
customers in the Power Utilities and Renewables Sector. As a thought leader you will liaise with Senior stakeholders (Technical and Business) working on a multitude of projects and initiatives at any given time. 
Enough about us, let’s talk about you:  


Act as Security Subject Matter Expert for Cybersecurity on various assignments & projects in the Power Utilities & Renewable Sector. 


Be a trusted advisor to our clients. 


Actively collaborate in a can-do manor to ensure desired outcomes are achieved.


Provide sound advice on capabilities of existing & potential security solutions. 


Provide leadership & guidance that promotes the development & utilisation of technical knowledge. 


Skills Desired


5 - 10 years’ experience in IT Security related field. 


Experience in Consulting is preferable, ability to facilitate and run workshop and listening to the clients needs


Experience in security architecture, strategy & design and the delivery of key organisational security capabilities across large and complex IT and OT environments


Cloud security architecture experience across IAAS, PAAS and SAAS. 


Identity & Access Management. 


Digital transformation.  


The ability to articulate a technical view gathered from business and regulatory requirements that can be consumed at various levels of competency to ensure the successful and secure delivery of solutions. 


Be aware and actively keep up to date on emerging technologies and threats. 


Experience in Cybersecurity concepts such as risk management, security architecture, threat management, security governance and compliance.


Experience in agile and waterfall project delivery models. 


Understanding of various security standards, IT governance and frameworks e.g., NIST, SOCI, AESCSF, OWASP, IEC 62443, ISO2700x, SABSA and COBIT. 


Experience with Australian regulatory & legislative compliance requirements across Power Utilities & Renewables. 


Why Deloitte?
At Deloitte, we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. We value difference and embrace people with diverse backgrounds and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in different ways, we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.
Next Steps
Sound like the sort of role for you? Apply now.

Scale and optimize SEM as part of a multi-channel, cross-segmented digital marketing engine against quarterly regional performance targets in APJ.

A strong desire to collaborate in a supportive and accountable environment.

Name: Security Architect
